name: Aadorf
geography: Aadorf is a municipality in the district of Münchwilen in the canton of Thurgau, Switzerland, located on the border with the canton of Zurich. It is the seventh largest municipality in Thurgau with over 9700 inhabitants. The Lützelmurg river, a western tributary of the Murg, flows through Aadorf.

name: Aarau
geography: Aarau is located on the right bank of the Aare River, at the northern edge of the Swiss Plateau and at the transition to the Jura Mountains. The western boundary of the city also forms the border with the Canton of Solothurn. The city is situated on a rocky headland of limestone that juts out into the river valley of the Aare, forming a bottleneck. Newer city districts extend on the high terrace east and south of this rocky headland, and on both sides of the Aare.
appearance: The old town of Aarau stands on a rocky headland made of limestone, which drops steeply on two sides. The Altstadt features baroque Giebelhäusern and spätgotischen Häuserreihen.

name: Aarberg
geography: Aarberg lies at 456 m above sea level on a sandstone rock above the Aare River, which since 1879 has divided into the old Aare and the new Aare, which flows into Lake Biel via the Hagneck Canal to the west. The town is located in the transition area from the Frienisberg plateau to the Seeland plain (Grosses Moos). Neighboring municipalities are Bargen, Kappelen, Lyss, Seedorf and Radelfingen.
appearance: Aarberg consisted at that time of two rows of wooden houses grouped around a market. The place was surrounded by a city wall. After a devastating fire in 1477, Aarberg was rebuilt. The striking market square was created between the rows of houses now built of stone. The church was rebuilt around 1484 on the site of the also burned down Grafenschloss; its tower was added in 1526.

name: Aarburg
geography: Aarburg is located on the northern edge of the Wiggertal on the banks of the Aare river, bordering the canton of Solothurn. The landscape is dominated by a narrow, steep rocky spur that reaches the riverbank and blocks the valley. This is an extension of the 664-meter-high Säli, the westernmost part of the Engelberg. The Wigger forms the southern border of the municipality.
appearance: The medieval old town is located at the narrowest point of the valley. North of it extends a river plain about one and a half kilometers long, which is also bounded by a narrow point at the opposite end.

name: Aarwangen
geography: Aarwangen is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland on the Aare river. The municipality consists of the small town of Aarwangen with the districts Bleuerain, Riedgass, Hard, Farnere, Hof and Mumenthal as well as the hamlet of Meiniswil in the southwest.  The largest part of the municipality is on the right side of the river. The Hopferebach flows from the south to the Aare through the municipality.
appearance: Aarwangen is a small town that has developed into the third largest municipality in Oberaargau.  Notable is the Schloss Aarwangen located next to the right bridgehead on the northern Aareufer.

name: Abtwil
geography: Abtwil is located at the foot of the southernmost foothills of the Lindenberg, at the transition between the Reuss Valley in the east and the Seetal in the west. The municipality lies at the foot of the Lindenberg's southernmost foothills, transitioning between the Reuss Valley to the east and the Seetal to the west. The area is mostly flat to undulating, rising slightly in the northwest towards the Lindenberg ridge. The Moos, a small moor area, is located in the very south. Altitude ranges from 499 to 664 meters above sea level.
appearance: The provided text focuses more on the location and less on a distinct appearance description.  It mentions the hamlet of Altchilen slightly offset south of the village itself. The provided context doesn't offer a detailed description of the town's architecture, urban or rural character, or notable buildings.

name: Aclens
geography: Aclens is located at 461 m above sea level, 7 km north of Morges. The farming village extends in the western Gros de Vaud, in the Waadtländer Mittelland, on a plateau west of the Venoge valley. The municipality covers an area of 3.9 km² in the gently undulating landscape of the Gros de Vaud. The eastern border runs in the wide valley of the Venoge.

name: Acquarossa
geography: Acquarossa is located in the middle Blenio valley in the Swiss Canton Tessin. Neighboring municipalities are Blenio and Serravalle. To the west Acquarossa borders Faido in the Leventina district. The municipality is heavily forested, with only 2% of the area built up.

name: Adelboden
geography: Adelboden is located in the west of the Bernese Oberland, at the end of the Engstligen valley, which flows into the Kander valley near Frutigen. Adelboden is located at 1350 m above sea level, the highest point of the municipality is the Grossstrubel at 3242 m above sea level, the lowest point is in the Pochtechessel area at the confluence of the Otterebach into the Engstlige at 1045 m above sea level. The vegetation is subalpine and alpine.
appearance: The main part of the village is located on a south-facing terrace above the Engstligen valley. The municipality also includes the Bäuerten Ausserschwand, Boden, Gilbach, Hirzboden and Stiegelschwand.

name: Adligenswil
geography: Adligenswil is a scattered settlement located northeast of the city of Lucerne, on the north side of the Würzebach valley. The Würzebach flows three kilometers further southwest into Lake Lucerne. The municipality is drained towards the Rontal in the west. The main settlement of Adligenswil is located in a depression between the Dietschiberg and the Dotteberg. The highest point is on the Dotteberg at 750 m above sea level, and the lowest at the Würzebach on the border with Lucerne at 458 m above sea level.

name: Adliswil
geography: Adliswil lies in the lower Sihl Valley between Albis and Zimmerberg, bordering the city of Zurich. One-third of the municipality's area is forest, almost half is settlement and traffic area, and 20% is still used for agriculture.

name: Aedermannsdorf
geography: Aedermannsdorf lies at 531 m above sea level, 7 km west of Balsthal. The village extends in a hollow of the Meisebach, on the sunny side of the northern valley edge of the Balsthalertal, at the foot of the Brunnersberg chain in the Solothurn Jura. The area includes a section in the western part of the Balsthaler or Dünnerntal, a longitudinal valley in the Solothurn Jura. The central part is occupied by the 500 m wide flat valley floor of the Dünnern.

name: Aefligen
geography: Aefligen lies in the lower Emmental valley, in the northwestern tip of the former Burgdorf district. The village is located directly on the Emme river and the Burgdorf–Solothurn railway line. Aefligen borders the municipalities of Rüdtligen-Alchenflüh, Fraubrunnen, Bätterkinden, Utzenstorf and Kirchberg.

name: Aegerten
geography: Aegerten is located in the Bernese Seeland, part of the Three-Lakes Region, and is part of the Biel agglomeration. The municipality is nestled between the Aare (Nidau-Büren Canal) and the Jensberg.

name: Aesch (BL)
geography: Aesch lies on the Birs river at 315 m above sea level, between the folded Jura (Blauen) and table Jura (Gempen). It borders the municipalities of Duggingen, Pfeffingen, Ettingen, Therwil, Reinach and the Solothurn municipality of Dornach. Aesch belongs to the Basel conurbation.

name: Aesch (LU)
geography: Aesch lies between the southern end of the Hallwilersee and the Lindenberg in the Lucerne part of the Seetal. The municipality covers 580 ha, including shares of the Hallwilersee and 465 ha of land. Of the latter, 64.5% is agricultural land, 18.7% forest and woodland, and 13.1% settlement area (as of 2015/2016).

name: Aesch (ZH)
geography: Aesch is located in the Dietikon district of the canton of Zurich. Neighboring municipalities are Arni, Islisberg, Oberwil-Lieli on the Aargau side and Birmensdorf, Wettswil am Albis and Bonstetten on the Zurich side. 55.7% of the municipality is agricultural land, 33.2% is forested, 7.3% is settlement area, and 3.5% is traffic area.

name: Aeschi (SO)
geography: Aeschi is a municipality in the Wasseramt district of the canton of Solothurn. The municipality consists of the districts of Aeschi, Burgäschi and Steinhof. South of Burgäschi lies the Burgäschisee.

name: Aeschi bei Spiez
geography: Aeschi lies south of Spiez on the right side of the Kander river, opposite the Niesen mountain. It's situated on a mountain ridge that gently rises towards Morgenberghorn, at an altitude of approximately 850 meters above sea level in the village center. Lake Thun is located almost 2 km northeast of Aeschi. The Aeschiried district is located slightly above the village.

name: Aeugst am Albis
geography: Aeugst am Albis and its hamlets are located almost circularly around the wooded Aeugsterberg. The Reppisch river flows through the upper Reppisch valley towards Birmensdorf. Topographically, the municipality is divided into the Reppisch valley and the southern slope on the Aeugsterberg, which extends into the Jonental. The Türlersee lake is a significant local recreation area and lies mostly within the municipality. The lowest point is Wengi at 536 m above sea level, and the highest is at 885 m above sea level on the Albis ridge.

name: Affeltrangen
geography: Affeltrangen is located in the upper Lauchetal valley at the confluence of the Hartenauer Bach. It lies at an altitude of 489 m above sea level, with the municipality's elevation ranging from 469 to 629 m above sea level. The municipality includes the Kirchdorf Affeltrangen and surrounding areas.

name: Affoltern am Albis
geography: Affoltern am Albis lies on the wooded hills between the Albiskette and Reuss, formed during the last ice age. It is located in the southwest of the canton of Zurich. The municipality includes the villages of Affoltern and Zwillikon as well as the hamlets of Loo, Ferenbach, Lochhof and Weid. Affoltern is 15 kilometers from Zurich and Zug.

name: Affoltern im Emmental
geography: Affoltern im Emmental is located in the Emmental valley. The municipality includes the hamlets of Weier-Schweikhof, Häusernmoos, Eggerdingen, Heiligenland and parts of Rinderbach. It is surrounded by the municipalities of Walterswil, Dürrenroth, Sumiswald, Rüegsau, Heimiswil and Wynigen. The well-known viewpoint Lueg is located on the territory of the municipality.

name: Agarn
geography: Agarn lies at an altitude of 620 m above sea level between the villages of Susten and Turtmann in the Rhone Valley. The village, due to its southern location in the Rhone Valley, gets no sun in the winter months. The mountain Bella Tola, at 3025 m above sea level, is the highest point in the municipality.

name: Agiez
geography: Agiez is located at 526 m above sea level, 2 km west of Orbe and 12 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends in a slight depression on the Jura plateau between the Orbe plain and the first Jura chain. The area extends to the Planches de Commune and to the Bois de Chênes and Bois de Fives. The Orbe river flows along the northern border.
appearance: Agiez is a farming village located in a slight depression on the Jura plateau. It consists of the two districts Le Moulin and Le Coin, as well as several isolated farms.

name: Agno
geography: Agno is a municipality and the capital of the Agno district in the Lugano region of the Malcantone in the canton of Ticino, Switzerland. The village is located on Lake Lugano and is the most important town in Malcantone. It includes the districts of Cassina d'Agno, Mondonico and Serocca. Neighboring municipalities are Magliaso, Bioggio, Neggio, Vernate, Collina d'Oro and Muzzano.

name: Aigle
geography: Aigle is situated at 415 meters above sea level, 13 km southeast of Montreux. It lies on the eastern edge of the lower Rhone valley, on the alluvial fan of the Grande Eau river, at the foot of the Vaud Alps. The municipality's territory extends from the Rhone to the valley of the Grande Eau, between the heights of Leysin and Chamossaire. The highest point is at 1060 meters on the slope below Leysin.

name: Aire-la-Ville
geography: Aire-la-Ville is located on the left bank of the Rhone River in a river loop. A part of the Barrage de Verbois run-of-river power plant is located on the municipality's territory.

name: Airolo
geography: Airolo is located at the upper end of the Valle Leventina, 55 km north of Bellinzona, at the southern foot of the Gotthard Pass on the border with German-speaking Switzerland (Canton Uri) and Romansh-speaking Switzerland (Canton Graubünden). West of Airolo lies the Val Bedretto, from which one can reach the neighboring canton of Valais via the Nufenen Pass and the Gries Pass, or the Italian Val Formazza via the Passo San Giacomo.

name: Alberswil
geography: Alberswil is a street village on the western edge of the Wauwilermoos plain, at the foot of a hill called Kastelen. The village consists of the districts of Kastelen, Ober- und Unterdorf and Burgrain. 71.1% of the area is agricultural, 17.4% is forest and woodland, and 10.4% is settlement area.
appearance: The town's appearance isn't directly described in the article.

name: Albinen
geography: Albinen is located on a south-facing slope at the entrance to the Dalatal.
appearance: Albinen features numerous well-preserved Valais mountain farming houses and barns.

name: Albula/Alvra
geography: Albula/Alvra is located in the Albula region of Graubünden, in the middle of the Albula valley and is crossed by important traffic axes. The municipality is located in the Parc Ela regional nature park.
appearance: Based on the image, Tiefencastel features traditional buildings and is likely surrounded by mountains.

name: Alchenstorf
geography: Alchenstorf lies at 500 m above sea level, 8 km north of Burgdorf. The village extends on the eastern edge of the Emme alluvial plain, in the Wynigenbach valley between the Grossholz and Wildberg hills. The area includes a section of the Molasse hills east of the Emme plain. The Wynigenbach valley crosses the area from southeast to northwest. The eastern boundary runs over the Ieschberg, the highest point at 626 m.
appearance: Alchenstorf consists of Unteralchenstorf, Oberalchenstorf, the hamlets of Wil, Tannhölzli, Mösli and Tannwald, as well as several farm groups and individual farms.

name: Allaman
geography: Allaman is located at 409 m above sea level, 9 km southwest of Morges. The village extends on a flat area about 30 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva, on the Armary stream, west of the Aubonne valley. The municipality's territory covers a small section on the northern shore of Lake Geneva. The highest point is 427 m above sea level.

name: Alle
geography: Alle is situated at 450 meters above sea level, 4 km east of Porrentruy. The village lies in the broad valley of the Allaine river in the Ajoie region, at the northern foot of the Jura mountains. The municipality's territory includes the rolling landscape of the Ajoie and reaches its highest point at 530 meters above sea level in the Gros Bois forest.
appearance: The provided text does not contain information describing the town's appearance, architecture, or urban character.

name: Allschwil
geography: Allschwil is a municipality and small town in the Arlesheim district of the Swiss canton of Basel-Landschaft. Geographically and culturally, it belongs to the Sundgau and is located on the southwestern edge of the city of Basel, bordered by France on two sides. It is the northernmost municipality of Basel-Landschaft.
appearance: Due to its location in the countryside and its proximity to the city of Basel, Allschwil is a popular residential area near Basel. It is located at the confluence of two streams (Lützelbach and Mülibach), which unite at the village square to form the Dorfbach (Bachgraben).

name: Alpnach
geography: Alpnach is located in the Sarneraatal valley at 464 m above sea level. The lowest point is Alpnachersee (434 m above sea level), and the highest point is Tomlishorn at 2128 m above sea level. The Kleine Schliere and Grosse Schliere rivers flow through Alpnach. About 2.645 km² of the total area of 56.98 km² are forest and 0.936 km² are used for agriculture.

name: Alpthal
geography: Alpthal is a municipality in the Schwyz district of the Swiss canton of Schwyz. It consists of the Alpthal, Brunni SZ and Eigen parts. It lies in the rear part of the Alptal valley and is traversed by the Alp river.
appearance: The municipality includes the village of Alpthal and the hamlet of Brunni, located at the northern foot of the Mythen mountains. Brunni has gained popularity due to the cable cars and ski lifts. The area is a popular day trip destination due to its proximity to the Zurich agglomeration.

name: Altbüron
geography: Altbüron is located in the northwest of the Luzerner Hinterland. It borders the municipality of Melchnau in the canton of Bern in the west. The highest point is at 725 m above sea level. The lowest point lies at 495 m above sea level. The village itself lies at about 545 m above sea level. 59.9% of the municipality is used for agriculture and 29.1% are forest and woodland, and only 10.8% is settlement area.

name: Altdorf (UR)
geography: Altdorf's center lies at 458 m above sea level in the Reuss plain, just above the Reuss river's mouth into Lake Lucerne. The municipality includes the scattered settlement of Eggberge (1410–1678 m above sea level) on the western slope of the Höch Egg (1785 m above sea level). The Reuss forms the western border. The Altdorf village stream flows through the municipality.

name: Altendorf
geography: Altendorf is a municipality in the March district of the canton of Schwyz, located on the southern shore of the Obersee (Upper Lake Zurich). It includes the hamlets of Seestatt and Steinegg, as well as scattered settlements on the Muschelberg, Mittlisberg, Vorderberg, and in the Schlipf. The municipality covers 2085 hectares, with the highest point (Rinderweidhorn) at 1316 meters above sea level and the train station at 412 meters above sea level.  It borders Freienbach and Einsiedeln to the west, Lachen and Galgenen to the east, Vorderthal to the south, and Lake Zurich to the north.

name: Altikon
geography: Altikon is a municipality in the Thurtal (Thur valley), north of Winterthur. 20% of the municipal area is covered by forest, and about 70% is agricultural land.

name: Altishofen
geography: Altishofen is located in the Wigger valley and the mountainous landscape with the large Altishoferwald to the west. The Huebbach river originates in the western part of the mountain forest. It borders the municipalities of Altbüron, Dagmersellen, Fischbach LU, Grossdietwil, Nebikon, Reiden, Schötz and Zell LU.
appearance: The village of Altishofen is known for its historic village appearance of national importance.

name: Altnau
geography: Altnau is located near the southern shore of Lake Constance on the moraine of the former Rhine Glacier. The village center is about two kilometers from the lake shore, at 471 m above sea level. It borders the municipalities of Güttingen, Langrickenbach and Münsterlingen. Altnau has a train station on the Kreuzlingen–Romanshorn railway line.
appearance: The Kirchdorf consists of the Ober- and Unterdorf (upper and lower village) as well as other settlements. It is located on the old country road Romanshorn–Kreuzlingen.

name: Alto Malcantone
geography: Alto Malcantone is located in the upper Malcantone region. It borders Aranno, Bioggio, Cademario, Lema, and Manno to the south, Bedano, Gravesano, and Torricella-Taverne to the east, Gambarogno TI and Mezzovico-Vira to the north, and Curiglia con Monteviasco (IT-VA) to the west.

name: Altstätten
geography: Altstätten is located in the western side of the St. Gallen Rhine Valley in the Alpine Rhine Valley, approximately midway between Lake Constance and Buchs. The municipality covers a total area of 39.11 square kilometers and borders the two Appenzell halves, the Austrian state of Vorarlberg and the Principality of Liechtenstein. The area extends from the lowest point in the Rhine plain (410 m above sea level) to the highest at 1795 m above sea level. The town lies at the transition from the Rhine plain to the foothills of the Alpstein mountains.
appearance: The town of Altstätten, with its adjacent suburb, is the focal point of the municipality. In addition, the villages of Lüchingen, Hinterforst and the exclave Lienz with Plona belong to the political municipality. Furthermore, there are various hamlets that also belong to Altstätten: Hub, Kobelwies, Ruppendörfli and Oberbüchel. The extensive mountain area with a typical scattered settlement is also characteristic.

name: Amden
geography: Amden is one of the larger municipalities in the canton with an area of 43 km². 12.09 km² is forest. The highest point of Amden is on the Leistchamm at 2101 m above sea level, the lowest point at 421 m at Lake Walen.
appearance: The municipality of Amden consists of four parts: Dorf (900 m above sea level), Arvenbüel (1250 m above sea level), and on the shore of Lake Walen, Fli or Fly (430 m above sea level) and Betlis (430 m above sea level) with the Ober- and Unterbetlis parts.

name: Amlikon-Bissegg
geography: The municipality is located on the eastern foothills of the Wellenberg and south of the Thur river. Only about 5% of its area lies on the opposite side of the river. The northern part is characterized by the alluvial Thur plain, partly used for gravel extraction. The southern part is a hilly moraine landscape with drumlins, where gravel and clay are extracted. Several streams drain the area northwards to the Thur. The Griesenbergtobel is the deepest ravine in the canton. The midpoint of the canton Thurgau is located in Amlikon-Bissegg.
appearance: The municipality Amlikon-Bissegg consists of the parish village Leutmerken, the eleven villages Amlikon, Bänikon, Bissegg-Junkholz, Fimmelsberg, Griesenberg, Holzhäusern, Hub-Vogelsang, Hünikon, Maltbach, Strohwilen and Wolfikon as well as some hamlets, such as Tümpfel, Eutenberg, Kreuz, Hofen and individual farms, for example "Holzhof", "Neuhof", "Ziegelhütten" and "Altenburg".

name: Ammerswil
geography: Ammerswil is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the district of Lenzburg. The village lies in a small transverse valley between the Bünztal to the east and the Seetal to the west. It is surrounded on all sides, except to the northeast, by wooded hills of the Rietenberg chain. The valley is drained by two streams, the Lenzburger Stadtbach and the Krebsbach.

name: Amriswil
geography: Amriswil is located in the Oberthurgau region, at the intersection of the Winterthur – Arbon and Konstanz – St. Gallen roads. It is accessible by the Winterthur – Romanshorn railway line. The municipality consists of the villages of Amriswil, Oberaach/Biessenhofen, Hagenwil/Räuchlisberg, Schocherswil and Schrofen.
appearance: The text describes Amriswil as an "urbanized industrial village."

name: Amsoldingen
geography: Amsoldingen is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Bern. It belongs to the Thun administrative district. The village lies on the shore of Lake Amsoldingen and is about 5 km from Thun.

name: Andeer
geography: Andeer is located in the Schamsertal (Val Schons in Romansh) on the Hinterrhein. Due to its favorable traffic location, Andeer is the most populous municipality in the Schams district. Neighboring municipalities are Ferrera, Muntogna da Schons, Sufers, Surses and Zillis-Reischen.

name: Andelfingen
geography: Andelfingen lies south of the Thur river, between Schaffhausen and Winterthur, in the center of the Zürcher Weinland region.

name: Andermatt
geography: Andermatt is located in the Ursern Valley on the Reuss river. The municipality extends up to the Oberalppass, which forms the cantonal border with Graubünden.  52% of the area is unproductive (water and mountains). On the summit of Piz Alv is a tripoint with Graubünden and Ticino cantons.

name: Andwil (SG)
geography: Andwil SG is a municipality in the canton of St. Gallen, located in the St. Gallen constituency. It lies north of Gossau SG. In addition to the village of the same name, the municipality includes the hamlets of Oberarnegg, Fronackeren and Hinterberg, as well as the Andwilermoos.
appearance: In 1732, the parish church and the "Hirschen" were built from the bulky stones of the Andwil castle ruins. In the same year, the Andwil school was also mentioned for the first time.

name: Anières
geography: Anières is a municipality located on the southern shore of Lake Geneva.

name: Allmendingen
geography: Allmendingen lies between Rubigen and Muri bei Bern, southeast of the city of Bern.

name: Anwil
geography: Anwil is located at 600 m above sea level on a plateau of the Tafeljura in a wind-protected depression and is the easternmost municipality of the canton of Basel-Landschaft. Its neighboring municipalities are Oltingen, Wenslingen and Rothenfluh as well as the Aargau municipality of Wittnau and the Solothurn municipality of Kienberg.

name: Appenzell
geography: Appenzell is a district and the capital of the Swiss canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden. The district includes part of the village of Appenzell as well as the localities of Rinkenbach, Kau and Meistersrüte with the hamlet of Brenden. The hamlet of Brenden is located at around 1000 m above sea level between Appenzell and Gais.

name: Aranno
geography: The village lies in Malcantone, 7 km west of Lugano, at the foot of Montaccio. It is located on the left bank of the Magliasina river.
appearance: The village is densely forested. Previously, intensive viticulture and grain cultivation were practiced here.

name: Arbaz
geography: Arbaz is located on the northern side of the Rhone Valley, about 5 kilometers north of the cantonal capital, Sitten. The highest point of the municipality lies south of the Wildhorn on the Col des Audannes at an altitude of 2886 m above sea level. The municipality consists of the village of Arbaz and the settlements Le Lazier and Mayens-d’Arbaz.

name: Arboldswil
geography: Arboldswil is located at 628 m above sea level on the plateau between the Waldenburg and Reigoldswil valleys in the southeast of the canton. Its neighboring municipalities are Ziefen, Reigoldswil, Titterten, Niederdorf and Bubendorf.
appearance: The article doesn't contain information about the town's appearance.

name: Arbon
geography: Arbon is located on a spur-shaped peninsula on the southern shore of Lake Constance between Romanshorn and Rorschach. To the south, the municipality borders the territory of the Canton of St. Gallen. It lies at an altitude of 402 m above sea level.
appearance: The Altstadt (old town) is of medieval origin and characterized by many narrow streets. The Bergli quarter is located on the "Bergli" hill, at about 430 m above sea level. The Süd-Quartier includes former workers' settlements from the time of industrialization and has a high growth rate.

name: Arch
geography: Arch is a municipality in the Seeland administrative district, canton of Bern, Switzerland.

name: Arisdorf
geography: Arisdorf lies at 345 m above sea level near the Arisdorf exit of the A2 motorway and the Arisdorf tunnel. The municipality also includes the hamlet of Basel-Olsberg (also called «Ländli»), which is separated from Aargau-Olsberg by the Violenbach. Arisdorf is connected to the cantonal capital Liestal and Augst/Pratteln by the AAGL line 83. Its neighboring municipalities are Giebenach, Füllinsdorf, Liestal, Hersberg in the canton of Basel-Landschaft as well as the Aargau municipalities of Magden and Olsberg.

name: Aristau
geography: Aristau is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Aargau, located in the Reuss valley on the border with the canton of Zurich. The municipality consists of three villages: Althäusern, Aristau, and Birri, situated on the edge of the Reuss river's original floodplain. The Reuss river, once prone to flooding, was straightened and confined by flood protection dams between 1972 and 1983.  The Wagenrain, a wooded ridge separates the Reuss valley from the Bünz valley to the west.  The Murimoos plain lies to the northwest.

name: Arlesheim
geography: Arlesheim is located at 335 m above sea level between the Birs river and the Gempen mountain, on the mountains flank in Birseck. The area of the municipality is 6.94 km², of which 53% is forest, 35% is settlements, 11% is agricultural zones and 1% is unproductive areas.
appearance: Arlesheim is considered a prosperous suburb of Basel and is generally regarded as a preferred residential and villa community in the canton.

name: Arnex-sur-Nyon
geography: Arnex-sur-Nyon is located about 2 km from the French border at 454 m above sea level, 3.5 km west of Nyon. The village extends south of the Boiron de Nyon river in the plain between Lake Geneva and the Jura. The municipality covers a section of the plain at the foot of the Jura. In the north, the Boiron flows through the municipality in a small valley.

name: Arnex-sur-Orbe
geography: Arnex-sur-Orbe is located at 543 m above sea level, 3 km south-southwest of Orbe and 13 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village is located in the Swiss Mittelland on the eastern edge of the Jura foothills, about 100 m above the plain of the Orbe River. The municipality includes a section of the Jura foothills plateau, reaching up to Crêt de la Croix (580 m) and the Bioute forest with protected ponds. A small area extends to the Nozon River valley.

name: Arni (AG)
geography: Arni lies east of the Reuss river, in the undulating plateau of Holzbirrliberg. The terrain rises gently to the Seegaden to the north, and to the Himmelsbüel and Rainhau to the south. The terrain is steeper only to the east, towards the Islisberg hill. The Arnerbach drains the plain and flows into the Reuss near Unterlunkhofen. The highest point is 643 m above sea level, the lowest is 517 m above sea level.

name: Arni (BE)
geography: Arni lies at 849 m above sea level, 16 km east of Bern. The village extends in a high valley on the Biglenbach, on the edge of the Arnimooses, in the Molasse heights between the Aare valley in the west and the Emmental in the east. The area includes a section of the hilly landscape east of the Aare valley.
appearance: Arni includes several hamlets as well as numerous farm groups and isolated farms scattered throughout the area.

name: Arogno
geography: Arogno is located in the Swiss canton of Ticino, at the foot of Mount Sighignola, which has its peak on Italian territory. The locality of Pugerna belongs to Arogno and borders Caprino, a locality of the municipality of Lugano. Below the municipality, Arogno borders the Italian municipality and exclave Campione d’Italia on the shore of Lake Lugano. Other neighboring municipalities are Bissone and Val Mara in Switzerland and Alta Valle Intelvi in Italy.

name: Arosa
geography: Arosa is located in the Plessur region of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is the highest settlement in the Schanfigg valley. The municipality's area covers 154.79 km². The highest point is the Aroser Rothorn at 2980.2 m, and the lowest point is at 711 m in the Plessur river.

name: Arth
geography: The municipality of Arth is located on the southern shore of Lake Zug, in a valley between the Rossberg and Rigi mountains. Its area extends over 4858 hectares, including a share of Lake Zug. Approximately 26% of the municipal area is agricultural land, and about 30% is covered by forest.

name: Arzier-Le Muids
geography: Arzier-Le Muids is located at 870 m above sea level, 9 km north of Nyon. The village extends on the southern slope of the Jura below the Molard, between the valleys of the Ruisseau d’Oujon and the Ruisseau de la Combe, in a panoramic location about 500 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The area extends over the Molard (1044 m above sea level) to the ridge of the Jura chain, including the Noirmont (1567 m), Mont Pelé (1536 m), Mont Sâla (1511 m) and Vue de Genève (1492 m).

name: Ascona
geography: Ascona is located on the northern shore of Lago Maggiore.  It is the lowest-lying village in Switzerland, as the village center is directly on the lake. To the west, the municipality extends over the wooded mountain and viewpoint Corona di Pinz, which lies at 1293 m above sea level. Other parts of the municipality are San Materno, San Michele, Monte Verità and Moscia. The municipality also includes Saleggi, the southwestern, flat part of the Maggia delta.

name: Assens
geography: Assens is situated at 635 meters above sea level, 10 km north of Lausanne. It is located on the high plateau of the Gros de Vaud, at the northwestern edge of the Jorat heights, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality's area includes a section of the rolling Gros de Vaud plateau. The highest point reaches 692 meters. The Talent river flows through a shallow valley, forming the eastern border.

name: Attalens
geography: Attalens is located in the Veveyse district of the Canton of Fribourg. It includes the villages of Vuarat and Tatroz, as well as the hamlets of Corcelles and Rombuet. The area lies in a valley shaped by the Rhone Glacier between Mont Vuarat and Mont Pèlerin. Water flows south to Lake Geneva and north to the Broye. The Biorda is the largest stream in the municipality. The lowest point is 701 m above sea level, and the highest is 984 m above sea level on Mont Vuarat.

name: Attinghausen
geography: Attinghausen is located on the left bank of the Reuss River, approximately 469 meters above sea level. The municipality is bordered by the Palanggenbach in the Gitschital to the north, and the Angibach in the Alptal Waldnacht and the Bockibach to the south. The large alpine farming area of Surenen, beyond the Surenen Pass, belongs to Attinghausen. The Surenental lies between the Wissigstock and Schlossberg mountain ranges.

name: Arbedo-Castione
geography: Arbedo-Castione is located at 278/280 meters above sea level. Neighboring municipalities are Bellinzona and Lumino in the canton of Ticino, as well as San Vittore and Roveredo in the canton of Graubünden. The municipality is traversed by the Ticino and Moesa rivers, and also contains the Laghetto d’Orbello.

name: Ardon
geography: Ardon is located on the north bank of the Rhone and on the west bank of the Lizerne, as well as on its alluvial fan, about halfway between Sion and Martigny. The neighboring municipalities of Ardon are Conthey to the north, Vétroz to the east, Nendaz to the south, and Chamoson to the west.
appearance: Ardon is a wine-growing village where the white wine grape variety Fendant is cultivated.

name: Attiswil
geography: Attiswil is located at the foot of the southern Jura mountains. It is a single village.

name: Au (SG)
geography: Au lies in the Alpine Rhine Valley in the St. Gallen Rhine Valley region, on the western bank of the Alpine Rhine. The municipality consists of the settlement cores of Au with the village parts Haslach, Hard, Monstein, as well as the hamlet Oberfahr and parts of the village Heerbrugg. The highest point is the Meldegg at 652 meters above sea level, the lowest point is the Binnenkanal on the border to the municipality of St. Margrethen at 401 meters above sea level.
appearance: The description focuses on the location and composition of the municipality rather than its appearance, so I can't provide an adequate appearance description. It mentions settlement cores, village parts, and a hamlet, but not what these places look like.

name: Aubonne
geography: Aubonne is situated at 508 m above sea level, 8 km west of Morges. The historic town is located on a promontory above the valley of the Aubonne River, on the edge of the Jura foothills plateau, with a panoramic view about 130 m above Lake Geneva.

name: Auenstein
geography: Auenstein is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the district of Brugg, about three kilometers northwest of Lenzburg on the Aare river. The village lies between the northern bank of the Aare and the southern slope of the 772-meter-high Gislifluh, a hill in the southernmost chain of the Jura mountains. The highest point lies on the Gislifluh at 772 meters, and the lowest at 350 meters on the Aare.

name: Augst
geography: Augst is located at 275 m above sea level at the northeastern end of the canton of Basel-Landschaft. The village extends over the gravel terrace on both sides of the Ergolz, which flows into the Rhine north of Augst. At Augst, the Violenbach reaches the Ergolz. The Rhine forms the border between Germany and Switzerland near Augst.
appearance: No specific appearance description found in the provided text.

name: Ausserberg
geography: Ausserberg lies at around 1000 m above sea level on the Lötschberg south ramp in Upper Valais. The municipality borders the districts of Visp, Brig and Raron. In the south, the municipality extends to the banks of the Rhone. The municipality follows the Suonen Niwa and Wiigartneri. Around the villages of Ausserberg, Hobiel and Leiigru are mountain pastures; many of these areas on the steep southern slope are listed in the Federal Inventory of Dry Meadows and Pastures of National Importance.

name: Auswil
geography: Auswil is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland. It is a scattered settlement with the localities of Oberauswil, Unterauswil, Hermandingen, Aerbolligen and Rohrbachberg. The neighboring communities from the north beginning clockwise are Madiswil, Gondiswil, Huttwil and Rohrbach BE.
appearance: It is a scattered settlement with the localities of Oberauswil, Unterauswil, Hermandingen, Aerbolligen and Rohrbachberg. The five hamlets are represented with a star each in the local coat of arms.

name: Autigny
geography: Autigny is located at 684 m above sea level, 13 km southwest of Freiburg. The village extends on a south-facing slope above the Glâne valley, in the Molasse hills of the Freiburg Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the Molasse hills in the Glâne valley, with the Glâne forming a flat valley floor up to 400 m wide. The area extends north over the Autigny slope to the Bois de Pertet, La Croix Neuve and La Fin heights.

name: Auw
geography: Auw is located at the foot of the Lindenberg on the border to the canton of Lucerne. The municipality consists of Auw and Rüstenschwil. The eastern half is flat to undulating, in the transition area between Bünztal and Reusstal. The southwest rises to the Lindenberg. The Sembach river flows from west to east between Auw and Rüstenschwil.

name: Avegno Gordevio
geography: The municipality is located in the lower Maggia Valley. Neighboring municipalities are Maggia, Terre di Pedemonte, Orselina, Brione sopra Minusio, Mergoscia, and Lavertezzo.
appearance: NULL

name: Avenches
geography: Avenches is situated at 480 meters above sea level, nestled between Payerne and Murten. The medieval town lies on an isolated hill at the southern edge of the Broye plain, in the Swiss Mittelland southwest of Lake Murten. The municipality includes a section of the Broye plain and the adjacent hills.
appearance: The provided text does not contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: Avers
geography: Avers is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden, located in the upper Averstal valley, a side valley of the Hinterrhein, in the Viamala region. At 1960 m above sea level, Avers is the highest municipality in Switzerland. The hamlet of Juf, part of Avers, is considered the highest permanently inhabited settlement in Europe at 2126 m above sea level. The entire upper valley from Cresta lies above the tree line.
appearance: The municipality consists of various hamlets: Campsut (1668 m), Cröt (1715 m), Cresta (1958 m, main town of the municipality), Pürt (1921 m), Am Bach (1959 m), Juppa, Podestatsch Hus (2046 m) and Juf (2126 m). The municipal office, the school (primary school, one-class school for six grades) and the church are located in Cresta.

name: Avry
geography: Avry is located at 679 m above sea level, 7 km west-southwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village stretches in a panoramic location on a ridge between the Glâne and Sonnaz valleys, in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Central Plateau. The municipality now belongs to the Fribourg agglomeration. The municipality's highest point is at 716 m above sea level.
appearance: Avry consists of the districts Avry-sur-Matran and Avry-Centre on the ridge, the industrial and train station settlement Rosé on a saddle between the valleys of Sonnaz and Glâne, the hamlet Corjolens and some isolated farms. Between Rosé and Avry-Bourg there is an extensive residential area.

name: Avully
geography: Avully is a municipality in the canton of Geneva, Switzerland. The municipality includes the settlements of Avully-Village, Épeisses, Eaumorte and Gennecy.

name: Avusy
geography: Avusy is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. The municipality includes the villages of Avusy-Village, Athenaz, Sézegnin and the hamlet of Champlong.

name: Ayent
geography: Ayent is located on the right side of the Rhône valley, separated from the rest of the Hérens district. The municipality extends north to the Wildhorn. The Wildhorn Glacier, located south of the Wildhorn, lies mostly within the municipality's territory. The Lac de Tseuzier reservoir is located in the northeast of the municipality.
appearance: The municipality consists of the settlements Botyre, Luc, Saxonne, La Place, Blignou, Fortunau, Saint-Romain, Signèse, Villa, Argnou, La Maya and the Anzère holiday village, built in the 1960s and 1970s on a sunny plateau 1500 meters above sea level.

name: Baar
geography: Baar is located north of the city of Zug at 443 m above sea level. Baar is flown around from east to west by the Lorze in a large arc, which rises in the Ägerisee and flows into the Zugersee, from where it flows into the Reuss.
appearance: The center of the municipality of Baar is the town of the same name; the extensive municipal area also includes the three settlements Allenwinden, Blickensdorf and Inwil, the hamlet of Deinikon and other individual farms.

name: Bachenbülach
geography: Bachenbülach is located in the lower Glatt Valley at 426 m above sea level in the Zurich Unterland. The village lies on the western slope of the Dättenberg at the exit of the Dorfbach from the Bachtobel. It has grown together with Bülach in the north and partly with Winkel in the south. To the west, the wooded Höragen rises gently. The highest point of the municipality is the Hüttenbüel at 573 m above sea level, the lowest point is at 414 m above sea level on the Dorfbach on the border with Bülach.

name: Bad Ragaz
geography: Bad Ragaz lies at the end of the Tamina Valley and on the western edge of the Rhine Plain. The village is the tourist center of the Sarganserland. The eastern boundary of the municipality coincides with the cantonal border with the canton of Graubünden, which runs in the Rhine. A section of the mountain chain of the Wildseehörner in the Pizol area belongs to the municipality of Bad Ragaz.
appearance: Bad Ragaz is known as a fashionable spa since the late 19th century.  It also has a landmark from the first half of the 13th century, the ruins of Freudenberg Castle.

name: Balgach
geography: Balgach lies at the foot of the western slope of the St. Galler Rheintal, between the municipalities of Au to the north and Rebstein to the south. To the west, Balgach extends to the ridge of the «Hümpeler» mountain. The forest covering the foothills of the Appenzeller Vorderland is called Vogelwald in the south, Kirchenwald in the middle, and Hümpelerwald in the north. The Nonnenbommert is the highest point at 641 m above sea level.
appearance: The village offers a view over the Rhine Valley from Lake Constance to the Säntis. South of the village, on a hill separated by a ravine, is Grünenstein Castle. To the north, in the district of Heerbrugg, are Heerbrugg Castle and Villa Schmidheiny. The historic village center is listed in the Federal Inventory of Protected Sites of National Importance.

name: Ballens
geography: Ballens is located at 707 m above sea level, 11 km northwest of Morges. The village is situated on a hilltop on the plateau at the foot of the Jura, in the Waadtländer Mittelland. The municipality covers a slightly undulating section in the western border zone of the Mittelland, extending from the Jura foothills across the Veyron valley and the Ballens ridge to the dry valley of Grand Marais.

name: Ballaigues
geography: Ballaigues is located at 861 m above sea level, 3 km northeast of Vallorbe. The village extends in the Vaud Jura on the southern slope of the Suchet chain, high above the river Orbe. The area covers a section of the Vaud Jura. The southern border is formed by the Orbe, which has created a deep valley.
appearance: NULL

name: Bachs
geography: Bachs lies in the Bachsertal valley, which is traversed by the Fisibach river. Northeast of the village is the Stadlerberg (637 m above sea level), southwest of it is the Egg (671 m above sea level). The municipality borders the Aargau municipalities of Fisibach and Siglistorf (for a few meters) and the Zurich municipalities of Weiach, Stadel, Neerach, Steinmaur, Schöfflisdorf and Oberweningen.

name: Baden
geography: Baden lies at the intersection of the Swiss Plateau and the Jura Mountains. The Lägern, a rocky ridge reaching up to 866 m above sea level, forms the easternmost foothills of the Jura. The Limmat river created a narrow passage during the formation of the Jura, with shallow waters and slight rapids in the narrowest section. The Limmattal widens into broad basins with gravel deposits.

name: Balerna
geography: Balerna lies between Mendrisio and Chiasso. The lowest areas of the municipality in the south are at 235 m above sea level, the highest on the slopes to Castel San Pietro in the north at around 346 m above sea level. In the east lies the Breggia gorge, in the south the Faloppia plain west of Chiasso.
appearance: The historical town center lies slightly elevated on a hill. In the lower regions of the suburb of Chiasso, many industrial and service companies have settled.

name: Balm bei Günsberg
geography: Balm bei Günsberg is situated at 655 meters above sea level, 5 km northeast of Solothurn. The farming village is located in a scenic spot on a southeast-facing terrace on the lower southern slope of the Jura, about 200 meters above the Swiss Plateau, in the Unterleberberg region. The municipality includes a section of the Solothurn Jura, extending from the slope near Balm to the crest of the first Jura chain.
appearance: The text does not offer a clear description of the town's appearance or architecture.

name: Bäriswil
geography: Bäriswil lies at 546 m above sea level, 10 km northeast of Bern. The village extends in a small valley on the southeast edge of the Urtenen valley at the northern foot of the Grauholz hills, in the Swiss Mittelland. The municipality area includes a section of the Bernese Mittelland, with a swampy hollow between the Röduberg, Mattstettenberg and Gibel hills. The Bermoos with its pond remains as a remnant of the former moorland.
appearance: null

name: Bassersdorf
geography: Bassersdorf is located between the cities of Zurich (about 5 km away) and Winterthur (about 7 km away).
appearance: As part of the "Glattalstadt", not far from the airport, the city of Zurich and the city of Winterthur, Bassersdorf has developed into a medium-sized agglomeration community with all the advantages of a well-situated business location.

name: Bassins
geography: Bassins is located at 753 m above sea level, 9 km north of Nyon. The village extends on a hill on the southern slope of the Jura, between the valleys of the Ruisseau de la Combe and the Serine, in a panoramic location about 400 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The area extends to the ridge of the Mont-Tendre chain, reaching 1410 m above sea level in the Bois de Peney.  The highest point is on Mont Sâla at 1420 m.

name: Baulmes
geography: Baulmes is situated at 656 m above sea level, 10 km west of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on the alluvial fan of the Baumine, a mountain stream that emerges from the Jura into the Swiss Plateau, at the southeastern foot of the Aiguilles de Baulmes. The municipality includes a section in the Vaud Jura with mountains such as Mont de Baulmes and Aiguilles de Baulmes.

name: Bavois
geography: Bavois is located at 447 m above sea level, 5 km south-southeast of Orbe and 12 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village is situated on the southeastern edge of the Orbe plain, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the Vaudois Central Plateau and extends eastwards over the slope of Bavois to the northern foothills of the Gros de Vaud plateau and into the Talent river valley.

name: Bedano
geography: Bedano is located at 390 m above sea level on the right bank of the Vedeggio river. Neighboring municipalities are Torricella-Taverne to the north, Lamone to the east, Gravesano to the south, and Alto Malcantone to the west.
appearance: null

name: Belmont-sur-Yverdon
geography: Belmont-sur-Yverdon is located at 535 m above sea level, 4 km south-southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on a terrace on the northern foothills of the Gros de Vaud heights, about 100 m above the Orbe plain.  The municipality extends from the Canal Oriental southwards over the Orbe plain and in a narrow strip over the Belmont terrace up to the Bois de Suchy.

name: Belp
geography: Belp is located at the entrance of the Gürbetal valley, 10 km from Bern towards Lake Thun. Despite its proximity to Bern, Belp is a rather rural municipality. The airport Bern-Belp is located in Belp.
appearance: Belp presents a rather rural community despite being close to Bern.

name: Benken (SG)
geography: Benken is a municipality in the Swiss canton of St. Gallen. It is located approximately 5 km southeast of the eastern end of Lake Zurich. Benken borders the cantons of Schwyz and Glarus. The Hausberg of Benken is the Benkner Büchel.

name: Berg (TG)
geography: Berg is a municipality in the district of Weinfelden in the canton of Thurgau in Switzerland. The municipality includes the former municipality of Berg with its former local communities of Berg, Andhausen, Graltshausen and Mauren, as well as the local community of Guntershausen near Birwinken.

name: Bever
geography: The village of Bever lies at the foot of the 2951-meter-high Crasta Mora. The Inn flows through the municipality to the south and east, and the Beverin flows from the west. Its highest point is Piz Calderas at 3397 m above sea level, and the lowest point is on the Inn at the border with La Punt Chamues-ch at 1688 m above sea level. Bever includes the hamlet of Spinas in Val Bever and the Isellas farm northeast of the village.
appearance: null

name: Bex
geography: Bex lies at 424 m above sea level, 8 km south-southeast of Aigle. It extends along the eastern edge of the lower Rhone Valley, on the alluvial plain of the Avançon River. The municipality includes a section of the lower Rhone Valley and the adjacent Alps. The western part lies in the Rhone Valley. The larger eastern part is in the Waadtländer Alps, comprising the drainage basin of the Avançon.  The highest point is the Sommet des Diablerets at 3210 m above sea level.

name: Biasca
geography: Biasca lies at 305 meters above sea level at the entrance to the Blenio Valley, 19 km north of Bellinzona, on the eastern bank of the Brenno and Ticino rivers. The urban settlement zone extends over four kilometers mainly from north to south. The 2172 m high Matro divides the Leventina from the Valle di Blenio. To the east, the terrain rises steeply and is overlooked by the 2329 m high Pizzo Magn.
appearance: In the north, a zone with numerous detached houses connects to the historic center. It stretches to the mountain slide cone of the Buzza di Biasca. South of the historic center, a residential and shopping zone with numerous apartment buildings merges into the industrial zone.

name: Biberstein
geography: Biberstein lies between the Aare river and the Homberg, part of the southernmost chain of the Jura mountains. The settled area extends over 2.5 km along the river, with the village center on an elevated terrace. The "Schachen", a narrow former floodplain, is used for agriculture. The Homberg slope is mostly wooded, with pastures at around 650 meters.

name: Biel/Bienne
geography: Biel is located in the north of the canton of Bern, in the Three-Lakes Region and borders directly on Lake Biel. It lies at the southern foot of the Jura.
appearance: Biel is characterized by a homogeneous new town, which was built in the Wilhelminian era and - especially in the railway station district - from the 1920s according to the rules of the Bauhaus and the New Building, and by a well-preserved old town of medieval structure.

name: Biel-Benken
geography: Biel-Benken is located in the Leimental at 317 m above sea level, at the entry point of the Birsig river into Swiss territory. It borders France, the canton of Solothurn, and the Basel-Landschaft municipalities of Oberwil and Therwil. The municipality covers 4.12 km², of which 52.2% is agricultural land, 20.1% is forest, 27.7% is settlements.

name: Bière
geography: Bière is located at 698 m above sea level, 13 km west of Morges. The village extends along the Aubonne river, at the southern foot of the Jura mountains and on the plateau in front of them. The municipality includes a section of the Jura foothills and the Vaud Jura.

name: Biezwil
geography: Biezwil is situated at 586 m above sea level, 14 km southwest of Solothurn. It is located in a hollow in the catchment area of the Rütibach on the Bucheggberg plateau, in the Solothurn Mittelland. The area encompasses a section of the Molasse heights of the Bucheggberg, with the Biezwil depression draining to the Oberwiler Mülibach. The highest elevation is the Flüeli at 673 m above sea level.

name: Biglen
geography: Biglen is located in the upper part of the Bigental valley, which belongs to the Emmental region. The Biglenbach stream flows through the village. Besides the village, the municipality includes the hamlet of Änetbach to the north, as well as numerous groups of houses and individual farms. The highest point is Adlisberg with 905 m above sea level.

name: Billens-Hennens
geography: Billens-Hennens lies at 738 m above sea level, 1.5 km west-southwest of Romont. The municipality extends slightly elevated west of the valley of the Glaney opposite Romont, on the ridge between the middle Broye valley in the west and the upper reaches of the Glâne in the east, in the Fribourg Central Plateau.
appearance: Billens-Hennens consists of the villages of Billens, Hennens in a hollow southwest of Billens, the hamlet of La Bioleyre west of the Glaney and several individual farms.

name: Binn
geography: Binn is located in the Binntal, a side valley of the Rhone, which is traversed by the Binna, which is why it is also called Binnatal.
appearance: The municipality consists of the inhabited villages Schmidighischere, Wileren, Giesse, Fäld and Ze Binne. The municipal administration is located in the most populous village, Schmidighischere.

name: Binningen
geography: Binningen lies in Leimental at 292 m above sea level, the last municipality on the Birsig river before it flows into the Rhine in Basel. Neighboring municipalities are Bottmingen to the south, Oberwil to the southwest, Allschwil to the west, and the city of Basel to the north and east. The municipality covers 4.46 km², 72% of which is settlement, 21% agricultural, and 7% forest.
appearance: Binningen is adjacent to Basel and is a popular residential and villa suburb due to its scenic integrity and proximity to the city. It is one of the wealthiest municipalities in the canton of Basel-Landschaft in terms of average taxable income.

name: Bioggio
geography: Bioggio is located in the south of Malcantone and in the plain of the Vedeggio River, 2 kilometers southwest of Lugano. Bioggio consists of the villages Bioggio, Bosco Luganese, Cimo and Iseo and numerous small hamlets. Neighboring municipalities are Alto Malcantone in the north, Manno, Vezia and Lugano in the east, Muzzano, Agno, Vernate, Lema in the south, Aranno and Cademario in the west.

name: Bioley-Magnoux
geography: Bioley-Magnoux liegt auf 573 m ü. M., 8 km südöstlich der Bezirkshauptstadt Yverdon-les-Bains. Das Strassenzeilendorf erstreckt sich auf einer Geländeterrasse am östlichen Talhang der Mentue, im Molassehügelland des nördlichen Waadtländer Mittellandes. Der westliche Teil des Gebietes wird von der Talniederung der Mentue und des Sauteru eingenommen. Höchster Punkt ist der Bois de la Faye mit 715 m ü. M.

name: Birmensdorf (ZH)
geography: Birmensdorf lies in the Reppischtal, in the middle of a wide valley basin. Several large streams, including the Lunnerenbach and the Wüeribach, run through the valley floor and eventually flow into the Reppisch. The valley basin is located on the west side of the Uetliberg and is open on several sides.
appearance: The beginnings of the modern settlement are at the river crossing of the road connection from Bremgarten to Zurich over the Reppisch. Pile finds from this site could be dated to around 610 AD.

name: Birmenstorf (AG)
geography: Birmenstorf is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the district of Baden, on a gravel plain on the right side of the Reuss river. The Reuss has created a narrow, deep gorge through erosion. The Stettberg, Bollrain, and Stutz hills extend into the plain. The village center is located at the narrow point between the Stutz and the Reuss.
appearance: The provided text does not contain a description of how the town looks (architecture, urban/rural character, notable buildings, atmosphere).

name: Birr
geography: Birr is located on the western edge of the Birrfeld, an extensive plain between the Aare to the west and the Reuss to the east. The plain is mostly flat and used for agriculture. The steep, wooded northern flank of the Chestenberg, a foothills of the Jura Mountains, rises south of the village. Birr is completely merged with Lupfig.

name: Birsfelden
geography: Birsfelden is located at 259 m above sea level, at the mouth of the Birs river into the Rhine. It is the lowest municipality in the canton of Basel-Landschaft. The lowest point of the canton is also located in Birsfelden, at 246 m above sea level, at the mouth of the Birs into the Rhine. The highest point is 280 m. The Birs forms the border with the city of Basel to the west; to the north and northeast, the Rhine forms the natural border with Basel and Riehen.

name: Bissone
geography: Bissone is located at 276 m above sea level on the shore of the southern arm of Lake Lugano, opposite Melide. The village is connected to Melide by a dam of the same name.  The village is located directly on the lake but is now cut off from the "hinterland" by the A2 motorway and the Lugano - Chiasso section of the Swiss Federal Railways.

name: Bister
geography: Bister lies in the upper Valais on the south side of the valley at the foot of the Bättlihorn. The Rotten forms the northern border of the municipality, which consists of the village of Bister and the hamlets of Bänna, Chrizacher and Egga as well as some alpine pastures. The entire municipal area of Bister has been located within the Binntal Landscape Park since 2009.
appearance: The provided text does not contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: Bitsch
geography: Bitsch is a municipality in the district of Östlich Raron in the German-speaking part of the canton of Valais in Switzerland.

name: Blatten
geography: Blatten lies at an altitude of 1540 m and is the highest municipality in the Lötschental valley. The Lonza river, which originates on the municipal territory at the Langgletscher glacier, and the Gisentella stream flow through the municipality and merge in the village center. The village is located in the Jungfrau-Aletsch mountain region, which has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2002.

name: Blauen
geography: Blauen is located on a terrace on the southern slope of the Blauen hill range (837 m). Neighboring municipalities are Dittingen, Zwingen, Nenzlingen, Pfeffingen BL, Ettingen and the two Solothurn municipalities Hofstetten-Flüh and Metzerlen. 34% of the 712 hectares is agricultural land, 61% forest and 6% settlements.

name: Bleienbach
geography: Bleienbach is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland. Neighboring municipalities are Langenthal, Lotzwil, Rütschelen, Ochlenberg, Thörigen and Thunstetten.

name: Blenio
geography: The municipality of Blenio encompasses the entire upper Blenio Valley. The main valley, Val Camadra, starts at the Greina Pass and is traversed by the Brenno river flowing in a north-south direction. The Val di Campo merges into the main valley at Campo (Blenio), and the Valle Santa Maria (providing access to the Lukmanier Pass) merges at the Olivone basin.

name: Böckten
geography: Böckten lies in the middle Ergolz valley between Sissach and Gelterkinden. Further neighboring municipalities are Thürnen and Rickenbach. Böckten's village center is located at 385 m above sea level. Forested areas of the municipality extend up to around 740 meters.
appearance: The settlement area of Böckten has grown together with that of Gelterkinden in the course of the 1980s and 1990s. It is still clearly separated from the settlement area of ​​Sissach.

name: Boécourt
geography: Boécourt is situated at 516 meters above sea level, 10 kilometers west of Delémont. It extends along the lower southeastern slope of the Mont Russelin Jura chain, separating the Doubs valley from the Delémont basin. The municipality's area encompasses the northwestern part of the intensively farmed Delémont basin.  The area reaches the crest of the Mont-Russelin chain, forming the watershed between the Rhône and Rhine basins.

name: Bofflens
geography: Bofflens is located at 572 m above sea level, 3 km southwest of Orbe and 13 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends in the Vaudois Mittelland on the Jura foothills plateau between the Orbe plain and the first Jura chain. The municipality covers a section of the Jura foothills plateau, which is slightly inclined to the east and forms a small depression near Bofflens.

name: Bolken
geography: Bolken is located at 496 m above sea level, 10 km east of Solothurn. The village extends on a hill west of the Önzberg, south of the valley of the Inkwilersee, in the southern Solothurn Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the moraine landscape that was shaped by the ice-age Rhone glacier. The highest elevation of the municipality is reached at 503 m above sea level north of Aeschi.

name: Bolligen
geography: Bolligen lies nordöstlich von Bern, connecting the Worblental with the Emmental on an area of 16.57 square kilometers. The ridge of the «Lutzere» forms the watershed between Emme and Aare. The Bantiger hill (947 m above sea level) is also located on the municipal territory.

name: Boltigen
geography: Boltigen lies in the Berner Oberland in the Obersimmental below Zweisimmen. The Jaunpass is located in the municipality of Boltigen.

name: Bonaduz
geography: Bonaduz is located on a plateau above the confluence of the Vorderrhein and Hinterrhein rivers, formed by the Flims rockslide. The village of Bonaduz lies in the valley plain at 662 m, the lowlands at around 590 m, and the mountainous region at around 1500 m (Alp Sut). Neighboring municipalities are Domat/Ems, Rhäzüns, Safiental, Tamins and Trin.

name: Boncourt
geography: Boncourt is located at 373 m above sea level, 10 km north-northwest of Porrentruy. The village stretches in the Allaine valley in the northern Ajoie on the border with France. The area includes the 500 m wide valley of the Allaine, the Mont Renaud and the heights of Le Recet and Le Neu Bois, which at 548 m above sea level is the highest point of the municipality.
appearance: The old village center is located west of the Allaine, while newer residential areas have developed along the main street.

name: Bönigen
geography: Bönigen is located in the Bernese Oberland on the southern shore of Lake Brienz. The flat alluvial plain between Lakes Brienz and Thun, on which the village lies, is called Bödeli. The largest part of the municipality consists of a steep mountainside, at whose peaks are the Loucherhorn (2230 m above sea level), the Roteflue (2296 m above sea level) and the Schynige Platte.
appearance: The actual village center lies on the northwestern municipal border along the Lütschine to the lake and is almost merged with Interlaken.

name: Boningen
geography: Boningen is located in the Solothurn Gäu. It sits at the southern foot of the Born mountain (719 m above sea level) on two terraces above the left bank of the Aare river. 22.1% of the municipality's 280 hectares is settlement area, 40.6% agricultural land, 30.6% forest and woodland, and 6.8% unproductive area.
appearance: Since 1744 there has been a simple chapel in the village, which was extensively restored in 1974. At the same time, the Bruderklaus Church was built, which fits well into the village next to the granary and the pond as well as the old schoolhouse built in 1837.

name: Boniswil
geography: Boniswil is located in the Seetal on the northwestern shore of Lake Hallwil, about eight kilometers south of Lenzburg. The village lies about one kilometer west of the Hallwilersee on the edge of the Seetal on an elevated terrace. Extensive moorlands with reed belts stretch along the lake shore.  The Aabach forms the northeastern border of the municipality. West of the village center is a steep mountain slope to the Leutwil plateau.

name: Bonstetten
geography: Bonstetten is a municipality in the canton of Zürich. The municipality consists of two parts, Bonstetten-Dorf and Bonstetten-Schachen. The Bonstetten-Wettswil train station is located in the Schachen quarter at 527 m above sea level. Bonstetten-Dorf is located at the community center/church at 543 m above sea level. Bonstetten borders Wettswil am Albis to the north, Stallikon to the east, Hedingen to the south, and Islisberg and Birmensdorf to the west.

name: Bonvillars
geography: Bonvillars is located at 475 m above sea level, 7 km north-northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The farming village extends at the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of Mont Aubert, about 1.5 km from the shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality includes a narrow section on the western shore of Lake Neuchâtel, east of the mouth of the Arnon. The area extends from the flat lakeshore northwards over the Arnon plain to the ridge of Mont Aubert, where it reaches 1346 m.

name: Boppelsen
geography: Boppelsen is located at 520 m above sea level on the southern slope of the Lägern above the Furttal. The east-west oriented Kalkrippe separates the southern Furttal from the Wehntal to the north.
appearance: Boppelsen is often referred to as the "Sonnenstube" (sunny spot) of the region. Nestled between the Lägern and the Breitlen, the village is characterized by a special climate.

name: Borex
geography: Borex is situated at 470 m above sea level, 5 km west of Nyon. It is located on the gently sloping plateau at the foot of the southern Jura, west of Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the Boiron de Nyon stream northwards over the built-up area of Borex to the En Caudray area, reaching the highest point of the municipality at 511 m above sea level.

name: Bosco/Gurin
geography: Bosco/Gurin is located at 1506 m above sea level, making it the highest village in the canton of Ticino. The municipality lies in the upper (western) half of the Valle di Bosco Gurin, 35 km northwest of Locarno on the border with Italy. The northern boundary follows ridges from the Wandfluhhorn to the Camino. Numerous streams merge to form the Rovana di Bosco/Gurin, which flows into the Rovana near Collinasca.

name: Bösingen
geography: Bösingen is located at 550 m above sea level on the northern edge of the Sense district, 11 km northeast of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The village extends on a promontory about 60 m above the valley floor of the Saane, near the confluence of the Sense near Laupen, in the northeastern Freiburg Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the Molasse hills east of the Saane valley.

name: Bossonnens
geography: Bossonens is located in the very south of the canton of Fribourg on the border with the canton of Vaud. The neighboring municipalities are Granges (Veveyse) and Attalens on the Fribourg side, and Oron on the Vaud side.

name: Boswil
geography: Boswil is located in the upper Bünztal in the Swiss canton of Aargau. The village sits at the western edge of the Bünztal plain, at the foot of the Lindenberg. Two valleys divide its eastern slope: the Tobel of the Wissenbach to the south and the less pronounced valley of the Forstbach to the west. Above the source of the Forstbach, between the Egghau and the Lindenberg ridge, is a plateau with the Feldenmoos, a raised bog.
appearance: The main settlement of Boswil consists of the districts of Unterdorf, Oberdorf, Vorstatt and Ritziziel, which have all grown together. The new building district east of the railway line has almost grown together with Bünzen. The hamlet of Sentenhof, a former estate of the Muri Monastery, is located over two kilometers south of the village on the municipal border.

name: Bottens
geography: Bottens is located at 730 m above sea level, 3 km southeast of Echallens and 12 km north of Lausanne. The village extends on a high plateau east of the Talent, in the eastern Gros de Vaud, on the northwest edge of the Jorat hills, in the Vaudois Mittelland.

name: Bottenwil
geography: Bottenwil is located in a narrow valley in the upper Uerkental, bordering the canton of Lucerne. The valley floor is no more than 250 meters wide. The municipality consists of the three districts Winkel, Eggen and Vorstatt. The Grabental branches off from Eggen, surrounded by the hills Eichstock, Rottannhubel and Bottenstein. The Buechwald hill rises between the valleys of the Uerke and the Sulbach.

name: Botterens
geography: Botterens lies at 744 m above sea level, 4 km east of Bulle. It extends on a terrain terrace above the southern end of the Gruyère lake, at the foot of the Freiburg Alps. The municipality includes a section of the pre-alpine area in the Gruyère region, including a small part of the lake surface and extends up the steep forest slope to Mont Bifé (1483 m above sea level).
appearance: The text describes Botterens as a former "Strassenzeilendorf", which translates to a linear village along a road, situated on a terrace. There's also mention of the village of Villarbeney and some individual farmsteads.

name: Bottighofen
geography: Bottighofen lies on the southwest shore of the Obersee, a part of Lake Constance. It is bordered by Kreuzlingen, Münsterlingen, and Lengwil. The lowest point is the lake shore at approximately 396 m above sea level, and the highest point is on the Aggerhau at the southern border at 481 m above sea level.

name: Bottmingen
geography: Bottmingen lies in Leimental at the foot of Bruderholz, 295 m above sea level. Neighboring municipalities are Reinach, Oberwil, Binningen and Basel. 52% settlement area, 28% agriculture, 19% forest and 1% unproductive area.
appearance: null

name: Böttstein
geography: Böttstein is located in the lower Aare valley between Brugg and the German city of Waldshut. It lies on the western bank of the Aare river and consists of the villages of Böttstein and Kleindöttingen, as well as the hamlets of Burlen and Eien. The historical main town, Böttstein, lies in the south on the eastern flank of the Bötteberg. Kleindöttingen, the largest village, is located in the river bend at the southern end of the Klingnauer Stausee.
appearance: The description primarily focuses on location and composition rather than appearance. Therefore, a detailed description of the town's appearance isn't available in the provided text.
pointsOfInterest: Flachmoor im Gebiet «Verlandung im Klingnauer Stausee»

name: Boudry
geography: Boudry is located at 460 m above sea level, eight kilometers southwest of the cantonal capital of Neuchâtel. The small town extends in the lower valley of the Areuse, near its mouth into Lake Neuchâtel, at the southern foot of the Jura. The municipality includes the lower section of the Areuse valley, extending east to Lake Neuchâtel and including part of the alluvial fan north of the Areuse.

name: Bougy-Villars
geography: Bougy-Villars lies at 548 m above sea level, above Rolle, 11 km west-southwest of Morges. The wine-growing village extends in the middle of the vineyards on the southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, in a panoramic location around 170 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the foot of the slope northwards over the vineyards of the Côte to the Signal de Bougy viewpoint (707 m above sea level).
appearance: Bougy-Villars is a wine-growing village (Weinbauerndorf).

name: Boulens
geography: Boulens is located at 718 m above sea level, 19 km north of Lausanne. It is located on a high plateau east of the Mentue valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. The municipality covers a section of the hilly landscape between the Orbe plain and the middle Broye valley.

name: Bourg-en-Lavaux
geography: Bourg-en-Lavaux is located in the Lavaux vineyards on the northern shore of Lake Geneva, about 15 kilometers east of Lausanne and 10 kilometers west of Vevey. The municipality borders Savigny VD to the north, Forel (Lavaux) to the northeast, Puidoux to the east, Lake Geneva to the south, and Lutry to the west.

name: Bourg-Saint-Pierre
geography: The village is located in the Val d’Entremont. To the west, the municipality borders Orsières, to the north Liddes, and to the east Val de Bagnes. To the south is the Swiss border with Italy.  The Great St. Bernard Pass and the hospice on the Great St. Bernard belong to the municipality.

name: Bournens
geography: Bournens is located at 562 m above sea level, 11 km north-northwest of Lausanne. The village extends on a west-facing slope in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Mittelland, east of the Venoge valley. The municipality covers an area of 3.9 km² encompassing a section of the slightly undulating plateau of the Gros de Vaud. The Ruisseau de Malomba flows to the Venoge, forming the northern boundary.

name: Bourrignon
geography: Bourrignon is located at 770 m above sea level, 8 km west-northwest of Delémont. The village is situated on a north-facing spur of the Jura mountain chain of Les Rangiers, above the Lucelle valley. The area includes the Lucelle's source region in the Jura mountains. A part of the high crest of Les Rangiers chain belongs to Bourrignon, where the highest point of the municipality, Les Ordons, is located at 995 m above sea level.

name: Boussens
geography: Boussens is located at 594 m above sea level, 11 km north-northwest of Lausanne. The village extends on the plateau in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Mittelland, east of the valley of the Venoge.  The area includes a section of the Gros de Vaud plateau. To the east, the area extends into the Bois Lovet forest with the Grand-Marais swamp area. The highest point is 613 m above sea level.

name: Bovernier
geography: Bovernier is located south of Martigny in the Val d’Entremont. It consists of the two settlements Bovernier and Les Valettes on the H21 pass road to the Great St. Bernard. Bovernier's neighboring municipalities are Martigny to the north, Val de Bagnes to the northeast, Sembrancher to the east, Orsières to the south, and Martigny-Combe to the west.

name: Bowil
geography: Bowil is located at 733 m above sea level, 6 km east of Konolfingen and 20 km east-southeast of the city of Bern. The village is situated in the broad valley between the Blasenflue and Kurzenberg mountains, on the watershed between the Chise and Emme rivers.
appearance: Bowil is a farming village with scattered hamlets, farm groups, and individual farms on the northern slope of the Kurzenberg.

name: Bözberg
geography: Bözberg is located on a gently rolling plateau in the Tafeljura around the Bözberg Pass. The plateau slopes down to the Aare valley in the south, to the Quelltäler of the Sissle in Fricktal in the west, to the valley of the Schmittenbach in the north and to the Reinerbach in the northeast. The highest point is on the Zeihergutsch on the Linnerberg at 757 meters, the lowest at 402 meters.

name: Böztal
geography: Böztal is a municipality in the canton of Aargau in Switzerland. It belongs to the Laufenburg district.

name: Braunau
geography: Braunau lies on a small pass in the south of the canton of Thurgau. It is embedded between the Bruunauer Bärg and the Brunauer Hööchi. Braunau includes the villages Beckingen, Hittingen and Oberhausen and 17 hamlets. The Hartenauer Bach flows north of the core municipality, and to the south, Braunau is drained by the Maugwilerbach.
appearance: Braunau lies at an altitude of 669 m above sea level. The landscape is characterized by high-stem fruit trees and many hedges.

name: Bregaglia
geography: Bregaglia is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden, located in the Bergell valley. The sources of the Inn river are located in the northeast of the municipality. The municipality also includes the village of Maloja on the Maloja Pass, which is the only part of the municipality in the Upper Engadine.

name: Breggia
geography: The municipality is located on the banks of the Breggia river and comprises the former municipalities of the Muggio valley. Neighboring municipalities are Castel San Pietro, Morbio Inferiore, Vacallo and Cernobbio, Moltrasio, Schignano, Cerano d’Intelvi and Centro Valle Intelvi in Italy.

name: Breil/Brigels
geography: The municipality stretches north to the watershed with Bifertenstock, Muttenstock and Hausstock. In the south, the valley floor at the Vorderrhein and the lowest part of the southern slope belong to Brigels. The Scatlè nature reserve, the highest altitude spruce forest in Europe, lies northwest of the village.

name: Breitenbach
geography: Breitenbach is located at 392 m above sea level, 4 km east-southeast of Laufen. It lies in the Lüssel valley, mostly on the eastern side of the Lüssel and on both sides of the Dorfbach, in the southern part of the Laufen basin in the Jura, in the Schwarzbubenland. The municipality includes a section of the northern Jura.

name: Bremblens
geography: Bremblens is located at 464 m above sea level, 4 km northeast of Morges. The farming village extends on the edge of a plateau west of the Venoge valley, in the Waadtland Mittelland, in a panoramic location about 100 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva.

name: Bremgarten (AG)
geography: Bremgarten is located in the lower Reuss Valley, approximately 16 km west of Zurich, 23 km east of Aarau, and 35 km north of Lucerne. The main part of the municipality is characterized by the Reuss Valley, which is about two kilometers wide. The valley is filled with a thick layer of Ice Age gravel deposits and remnants of a former end moraine.
appearance: The traffic-calmed old town, surrounded on three sides by the Reuss, is a cultural monument of national importance. The old town stands on a moraine up to 30 meters high.
