The Reuss flows around the south side of the old town to the northwest, describes a wide 270° curve, and then flows in a southeastern direction past the north side of the old town.

name: Brenzikofen
geography: Brenzikofen is located at 583 m above sea level, 7 km north of Thun. The village extends at the western foot of the Falkenflue in a wide valley trough, which is separated from the rest of the Aare valley by the bar of the Oppligenbergli, in the pre-Alpine hills. The area includes a section of the Aare valley between Bern and Thun, reaching the Bürglen, a foothill of the Falkenflue, at 860 m.

name: Bretigny-sur-Morrens
geography: Bretigny-sur-Morrens is located at 721 m above sea level, 8 km north of Lausanne. The village extends on a high plateau east of the Talent, in the eastern Gros de Vaud, on the northwestern edge of the Jorat hills, in the Vaudois lowlands. The municipality lies in the higher Vaudois lowlands, bordered by the Talent river to the west and south, and the Combron stream to the northeast. The highest point is at 743 m above sea level.

name: Bretonnières
geography: Bretonnières is located at 681 m above sea level, 5 km west of Orbe and 15 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on the Jura foothills plateau between the Orbe plain and the first Jura chain. The municipality covers a section of the Jura foothills plateau, extending from Crêt des Fives westward across the dry valley north of Croy to the forests.

name: Bretzwil
geography: Bretzwil is located at 628 m above sea level in the southern central part of the canton in a depression on the Seebach. It is surrounded on three sides by the canton of Solothurn. Its neighboring municipalities are Lauwil and Reigoldswil and the Solothurn municipalities Seewen and Nunningen.

name: Brienz (BE)
geography: The municipality of Brienz, with an area of 5492 ha, lies on the shore of Lake Brienz and at the foot of the Brienzer Rothorn (2350 m above sea level). It extends from the Brienzergrat in the north over the lowest point (lake level 564 m above sea level) to the highest elevation Schwarzhorn (2928 m above sea level) south of the lake.

name: Brienzwiler
geography: Brienzwiler is located in the Berner Oberland at the foot of the Wilerhorn on a hill above the Brienzersee. The settlement of Balmhof, further down in the Aaretal valley below a steep rock (Balm), also belongs to Brienzwiler. A piece of uninhabited mountains with alpine pastures on the other side of the Aaretal also belongs to the municipality. The highest mountain there is the Wildgärst at 2891 m above sea level.

name: Brig-Glis
geography: Brig-Glis lies between the southern Bernese Alps and the northern Valais Alps at the confluence of the Saltina and the Rhone. The municipality extends from the valley floor (678 m above sea level) up to the Spitzhorli (2737 m above sea level), which belongs to the Weissmies group and rises west-northwest of the Simplon Pass.
appearance: Brig-Glis consists of Brig, Glis (with the hamlet of Gamsen) and Brigerbad.

name: Brione sopra Minusio
geography: The municipality is located above Minusio on a mountainside overlooking Lago Maggiore.

name: Brislach
geography: The rural municipality is located about 20 kilometers southwest of the city of Basel, at the beginning of the Lüsseltal valley. The area of the municipality is 942 hectares, of which 40% is agricultural land, 37% forest and 9% settlements (as of 2024).

name: Brissago
geography: Brissago is located on the northwestern shore of Lago Maggiore, southwest of Ronco sopra Ascona and Ascona, on the border with Italy. The municipality consists of several hamlets and the Brissago Islands. The town hall is at 197 meters above sea level, the highest hamlet is at 1037 meters, and the highest point is the summit of Gridone (2188 meters).
appearance: Brissago is known for its mild climate and the Brissago Islands, where a botanical garden with around 1500 different plant species is located. There are palms, bamboo and eucalyptus.

name: Brittnau
geography: Brittnau is located in the lower Wiggertal region, bordering the canton of Lucerne. The village center lies west of the Wigger river on a raised terrace. The Altachenbach river, also forming the border with Lucerne, flows parallel to the Wigger. West of the Wiggerebene extends a hilly zone with the Chilchberg, Stockhubel and Schürberg. In the south rises the Heidenhubel, an offshoot of the Brettschellenbergs.
appearance: The flat area is fully built up. West of the three hills is the so-called "outer community" which includes small hamlets and isolated farms. The Talzone and Schürberg are historically considered the "inner community."

name: Broc
geography: Broc is located at 718 m above sea level, 3.5 km east-southeast of Bulle. The village lies on the high terrace between the Saane and Jaunbach rivers, south of Lake Gruyère, on the northern edge of the Alps.  The municipality covers an area of 10.0 km² and includes a section of the pre-alpine region in the Gruyère region.

name: Brot-Plamboz
geography: Brot-Plamboz lies at 1012 m above sea level, 15 km west of the cantonal capital Neuchâtel. The farming village stretches along the southeastern edge of the Vallée des Ponts high valley in the Neuchâtel Jura, west of the La Tourne pass and at the northern foot of the Solmon.
appearance: The municipality of Brot-Plamboz consists of the villages of Brot-Dessus (1012 m above sea level) and Plamboz (1017 m above sea level, at the western foot of Mont Racine) and the hamlets of Vers chez les Brandt (1008 m above sea level), Les Petits Ponts (1007 m above sea level), all along the road on the eastern edge of the Vallée des Ponts, and Le Joratel (1022 m above sea level) on the southern edge of the high valley. In addition, numerous isolated farms are scattered across the Jura heights.

name: Brugg
geography: Brugg is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau. The town lies at the southern foot of the Jura mountains and at the "Wasserschloss of Switzerland", the confluence of the Aare, Reuss and Limmat rivers. The Aare river separates two distinct landscapes: the Swiss Mittelland on the south side and the Tafeljura on the north side. The town stretches more than nine kilometers in the Aare valley.
appearance: Brugg is a small town that forms a regional center in northwestern Switzerland. Together with the neighboring town of Windisch, it forms a cantonal development focus. The town has extensive industrial and commercial areas.

name: Brügg
geography: Brügg is located in the Verwaltungskreis Biel/Bienne in the canton of Bern. The neighboring municipalities are Orpund, Schwadernau, Aegerten, Nidau and Biel/Bienne. The southern border is formed by the Aare in the Nidau-Büren-Kanal.

name: Brunegg
geography: Brunegg is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Lenzburg district, between the Reuss and the lower Bünztal. It sits on the southern edge of the Birrfeld plain. The eastern flank of the Chestenberg rises steeply at the edge of the village. The highest point is 590 meters on the Chestenberg ridge, and the lowest is 409 meters at the northeastern border.
appearance: The village is a clustered settlement (Haufendorf). The article mentions a farmhouse in the village center. The village owes its existence to Brunegg Castle.

name: Brünisried
geography: Brünisried is located at 876 m above sea level, 11 km east-southeast of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The farming village extends on a high plateau west of the Sense River, at the foot of the Oberholz, in the pre-Alpine hills of the eastern Fribourg Central Plateau. The area is bordered to the west by the wooded Oberholz hill.

name: Brusino Arsizio
geography: Brusino Arsizio is located at 276 m above sea level on the shore of Lake Lugano, on the road Riva San Vitale-Porto Ceresio and 6 km northwest of the Capolago station of the Swiss Federal Railways. It lies at the foot of Monte San Giorgio. A cable car leads from the "Terniciolo" district to Serpiano (650 m above sea level).
appearance: Brusino Arsizio was formerly a typical fishing village. With the rise of tourism, numerous holiday homes were built. The parish church of San Michele and the church of Beata Vergine Addolorata both date from the 18th century.

name: Brusio
geography: Brusio is located in the Italian-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. Together with Poschiavo, it forms the Val Poschiavo and the Bernina Region. The municipality covers the lower Puschlav and extends from the southern end of Lago di Poschiavo to the Italian border. The lowest point is at Piattamala (517 m above sea level), and the highest point is the Piz Combul (2901 m).
appearance: The main village of Brusio lies at 780 m, with the villages of Campascio (637 m) and Campocologno (553 m) below. The villages Viano (1281 m) and Cavaione are on narrow terraces above the valley slopes. The area is characterized by scree slopes and chestnut groves.

name: Brüttelen
geography: Brüttelen lies in the Grossen Moos, a fertile area with almost black soils in the Berner Seeland.

name: Brütten
geography: The village belongs to the agglomeration of the city of Winterthur.

name: Bubendorf
geography: Bubendorf is located at 372 m above sea level at the entrance to the Hinteren Frenkental. The village forms the intersection between the Waldenburger- and the Reigoldswilertal. Bubendorf lies between its neighboring municipalities Liestal, Lausen, Ramlinsburg, Hölstein, Lampenberg, Niederdorf, Arboldswil, Ziefen, Lupsingen and Seltisberg. The Frenke river arises at the eastern end of the village through the confluence of the Hinteren and Vorderen Frenke.

name: Bubikon
geography: Bubikon is located in the Zürcher Oberland on the watershed between the Glatt and Lake Zurich. The highest point is the Hombergchropf at 568 m, and the lowest point is the Schwarz river at 480 m.

name: Buch (SH)
geography: Buch is located in the Hegau between Singen am Hohentwiel (D), Stein am Rhein and Schaffhausen. The hamlets of Hard and Blindenhusen belong to Buch. The village lies on the river Biber, which flows into the Rhine at the Bibermühle.

name: Buch am Irchel
geography: Buch am Irchel is a municipality in the district of Andelfingen in the canton of Zurich in Switzerland.

name: Buchberg
geography: Buchberg is located opposite the mouth of the Töss River into the Rhine, on the southern slope of the Hurbig, between the municipalities of Eglisau and Rüdlingen. Together with Rüdlingen, Buchberg forms an exclave of the Canton of Schaffhausen, completely surrounded by the Canton of Zurich and Baden-Württemberg in Germany. The two municipalities form the southern part of the canton.
appearance: In the 20th century, Buchberg developed from a rural, agricultural village into a residential community with viticulture.

name: Buchegg
geography: Die Gemeinde Buchegg liegt auf dem solothurnischen Bucheggberg und grenzt sowohl im Nordwesten als auch im Osten und Südosten an den Kanton Bern. Die südliche Gemeindegrenze bildet der Limpach.

name: Buchholterberg
geography: Buchholterberg is located in a hilly area on the right side of the valley, extending from the Rothachen Gorge up to the Schindelberg. The main settlement is the village of Heimenschwand. Other hamlets are Zihl, Bätterich, Marbach, Schaubhaus, Badhaus, Ibach, Wangelen, Teufenbach, Wyler and Rothachen.

name: Buchillon
geography: Buchillon is located at 398 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of Morges. The village extends on a terrace east of the Aubonne river, about 30 m above Lake Geneva. The municipality covers an area on the north shore of Lake Geneva, extending northwards to the terrace of Buchillon, reaching an altitude of 410 m. The eastern boundary is the Ruisseau des Chenaux, and the western boundary reaches the Aubonne river.
appearance: Buchillon includes single-family house settlements, the hamlet of Grands Bois (405 m above sea level) on the terrace east of the Aubonne valley, and the Chanivaz farm (378 m above sea level) on the alluvial fan of the Aubonne.
pointsOfInterest: Naturschutzgebiet von nationaler Bedeutung ausgewiesenen Areals Chanivaz – Delta de l’Aubonne

name: Buchrain
geography: The municipality of Buchrain is located on the eastern foothills of the Hundsrüggens, nestled between Reuss and Rontal. The village of Perlen also belongs to Buchrain. The highest point of the municipality is on the Hundsrüggen at 484 m above sea level, the lowest on the Reuss at 412 m above sea level.

name: Buchs (AG)
geography: Buchs is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the lower Suhre Valley, and is part of the agglomeration of the cantonal capital, Aarau. The village center is located on both sides of the Suhre river. The municipality lies entirely in the flat plain of the Suhre. The eastern half is covered by the extensive Suret forest.
appearance: The village center consists of the Oberdorf on the western side and the Ausserdorf on the eastern side. Newer residential areas connect to it in the east. The municipality's settlement area has completely merged with that of Aarau and Suhr.

name: Buchs (SG)
geography: Buchs is a town and municipality in the canton of St. Gallen in Switzerland. It is the center of the Werdenberg region. To the east, the municipality borders the Principality of Liechtenstein, with the Rhine River forming the municipal and state border. Buchs also borders the municipalities of Grabs, Gams, Sevelen, and Sennwald. The lowest point is at 441 m above sea level, and the highest point is on the Glannachopf at 2232 m above sea level.

name: Buchs (ZH)
geography: Buchs is located in the Furttal at the foot of the Lägern, near the city of Zürich.

name: Buckten
geography: Buckten lies between two valley slopes at the foot of the Hauenstein, in the Homburgertal on the so-called Hauenstein line.

name: Büetigen
geography: Büetigen is a municipality in the Seeland administrative district of the Canton of Bern in Switzerland. It borders Diessbach bei Büren, Dotzigen, Schwadernau, Studen BE and Lyss.
appearance: Büetigen has grown strongly in recent years thanks to developments. The construction of the A5 motorway from Solothurn to Biel/Bienne has enhanced the location.

name: Bühl
geography: Bühl is located on the northwest edge of the Seeland plain on a narrow hill. The neighboring municipalities are Hermrigen, Kappelen BE, Walperswil and Epsach.
appearance: The town lies on a narrow hill, giving it the name Bühl.

name: Bühler
geography: Bühler lies between Teufen and Gais on the Appenzeller Bahnen route. The Steig hamlet belongs to Bühler. Neighboring communities are Teufen, Gais, Trogen and Speicher, as well as the Innerrhoden district of Schlatt-Haslen. The municipality has a total area of 560 hectares, of which 66 hectares are settled. 350 hectares are used by agriculture. 138 hectares are wooded. The remaining 6 hectares belong to the unproductive areas.

name: Bülach
geography: Bülach lies at 428 m above sea level at the western foot of the Dättenberg. Besides the actual town settlement with its medieval core, Bülach includes the localities of Eschenmosen, Nussbaumen and Heimgarten. The present-day district of Niderflachs was originally also a separate settlement. The direct distance to Zurich is 16 km. 39.0% of the municipal area consists of forest, 29.8% is used for agriculture, and 30.8% is used for settlement and transport.

name: Bulle
geography: Bulle lies at 771 m above sea level, 22 km south-southwest of Fribourg. The town extends on the plain north of the Trême stream, in the Bulle basin in the Gruyère region, at the northern foot of the Moléson massif. A few kilometers east is the Gruyère lake, through which the Saane river flows.

name: Bullet
geography: Bullet is located at 1143 m above sea level, 8 km northwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on the open, south-facing slope of the Jura chain of Chasseron, in a sunny location about 700 m above the Swiss plateau. The municipality area covers a section on the southern slope of the Chasseron chain, reaching to the ridge of the Chasseron, which at 1608 m above sea level, is the highest point of Bullet.

name: Bünzen
geography: Bünzen is located on the Bünz, a partially canalized river. The village is almost merged with Boswil. Waldhäusern lies two kilometers north. In the northeast extends the Wagenrain, a wooded ridge. The village center is located at the end of a moraine.

name: Buochs
geography: Buochs is located on the southern shore of Lake Lucerne (Vierwaldstättersee), on the northern slope of the Buochserhorn, and in the plain created by the Engelberger Aa to the northwest of it. The local mountain of Buochs is the Buochserhorn, at 1806.8 m above sea level. The village center is at 435 m above sea level.

name: Bürchen
geography: Bürchen is located on a west-facing plateau above Visp and Raron. The municipal boundary extends from Turtig in the valley floor at 640 m above sea level to the Violengrat at 2810 m above sea level. To the east and south, the municipalities of Visp, Zeneggen and Törbel border it, and to the north and west Raron and Unterbäch. The municipal area is 13.41 km², of which only 5.4% is used as settlement area. 55.3% are wooded and 25.7% are used for agriculture.
appearance: The townscape of Bürchen is characterized by its typical scattered settlement character with many individual hamlets.

name: Bure
geography: Bure is situated at 587 m above sea level, 6 km northwest of Porrentruy. The farming village extends on the plateau of the western Ajoie, near the border with France. The municipality's area covers the open, gently undulating plateau of the Ajoie west of the Allaine Valley. The highest point is the Haut Mont (633 m above sea level). Larger forests (Le Rondat and Bois de Bure) occupy the west of the municipal area.

name: Büren (SO)
geography: Büren lies at 441 m above sea level, 6 km southwest of Liestal. It is located in a basin at the foot of the Gempen plateau in the Tafeljura, on a source stream of the Orisbach, in the Schwarzbubenland.

name: Büren an der Aare
geography: Büren an der Aare lies on the Aare river, about 15 kilometers east of Biel/Bienne and 20 kilometers west of Solothurn. The municipality extends north and south of the river, with the old town on the right south bank. The municipal area includes the area in a former Aare loop with the nature reserve in the Häftli. The highest point of the municipal area is in the southwest on a mountain at 596 m above sea level.

name: Burg im Leimental
geography: Burg im Leimental is located in the Leimental valley.

name: Burgdorf
geography: Burgdorf is a town and municipality in the Swiss canton of Bern, belonging to the Emmental administrative district. The municipality is located in the Emmental valley, with an altitude ranging from 518 to 734 meters above sea level.

name: Burgistein
geography: Burgistein lies at 763 m above sea level, 10 km west-northwest of Thun. It's located on the heights west of the Gürbetal in the transition area from Längenberg to Gurnigel. The municipality includes a section of the pre-Alpine hills west of the Aare valley, including the valley plain along the Gürbe river. The area extends westward over the Burgistein slope to the heights of Egghölzli, Muttlen, and Holiebi (982 m above sea level).
appearance: The description mentions a "Streusiedlung" which translates to a scattered settlement without a distinct village center. It sits in a scenic location.

name: Bürglen (TG)
geography: Bürglen lies on the Thur River at the intersection of the Weinfelden – Romanshorn and Konstanz – Wil SG roads, and on the Winterthur–Romanshorn railway line. A bridge over the Thur connects the Istighofen district in the south with Bürglen. In addition to the village of Bürglen, the political municipality includes the former villages of Opfershofen and Leimbach in the northeast, as well as Moos in the southwest.
appearance: The village features Bürglen Castle, which houses part of the primary school, and the small old village center that extends at the foot of the castle.

name: Bürglen (UR)
geography: Bürglen, also called Tellendorf, lies southeast of the cantonal capital Altdorf at the entrance to the Schächental. In addition to the village, there are numerous scattered settlements on both sides of the valley. The Schächen flows through Bürglen. The municipality has large alpine areas, mostly behind the Kinzigpass.

name: Büron
geography: Büron is located approximately 6 km from Sursee in the Suhrental valley, between the Suhre river and the Gibelgrat mountain (693 m above sea level). The Suhre river forms the western boundary of the municipality. The Weiherbach stream flows through the village and empties into the Suhre river west of the village. The western slope of the Gibelgrat mountain on the eastern side of the village is heavily forested.

name: Bursinel
geography: Bursinel is situated at 428 m above sea level, 8 km northeast of Nyon. It is located on the southern edge of the plateau at the foot of the Waadtländer Côte, in a scenic location about 50 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the lake shore to the northwest across the flat shore strip and the subsequent steep slope up to the plateau.
appearance: Bursinel is a farming village.

name: Bursins
geography: Bursins lies at 473 m above sea level, 9 km north-northeast of Nyon. The wine-growing village is slightly elevated on the lower southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, in a panoramic location about 100 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the Fossy stream northwards over the plateau at the foot of the Côte to the Jura.

name: Burtigny
geography: Burtigny is situated at 737 m above sea level, 10 km north of Nyon. It lies on a gently south-facing plateau between the Serine and its eastern tributary Moteline, on the southern slope of the Jura, about 350 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva.

name: Buseno
geography: Buseno is located in the Italian-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is in the lower Calanca valley. The municipality consists of the village of Buseno and the district of Molina in the valley floor, as well as the mountain settlements of Giova and San Carlo. The village is located on a heavily wooded slope on the right side above the river Calancasca. From the entire municipal area, most is covered by forest and woodland.
appearance: The village is located on a heavily wooded slope on the right side above the river Calancasca. In Molina there is an artificial pond.
pointsOfInterest: Pfarrkirche SS. Pietro e Antonio abate
Chiesa Madonna di Fatima in Giova

name: Büsserach
geography: Büsserach is located at 420 m above sea level, 4.5 km southeast of Laufen. The village extends in the Lüssel valley, on both sides of the Lüssel, on the southern edge of the Laufen basin in the Jura, in the Schwarzbubenland. The Lüssel crosses the area with a flat valley floor.  The highest point is on the Mettenberg at 813 m above sea level.
appearance: The settlement area of Büsserach has almost completely merged with that of Breitenbach.

name: Bussigny
geography: Bussigny lies at 415 m above sea level, 7 km northwest of Lausanne. It's situated on a south-facing slope east of the Venoge valley, in the Waadtländer Mittelland. The municipality extends over a section of the Waadtländer Mittelland in the Lake Geneva region, between the Venoge and Sorge valleys. The highest point is Sumont hill at 495 m above sea level.
appearance: Bussigny consists of extensive single-family housing estates and industrial zones.

name: Bussnang
geography: Bussnang is located on the south bank of the Thur river, about two kilometers southwest of Weinfelden.

name: Busswil bei Melchnau
geography: Busswil bei Melchnau liegt im Oberaargau im Schweizer Mittelland. Die Nachbargemeinden von Norden beginnend im Uhrzeigersinn sind Langenthal, Melchnau, Madiswil und Lotzwil.
appearance: Das Bild der bäuerlichen Landgemeinde hat sich durch die Bautätigkeit gewandelt. Heute ist Busswil eine Wohngemeinde für auswärtige Pendler.

name: Bussy-sur-Moudon
geography: Bussy-sur-Moudon is located at 628 m above sea level, 18 km southwest of Payerne. The village extends on a terrace on the upper western slope of the Broye valley, in the Molasse hills of the eastern Vaud Central Plateau. The municipality covers an area of 3.1 km² in the hills between the Mentue valley and the middle Broye valley. The area extends westward over the Bois de la Grange (701 m above sea level) to the Vallon des Vaux valley.

name: Bütschwil-Ganterschwil
geography: Bütschwil-Ganterschwil is located in the Wahlkreis Toggenburg. The municipality is located beidseits der Thur in the lower Toggenburg. It borders Mosnang to the west, Lütisburg to the north, Neckertal to the east, and Lichtensteig and Wattwil to the south.

name: Büttenhardt
geography: Büttenhardt is located on the Reiathöhen and can only be reached from Schaffhausen and the neighboring town of Lohn via the Freudental.

name: Büttikon
geography: Büttikon is located on the western edge of the Bünztal valley. The village lies on a plateau between two foothills of the Lindenberg: the Nässi (570 m above sea level) in the east and the Bärholz (510 m above sea level) in the north. The Hinterbach stream, a tributary of the Bünz, drains the area.

name: Buttisholz
geography: Buttisholz is a municipality in the Sursee district of the canton of Lucerne. It lies east of the main traffic axis Luzern-Ruswil-Ettiswil in the Rottal. The municipality includes the village and the hamlets of Gattwil, Guglern, Luternau, St. Ottilien and Soppensee as well as numerous groups of houses and individual farms. 72.1% of the area is agricultural land, 16.6% forest and woodland, and 9.1% settlement area.

name: Buttwil
geography: Buttwil is located on the western edge of the Bünztal valley, on a terrace on the eastern slope of the Lindenberg, two kilometers west of Muri. A further terrace with the hamlet of Galitzi lies to the southwest. Several small streams drain the slope, flowing into the Sörikerbach and finally the Bünz. The Wissenbach flows along the western and northern border. The area is 4.57 km², 1.12 km² of which is forest.

name: Buus
geography: Buus is located in a valley floor where several small valleys meet. With 8.85 square kilometers, it is the third largest municipality in the Sissach district. Neighboring villages include Maisprach, Wintersingen, Rickenbach BL, Ormalingen, Hemmiken in Basel-Landschaft, and Hellikon, Zuzgen, and Zeiningen in Aargau.

name: Cademario
geography: Cademario is located in the upper Malcantone on the western side of the Vedeggio valley. The highest point is at an altitude of 974 meters near Alpe Agra, and the lowest point is at 374 meters above Bioggio. Approximately 16 percent of Cademario's land is used for agriculture, and nearly 80 percent is forested. The climate is mild, almost Mediterranean, due to its sunny and sheltered location.

name: Cadempino
geography: Cadempino is a municipality in the district of Lugano in the canton of Ticino, Switzerland. The village is located at 315 m above sea level on the left bank of the Vedeggio River near the Lugano Nord highway exit. Neighboring municipalities are Lamone to the north, Cureglia to the east, Vezia to the south, and Manno TI to the west.

name: Cadenazzo
geography: Cadenazzo is located in the Swiss canton of Ticino. The village lies at around 215 m above sea level in the Magadino plain, while the highest point of the municipality, the Mattro at 1198 m above sea level, is on the southern slope of the Ceneri massif.

name: Calanca
geography: Calanca is located in the central part of the Calanca Valley, a side valley of the Misox. The lowest point is 763 meters above sea level on the Calancasca, and the highest is 2,953 meters above sea level on a pre-summit of Torent Alto.

name: Cama
geography: Cama is located in the southern Misox on both sides of the Moesa river. The municipality consists of the two districts Al Pont and Norantola. Of the total municipal area of 1506 hectares, 905 hectares are forest and woodland, 498 hectares are unproductive areas (mostly mountains), 63 hectares are agricultural land and 40 hectares are settlement area.

name: Campo (Vallemaggia)
geography: Campo (Vallemaggia) lies in the Valle di Campo at 1314 m ü. M., 26 km northwest of Locarno. The northern border with Bosco/Gurin follows the crest of a mountain chain. The western border to Val Formazza is also the national border with Italy. The southern border is also the district border and runs mostly along mountain ridges. Four small lakes lie in the southern mountain region: Lago dei Pozzöi, Lago Gelato, Lago di Sfii and Lago del Pèzz. The main stream is the Rovana di Campo.
appearance: The municipality consists of numerous groups of houses and individual farms. The largest settlements are Pianelli, Cimalmotto (1405 m ü. M.), Campo (Vallemaggia) (1281–1311 m ü. M.), Piano di Campo (1187 m ü. M.) and Niva (954 m ü. M.). All these settlements are located north of the Rovana di Campo.

name: Canobbio
geography: Canobbio is located at 400 m above sea level on the Lugano-Tesserete road, on the right bank of the Cassarate on a hill 3.5 km north of Lugano. The neighboring municipalities are Capriasca to the north, Lugano to the east, Lugano and Porza to the south, and Comano TI to the west.
appearance: The village is located on a hill.

name: Capriasca
geography: Capriasca is located in the central part of the canton of Ticino in three hilly valleys in the foothills of the Alps, characterized by chestnut forests, terraced meadows and small settlements. The Val Capriasca valley rises from the main town of Tesserete to the north between the Monte Bigorio in the west and the Monte Bar in the east. The area falls towards Lugano on the west side of the Cassarate river.

name: Carouge (GE)
geography: Carouge is a municipality in the canton of Geneva, Switzerland. The city lies southwest of the Arve river. The Les Acacias quarter and part of the La Praille quarter belong to the city of Carouge.
appearance: Carouge is known as the "Greenwich Village of Geneva" because of its artist and bohemian scene. The town was rebuilt from the ground up in the last quarter of the 18th century by the Sardinian monarchy (House of Savoy) to compete with the neighboring city of Geneva.

name: Cartigny
geography: Cartigny is a municipality in the Canton of Geneva, Switzerland. The municipality is located in the center of the Champagne region and includes the villages of Cartigny and La Petite Grave.

name: Caslano
geography: Caslano is located at 275 m above sea level on Lake Lugano, near the mouth of the Magliasina. Its territory protrudes as a peninsula into Lake Lugano. The highest point of the peninsula is Monte Caslano with a height of 526 m above sea level. The municipality includes the right bank of the Magliasina river.
appearance: The old town center on the lake shore leans against Monte Caslano. The village was created on a Roman fortification, which is indicated by the old town name Castellano.

name: Castaneda
geography: Castaneda is located on a terrace in the southern Calanca Valley, 500 meters above the confluence of the Calancasca River and the Moesa River. The village is the first municipality at the entrance to the Calanca Valley. 302 ha of the total municipal area of 394 ha are covered by forest and woodland, while 61 ha are unproductive, mostly mountains. Only 15 ha are agricultural land and 16 ha are settlement area.

name: Castel San Pietro
geography:
Castel San Pietro is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino. It extends over the entire western side of the Muggio Valley up to Monte Generoso.

The neighboring municipalities are Val Mara to the north, Centro Valle Intelvi (IT-CO) to the east, Breggia, Morbio Inferiore, Balerna, Coldrerio to the south, and Mendrisio to the west.

name: Cazis
geography: Cazis is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is located west of the Hinterrhein on the Heinzenberg, about three kilometers north of Thusis. The valley municipality consists of the village of Cazis and seven fractions: Luvreu, Oberrealta, Ratitsch, Schauenberg, Summaprada, Unterrealta and Valleina.

name: Celerina/Schlarigna
geography: Celerina lies in the Upper Engadine. The neighboring villages are St. Moritz to the southwest, Samedan to the northeast, and Pontresina to the southeast. Because the valley is open in three directions at Celerina, Celerina records more hours of sunshine than the surrounding villages. Celerina became famous mainly because of its bobsleigh run and its proximity to the fashionable St. Moritz. The Las Trais Fluors high plateau is located on Celerina's territory.

name: Céligny
geography: Céligny is located in the north of the Canton of Geneva and includes two exclaves of the Canton of Geneva on the right bank of Lake Geneva, one of which is an enclave in the Canton of Vaud. The highest of the two has an altitude of 434 meters.

name: Centovalli
geography: Centovalli is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino, located in the Melezza valley, about 15 km west of Locarno. It encompasses the central part of the valley of the same name, through which the Melezza river flows. The municipality includes numerous small villages and hamlets. The lowest point is about 247 meters above sea level, and the highest point is the Gridone at 2188 meters above sea level.

name: Cerentino
geography: Cerentino is located at the confluence of the Valle di Bosco Gurin and the Valle di Campo, 25 km northwest of Locarno. The municipality's eastern boundary follows streams from Madone di Càmedo (2446 m) to Pizzo Mezzodì (2223 m). The northern border runs east to Pian Cròsg (1925 m) and then north to Camino (2489 m). The remaining boundary follows ridges. Main streams are the Rovana di Campo and Rovana di Bosco/Gurin.
appearance: Not available from the article content.

name: Cevio
geography: Cevio is located 23 km northwest of Locarno in the upper Maggia Valley. The valley floor along the Maggia River forms a well-preserved natural river landscape and is a protected area of national importance as the Maggia alluvial protection area. In 2009, 37.1% of the municipality's area of 151.31 km² was covered by forest and woodland. More than half (exactly 56.0%) was unproductive land (mostly mountainous), 6.0% agricultural land and 1.0% settlement area.
appearance: The municipality consists of the valley village of Cevio and the villages of Bignasco and Cavergno, as well as some hamlets and isolated groups of houses in the Bavona Valley. The hamlets are (from southeast to northwest) Mondada, Fontana, Alnedo, Sabbione, Ritort (Ritorto), Foroglio, Rosed (Roseto), Fontanelada (Fontanellata), Faed (Faedo), La Bola, Sonlèrt (Sonlerto), San Carlo.

name: Chalais
geography: Chalais is a political municipality in the district of Siders in the French-speaking part of the canton of Valais in Switzerland. The municipality also includes the localities of Réchy in the Rhone Valley, Briey, the northern part of the Val de Réchy and the holiday resort Vercorin, situated on a mountain terrace at approx. 1300 m above sea level.

name: Cham
geography: Cham lies on the north shore of Lake Zug at the lake outflow of the Lorze in a hilly landscape shaped by flat glacial moraines east of the Reuss plain. Besides the village center, the municipality also includes the villages and hamlets of Lindencham, Friesencham, Rumentikon, Hagendorn, Bibersee, Niederwil, Oberwil, Hatwil, Islikon, Wannhäusern, Enikon and the Frauenthal in Hagendorn and Heiligkreuz in Cham.

name: Chamoson
geography: Chamoson is located on the north side of the Rhone, halfway between Sion and Martigny. The location on the alluvial fan of the mountain stream Losentse, protected by the Ardève and the rock faces of the Haut de Cry, is ideal for viticulture. The municipality consists of the villages Chamoson and Saint-Pierre-de-Clages.
appearance: Saint-Pierre-de-Clages is the only book village in Switzerland. Numerous antiquarian bookshops and bookstores have settled in the village Suisse du Livre.

name: Champagne
geography: Champagne is located at 457 m above sea level, 6 km northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends at the southern foot of the Jura, on the edge of the Arnon valley, about 1.5 km from the shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality covers an area of 3.9 km² on the southern slope of the Jura. The southern border is formed by the Arnon River.

name: Champéry
geography: Champéry is located at the end of the Val d’Illiez, at 1050 m above sea level, at the foot of the Dents du Midi and the Dents Blanches, in the heart of the Portes du Soleil ski area.
appearance: Champéry is one of the oldest tourist resorts in Switzerland.  Feriengäste could walk along the Galerie Défago.  The village has a modern cable car that goes to the Croix de Culet.

name: Champoz
geography: Champoz is located at 849 m above sea level, 6 km west-southwest of Moutier. The farming village extends on the broad saddle between two Jura chains north of the Vallée de Tavannes. The area includes the Champoz saddle and the valley sloping northeast towards Moutier. In the east, the area reaches the Mont Girod ridge and the western edge of the Klus von Court. To the north, the municipality extends over the steep slope of the Forêt du Droit up to the ridge of the Moron.

name: Champtauroz
geography: Champtauroz is located at 692 m above sea level, 13 km southwest of Payerne. The village is situated on a promontory on the western slope of the Petite Glâne valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. The municipality encompasses a section of the hilly landscape between Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye valley. The eastern part is occupied by the Petite Glâne valley.

name: Champvent
geography: Champvent is located at 530 m above sea level, 5 km west of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends along the edge of the Jura foothills, above the valley of the Bey and the Orbe plain, opposite Mont de Chamblon, in the northern Waadtländer Mittelland.

name: Chancy
geography: Chancy is a municipality in the Canton of Geneva, located in the Champagne region in the westernmost part of Switzerland. It includes the villages of Chancy and Passeiry, as well as the hamlet of Le Cannelet. The westernmost Swiss border marker is situated within Chancy's municipal area.
appearance: The provided text does not contain enough detail about the appearance of the town to create a description.

name: Chardonne
geography: Chardonne is located at 586 m above sea level, 2 km northwest of Vevey. The village stretches on the steep southern slope of Mont Pèlerin, in the eastern Lavaux, in a panoramic location about 200 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva, above Vevey. The municipality includes a section on the northeast shore of Lake Geneva and extends northwards over the steep vineyard slope of Chardonne to the heights of Mont Pèlerin.

name: Château-d’Oex
geography: Château-d’Oex lies at 958 m above sea level, 22 km east of Vevey. The village stretches in a valley widening of the Pays-d’Enhaut on a terrain terrace north above the valley of the Saane (frz. Sarine), between the Vaud Alps in the south and the Freiburg Alps in the north. The Saane flows from east to west, which forms a valley widening at Château-d'Oex.

name: Châtel-Saint-Denis
geography: Châtel-Saint-Denis is located at 809 m above sea level, 9 km north-northeast of Vevey. The village is located directly on the watershed between the Rhône and Rhine catchments, on a hilltop between the Veveyse de Châtel and the Tatrel. Châtel-Saint-Denis extends on a plateau at the foot of the Fribourg Pre-Alps. The municipality includes a section of the higher Fribourg Plateau and the adjacent Fribourg Pre-Alps.

name: Châtel-sur-Montsalvens
geography: Châtel-sur-Montsalvens is located at 910 m above sea level, 5 km east of Bulle. The farming village extends in the Freiburg Pre-Alps on the southern slope of Mont Bifé above the entrance to the valley of the Jaunbach (Jogne), above the Lac de Montsalvens reservoir. The municipality area includes a section of the pre-Alpine area in the southern part of the canton of Freiburg. The southern boundary runs along the Jaunbach.

name: Châtillon (FR)
geography: Châtillon is located separated from Lake Neuchâtel by the former municipality of Font, which has belonged to Estavayer since 2012. Châtillon also borders Cheyres-Châbles and Lully. From the village of Le Purgatoire there is a panoramic view from the Jura to Mont Blanc.

name: Châtillon (JU)
geography: Châtillon lies at 523 m above sea level, 4 km south of the cantonal capital Delémont. The former street village extends east of the Le Bie stream on a north-facing slope on the southern edge of the Delsberg Basin. The area extends from the Montchaibeux to the Jura chain of Le Mont.

name: Châtonnaye
geography: Châtonnaye is located at 692 m above sea level, 7 km northeast of Romont. The agricultural village extends in a scenic location on a northwest-facing slope in the Molasse hills east of the middle Broye valley, in the Freiburg Mittelland.

name: Chavannes-de-Bogis
geography: Chavannes-de-Bogis lies at 479 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of Nyon. The village extends to the southwest of the Vaud, on the ridge between the Versoix and Lake Geneva. The municipality area comprises a section of the ridge between the Versoix in the west and Lake Geneva in the east. The western boundary is the course of the Versoix river.

name: Chavannes-des-Bois
geography: Chavannes-des-Bois is located at 469 m above sea level, 12 km north of Geneva. The village extends on the ridge between the lowlands of the Versoix and Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the Versoix eastward over the hill of Chavannes-des-Bois (highest point of the municipality) to the channelled course of the Creuson.

name: Chavannes-le-Veyron
geography: Chavannes-le-Veyron liegt auf 610 m ü. M., 11 km nördlich der Bezirkshauptstadt Morges. Das Dorf erstreckt sich auf dem Jurafussplateau, nördlich des Tals des Veyron, im Waadtländer Mittelland. Das Gemeindegebiet umfasst einen Abschnitt des leicht gewellten Waadtländer Mittellandes. Von Westen nach Osten wird das Gebiet vom leicht eingetieften Tal des Veyron durchzogen.

name: Chavannes-près-Renens
geography: Chavannes-près-Renens lies at 415 m above sea level, 4.5 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality is located on a plateau between the Sorge and Mèbre streams, north of Lake Geneva. The municipality's area comprises a small section west of Lausanne. The western and southern border is formed by the river Sorge.

name: Chavannes-sur-Moudon
geography: Chavannes-sur-Moudon is located at 680 m above sea level, 20.5 km southwest of Payerne. The village extends on a saddle east of the middle Broye valley, in the eastern Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills between the Broye valley and the upper reaches of the Glâne.

name: Chavornay
geography: Chavornay is located at 452 m above sea level, 4 km southeast of Orbe. The village stretches along the eastern edge of the Orbe plain, between the Talent and Ruisseau de Sadaz rivers. The area includes a section of the Waadtländer Mittelland, with the Orbe plain drained by the Nozon, Talent, and Entreroches canals. The Bois Désert reaches 608 m above sea level.
appearance: Chavornay includes extensive new housing developments, the Le Pâquier farmstead in the Orbe plain west of the Entreroches canal, and some isolated farms.

name: Chêne-Bougeries
geography: Chêne-Bougeries is a municipality in the Canton of Geneva, Switzerland. The rural municipality is located on the left bank of Lake Geneva and to the right of the Seymaz river, encompassing the districts of Grange-Canal, Malagnou, Le Vallon, La Pommière and Conches, as well as the residential blocks of La Gradelle and La Montagne built at the end of the 20th century.

name: Chêne-Bourg
geography: Chêne-Bourg is a municipality located south of Lake Geneva on the left bank of the Seymaz river. The municipality is enclosed by Thônex to the east, and Chêne-Bougeries lies to the west, on the opposite bank of the Seymaz.

name: Chénens
geography: Chénens is situated at 696 m above sea level, 14 km southwest of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The village extends in a scenic location on the northern slope of the Glâne valley, on the Molasse plateau of the Freiburg Central Plateau. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills of the Freiburg Central Plateau. The southern border runs along the Glâne river.

name: Chêne-Pâquier
geography: Chêne-Pâquier is located at 662 m above sea level, 10 km east of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau, southwest of the deep Vallon des Vaux. The municipality's area comprises a section of the hills between Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye valley. The main part of the area is occupied by the Chêne-Pâquier plateau, which reaches its highest point in the southwest at 725 m above sea level.
appearance: Chêne-Pâquier consists of the village of Le Chêne (662 m above sea level), the hamlet of Le Pâquier (638 m above sea level) in a small hollow of the high plateau, and a few individual farms.

name: Cheseaux-Noréaz
geography: Cheseaux-Noréaz is located 3 km east of Yverdon-les-Bains. Cheseaux is situated on a terrace above the southern shore of Lake Neuchâtel, while Noréaz lies on the northern slope of Montéla, about 100 m above the lake. The municipality extends from the lake shore southwards over a reed-covered shoreline and a steep slope to the terrace of Cheseaux-Noréaz. The area includes the wooded slope of Montéla, reaching 616 m above sea level.
appearance: Cheseaux-Noréaz consists of the two hamlets Cheseaux and Noréaz. In between, a larger single-family house quarter has developed, which is seamlessly connected to the settlement area of the city of Yverdon-les-Bains. Furthermore, some individual farms belong to the municipality.

name: Cheseaux-sur-Lausanne
geography: Cheseaux-sur-Lausanne is located at 604 m above sea level, 7 km north of Lausanne. The village is located on the plateau of the southern Gros de Vaud, north of the Mèbre stream, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the Gros de Vaud. The plateau is bordered to the south by the small valley of the Mèbre. To the west, the municipal area extends into the source area of the Chamberonne and Petite Chamberonne.
appearance: Cheseaux-sur-Lausanne includes new residential areas and commercial and industrial zones. Today the village belongs to the agglomeration of Lausanne.

name: Chéserex
geography: Chéserex is located at 530 m above sea level, 5 km west-northwest of Nyon. The village is situated on a gently southeast-sloping plateau at the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of La Dôle, in an area with panoramic views about 150 m above the level of Lake Geneva. The area extends from the En Caudray area up the gently sloping slope to the village of Chéserex and the Bonmont golf course.

name: Chessel
geography: Chessel is situated at 379 meters above sea level, 7 km northwest of Aigle in the Rhône plain, east of the canalized Rhône, at the eastern foot of Grammont. The municipality covers a section of the lower Rhone valley, extending eastward to beyond the Grand Canal.
appearance: Chessel is a farming village located in the Rhône plain.

name: Chevilly
geography: Chevilly is located at 575 m above sea level, 15 km north of Morges. The village is situated on an east-facing slope, above the valley of the Veyron, in the Waadtland plateau. The municipality covers an area of 3.9 km² and includes a section of the gently undulating Waadtland plateau. The area is bordered to the east by the Veyron and to the northwest by the Venoge river. The highest point is 625 m above sea level.
appearance: The article does not contain any information about the town's appearance.

name: Chevroux
geography: Chevroux is located at 454 m above sea level, 8 km north of Payerne. The village extends slightly elevated above the southern shore of Lake Neuchâtel, in the Swiss Mittelland. The area of the municipality covers a section on the southern shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The very flat shore is accompanied by a reed belt up to 500 m wide and a forest belt that is another 300 m wide.

name: Chexbres
geography: Chexbres is situated at 565 meters above sea level, 12 km east-southeast of Lausanne. The village lies on a terrace east of the Forestay stream, in the Lavaux region, with a panoramic location about 200 meters above the level of Lake Geneva.

name: Chiasso
geography: Chiasso is located in the Sottoceneri region, in the Mendrisiotto, southeast of Mendrisio, between Lake Lugano and Lake Como, directly on the border with Italy. It occupies the eastern half of a small plain at 235 m above sea level, surrounded by mountains. To the south lies the elongated Pedrinate hill chain (Sasso di Cavallasca, 614 m), to the northwest the hills before Lake Lugano, and to the north the foothills of Monte Bisbino (1325 m). The plain is drained by the Breggia river.

name: Chigny
geography: Chigny is located at 445 m above sea level, 2 km northwest of Morges. The village extends on a slightly south-facing slope west of the Morges valley, in a panoramic location about 70 m above the level of Lake Geneva.
appearance: The compact old village center is located amidst vineyards.  Chigny also includes the hamlet of La Motte, the single-family home development La Morgette on the left slope of the Morges valley, and L'Eglantine on the plateau below the village.

name: Chippis
geography: Chippis lies on the left, southern bank of the Rhone River and is traversed from the south by the Navisence River before it flows into the Rhone. The stream also divides the municipality into the settlement area to the west and the industrial zone with the aluminum foundry on the east bank.

name: Choulex
geography: The municipality is located south of Lake Geneva and includes the street village of Choulex and the hamlets of Bonvard, Briffod, Chevrier, La Capite and Miolan.

name: Chur
geography: Chur lies in the wide valley of the Alpine Rhine, which bends here from the west to the north. The Plessur flows in from the right, a wild river rich in sediment. The city's territory reaches its greatest heights in the northeast at Montalin (approx. 2220 m above sea level), in the south at the Spundisköpf (1847 m above sea level), the lowest point being the Rhine on the northern municipal border (just under 550 m above sea level.).
appearance: Starting from the right bank of the Plessur below the episcopal court standing on a rocky ridge, the settlement area has gradually spread out onto the alluvial fan, so that the buildings almost reach the Rhine and the core city has grown together with the hamlet of Masans, which is two kilometers to the north.

name: Churwalden
geography: Churwalden lies 8 km south of Chur. The municipality is in the Churwalden valley and includes two sections of the valley, which runs from south to north and is traversed by the Rabiosa river. The territory reaches the Stätzerhorn (2574 m) and Fulhorn (2529 m) on the left side of the valley, and the Parpaner Schwarzhorn (2682 m) on the right side.
appearance: The village of Churwalden has developed into a 2 km long street village. The municipality includes hamlets, farmhouses, the Kurhaus Passugg, and houses in Meiersboden.

name: Clarmont
geography: Clarmont is located at 525 m above sea level, 5.5 km northwest of Morges. The village extends on a small flat area on a south-facing slope west of the Morges valley, in a scenic location about 130 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality covers an area in the hinterland of Morges on the western slope of the Morges valley.
appearance: Clarmont is a farming village.

name: Clos du Doubs
geography: Clos du Doubs is a municipality in the district of Porrentruy in the canton of Jura in Switzerland.

name: Coeuve
geography: Coeuve is located at 432 m above sea level, 5 km northeast of Porrentruy. The farming village extends in the central Ajoie, in the wide valley basin of the Coeuvatte stream, which rises in the village. The municipality covers the upper part of the Coeuvatte valley. The municipal area extends to the height of Charme (up to 500 m above sea level).

name: Coinsins
geography: Coinsins is located at 472 m above sea level, 4.5 km north of Nyon. The village extends on a terrace at the southern foot of the Jura, on the northern edge of the valley plain of the Promenthouse. The municipality covers a section at the southern foot of the Jura, extending northwards along the Promenthouse River across the valley and the Coinsins terrace to the edge of the Bois de Chênes.

name: Coldrerio
geography: Coldrerio is a municipality in the Mendrisio district of the canton of Ticino, located in southern Ticino near the Swiss-Italian border, about four kilometers (as the crow flies) from Chiasso.
appearance: NULL

name: Collex-Bossy
geography: The residential municipality includes the villages of Collex and Bossy and is located on the right bank of the Versoix on the border with France.

name: Collina d’Oro
geography: Collina d’Oro is a municipality in the district of Lugano in the Swiss canton of Ticino. The neighboring municipalities are Muzzano TI and Sorengo to the north, Lugano and Grancia to the east, Vico Morcote and Morcote to the south, and Agno TI, Magliaso and Caslano to the west.
pointsOfInterest: The American Schools in Switzerland in Montagnola

name: Collombey-Muraz
geography: Collombey-Muraz is a political municipality in the Monthey district in the French-speaking part of the canton of Valais in Switzerland.

name: Collonge-Bellerive
geography: Collonge-Bellerive is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland.

name: Collonges
geography: Collonges is located southeast of Saint-Maurice and northwest of Martigny on the east bank of the Rhone, which flows from south to north at Collonges. The neighboring municipalities of Collonges are Bex (VD) to the north, Fully to the east, Dorénaz to the south, Evionnaz to the west, Saint-Maurice to the northwest, and Lavey-Morcles (VD) to the north-northwest.

name: Comano
geography: Comano is located at 511 m above sea level on a hill terrace northwest of Lugano. The neighboring municipalities are Origlio and Capriasca to the north, Canobbio to the east, Porza to the south, and Cureglia to the west.
appearance: NULL
pointsOfInterest: Studios des Fernsehens der italienischsprachigen Schweiz

name: Commugny
geography: Commugny is located at 419 m above sea level in the extreme southwest of the Canton of Vaud, 13 km north of Geneva. The village extends on the ridge flanking the lower Lake Geneva on its western side, on both sides of the Greny stream. The municipality covers a section of the ridge west of Lake Geneva.

name: Concise
geography: Concise is located at 440 m above sea level, 10 km northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches along the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of Mont Aubert on both sides of the Ruisseau du Moulin stream, near the shores of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipal area extends from the lake shore northwards over the densely wooded slope (Bois de la Côte) to the Jura ridge of Mont Aubert, where the highest point of Concise is reached at 1320 m above sea level.

name: Confignon
geography: Die Gemeinde Confignon erstreckt sich über eine Fläche von 2,77 km² und grenzt an Bernex, Onex, Plan-les-Ouates und Perly-Certoux.

name: Conters im Prättigau
geography: Conters im Prättigau is located on the southern side of the Prättigau valley, about two kilometers east of Küblis. The municipal area extends from the Landquart over the mostly wooded slope, divided by several wild streams, to the extensive alpine pastures at the Durannapass (2116 m above sea level), which leads as a bridle path to Schanfigg. The highest point is the Chistenstein (2473 m) in the southwest of the territory.
appearance: The municipality consists of the compact clustered village of Conters im Prättigau (1110 m), elevated above the confluence of the Schwarzbach and Wissbach, and the hamlet of Brunnen (982 m) on the road to Küblis. In addition, there are numerous individual farms and Maiensässe.

name: Conthey
geography: Conthey extends from the Tsanfleuron Glacier on the border with the Canton of Vaud down to the banks of the Rhone. The altitude ranges from over 3000 m above sea level to 460 m above sea level. It consists of ten villages: Aven, Châteauneuf, Conthey, Daillon, Erde, Le Bourg, Premploz, Sensine, St-Séverin and Vens.

name: Coppet
geography: Coppet is located at 377 m above sea level, in the extreme southwest of the Canton of Vaud, 13 km north-northeast of the city of Geneva. The village stretches along the shore of Lake Geneva, south of the mouth of the Greny stream. The area of only 1.9 km² comprises a narrow section on the western shore of Lake Geneva.
appearance: The historical core of Coppet is surrounded by a green belt. The numerous new single-family houses and villa districts are mostly located on the edge of the municipality and merge with the settlement areas of the neighboring municipalities of Tannay, Commugny and Founex.

name: Corbeyrier
geography: Corbeyrier is located at 920 m above sea level, 3.5 km north of Aigle. The village extends on a south-facing slope on the eastern side of the lower Rhone valley, on the slope of the Tour d'Aï, in a panoramic location about 550 m above the Rhone plain. The municipality includes a section of the Vaud Alps, reaching up to 2205 m above sea level. The northern part contains the nature reserve Argnaule with mountain lakes.

name: Corbières
geography: Corbières lies at 719 m above sea level, 6 km northeast of Bulle. The former farming village extends on a terrain terrace above the eastern bank of the Greyerzersee, at the foot of the Berra.

name: Corcelles (BE)
geography: Corcelles is located at 655 m above sea level, 6 km east of Moutier. The village lies in the Kettenjura, in the Cornet, the eastern part of the Jura valley of Moutier. Corcelles lies at the foot of the La Hauteur pass. The area includes the easternmost section of the Grand Val, which is bordered to the north by Mont Raimeux. The area extends to the high plateau of Mont Raimeux and the Jura chain La Haute Joux.

name: Corcelles-le-Jorat
geography: Corcelles-le-Jorat is located at 786 m above sea level, 28 km southwest of Payerne. The village is situated in a hollow of the Ruisseau de Corcelles stream, on the eastern slope of the Jorat plateau, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills between the Jorat and the upper reaches of the Broye, drained by two northeast-flowing streams.

name: Corcelles-près-Payerne
geography: Corcelles-près-Payerne liegt auf 454 m ü. M., 2 km nordöstlich von Payerne. Das Dorf erstreckt sich am Südrand der Broyeebene, beidseits des Flüsschens Arbogne, an deren Austritt aus dem freiburgischen Molassehügelland, im nordöstlichen Waadtländer Mittelland. Die Nordgrenze verläuft teilweise entlang der Autobahn A1.

name: Corgémont
geography: Corgémont lies at 663 m above sea level, 10 km northwest of Biel. The former linear village stretches in the eastern part of the Vallon de Saint-Imier valley, mostly north of the Schüss river. The municipality includes a section of the valley basin of the Vallon de Saint-Imier and extends north to the Montagne du Droit and south to the Chasseral chain, reaching an altitude of 1325 m.
appearance: Corgémont includes numerous individual farms scattered throughout the valley and on the Jura heights.

name: Corminboeuf
geography: Corminboeuf is located at 633 m above sea level, 4.5 km west of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village stretches in the valley of the Ruisseau du Tiguelet in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Plateau. The municipality covers an area of the Molasse heights between the valleys of the Sonnaz and the Saane. The northern part is taken by the valley of the Ruisseau du Tiguelet, bordered by the Champ de la Croix and the Bois de Moncor.

name: Cormoret
geography: Cormoret lies at 706 m above sea level, 15 km west-northwest of Biel. The former linear village extends in the central part of the Vallon de Saint-Imier valley on both sides of the Schüss river. The municipality includes a relatively narrow section of the valley floor in the Vallon de Saint-Imier. The Schüss river flows through the central part.

name: Cornaux
geography: Cornaux is located between the slopes of the Jura and the plain between Lake Neuchâtel and Lake Biel. It is situated on the Zihl Canal. Two municipalities border Cornaux: Cressier to the northeast and Laténa to the west and south, where the Zihl Canal forms the cantonal border with Bern.
appearance: The southern part of the municipality is determined by the agricultural and industrial zone. The northeastern territory consists of vineyards and the village, and the northeast consists of forest.

name: Cornol
geography: Cornol is located at 520 m above sea level, 7 km east of Porrentruy. The village stretches along the Cornoline stream in the Ajoie, at the northern foot of the Jura mountains. The municipality area includes the La Pran plain, and extends into the source area of the Cornoline on the northern slope of the Lomont Jura chain. The highest point is 940 m above sea level on the Lomont chain.

name: Corseaux
geography: Corseaux is located at 445 m above sea level, 1.5 km northwest of Vevey. The village extends slightly elevated on the northeast shore of Lake Geneva, at the southern foot of Mont Pèlerin, in the eastern Lavaux, above Vevey.  The area of the 1.1 km² municipal area comprises a section on the northeast shore of Lake Geneva. The municipal area extends from the lake shore northwards up the slope of Mont Pèlerin, where the highest point of Corseaux is reached at 500 m above sea level.
appearance: Corseaux includes extensive residential settlements and some vineyards.

name: Corsier (GE)
geography: Corsier is located on the left, southern shore of Lake Geneva.

name: Corsier-sur-Vevey
geography: Corsier-sur-Vevey is located at 420 m above sea level, 1 km north of Vevey. The village extends slightly elevated on a terrace north of the alluvial fan of the Veveyse at its mouth into Lake Geneva, at the southern foot of Mont Pèlerin, in the extreme southeast of Lavaux. The municipality extends from the alluvial fan of the Veveyse in a narrow strip to below Châtel-Saint-Denis and includes the right (northwestern) side of the Veveyse valley.

name: Cortaillod
geography: Cortaillod is located at about 484 m above sea level, 8 km southwest of Neuchâtel. The village lies on the edge of a plateau at the foot of the Jura, south of the alluvial fan of the Areuse, about 50 m above the level of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality covers an area on the northwest shore of Lake Neuchâtel.

name: Cortébert
geography: Cortébert lies at 680 m above sea level, 12 km northwest of Biel. The village extends in the eastern part of the Vallon de Saint-Imier valley on both sides of the river Schüss. The municipality includes a section of the valley basin of the Vallon de Saint-Imier. To the north, the area reaches the Montagne du Droit (up to 1210 m above sea level). To the south, Cortébert extends to the Chasseral chain, where the highest point of the municipality is reached at 1400 m above sea level.
appearance: Cortébert includes numerous individual farms scattered throughout the valley and on the Jura hills.

name: Cossonay
geography: Cossonay is situated at 562 m above sea level, 11 km north of Morges. The small town extends on the edge of the high plateau west of the Venoge, about 130 m above the river valley, in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the Gros de Vaud plateau. The eastern border is formed by the Venoge river. The Bois du Sépey forest, with an altitude of 620 m above sea level, marks the highest point.

name: Cottens (FR)
geography: Cottens is situated at 714 m above sea level, 11 km southwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. It lies on the northern slope of the Ruisseau de Cottens valley, in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the gently undulating Molasse plateau between the Broye plain to the north and the Glâne valley to the south.

name: Courchapoix
geography: Courchapoix lies at 496 m above sea level, 9 km east of Delémont. The village stretches along the Scheltenbach in the Val Terbi. The municipality covers a section in the east of the Delsberger Beckens. The Ruisseau de Montsevelier flows into the Scheltenbach here. In the north, the municipal area extends to the Jura crest of the Fringelikette. The highest elevation is at 940 m above sea level. To the south, the area extends to the Plain Fayen (759 m above sea level).

name: Courchavon
geography: Courchavon is located at 407 m above sea level, 3 km northwest of Porrentruy. The former street village extends in the valley of the Allaine, in the Ajoie. The area of the 6.2 km² municipal area covers a section of the relatively narrow Allaine Valley and extends to the often wooded table Jura heights of the Ajoie.

name: Courgenay
geography: Courgenay is located at 488 m above sea level, 4 km east-southeast of Porrentruy. The village stretches in a wide depression south of the Allaine, in the Ajoie, at the northern foot of the Jura mountains. The area includes the plain, which slopes slightly northwards to the Allaine. The municipal area extends south to the Jura ridge of the Lomont chain, which separates the Ajoie from the Doubs valley.

name: Courgevaux
geography: Gurwolf is located at 475 m above sea level, 2.5 km south of Murten. It lies in a broad depression through which the Ruisseau du Moulin stream flows, at the northwest foot of the Bouley forest, in the northern Fribourg Central Plateau. The area includes a section of the hills south of Lake Murten, a drumlin landscape formed by the ice-age Rhone Glacier.

name: Courrendlin
geography: Courrendlin lies at 436 m above sea level, 4 km southeast of Delémont. The village stretches on both sides of the Birs, at the exit from the Choindez gorge on the southern edge of the Delsberg basin. The area includes a section in the central part of the Delsberg basin plain. In the south, it includes the Choindez gorge, flanked by the Rochers du Midi and the Forêt de la Cendre.

name: Courroux
geography: Courroux is located at 418 m above sea level, 2 km east of the cantonal capital Delémont. The village is located in the plain east of the Birs in the central part of the Delsberg Basin, a broad depression in the folded Jura. The area extends in a narrow strip to the foothills of the Montchemin and Rosé hills, part of the Mont-Raimeux chain.

name: Court
geography: Court is located at 666 m above sea level, 5 km southwest of Moutier. It lies in the Kettenjura, on both sides of the Birs, in the eastern part of the Vallée de Tavannes, at the point where the Birs leaves the valley basin to the north through the Klus von Court. The area includes the easternmost section of the Vallée de Tavannes.

name: Courtedoux
geography: Courtedoux is located at 470 m above sea level, 2.5 km west-southwest of Porrentruy. The village extends on a terrace north of the Creugenat valley, in the Ajoie, at the northern foot of the Jura mountains. The municipality includes the partly wide lowland of the dry valley of Creux-Genat. In the northwest, the municipality extends up the gently rising slope to the table Jura plateau of Bure.

name: Courtelary
geography: Courtelary lies at 695 m above sea level, 14 km west-northwest of Biel/Bienne. It stretches in the central part of the Vallon de Saint-Imier valley on both sides of the Schüss river. The area extends to the Montagne du Droit (up to 1263 m) in the north and to the Chasseral chain (up to 1540 m) in the south.

name: Courtepin
geography: Courtepin lies at 578 m above sea level, 7 km north-northwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village stretches in a broad valley basin of a stream flowing into the Schiffenensee, in the Molasse hills in the northern Fribourg Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Molasse hills between Lake Murten and the Saane valley.

name: Courtételle
geography: Courtételle is located at 441 m above sea level, 3 km southwest of the cantonal capital Delémont. The village extends mostly to the right of the Sorne in the plain in the central part of the Delsberg basin, a broad depression in the folded Jura. The municipality extends to the ridge of the Jura chain Le Mont (up to 1133 m above sea level).

name: Crans
geography: Crans (VD) liegt auf 423 m ü. M., 4 km südwestlich von Nyon. Das Dorf erstreckt sich auf einer Geländeterrasse über dem Westufer des Genfersees und über dem Tälchen des Nant du Pry. Der Gemeindeboden erstreckt sich vom Seeufer westwärts bis auf den Höhenrücken, auf dem mit 473 m ü. M. der höchste Punkt erreicht wird. Die südliche Grenze bildet das Tal des Nant du Pry.
appearance: Crans (VD) besteht aus mehreren Einfamilienhaus- und Villenquartieren sowie einigen Einzelhöfen.

name: Crans-Montana
geography: Crans-Montana is located in the French-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Valais (district of Siders). The holiday region lies on a high plateau above the Rhône Valley between Sion and Sierre.
appearance: Crans-Montana is known as a noble ski resort. The resort includes the district of Crans-sur-Sierre. It has grown together with the holiday settlement of Crans-sur-Sierre and is known under this double name in tourist usage. The area is decorated with small lakes and extensive spruce forests.
pointsOfInterest: Les Roches International School of Hotel Management
Communauté Beit Yossef de Crans-Montana et du Canton de Valais CBYCM

name: Crassier
geography: Crassier is located directly on the French border, 6 km west of Nyon. The village stretches along the Boiron de Nyon river in the plain between Lake Geneva and the Jura mountains. The municipality covers an area of the plain at the southern foot of the Jura. The municipality extends from the Bois d'Ely hilltop northwards across the Boiron valley.

name: Crémines
geography: Crémines is located at 616 m above sea level, 5 km east of Moutier. The village stretches along the La Raus stream in the Jura Mountains, in the Cornet, the eastern part of the Moutier Jura valley, also called Grand Val. The area is bounded to the north by the Mont Raimeux Jura chain. The municipality extends south into the Klus of Gänsbrunnen.

name: Cressier (FR)
geography: Cressier is located at 567 m above sea level, 4 km southeast of Murten. The village lies in a panoramic position on a plateau east of the Bouley forest, above the Biberen valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Fribourg Mittelland. The area encompasses a section of the Molasse hills between Lake Murten and the Saane valley. The Bouley forest, at 630 m above sea level, forms the highest point.

name: Cressier (NE)
geography: Cressier lies at 436 m above sea level, 10 km northeast of Neuchâtel. The village stretches along the southern foot of the Jura, on both sides of the Ruhaut stream, on the northern edge of the Zihlebene plain between Lake Neuchâtel and Lake Biel. The area extends northwards over the Raffineriegelände and the agricultural plain. The municipal area extends west to the edge of the Chaumont.

name: Crésuz
geography: Crésuz is located at 909 m above sea level, 6.5 km east of Bulle. The village lies on the southern slope of Mont Bifé on a terrace above the Lac de Montsalvens reservoir. The municipality includes a section of the pre-Alpine area in the southern part of the canton. The former Jaunbach river course forms the southern border. The eastern border follows the Javro River, which is dammed by Lac de Montsalvens.

name: Crissier
geography: Crissier is located at 467 m above sea level, 5.5 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality extends on a southwest-facing slope between the valleys of the Sorge to the west and the Mèbre to the east, in the Vaud Central Plateau, north of Lake Geneva. The municipality's area comprises a section of the Vaud Central Plateau, reaching up to the Gros de Vaud plateau to the north.
appearance: Crissier includes new residential areas and an extensive commercial and industrial zone along the highway.

name: Cuarnens
geography: Cuarnens is located at 620 m above sea level, 13 km north of Morges. The village extends on the Jura foothills plateau, on both sides of the upper Venoge, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The area is drained by the Venoge. The municipality extends to the lower southern slope of the Jura, where the highest point of Cuarnens is reached at 750 m above sea level.

name: Cudrefin
geography: Cudrefin is located at 434 m above sea level, 16 km northeast of Payerne. The village extends in the plain north of the Mont Vully, near the southeast shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality borders the southeast shore of Lake Neuchâtel and stretches southwards over a reed belt into the Marais de Cudrefin. The highest point is reached at 578 m above sea level on the edge of the Bois de l'Allou forest.

name: Cugnasco-Gerra
geography: Cugnasco-Gerra is located on the edge of the Magadino Plain. It includes the village of the same name and the hamlets of Boscioredo, Bosco, Massarescio, Medoscio, Moncucco, Pian Restell and Sciarana. The Maiensässe of Monti di Ditto and Curogna are the oldest settlements of Cugnasco.

name: Cureglia
geography: Cureglia is located at 430 m above sea level. The neighboring municipalities are Origlio to the north, Comano TI to the east, Porza and Vezia to the south, and Lamone and Cadempino to the west.

name: Dachsen
geography: Dachsen lies in the Zurich Weinland, in the northwestern corner, the Ausseramt. It is nestled between the Cholfirst and the course of the Rhine, which here has dug deep into the Ice Age gravel plain. The Rhine Falls at 395 m above sea level is in the immediate vicinity. To the west runs the border between Germany and Switzerland.

name: Dägerlen
geography: Dägerlen is a municipality in the Winterthur district of the Canton of Zurich in Switzerland. The municipality of Dägerlen in the Zurich Weinland includes the districts of Oberwil, Rutschwil, Berg, Bänk and Dägerlen. A good two-thirds of the municipality's area is used for agriculture, a quarter is wooded and a good eight percent are settlement and traffic areas (as of 2018). To the north, the municipality borders the Andelfingen district, to the east Dinhard, to the south Seuzach and to the west Hettlingen.

name: Dagmersellen
geography: Dagmersellen lies in the Swiss Midlands, on the banks of the Wigger river.  The municipality borders Reiden to the west and north, Triengen to the northeast, Knutwil to the east, Mauensee to the southeast, Wauwil, Egolzwil and Nebikon to the south, and Altishofen to the southwest.
appearance: The town center of Dagmersellen is shown in a photograph featuring a roundabout. The image provides a glimpse of the urban landscape.

name: Daillens
geography: Daillens is situated at 503 m above sea level, 3 km east of Cossonay and 13 km north-northwest of Lausanne. The village is located on a gently sloping hillside on the plateau of the Gros de Vaud, east of the Venoge valley. The municipality covers a section of the Gros de Vaud plateau. The Ruisseau de Malomba stream flows through the area in the south.

name: Dallenwil
geography: Dallenwil lies on the eastern slope of the Stanserhorn between the left bank of the Engelberger Aa up to the Hohberg and Arvigrat. The municipality includes the hamlets and settlement areas: Städtli, Chapellendorf, Mühledorf, Vorder-, Hinter- and Ober-Dallenwil as well as Oberau. On a terrain terrace at around 1200 m lie Wirzweli, Wiesenberg, Dürrenboden and Wissifluh. In terms of area, Dallenwil is the fifth largest municipality in the canton of Nidwalden.

name: Dällikon
geography: Dällikon is located in the Furttal, north of the city of Zürich, south of the Lägern, east of Baden and west of the Zurich-Kloten airport. The area of 449 ha consists of 41.2% agricultural zone and 32.7% forest. 20.3% are settlement area, 4.9% traffic area, 0.2% water and 0.7% unproductive area.

name: Dalpe
geography: Dalpe is a municipality in the Quinto circle in the Leventina district of the canton of Ticino in Switzerland. The mountain village of Dalpe lies on a plateau at the entrance to the Val Piumogna, a right side valley of the Valle Leventina. It includes the hamlet of Cornone, which together with Dalpe forms the municipality.
appearance: Not present in article content.

name: Damphreux-Lugnez
geography: Damphreux-Lugnez is a municipality in the Porrentruy district of the Canton of Jura in Switzerland.

name: Däniken
geography: Däniken liegt im solothurnischen Niederamt, zwischen Aarau und Olten. Die Städte Olten und Aarau liegen ca. 7 bis 8 km von Däniken entfernt. Mit umliegender Hügellandschaft, dem Aareufer und dem nahegelegenen Jura bietet es einen Erholungsraum. Die Gemeinde misst 543 Hektar, davon rund ein Drittel Wald. Nachbargemeinden sind Niedergösgen, Obergösgen, Dulliken, Walterswil SO und Gretzenbach. Der Bahnhof liegt 382 Meter über Meer, der höchste Punkt (610 Meter) befindet sich im Waldgebiet gegen den Engelberg.
appearance: Ein Grossteil des Däniker Gemeindegebietes wurde allgemein sehr stark durch die Aare geprägt. Der unstete Lauf der Aare war Ursache ungezählter Überschwemmungen und damit dauernder Umgestalter der Tallandschaft. Die Anhöhen waren mit mächtigen Wäldern bedeckt. Dort siedelten sich die ersten Bewohner an, rodeten und urbanisierten das Land.

name: Dardagny
geography: Dardagny is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. It is located almost at the westernmost point of the country and consists of the villages of Dardagny and La Plaine, as well as the hamlets of Malval, Essertines, La Tuilière and Les Granges. Dardagny lies on the border with France on the Rhone.
appearance: Dardagny is situated on the Ruisseau des Charmilles creek. It offers a romantic atmosphere due to its Château de Dardagny. The Ruisseau des Charmilles flows by the edge of the village.

name: Därligen
geography: Därligen is located in the Berner Oberland on the southern shore of Lake Thun. The municipality includes the hamlet of Tracht in the west of the municipality on the shore of the lake and various individual farms and Alps on the slope of the Därliggrat. The neighboring municipalities are Unterseen, Interlaken, Matten bei Interlaken, Wilderswil, Saxeten and Leissigen.
appearance: The village is located on the lake shore, while the municipality extends to the Därliggrat.

name: Dättlikon
geography: Dättlikon is located as the westernmost village in the Winterthur district on the southern slope of the Irchel. It is a political municipality in the lower Tösstal in the Winterthur district of the canton of Zurich in Switzerland.
appearance: Thanks to its mild climate, long hours of sunshine and quiet location, Dättlikon is an attractive place to live. The municipality also includes the new settlements of Böckli, Deller and Blumetshalde on the Töss, which were built after the melioration in the 1970s.

name: Davos
geography: Davos is located in the Prättigau/Davos region of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It encompasses almost the entire Landwassertal valley.
