The valley's axis, marked by the Landwasser river, the main road, and the railway line, runs from northeast to southwest. The valley floor descends gently from Davosersee.

name: Degersheim
geography: Degersheim is situated on the Südostbahn line. It lies in a hilly landscape. The lowest point is in the Bubental at 647 m above sea level, and the highest point is near the Degersheim exclave Obergampen at 1061 m above sea level. The municipality is drained by the Aachbach and the Talbach.

name: Deitingen
geography: Deitingen is situated at 430 m above sea level, 6 km east of Solothurn. The village stretches on both sides of the Ösch River on the gravel plain of the Emme south of the Aare, in the Solothurn Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the groundwater-rich gravel plain, reaching the Aare to the north and the A1 motorway to the west. The Deitinger Wald reaches an altitude of 468 m above sea level.

name: Delémont
geography: Delsberg lies at 413 m above sea level, 28 km southwest of Basel. The town extends on both sides of the Sorne, shortly before it flows into the Birs on the northern edge of the Delsberg basin. The municipality includes a section in the central part of the agricultural plain of the Delsberg basin. To the north, the area extends to the anticline of the Les-Rangiers chain, reaching the highest point in the Plain de la Chaive (930 m above sea level).

name: Delley-Portalban
geography: Delley-Portalban is located 10 km north of Payerne. Portalban lies on the eastern shore of Lake Neuchâtel, south of the town of Neuchâtel, on the Ruisseau de la Contentenetta stream, while Delley lies on the adjacent broad ridge between the lake and the Broye plain in the northwestern Fribourg Mittelland.
appearance: Delley-Portalban consists of the two villages Delley (497 m above sea level) and Portalban, the latter being divided into the districts of Portalban-Dessous (435 m above sea level) on the flat shore strip and Portalban-Dessus (475 m above sea level) on the high plateau.

name: Démoret
geography: Démoret is located at 733 m above sea level, 10 km east-southeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on a slightly northeast-sloping plateau in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. The area encompasses a section of the hill country between Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye Valley. The central part is taken up by the undulating plateau of Démoret.
appearance: null

name: Denges
geography: Denges is located at 399 m above sea level, 3.5 km east-northeast of Morges. The village stretches on the northeast slope of the Monteiron hill, west of the Venoge, in the Vaudois Mittelland, near the northern shore of Lake Geneva. The municipality covers a flat section in the Vaudois Mittelland. The area extends from the Venoge to the Monteiron hill, reaching the highest point at 433 m above sea level.

name: Densbüren
geography: Densbüren is located in the Staffeleggtal and differs geographically from the rest of the district. It is the only municipality not in the Aare, Suhre, and Wyna river valley plains, but separated by the 621-meter Staffelegg Pass in the southernmost Jura chain. The area is drained by the Staffeleggbach and, in the eastern part near Sulzbann, by the Zeiherbach, both flowing north to the Sissle.

name: Derendingen
geography: Derendingen lies at 439 m above sea level and 4 km east-southeast of Solothurn. The village extends on the gravel plain east of the Emme, on the Grüttbach, in the Solothurner Mittelland.
appearance: After the construction of new residential quarters, Derendingen and Oberdorf have grown together to form a single large settlement. There are industrial and commercial areas along the Emme and the Emmekanal as well as in the eastern part of the village.

name: Develier
geography: Develier lies at 477 m above sea level, 4 km west of the cantonal capital Delémont. The former street village extends in the lowland of the La Pran stream, in the central part of the Delsberg basin, a wide depression in the folded Jura. In the north, the municipality extends to the ridge of the Jura chain of Les Rangiers (up to 880 m above sea level).
appearance: The text does not contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: Diegten
geography: Diegten liegt auf 470 m ü. M. Das Dorf wird vom Diegterbach durchflossen, der im südlich angrenzenden Eptingen als Obertlochbach entspringt. Ausserdem grenzt Diegten noch an Läufelfingen im Südosten, an Känerkinden im Osten, an Wittinsburg im Nordosten, an Tenniken im Norden, an Hölstein im Nordwesten und an Bennwil im Westen.

name: Dielsdorf
geography: Dielsdorf is located in the northwest of the canton of Zurich, at the eastern end of the Lägern and at the foot of the small town of Regensberg. The lowest point of the municipality is 410 m above sea level, as an offshoot of the Neeracher Ried, the highest point at 653 m above sea level, about at the height of Regensberg.

name: Diemtigen
geography: Diemtigen lies in the Bernese Oberland in the Alps. The villages of Oey and Diemtigen are located at the foot of the Diemtigtal valley, which essentially encompasses the municipality. Oey is located at the mouth of the Chirel into the Simme. The municipality consists of the eight areas Oey, Diemtigen, Bächlen, Horboden, Riedern, Entschwil, Zwischenflüh and Schwenden.

name: Diepflingen
geography: Diepflingen is located in the Homburgertal on the Hauenstein railway line Sissach-Läufelfingen–Olten. The rail altitude is 411 m above sea level.

name: Diepoldsau
geography: Diepoldsau liegt mehrheitlich östlich des Rheins, der in diesem Bereich mit dem Diepoldsauer Rheindurchstich im Zuge der Regulierung des Alpenrheins 1923 neu angelegt wurde. Der Alte Rhein bildet die Landesgrenze zu Österreich.

name: Dierikon
geography: Dierikon is located in the Rontal valley on the Lucerne-Zug route between Ebikon and Root LU, north of the Dotteberg and Rooterberg. The municipality is partially wooded on both mountain slopes. The Götzetal valley, which contains a historical country estate, separates Dotteberg and Rooterberg. The Götzetalbach flows through this valley in a northwesterly direction to its confluence with the Ron. The highest point is on the Rooterberg (786 m above sea level), the lowest on the Ron (414 m above sea level).
appearance: The unofficial village center is the Rigistrasse area from the Zentralstrasse junction up to and including the bakery. This area includes a residential and commercial building with a restaurant, the church with its steeple, the town hall with a post office agency, the bakery, the primary school, the kindergarten, and the historic village.

name: Diessbach bei Büren
geography: Diessbach bei Büren is a municipality in the Seeland administrative district of the Canton of Bern in Switzerland. Diessbach borders Schnottwil, Wengi, Grossaffoltern, Lyss, Büetigen, Dotzigen and Büren an der Aare. It is located in the Seeland.

name: Diessenhofen
geography: Diessenhofen lies on the south bank of the High Rhine, on the road from Schaffhausen to Stein am Rhein. The municipality extends for approximately 8 km along the southern bank of the Rhine, between Schaffhausen and Stein am Rhein. The High Rhine forms the border between Germany and Switzerland. At the Schifflände, the Geisslibach flows into the Rhine.
appearance: The town of Diessenhofen retains its original medieval structure to this day. The townscape includes the Rhine bridge, the town church, the landing stage (Schiffslände), and Unterhof Castle.

name: Dietikon
geography: Dietikon is located west of Zürich at 388 meters above sea level. It lies at the confluence of the Reppisch and Limmat rivers and on the railway line from Zürich to Baden. About 25% of the area is forest, with the largest and most well-known being Honeret, Guggenbüehl and Röhrenmoos.

name: Dietlikon
geography: Dietlikon is divided into three parts by the Schwamendingen–Effretikon road and the 1855 NOB main line Oerlikon–Winterthur. To the north is the idyllic village center with lots of green space. The neighboring municipalities are Wallisellen, Kloten and Bassersdorf to the west, Wangen-Brüttisellen and Dübendorf to the south.
appearance: The northern part is the idyllic village center with many green spaces. The middle part has a similar character with a rest of industry in the west, in the southern part is the industrial district, which is cut through once more by the highway.

name: Dietwil
geography: Dietwil is located in the Reuss valley and is the southernmost municipality in the canton of Aargau. The village lies about 1.5 kilometers from the western bank of the Reuss on a moraine hill at the foot of the Iberg, which forms the western boundary with the Seetal. The elevation ranges from 400 to 538 meters above sea level.
appearance: The village is situated on a moraine hill. The plain between the village and the river is completely flat. There is a church and rectory.

name: Dinhard
geography: Dinhard is a municipality in the Canton of Zürich, belonging to the district of Winterthur. The municipality consists of the localities Eschlikon, Welsikon, Vorder-Grüt, Ausser-Dinhard, Riedmühle, Kirch-Dinhard and Längerenrüti. 69.8% of the municipality's area is used for agriculture, 19.7% is covered with forest, 3.9% is traffic area and 6.2% is settlement area, 0.4% is water.

name: Dintikon
geography: Dintikon is located on the western edge of the lower Bünztal valley, about five kilometers southeast of Lenzburg. The old village center is on the eastern slope of the Rietenberg. The municipality includes parts of the Herrliberg, Hochrüti, Hochwacht, and Grossmoos hills. Dintikon forms the southern end of a four-kilometer-long settlement band that extends across the Bünztal plain.
appearance: No information about the town's appearance was found in the provided text.

name: Disentis/Mustér
geography: The winter sports and health resort is located in the Cadi in the upper part of the Surselva, at the confluence of the Medelser Rhine with the Vorderrhein. The Rein d’Acletta flows south of Disentis, which flows into the Vorderrhein. On the summit of Piz Cazarauls there is a three-canton corner to the cantons of Glarus and Uri.

name: Dittingen
geography: Dittingen is located in a northern side valley of the Laufental on the southern slope of the Blauen mountain chain. In the southeast, the municipality borders the Birs river.

name: Dizy
geography: Dizy is located at 583 m above sea level, 14 km north of Morges. The village extends on the high plateau west of the Venoge valley, in the western Gros de Vaud. The municipality covers a section of the undulating plateau of the Waadtländer Mittelland.
appearance: The article doesn't describe the town's appearance or architecture.

name: Domat/Ems
geography: Domat/Ems is located on the Alpine Rhine. Neighboring municipalities are Bonaduz, the city of Chur, Churwalden, Domleschg, Felsberg, Rhäzüns, Rothenbrunnen and Tamins. Geographically, Domat/Ems is known for the twelve Tumas in its municipality.

name: Domleschg
geography: Domleschg is located in the Viamala region and encompasses about two thirds of the Domleschg landscape. Neighboring municipalities are Cazis, Churwalden, Domat/Ems, Fürstenau, Rothenbrunnen, Scharans and Vaz/Obervaz.

name: Dompierre (VD)
geography: Dompierre lies at 713 m above sea level, 13 km south of Payerne. The village extends on a plateau east of the valley of the middle Broye, in the eastern Vaudois Mittelland. The area is part of the Molasse hills between the Broye valley and the upper Glâne valley. The Seyve drains the area to the Broye. The highest point is 800 m above sea level in the Bois de Billens.

name: Donneloye
geography: Donneloye lies at 540 m above sea level, 7 km east-southeast of the district capital Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on a terrace on the eastern slope of the Mentue valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau.  The municipality extends from the Mentue eastwards over the valley floor and the terrace of Donneloye to the adjacent heights below Mézery-près-Donneloye.

name: Doppleschwand
geography: Doppleschwand is located on a terrace between Grosser Fontanne and Kleiner Emme in the lower Entlebuch at the foot of the Napfgebirge. The municipality includes the village as well as the hamlets of Gober, Holz and Oberhüsern. The differences in altitude within the municipality are considerable. The Goberflue lies at 971 m above sea level, the village at 750 m above sea level and the lowest point at the mouth of the Grossen Fontanne into the Kleine Emme at 590 m above sea level.

name: Dorénaz
geography: Dorénaz lies on the eastern bank of the Rhone, north of Martigny and south-southeast of Saint-Maurice. Besides the village of Dorénaz, the municipality includes the hamlets of Alesse and Champex. Champex is reachable from Dorénaz by aerial cable car. Neighboring municipalities are Collonges to the north, Fully to the east, Martigny to the south, Vernayaz to the west, and Evionnaz to the north-northwest.

name: Dorf
geography: Dorf is located on the road from Henggart to Flaach in the Flaach Valley. 46.0% of the municipality's area is agricultural land, 41.0% is forest, 11.7% is settlement area, and 1.3% is used for transport (as of 2018).

name: Dörflingen
geography: Dörflingen is a municipality in the Canton of Schaffhausen in Switzerland. It borders German territory on two opposite sides, forming a strip of land that separates Büsingen am Hochrhein from the rest of Germany, making it an exclave.
appearance: Dörflingen is an old farming village where arable farming and viticulture used to predominate. In recent decades, the village has increasingly developed into a residential community with numerous commuters.

name: Dornach
geography: Dornach is a municipality located in the Dorneck district in the canton of Solothurn, Switzerland. Its border is formed by the Gempen plateau on the mountain side and the Birs river on the valley side.

name: Dottikon
geography: Dottikon is located in the lower Bünz valley. The village center lies between the western slope of the Wagenrain and the canalized Bünz river. The southern half of the village and the extensive industrial area are located in the Bünz plain. A wooded hill called "Berg" rises in the southeast. The area is 3.88 square kilometers, with altitudes ranging from 406 to 549 meters above sea level.

name: Döttingen
geography: Döttingen is located in the lower Aare valley, about five kilometers south of the border with Germany. The Aare river forms the western border, flowing north into the Klingnauer Stausee. The Surbtal valley extends east-west, bordered by steep slopes. To the north rises the Hornbuck (484m) and Aemmeribuck (515m), part of the Acheberg.
appearance: The village center is located just north of the confluence of the Surb and Aare rivers. The settlement has completely merged with that of the neighboring municipality of Klingnau. The southern and southwestern slopes are planted with vines.

name: Dotzigen
geography: Dotzigen lies in Seeland at the foot of the Dotzigen-/Stedtliberges. It borders Busswil bei Büren, Büetigen, Schwadernau, Scheuren BE, Meienried, Büren an der Aare and Diessbach bei Büren. In the west, the Alte Aare flows through, and there is a now protected floodplain on both sides of its banks.

name: Dozwil
geography: Dozwil is located in the Oberthurgau on the Seerücken. From viewpoints at the edge of the village, the entire Lake Constance can be overlooked in favorable weather. To the west of Dozwil lies the Güttingerwald and to the east the Romanshornerwald, both local recreation areas.  It is the second smallest municipality in terms of area in the canton of Thurgau.
appearance: The non-denominational St. Michael's Association, founded by Paul Kuhn, found a large influx after 1970 and shapes the village with its buildings.

name: Drei Höfe
geography: Drei Höfe liegt im Schweizer Mittelland östlich der Schwemmebene der Emme im Südosten des Solothurner Wasseramtes. Die Gemeinde besteht aus den Siedlungen Heinrichswil, Mösli und Winistorf der früheren Gemeinde Heinrichswil-Winistorf und den beiden Siedlungen Hersiwil und Rütihof der früheren Gemeinde Hersiwil.

name: Dübendorf
geography: Dübendorf is located in the district of Uster in the canton of Zurich. It is situated at an altitude of 440 m above sea level and is part of the Zurich metropolitan area. It lies on the Glatt river, eight kilometers east of the city center of Zurich, which is separated from the Glatt Valley by the Adlisberg.

name: Düdingen
geography: Düdingen is located east of the Schiffenensee (Lake Schiffenen) in the middle of the German-speaking part of the Canton of Fribourg. The municipality is located in the lower Sense district. The area slopes towards the Saane river. The Saane forms the Schiffenensee and the district border. The Düdingerbach (also called Horiabach) divides the municipality into two similar-sized areas.  The lowest point is 498 m above sea level below the dam of the Schiffenensee; the highest point is 708 m at Dählhölzli.
appearance: Düdingen consists of a village with a core and adjacent quarters, and about 20 small hamlets.

name: Duggingen
geography: Duggingen is a municipality in the Laufen district of the canton of Basel-Landschaft. Duggingen borders Aesch, Pfeffingen, Grellingen, Seewen, Hochwald, Dornach and Himmelried. 28% of the area is agricultural, 56% forest, 14% building zone and 2% unproductive area.
appearance: Duggingen is a typical single-family house village due to its rural location and well-thought-out zoning regulations. The large, fully developed building land areas currently make Duggingen an attractive place for newcomers.

name: Duillier
geography: Duillier is located at 466 m above sea level, 3 km north of Nyon. The village is situated on a small elevation at the southern foot of the Jura, on the right of the Promenthouse valley. The municipality extends from the valley of the Asse northwards over the hill of Duillier to the river Promenthouse, reaching an altitude of 490 m above sea level at the foot of the Jura.

name: Dulliken
geography: Dulliken is located at 394 m above sea level, 3 km east of Olten, on the high terrace at the southern edge of the Aare river plain, at the foot of the Engelberg chain, at the southern foot of the Jura mountains. The municipality extends from the Aare valley over the Dulliken terrace to the Engelberg anticline. The highest point is on the Engelberg ridge at 702 m above sea level.

name: Dully
geography: Dully is located at 420 m above sea level, 7 km northeast of Nyon. The village extends on a promontory at the edge of the plateau at the foot of the Vaudois Côte, bordered by the valley of the Dullive in the west and Lake Geneva in the east, in a panoramic location about 50 m above the lake level.

name: Dürnten
geography: Dürnten is located in the Tössbergland region of the Zürcher Oberland. It lies between the Jonatal valley and the Bachtelhang at Hasenstrick. The landscape is characterized by deep ravines, wooded hilltops, and rocky outcrops. At the transition from the Zürcher Obersee to the Glatttal, it joins the drumlin landscape with glacial hills, moors and forests. The municipality is bordered by the Oberlandautobahn A15 and the Schwarz river.
appearance: Dürnten consists of four geographically separate parts: Tann, Dürnten, Oberdürnten and Breitenmatt. Oberdürnten lies on the slope of the Bachtel, east of Dürnten. Oberdürnten and Breitenmatt are separated by some fields and a height difference of 50 meters. From Breitenmatt there is a good view over the Zürcher Oberland to Lake Zurich.

name: Dürrenäsch
geography: Dürrenäsch liegt an der Wasserscheide zwischen Wynental und Seetal. Das Dorf liegt in einem Sattel des Höhenzugs, der das Wynental vom Seetal trennt. Der grösste Teil des Gemeindegebiets wird gegen Westen in Richtung Wyna entwässert. Gegen Süden steigt das Gelände zur Wandfluh (766 m ü. M.) an. Am nördlichen Ende des Sattels liegt der 630 Meter hohe Bampf. Der östliche Teil gehört geographisch zum Seetal.
appearance: Das Dorf besitzt eine lockere Siedlungsstruktur mit einigen auseinander liegenden Häusergruppen, die stellenweise mit dem kleinen Zentrum zusammengewachsen sind. Es liegt in einem Sattel des Höhenzugs.

name: Dürrenroth
geography: Dürrenroth is located in the valley of the Rotbach. The village itself lies on the southern valley terrace. The three hamlets Hubberg, Hubbergschachen and Gassen are on the north side of the valley, while the hamlet of Waltrigen is located on the south side. The municipality covers an area of approximately 14 square kilometers.

name: Ebikon
geography: Ebikon is located in the Rontal valley and is a suburb of the city of Lucerne. The municipality includes the upper Rontal valley, the largest part of the Rotsee lake, and the Rathausen district, which lies on the Reuss river. To the west is the Hundsrüggen with the Sädelwald forest. North of it, the Reuss flows past and forms the northern municipal boundary.

name: Ebnat-Kappel
geography: Ebnat-Kappel is a municipality in the canton of St. Gallen in Switzerland, located in the Toggenburg constituency. The municipality includes the hamlets of Brandholz, Wintersberg, and Bendel. The highest mountain is the Speer, which is also the highest Nagelfluh mountain in Europe at 1950 m above sea level.

name: Echallens
geography: Echallens lies at 617 m above sea level, 14 km north of Lausanne. It is located on the extensive plateau of the central Gros de Vaud, on both sides of the Talent River, on the northwest edge of the Jorat hills, in the Vaudois Mittelland.
appearance: Echallens includes extensive new residential areas as well as some isolated farms.

name: Echandens
geography: Echandens is located at 432 m above sea level, 4 km northeast of Morges. The village extends on a promontory on the southeast slope of the Echandens plateau, west of the Venoge, in the Vaudois Mittelland, in a panoramic position about 50 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The highest point in the municipality is Sur Sian at 462 m above sea level.

name: Echarlens
geography: Echarlens is located at 716 m above sea level, 3.5 km northeast of Bulle. The village stretches in the valley east of the Sionge stream, at the southeast foot of the Gibloux, west of Lake Gruyère. The municipality covers a section of the Bulle basin in the Fribourg Alps.

name: Echichens
geography: Echichens is located at 466 m above sea level, 2 km north of Morges. It extends at the edge of a plateau east of the Morges in the Vaud Central Plateau, in a panoramic location about 100 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality includes a section of the Vaud Central Plateau in the hinterland of Morges.

name: Eclépens
geography: Eclépens is located at 461 m above sea level, 16 km north of Morges. The village extends in the valley of the Venoge, at the southern foot of the Mormont, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The area of the 5.8 km² municipal area covers a section of the Vaudois Mittelland. The central part of the area is occupied by the up to 1 km wide flat valley lowlands at the middle course of the Venoge.
appearance: No information about appearance found in the text

name: Ecublens (VD)
geography: Ecublens is located at 428 m above sea level, 6 km west of Lausanne. The original village stretches on a moraine between the valleys of Venoge and Sorge, in the Vaudois Mittelland, about 50 m above the level of Lake Geneva. The municipality does not directly border the lake. The area is characterized by the moraine and the valley of the Venoge.
appearance: The provided text does not contain a description of how the town looks.

name: Ederswiler
geography: Ederswiler is located at 553 m above sea level, 7 km north of Delémont. The farming village lies in the northern Jura near the border with France, in a valley basin on the Bösenbach. The municipality area includes the valley of the Bösenbach, which drains north to the Lützel.  The area extends to the hills of Berg and Hasenschell, and the Lobberg.

name: Egerkingen
geography: Egerkingen is located at the northeastern end of the Gäu district. It borders Langenbruck to the north, Hägendorf to the northeast, Gunzgen to the east, Härkingen to the southeast, Neuendorf to the south, Oberbuchsiten to the southwest, and Holderbank SO to the northwest. The northern half is covered by the Unterwald forest, while the southern half consists of settlements and arable fields.  The altitude ranges from 426 to 966 meters above sea level.
appearance: Egerkingen is a village at the southern foot of the Jura mountains. It is one of the oldest settlements in the canton of Solothurn.  The Catholic St. Martin's Church stands on Roman walls.

name: Egg
geography: Egg ZH is located between the Greifensee and the Pfannenstiel, forming the southwest corner of the Zurich Oberland. The municipality consists of the three villages Hinteregg, Egg and Esslingen. It is complemented by the outer districts Rällikon, Inner- and Usser-Vollikon, Niederesslingen, Rohr, Schaubigen, Eichholz, Neuhaus and Guldenen. The lowest point is in Rällikon (438 m above sea level), the highest on the Pfannenstiel (853 m above sea level).

name: Eggenwil
geography: Eggenwil lies in the Reuss Valley, north of Bremgarten. It sits between the east bank of the Reuss and the western slope of the Heitersberg. A spur of land juts into the Reuss plain, where the village center is located. The Reuss meanders strongly near Eggenwil, bordering the Foort peninsula on three sides.  The area is 246 hectares, with forests covering 67 hectares and built-up areas covering 41 hectares. The highest point is at 555 meters, and the lowest is at 357 meters.

name: Eggerberg
geography: Eggerberg lies in the German-speaking Upper Valais on the south side of the Bernese Alps on the northern valley side of the Rhone Valley. The municipality consists of the villages of Eggerberg and Eggen, the hamlets of Finnu, Mühlackern, Wirmschland, Weitematte, Schliecht, Nest, Engernhaus, Berg, Lipboden, Halta, Zum Stadel, Rohrli, Hohwang, the areas of Wang and Wyer, and various Alpine pastures.

name: Eggersriet
geography: Eggersriet is a municipality on the southern slope of the Rorschacherberg, located slightly above and east of St. Gallen, on the route between St. Gallen and Heiden. It consists of the villages of Eggersriet and Grub SG, as well as the hamlet of Egg. Neighboring municipalities are St. Gallen to the west, Untereggen and Rorschacherberg to the north, Lutzenberg and Heiden to the east, and Grub AR, Rehetobel and Speicher to the south.

name: Eggiwil
geography: Eggiwil lies in the upper Emmental. Neighboring municipalities are Signau, Langnau, Röthenbach, Schangnau, Marbach, Trub and Trubschachen. The Emme and the Röthenbach flow through the municipality. The highest point is the Wachthubel at 1414 m above sea level, the lowest point lies in the Aeschau at 690 m above sea level.

name: Eglisau
geography: Eglisau is a small town and municipality in the Bülach district in the Unterland of the canton of Zurich in Switzerland. The historical town is located on the Rhine near the German border, nestled in sunny vineyards and is part of the Rafzerfeld. Eglisau also includes the districts of Seglingen and Tössriederen on the left bank of the Rhine.
appearance: The historic town is located on the Rhine, nestled in sunny vineyards. Despite having just over 5000 inhabitants, the municipality has retained the old city rights acquired in the Middle Ages.

name: Egliswil
geography: Egliswil is located four kilometers south of Lenzburg in the Seetal valley.  It sits in a gently sloping hollow between the Häbni, Birch, and Emmet hills. Northeast of the village, the hollow transitions into the narrow side valley of the Tribach stream.  The area west and south of the village is largely flat. The municipality's altitude ranges from 412 to 666 meters.

name: Egnach
geography: Egnach is located on the shore of Lake Constance between Arbon and Romanshorn. It covers 18.50 km², of which 16.4 km² is cultivated land, 0.75 km² is forest, and 2.8 km is lakefront.
appearance: The sprawling scattered settlement includes the settlement centers of Egnach on Lake Constance, Neukirch and Steinebrunn on the road connection Amriswil–Arbon, as well as 68 hamlets and farms, including Buch, Hegi, Winden (formerly Kügeliswinden) and Burkartshaus. The seat of the municipal administration is located in Neukirch.

name: Egolzwil
geography: Egolzwil is located on the edge of the silted-up Wauwil Lake at the southern end of the Santeberg, known locally as the Egolzwilerberg, which reaches a height of 701 m above sea level. The municipality includes the Wauwilermoos penal institution and the district of Engelberg. The Egolzwilersee lake is also part of the municipality.

name: Ehrendingen
geography: Ehrendingen lies at the northern foot of the Lägern in a side valley of the Surb. The Lägern is the northeasternmost foothills of the Jura mountains. Its ridge stretches from west to east, at an altitude of 757 m above sea level up to 859 m above sea level. The Steinbuck (661 m above sea level) rises on the eastern border. The lowest point is 425m at the Surb, and the highest is the Burghorn at 859m.
appearance: The buildings of the two villages are seamlessly connected and follow the Dorfbach, which rises on the north flank of the Lägern. To the west, the foothills of the Siggenberg extend, which is part of the Tafel Jura.

name: Eich
geography: Eich lies on the eastern shore of Lake Sempach, between Sempach and Sursee. The village is divided into the lower village on the lake and the upper village near the church. The Dorfbach flows through the village. The Brandbach flows along the northern border. The municipality area is 922 ha - without the share of Lake Sempach only 589 ha.

name: Eichberg
geography: Eichberg is located south of the city of Altstätten on the southeast slope of the Hirschberg and is characterized by scattered settlements with the cores of Eichberg-Dorf, Au, Hölzlisberg and part of Hinterforst. A tripoint of the cantons of Appenzell Ausserrhoden and Appenzell Innerrhoden is located on the summit of the Hörchelchopf.

name: Eiken
geography: Eiken is located in the Fricktal region, just over two kilometers south of the German border. The village lies on the western side of the Sissle, on the edge of the valley plain. North of the village, the river reaches the Rhine plain. South of the village, the steep slopes of the Tafeljura hills rise up, including the Seckenberg (458 m above sea level) and the Schupfarterberg (472 m above sea level).
appearance: The village is a street village almost two kilometers long.

name: Einsiedeln
geography: Einsiedeln is located south of the Lake Zurich on a high plateau at about 880 m above sea level.
appearance: Einsiedeln is known for the Einsiedeln Abbey, the most important Baroque building in Switzerland.

name: Embd
geography: Embd is located in the front part of the Mattertal valley. It is a steep village with an average incline of 55% or 29 degrees.

name: Embrach
geography: Embrach lies in the Embrachertal valley, 6 kilometers northeast of Zurich International Airport, in a wide U-shaped side valley of the Töss river. A plain of 500 ha, 5 km long and up to 1.5 km wide forms the valley floor. The plain is bounded by the slopes of the Blauen to the east, the Dättenberg to the west, the Ghei and Egg to the south, and the Töss gorge to the north.

name: Emmen
geography: Emmen is located at the confluence of the Kleine Emme and the Reuss River, bordering the Swiss Mittelland and the Lucerne Alps. It's a northern suburb in the agglomeration of Lucerne, bordering the city of Lucerne to the south and southwest. Emmen consists of Emmen and Emmenbrücke. Emmen lies in the Reuss valley, while Emmenbrücke is mostly on a plateau (ca. 460 m).
appearance: Emmen-Dorf consists of Oberdorf and Unterdorf. The Emmenfeld/Hasli/Buholz plain is undeveloped due to the airfield, except for industrial zones. Emmenbrücke's settlement has surpassed Emmen in population and is expanding over former agricultural zones. New residential areas are being developed on the south-facing slope west of Gerliswil.

name: Emmetten
geography: Emmetten is located on a pre-alpine terrace above the southern shore of Lake Lucerne. The municipality's territory extends from 434 m above sea level on the lake shore to the summit of the Schwalmis, the highest point of the municipality at 2246 m above sea level. Other prominent points include the Niderbauen Chulm and the Oberbauenstock.
appearance: The municipality includes several farms down by the lake, the village on the terrace with several districts (Schöneck, Gumprecht, Sagendorf, Sunnwil, Hattig) and the Choltal located south of the village. From south to north, the Cholbach crosses the municipality and then flows into Lake Lucerne.

name: Endingen
geography: Endingen is located in the Surbtal valley, about four kilometers from the German border. The valley initially runs west, then turns north in the village center. The municipality is bordered by the Ruckfeld plateau to the west and the Hörndlihau (543 m above sea level) to the east. The area south of the village is a transition zone to the Mittelland, with the Siggenberg forming the natural border to the Limmattal.

name: Engelberg
geography: Engelberg is located 25 km south of Lake Lucerne and 20 km south of Stans, in a wide high valley at about 1000 m altitude. It is enclosed between the Titlis massif (3238 m) in the south and a mountain chain in the north, formed by the Engelberger Rotstock, Ruchstock, Rigidalstock and the Walenstöcke mountains (up to about 2800 m). In the east, the Hahnen (2600 m) dominates the townscape.
appearance: The flat valley floor of Engelberg was formed at the end of the last ice age, when a huge rockfall from the Titlis blocked the valley exit to the northwest. The resulting natural reservoir was filled up within a few thousand years by debris and sand carried down from the neighboring mountains by the Engelberger Aa and its tributaries. Today, only the small, artificially regulated Eugenisee reminds of the former mountain lake.

name: Ennetbaden
geography: Ennetbaden is located opposite the city of Baden on the right bank of the Limmat. The village lies in a side valley of the Limmat between the Geissberg and the Lägern. The Lägern is the northeastern foothills of the Jura mountains, while the Geissberg is part of the Table Jura. The Limmat forms the western boundary, and the Höhtal Saddle the eastern boundary.

name: Ennetbürgen
geography: Ennetbürgen is located in the Swiss canton of Nidwalden. The municipality includes parts of the Allmend between Stans and Buochs, the Bürgenberg and Bürgenbergwald areas, and Lake Lucerne. It lies between 435 m above sea level on the lake shore and 1127 m above sea level on the summit of the Bürgenstock.

name: Ennetmoos
geography: Ennetmoos is a municipality in the canton of Nidwalden, Switzerland. The municipality includes the new development area Gotthardli towards Stans, the hamlets St. Jakob, Rohren, Allweg/Grueb, Rotzloch, Rütli and Vorsäss, the Mueterschwanderberg, part of the north and west flank of the Stanserhorns and shares in Lake Lucerne. Only 5.7 % of the municipality is settlement area. A large part (43.9%) is covered with woodland. An even larger area of 47.9 % is used for agriculture.

name: Entlebuch
geography: Entlebuch is located in the southwest of the Canton of Lucerne. The entire municipality is hilly or mountainous. The village itself lies in the valley created by the Kleine Emme River. The municipality's territory reaches the Wissgubergrat (1940 m above sea level) on the border with the Canton of Obwalden, where the Grosse Entlen river originates.

name: Epalinges
geography: Epalinges is located at 785 m above sea level, 4 km northeast of Lausanne. It is situated on the southern slope of the Jorat, below the Col du Chalet-à-Gobet pass, in the Waadtländer Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the southern slope of the Jorat, divided by smaller valleys. The area is bordered by the valley of the Flon stream to the west and the valley of the Flon Morand to the east. Several tributaries of the Flon originate in the municipal area.
appearance: Today, the former agricultural areas of Epalinges are largely built over, and the settlement area has grown seamlessly together with that of Lausanne. The municipality consists of several centers.

name: Ependes (VD)
geography: Ependes is located at 447 m above sea level, 5 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains.  It sits on a slight elevation at the southeastern edge of the Orbe plain, at the foot of the northern foothills of the high plateau of the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Midlands.

name: Eppenberg-Wöschnau
geography: Eppenberg-Wöschnau is located about 2 km southwest of Aarau. Wöschnau lies at 379 m above sea level on the southern edge of the Aare valley on the gravel terrace and at the foot of the Buechholz, while Eppenberg is on a gently east-facing slope at 459 m above sea level in a clearing on the hill between the Aare and Suhr valleys.
appearance: The municipality consists of the districts Eppenberg and Wöschnau and an industrial area in Schachen.

name: Epsach
geography: Epsach is located in the Bernese Seeland. The neighboring municipalities starting from the north in a clockwise direction are Mörigen, Hermrigen, Bühl BE, Walperswil and Täuffelen.
appearance: Five municipal fountains, mostly dated, stand along the streets. The fountains of Epsach, in addition to the farmhouses worthy of protection or preservation, are part of the townscape and of national importance.

name: Eptingen
geography: Eptingen is located at the upper end of the Diegtertal valley and is completely surrounded by the Faltenjura.

name: Ergisch
geography: Ergisch lies at 1086 m ü. M. on a terrace nearly 500 m above the valley of the Rhone, east of the mouth of the Turtmanntal coming from the south.

name: Eriswil
geography: Eriswil is located in the upper part of the Langete valley. Its eastern boundary is also the border with the canton of Lucerne. To the east are the municipalities of Luthern and Ufhusen, to the north Huttwil, to the west Wyssachen, and to the south Wasen. The Langete river, which gives its name to the valley, rises in the municipality.

name: Eriz
geography: Eriz is located in the upper part of the Zulgtal valley on the southern slope of the Honegg and the western slope of the Hohgant. The municipality consists of Aussereriz and Innereriz with several hamlets. 45.1% of the municipal area is agricultural land, 44.0% is covered by forest and woodland, 8.4% is unproductive area, and only 2.6% is settlement area.

name: Erlach
geography: Erlach is a small town located on the shores of Lake Biel at 433 meters above sea level. The Jolimont, a 603-meter-high hill with views of Lake Biel, is located within the municipality.
appearance: NULL

name: Erlen
geography: Erlen is located in the district of Weinfelden in the canton of Thurgau.  The municipality includes the former local municipalities of Buchackern, Engishofen, Ennetaach, Erlen, and Kümmertshausen, as well as Riedt.
appearance: The village of Erlen consists of the districts of Erlen-Dorf, Eestäge and Eppishausen on the main road Weinfelden–Amriswil and its intersection with the road to Konstanz.  Since 1950, it has become increasingly interconnected.

name: Erlenbach (ZH)
geography: Erlenbach, also called Erlenbach am Zürichsee, is a municipality located on the lower right shore of Lake Zurich on the «Goldküste» in the Meilen district in the canton of Zurich.  The municipality covers 288.7 ha, of which 43.1% is settlements, 24.2% agriculture, 22.6% forest, 9.7% transport and 1.1% water. The neighboring municipalities are Küsnacht to the north and Herrliberg to the south.

name: Erlenbach im Simmental
geography: Erlenbach im Simmental liegt im Berner Oberland in den Alpen an der Simme. Die Nachbargemeinden sind Stocken-Höfen, Reutigen, Wimmis, Diemtigen und Därstetten.

name: Erlinsbach (AG)
geography: Erlinsbach is located in the canton of Aargau, in the district of Aarau, on the Erzbach. The northern boundary extends along the main ridge of the Jura mountains. The Geissfluegrat is the highest point in Aargau at 908 meters. South of the Salhöhe, the Erzbach flows through a narrow gorge between the Egg and the Gugen. The Erzbach separates Aargau from Solothurn, and the two Erlinsbach municipalities form a single settlement.

name: Erlinsbach (SO)
geography: Erlinsbach SO is a municipality in the Gösgen district of the Canton of Solothurn in Switzerland, on the border with the Canton of Aargau, about four kilometers (as the crow flies) west of Aarau.

name: Ermatingen
geography: Ermatingen lies on the southern shore of the Untersee (lower lake) part of Lake Constance, opposite the island of Reichenau. The municipality consists of the districts Ermatingen and Triboltingen. The lowest point of the municipality is on the lake shore at about 396 m above sea level, the highest on the Seerücken on the southern border of the municipality at 613 m above sea level.

name: Ermensee
geography: Ermensee lies between Lake Baldegg and Lake Hallwil, east of the Erlosen. The Aabach river flows through the municipality. In addition to the village, the municipality includes the hamlet of Herrenberg (493 m above sea level), which is a few hundred meters south of the village. 53.1% of the 572 ha municipal area is used for agriculture; 36.4% are covered by forest and woodland and 9.8% are built on as settlement areas.

name: Ernen
geography: Ernen is located in Goms on the left side of the upper Rhone Valley. Since the fusion in spring 2005, its territory consists of the former municipalities of Ausserbinn, Ernen, Mühlebach and Steinhaus. Ernen is part of the Binntal regional nature park.

name: Erschwil
geography: Erschwil lies at 447 m above sea level, 6.5 km south-southeast of Laufen. The former road and stream village extends in a valley widening of the Lüssel, in the Jura south of the Laufen basin in Schwarzbubenland. The area encompasses a section of the folded Jura, with the Lüssel flowing through a flat valley floor.

name: Ersigen
geography: Ersigen lies at 500 m above sea level, 5 km northwest of Burgdorf. The village is located on the Ösch, at the eastern edge of the Emme alluvial plain and at the foot of the Loberg molasse hill, in the Swiss Mittelland.

name: Erstfeld
geography: Erstfeld is located in the Swiss Canton of Uri, in the Reuss valley. It lies on one of Europe's most important transit axes, the pass over the Gotthard Massif. The old part of the village is on the left bank of the Reuss at the entrance to the Erstfeldertal, bordered by the Schlossberggletscher. The western boundary extends to the Spannort peaks (3140 and 3198 m above sea level). The Erstfelder Tal and its surrounding mountain ranges cover most of the municipal area.
appearance: The provided text does not describe the appearance of the town.

name: Eschenbach (LU)
geography: Eschenbach is a municipality located 9 km north of Luzern, on a terrain threshold between the Reuss Valley and the Seetal. In addition to the village, numerous groups of houses and individual farms belong to the municipality. The neighboring municipalities are Ballwil, Buchrain, Emmen, Hochdorf, Inwil, Rain and Rothenburg.

name: Eschenbach (SG)
geography: Eschenbach is located above the Zürichsee municipality of Schmerikon, east of the city of Rapperswil-Jona. It includes Eschenbach, Bürg, Diemberg, Ermenswil, Länziken, Lütschbach, Neuhaus, and since 2013, Goldingen and St. Gallenkappel.
pointsOfInterest: St. Jakob in Neuhaus am Pilgerweg nach Einsiedeln

name: Eschenz
geography: Eschenz lies on the southern shore of the Rheinsee, before the outflow of the High Rhine from Lake Constance (Untersee). The municipality includes one of the smaller islands in Lake Constance, the island of Werd. The village is now almost spatially merged with the Burg district of the small town of Stein am Rhein. The northern border runs along the middle of the Rhine, marking the boundary between Germany and Switzerland.

name: Eschert
geography: Eschert lies at 596 m above sea level, 2 km east of Moutier. The village extends on a terrain projection at the northern foot of the Jura chain of Graitery, in the Jura valley of Moutier, which also bears the name Grand Val. The northern boundary of Eschert is usually formed by the stream La Raus.

name: Eschlikon
geography: Eschlikon is located about six kilometers west of Wil SG, in the Swiss canton of Thurgau.

name: Escholzmatt-Marbach
geography: Escholzmatt-Marbach is located in the upper Entlebuch at the transition to the Emmental, and is traversed by the Ilfis and Weissemme rivers. The Ilfis exits the municipality near Wiggen towards the Emme, while the Weissemme flows towards the Kleine Emme. The municipality is the second largest in the canton of Lucerne with an area of over 100 km². The highest point is the Hängst peak of the Schrattenfluh at 2092 m above sea level.

name: Essertines-sur-Rolle
geography: Essertines-sur-Rolle is located at 726 m above sea level, 14 km northeast of Nyon. The village extends on the slope of the plateau above the Waadtländer Côte, at the southern foot of the Jura, in the area of the Ruisseau des Chaux stream. The municipality covers a section of the Jura foothills plateau and the Waadtländer Côte.

name: Essertines-sur-Yverdon
geography: Essertines-sur-Yverdon is located at 600 m above sea level, 22 km north of Lausanne. The village extends on a terrace on the eastern slope of the Buron valley, in the northern Gros de Vaud, in the Waadtland plateau. The municipality includes the gently sloping west-facing slope of the Grand Bois d'Essertines ridge, reaching 695 m above sea level.

name: Etagnières
geography: Etagnières lies at 628 m above sea level, 9 km north of Lausanne. The village extends on the vast plateau of the Gros de Vaud, on the western edge of the Jorat hills, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The area includes a section of the gently undulating plateau of the Gros de Vaud. The highest point is on the western slope of the Tremble hill at 670 m above sea level.

name: Etoy
geography: Etoy is located at 454 m above sea level, 7 km west-southwest of Morges. The village stretches on a gentle slope north of Lake Geneva, east of the Aubonne valley, in a scenic location about 80 m above the lake level. The municipality extends from the terrain terrace near Buchillon northwards up the gently sloping hillside to below the Le Châtelard hill, where the highest point of Etoy is reached at 495 m above sea level.

name: Ettingen
geography: Ettingen lies in the Leimen and Birsig valley on 331 m above sea level at the foot of the Blauen. Its neighboring communities are Blauen, Pfeffingen, Aesch, Therwil and the two villages Witterswil and Hofstetten-Flüh.
appearance: The current village of Ettingen was built in the 6th or 7th century along a stream, the Dorfbach, which now runs hidden under the Dorfstrasse. It was divided into three courtyards, the Oberhof, the Mittel- or Pfandhof and the Niederhof.

name: Ettiswil
geography: The municipality lies in a plain between Sursee and Willisau on the southern edge of the Wauwilermoos at the entrance to the Rottal and the Lucerne Hinterland. The village itself lies between the Wigger and the (Grosswanger) Rot. Kottwil as well as the hamlets Zuswil and Seewagen also belong to the municipality.
appearance: NULL

name: Etziken
geography: Etziken lies at 479 m above sea level, 9 km east of Solothurn. The village stretches on a slightly northwest-sloping hill between the Emme plain and the Önzberg. The municipality covers part of the moraine landscape shaped by the Rhone Glacier. The area extends from Unterwald southwards over the plain west of the Inkwilersee and the slope of Etziken to the heights of Cholholz and Eichwald, reaching the highest elevation of Etziken at 523 m.
appearance: Null

name: Evilard
geography:
Evilard lies at 697 m above sea level, 1 km north of Biel. The village extends in a clearing on the southeast slope of the foremost Jura chain, about 300 m above the city of Biel. In clear weather, Evilard offers a beautiful view of the Swiss Mittelland and the Alps from Mont Blanc to the Glärnisch and Alpstein region.

The area of the 3.7 km² municipal area extends to the height of the anticline of the Magglingerberg.

name: Evionnaz
geography: The municipality of Evionnaz extends from the Rhone plain in the east to the Dents Blanches in the west. The western boundary is partially formed by the Dents du Midi and the Torrent de St. Barthélemy, the eastern boundary by the Rhone. In the south of the municipality, at 1925 m above sea level, lies the Lac de Salanfe reservoir. The village itself lies in the Rhone plain.

name: Evolène
geography: The municipality extends from the upper part of the Val d’Hérens to the Italian border. The Borgne flows in the valley. The highest point of the municipality is the summit of the 4357 m high Dent Blanche.

name: Eysins
geography: Eysins is located at 438 m above sea level, 2.5 km west of Nyon. The village extends on the plain between Lake Geneva and the southern foot of the Jura, north of the Boiron de Nyon stream. The municipality covers an area of 2.4 km² on the plain at the foot of the Jura west of Nyon. In the southern part is the Boiron valley.

name: Fahrni
geography: Fahrni is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Bern. It is located in the hills between the Rotacher and Zulgtal valleys. The municipality consists of numerous hamlets and isolated farms. 68.8% of the municipal area is used for agriculture, 25.5% is covered by forest, and 4.6% is settlement area. The highest point is the Lueghubel.

name: Fahrwangen
geography: Fahrwangen is located in the Seetal valley, not far from the Hallwilersee (lake) and borders the canton of Lucerne. The village lies in a hollow on the gently sloping northwest slope of the Lindenberg. The Dorfbach stream drains the municipality towards the Hallwilersee, partly running through a ravine. An extensive plain extends north from the village center. Fahrwangen has a 500-meter-long shoreline on the Hallwilersee.
appearance: The village is completely merged with the neighboring municipality of Meisterschwanden.

name: Fahy
geography: Fahy is located at 567 m above sea level, 9 km west of Porrentruy. The farming village is situated on the plateau of the Tafeljura in the west of the Ajoie region, bordering France. The municipality covers a slightly undulating, karstified plateau with no surface waterways. The northern part is partially wooded.
appearance: Fahy is a farming village.

name: Faido
geography: Faido is located at 721 m above sea level on the left bank of the Ticino river in the Leventina valley. The municipality has expanded to include all former municipalities in the central Leventina valley below Piottino to Biaschina.
appearance: NULL

name: Falera
geography: Falera is located on a terrace on the left slope of the Vorderrhein valley. Of the total area of 2235 ha, 1432 ha are agricultural land (mostly alpine pastures), 435 ha forest and woodland, 309 ha unproductive area (mostly mountains) and 59 ha settlement area. The municipality has a share in the Vorab glacier, while the popular ski mountain Crap Sogn Gion is largely on its territory. The municipality borders on Ilanz/Glion, Laax, Sagogn and Schluein.

name: Fällanden
geography: Fällanden is located in the district of Uster. The municipality includes the village of Fällanden as well as the former Hofsiedlungen Benglen, Pfaffhausen and Neuhausen. It lies between the northeastern slope of the Pfannenstiel chain and the northwestern shore of the Greifensee on the edge of the Zürcher Oberland. The village center is located at the foot of the hill (453 m).
appearance: The town center of Fällanden is located at the foot of the hill, where the traffic routes Dübendorf–Maur and Schwerzenbach–Zürich intersect. From there, the town has expanded into the flat Glatt Valley, but also up the slope. Benglen and Pfaffhausen lie on terraces of the Pfannenstiel chain about 150 meters above the village.

name: Faoug
geography: Faoug is located at 449 m above sea level, 14.5 km northeast of Payerne. The village extends slightly elevated on the southern shore of Lake Murten. The municipality includes a section on the southern shore of Lake Murten. The municipal area extends southward over the flat shore strip to the adjacent Molasse hills with the wooded elevations of Bois de Mottey (474 m above sea level) and Bois de Rosset (at 485 m above sea level).

name: Farnern
geography: Farnern is located at 800 m above sea level, 9 km northeast of Solothurn. The village stretches in a scenic location on a flat area on the southern slope of the foremost Jura chain, about 400 m above the Swiss Plateau, above Wiedlisbach, in the Oberaargau region. The area encompasses a section of the southern Jura slope.
appearance: The article mentions a "Strassendorf" (street village) at a scenic location, but doesn't give further details.

name: Féchy
geography: Féchy is located at 495 m above sea level, 10 km west-southwest of Morges. The wine-growing village extends on a small promontory in the middle of the vineyards on the southern slope of the Vaudois Côte, in a panoramic location about 120 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipal area extends from the shore of Lake Geneva northwards over the plateau to the east of the Signal de Bougy.
appearance: Féchy consists of three parts: Féchy-Dessus (the original village), Féchy-Dessous (at the foot of the slope) and Les Cassivettes (a residential area on the slope of the Signal de Bougy). Féchy-Dessous is further subdivided into the settlements Le Saugey, Marterey and La Crause, all located at the foot of the Côte.

name: Fehraltorf
geography: Fehraltorf is located in the Kempttal northwest of Pfäffikon in the Zürcher Oberland. The landscape is flat, with interspersed hills, called Drumlins. 50.9% of the municipality's area is used for agriculture, 27.6% is covered with forest, 14.6% is settlement area and 5.9% traffic area, 0.6% is water and 0.3% unproductive area. The highest point is 610 m above sea level, the lowest point is 514 m above sea level.
appearance: null

name: Fehren
geography: Fehren lies at 587 m above sea level, 6.5 km east-southeast of Laufen. The village extends in a panoramic position on a hill at the northern foot of the Mettenberg, on a slope falling towards the Laufen basin, in the Schwarzbubenland. The municipality covers a section of the northern Jura. The main part is the slope of Fehren. To the east, the area extends over the Mittlerberg to the Ibach.

name: Felben-Wellhausen
geography: The two villages Felben and Wellhausen are separated by the Winterthur–Romanshorn railway line with the Felben-Wellhausen station and are located on the cantonal roads from Frauenfeld to Kreuzlingen (Felben) and Weinfelden (Wellhausen). In addition to these two villages, the hamlets Römerstrasse and Gutenberg and Wellenberg near the castle of the same name are located on the municipality.

name: Feldbrunnen-St. Niklaus
geography: Feldbrunnen-Sankt Niklaus lies at 452 m above sea level, 2 km northeast of Solothurn. The municipality extends on a terrace north of the Aare, at the southern foot of the Jura, east of the Verenabach, in the Solothurn Mittelland.  The area extends northwards over the Feldbrunnen terrace, the Spiessachers plateau and the Verenakette forest heights. The Rehhubel and Moos reach the highest elevations at 595 m above sea level.

name: Felsberg
geography: Felsberg is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is located in the Imboden Region, just west of Chur. Immediately north of the village rises the Calanda mountain range, which reaches a height of 2697 m above sea level in the Felsberger Calanda.

name: Ferden
geography: Ferden is located in the lower Lötschental valley, at the foot of the Ferdenrothorn on the Lonza river, which is dammed south of the village to form the Ferden reservoir. Ferden also includes the hamlet of Goppenstein, where the southern portal of the Lötschberg Tunnel is located.

name: Ferenbalm
geography: Ferenbalm lies on the plateau between the Saane and Biberen rivers. The municipality consists of the hamlets of Ferenbalm, Vogelbuch, Kleingümmenen, Rizenbach, Biberen, Jerisberg, Jerisberghof, Haselhof, and the Gammen exclave.
appearance: No specific information about the town's appearance is mentioned in the provided text.

name: Ferpicloz
geography: Ferpicloz is located at 767 m above sea level, 7 km south of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The village extends in a scenic location on a high plateau east of the Bois d'Amont, in the pre-Alpine hills of the Freiburg Central Plateau. The area of the municipality covers a section of the higher Freiburg Central Plateau near the northern edge of the Alps. The central part is occupied by the height of Ferpicloz.

name: Ferrera
geography: Ferrera is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is located in the Ferreratal valley, which belongs to the Viamala region.

name: Ferreyres
geography: Ferreyres is located at 560 m above sea level, 16 km north of Morges. The village is located on a south-facing slope above the Venoge valley, in the Vaudois Mittelland, at the foot of the Jura mountains. The municipality covers a section of the western edge of the Vaudois Mittelland. The southern border runs along the Venoge, which flows through a valley.

name: Fétigny-Ménières
geography: Fétigny-Ménières is a municipality in the Broye district of the canton of Fribourg in Switzerland.

name: Feuerthalen
geography: Feuerthalen is located north of the heavily wooded Cholfirst in a river landscape formed by the Rhine. It is located in the outer district of Andelfingen directly on the river bank opposite the city of Schaffhausen. It is the northernmost municipality in the canton of Zurich and has an international border with the exclave of Büsingen am Hochrhein (Germany).

name: Feusisberg
geography: Feusisberg is a municipality located on a high terrace on the Etzel mountain. Schindellegi is situated at the incision that the Sihl river has created between Etzel and Höhronen. One-third of the municipality's area is wooded. At the Höhronen there is a tripoint of cantons (Schwyz, Zug and Zurich) (47.16348.6922).
appearance: NULL

name: Fideris
geography: Fideris is located on the southern side of the middle Prättigau valley.  The municipality includes the main settlement of Fideris, a cruciform street village on a terrace above the confluence of the Arieschbach stream into the Landquart river.  The territory extends from the Landquart in the north to the watershed against the Schanfigg. The semi-circular end of the valley is occupied by the Alps of the Fideriser Heuberge, behind which rise the peaks of Mattjisch Horn (2461 m above sea level) and Chistenstein (2473 m).
appearance: The main settlement is the cruciform street village Fideris on a terrace.

name: Fiesch
geography: Fiesch lies at the foot of the Eggishorn (2934 m above sea level) in the upper Rhone Valley (Rottental).

name: Fieschertal
geography: Fieschertal lies below the Fieschergletscher, at the end of the valley. The municipality is one of the largest in Switzerland, with 17,295 ha, 15,966 ha of which are in the World Natural Heritage area. The municipality extends to the Jungfraujoch in the north; the terminus of the Jungfrau Railway (Jungfraujoch station) is located on the municipal territory.

name: Fiez
geography: Fiez is located at 520 m above sea level, 5 km north of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches at the southern foot of the Jura, on the northern slope of the Arnon River valley. The municipality is divided into two parts: the area at the foot of the Jura and the Chasseron chain.

name: Finhaut
geography: Finhaut lies in the upper part of the Vallée du Trient, which is crossed by the Trient, a tributary of the Rhone. The border with France is marked by a series of mountain peaks of the Valais Alps: Pointe de la Finive (2838 m above sea level), Le Cheval Blanc (2831 m above sea level), Pointe de la Terrasse (2732 m above sea level) and Les Perrons (2674 m above sea level).

name: Finsterhennen
geography: Finsterhennen liegt im Grossen Moos, einem besonders fruchtbaren Gebiet mit fast schwarzen Böden im Berner Seeland. Die Nachbargemeinden von Norden beginnend im Uhrzeigersinn sind Lüscherz, Siselen, Kallnach, Treiten und Brüttelen.

name: Fischbach
geography: Fischbach is a municipality in the Willisau district of the canton of Lucerne. The village lies on the road from Zell LU to St. Urban. The stream of the same name flows through the village. The municipality includes the hamlet of Leimbütz on the road to Zell. The Rotbach forms the western border of the village and is also the border to the canton of Bern. The highest elevations are the Schönenthülerhöhe and part of the Bodenberg.
appearance: NULL

name: Fischbach-Göslikon
geography: Fischbach-Göslikon is located in the Reuss valley. The municipality consists of the districts Fischbach and Göslikon. They are located on the eastern slope of the Wagenrain, near the Reuss river. In the south the municipality has a part in the Bremgarterwald. The Fischbacher Mösli and a high moor are also located there.

name: Fischenthal
geography: Fischenthal is the highest municipality in the Tössbergland and the Canton of Zürich, with its highest mountain, the Schnebelhorn, at 1291 m above sea level. The municipality includes the villages of Steg im Tösstal and Gibswil.  The municipal area covers 30.25 km² and is the largest rural municipality in the canton of Zurich.

name: Fischingen
geography: Fischingen is located at the northern foot of the Hörnli in the transition area from the Swiss Plateau to the Pre-Alps. The Murg river flows through it. It is the largest municipality in Thurgau in terms of area, with half of the area consisting of forest. The southernmost point of the municipality and canton is the Dreiländerstein on the Silberbüel at the Ergete nature reserve. The highest elevation is on the Fischinger Grat (Hohgrat or Groot) at 991 m above sea level.
appearance: The village of Fischingen developed north of the monastery, which was founded shortly before 1138 and was then known as nova cella Vishina. The municipality has numerous external courtyards.

name: Fisibach
geography: Fisibach is located in the Aargau canton, in the district of Zurzach, on the Hochrhein at the border with Germany and the canton of Zurich. The village lies about one kilometer south of the Rhine. It is named after the Fisibach brook. The area has the Sanzenberg (552 m) and the Berg (603 m).
appearance: Fisibach doesn't have a real town center; the houses are around a big meadow in the center. About one and a half kilometers south of the village lies the hamlet of Hägelen (405 m), southwest of it, on a small terrace directly on the cantonal border, the hamlet of Waldhausen (495 m).

name: Fislisbach
geography: Fislisbach is located at the edge of the Reuss Valley, about three kilometers east of the Reuss River. The village center is nestled in a hollow between the wooded Hiltiberg and Buechberg hills, which are part of a north-south moraine formed by the Reuss glacier during the last ice age. The terrain rises to the Oberhau, part of the Heitersberg chain, east of this valley. The modern development is in the flat plain west of the moraine.

name: Flaach
geography: Flaach is situated at 360 m above sea level in the Zürcher Weinland on the northern slope of the Irchel. The municipality covers an area of 1016 ha, of which 345 ha are forest. 248 ha of this forest area are owned by the municipality.

name: Fläsch
geography: Fläsch is the northernmost village in the Grisons and lies on the right side of the Rhine valley at the foot of Fläscherberg and St. Luzisteig. 874 ha of the 1995 ha area is covered with forest and woodland, 705 ha agricultural land, 376 ha unproductive area and 40 ha settlement area. Fläsch borders Maienfeld, Bad Ragaz and Balzers.

name: Flawil
geography: Flawil is located in the Untertoggenburg region. The lowest point is at the Glatt river at 542 meters above sea level, and the highest point is above Alterschwil at 814 meters above sea level. The Flawil train station is at 610.6 meters above sea level. Flawil is made up of the village itself and the hamlets of Oberglatt, Burgau, Egg, Alterschwil, Langenentschwil, Grobenentschwil, and Raaschberg.

name: Flerden
geography: Flerden is located in the Viamala region. It is the northernmost of the upper Heinzenberg villages. The municipality covers 606 ha, with 331 ha used for agriculture, 182 ha covered by forest, and 71 ha of unproductive area (mostly mountains).
appearance: The location is a clustered village (Haufendorf).

name: Flims
geography: Flims is located at a pass of the Hauptstrasse 19. It is divided into Flims Dorf and Flims Waldhaus, with Fidaz and Scheia as additional parts. Flims forms a pass height of the main road 19. This rises 500 meters in altitude from Reichenau to Flims and loses 400 meters in altitude again via Laax to Ilanz. On the debris cone of the Flims landslide, in the south of the municipality, lies the Grosswald Flims with its four lakes.
appearance: Flims-Dorf and Flims-Waldhaus are located on both sides of the valley of the Flem, which forms the Stenna Gorge shortly above. The Oberalpstrasse through Flims also served to develop the Surselva until the opening of the bypass in 2007.

name: Flüelen
geography: Flüelen is located at the southern end of Lake Lucerne (Urnersee), between the mouth of the Reuss River and the Rophaien mountain range. The Axen cliffs rise almost 400 meters directly from the lake. The northeastern boundary follows the watershed with the Hüenderegg, Hagelstock, Siwfass, and Diepen mountains, the latter being the highest point in the municipality at 2222 m above sea level.

name: Flühli
geography: Flühli is a municipality in the Entlebuch of the Canton of Lucerne in Switzerland and includes the villages of Flühli and Sörenberg. The municipality lies in the Central Swiss Prealps and is the largest municipality in the canton of Lucerne in terms of area. Parts of the two largest moorlands in Switzerland are located on the municipality territory: Glaubenberg and Sörenberg. The limestone mountains include the Schwändiliflue, the Grönflue and the Schrattenfluh.
appearance: The municipality comprises two districts, namely Flühli and Sörenberg, which at the same time form independent parish communities. Flühli is not only the largest municipality in the canton of Lucerne, but also has the highest point in the entire canton with the Brienzer Rothorn (2350 m above sea level).

name: Flumenthal
geography: Flumenthal is located at 430 m above sea level, six kilometers east-northeast of Solothurn. The municipality lies in the Unterer Leberberg region. The village extends slightly elevated on the northern edge of the Aare depression, near the mouth of the Siggern, on the southern foot of the Jura, in the Solothurn Mittelland. The Aarbächli flows through the municipality, a small tributary of the Aare.
appearance: Flumenthal is a clustered village (Haufendorf).

name: Flums
geography: Flums is located in the Schilstal valley up to the southwestern border with the canton of Glarus. It includes a part of the plain traversed by the Seez stream, the Seeztal, and the western slope of the Alvierkette. Flums is known for the Flumserberg ski and hiking area, which also lies in the municipality of Quarten.

name: Flurlingen
geography: Flurlingen lies between the Rhine river and the western slope of the Cholfirst. 56.7% of the municipal area is covered with forest.

name: Fontaines-sur-Grandson
geography: Fontaines-sur-Grandson is located at 563 m above sea level, 6 km north of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends at the southern foot of the Jura, north of the valley of the river Arnon. The municipality extends on the southern slope of the Jura from the valley of the Arnon over the plateau of Fontaines to the Champagne stream.

name: Fontenais
geography: Fontenais is located at 458 m above sea level, 1.5 km south of Porrentruy, in a side valley of the Allaine at the northern foot of the Jura mountains in Ajoie. The municipality includes the Fontenais valley, bounded to the north by the hills of Le Banné and La Perche. To the south, the area extends to the Jura ridge of the Lomontkette, reaching its highest point at Les Chainions.

name: Forel (Lavaux)
geography: Forel (Lavaux) is located at 716 m above sea level, 11 km east of Lausanne. The municipality stretches on the high plateau southeast of the Jorat, north of Lake Geneva, in the Vaud Central Plateau. The area includes a section of the Molasse heights of the Jorat. Almost the entire area is drained northeast to the Broye by the Grenet and its source streams.
appearance: The scattered settlement municipality consists of the actual center Cornes de Cerf (716 m above sea level) and numerous hamlets and farm settlements, including Le Pigeon (684 m above sea level), Le Plâne (691 m above sea level), Le Grenet (750 m above sea level), Les Chesaudes (724 m above sea level, a detached house district) and La Tuilière (722 m above sea level).

name: Forst-Längenbühl
geography: Forst-Längenbühl is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Bern. It belongs to the Thun administrative district.

name: Founex
geography: Founex is located at 398 m above sea level, 15 km north-northeast of Geneva. The village extends near the western shore of Lake Geneva on a gently sloping hillside towards the lake. The municipality extends from the lake shore westwards over the shore strip and onto the adjacent ridge. In the far west, the area includes a section of the small valley of the Greny stream. The highest elevation of Founex is reached with 475 m above sea level.

name: Fräschels
geography: Fräschels lies at 457 m above sea level, 10 km northeast of Murten. The farming village stretches along the eastern edge of the Grosse Moos, at the foot of the adjacent Molasse hills, in the northern Freiburg Mittelland. Fräschels is the northernmost municipality in the canton of Freiburg.
appearance: null

name: Fraubrunnen
geography: Fraubrunnen is located nearly 20 km from the cities of Bern and Solothurn, and just over 10 km from the town of Burgdorf. The municipality's territory extends from the A1 motorway to the Limpach valley and from the Emme to the ridge in the northeastern part of the Rapperswil Plateau. The Fraubrunnenmoos is drained by the Urtenen towards the Emme. The highest elevation is Buech-Ischlag (Etzelkofen) at 595 m above sea level.

name: Frauenfeld
geography: The core of Frauenfeld was built around 1230 on a rectangular area of 250 × 110 meters on a high plateau. This plateau slopes steeply westward into the Thur valley and southward in a rocky drop to the Murg river.

name: Freienbach
geography: Freienbach is located on the left bank of Lake Zurich and at the foot of the Etzel. The municipality includes the islands of Ufnau and Lützelau in Lake Zurich. Ufnau can be reached by scheduled boats.
appearance: Freienbach defines itself as a municipality with five villages. Some dominant high-rise buildings are noticeable in the Pfäffikon SZ district.

name: Freienstein-Teufen
geography: Freienstein-Teufen lies between Irchel and Dättenberg in the lower Töss valley on the right side of the Töss. The municipality consists of the villages Freienstein and Teufen and borders on the Rhine near Tössegg. Rorbas lies on the left side of the river.

name: Freienwil
geography: Freienwil lies in a southern side valley of the Surbtal. The valley forms a flat trough on the edge of the Siggenberg. The terrain rises towards the Hörndli (624 m above sea level). The Büel (526 m above sea level) forms the boundary to the valley of Ehrendingen. The Rickenbach drains the municipality.

name: Freimettigen
geography: Freimettigen liegt auf 675 m ü. M., 1,5 km südlich von Konolfingen und 13 km nördlich der Stadt Thun. Es erstreckt sich leicht erhöht am östlichen Talrand der Chise, am Westfuss des Kurzenbergs, im voralpinen Hügelland. Das Gebiet wird von der Chise in einer breiten Talmulde durchquert. Nach Osten erstreckt sich der Gemeindeboden bis auf die Waldhöhen des Kurzenbergs, wo mit 1008 m ü. M. die höchste Erhebung erreicht wird.
appearance: The provided HTML does not contain any information about the town's appearance.

name: Frenkendorf
geography: Frenkendorf is located 12 km from the city center of Basel and 2 km from the cantonal capital Liestal. It has six neighboring municipalities: Füllinsdorf, Gempen (canton of Solothurn), Liestal, Muttenz, Nuglar-St. Pantaleon (canton of Solothurn) and Pratteln. The border is about 14.5 kilometers long.

name: Fribourg
geography: Freiburg is located on both sides of the Saane in the Swiss Mittelland. The well-preserved old town is situated on a narrow rocky spur above the Saane valley and in its narrow floodplain. The old town of Freiburg lies at 581 m above sea level, 28 km southwest of Bern. The riverbed is deeply cut into the Molasse sandstone layers.
appearance: The old town is located on a meander spur west of the Saane, about 40 m above the valley floor of the river. Most of the city districts are located on the high plateau at an average of 620 m above sea level and on the adjacent hills, while the valley floor of the Saane is only inhabited in the area of ​​the old town meander.

name: Frick
geography: Frick is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Laufenburg district. The village lies in the Sissle valley, which widens into a broad, flat basin at this point. The municipality extends to the Staffeleggbach estuary in the east and the Bruggbach valley in the southwest. The valley basin is framed by wooded hills of the Tafeljura, with steep flanks and plateaus. The Frickberg rises to the east, and the Kornbergebene lies to the south.
appearance: The settlement area of the village has grown together with the built-up areas of the neighboring municipalities of Gipf-Oberfrick and Oeschgen since the 1970s.

name: Froideville
geography: Froideville is situated at 819 m above sea level, 6 km southeast of Echallens and 9 km north-northeast of Lausanne. The village extends on a plateau on the northwest slope of the Jorat, in the Vaudois Mittleland. The municipality covers a section of the higher Vaudois Mittleland. The northwestern part is taken up by the open plateau around the village, which peaks at 844 m above sea level.

name: Frutigen
geography: Frutigen is located in the Kander and Engstligen valleys and extends from the Niesen range to the Gehrihorn. The municipality is divided into eight Bäuerten (local parts), including Achseten and Elsigbach in the Engstligen valley. The eastern flank of the Niesen range is called Spissen. Small settlements are arranged on terraces at 1000 to 1200 m above sea level.

name: Fulenbach
geography: Fulenbach lies at 429 m above sea level, 10 km southwest of Olten. The village stretches on a gravel terrace north of the Aare River, opposite Murgenthal, in the Aaregäu of the Solothurn Mittelland.
appearance: NULL

name: Füllinsdorf
geography: Füllinsdorf is located in the Liestal district of the canton of Basel-Landschaft. The municipality consists of two main areas: residential areas with large apartment buildings on both sides of the Ergolz river in the plain, and detached houses stretching up the sunny hillside. Above the village, in the forest, lies the medieval Altenberg castle ruins.
appearance: In the plains on either side of the Ergolz, residential quarters with large apartment buildings dominate. Single-family homes stretch far up the sunny hillside. Above the village, in the forest, lies the medieval castle ruin Altenberg.

name: Full-Reuenthal
geography: Full-Reuenthal is the northernmost municipality in the canton of Aargau, located in the Zurzach district on the High Rhine at the border to Germany. It consists of the villages of Full and Reuenthal. Full is a scattered settlement in the Fullerfeld, a wide gravel plain almost semicircularly surrounded by the Rhine. The Aare flows into the Rhine southeast of Full. Reuenthal is located on a raised plain, separated by the Fullerhalde, a limestone cliff.

name: Fully
geography: Fully is located northeast of Martigny on the north side of the Rhone Valley at the foot of the Grand Chavalard (2901 m above sea level). The municipality consists of 18 villages and hamlets, namely Fully, Beudon, Branson, Buitonne, Châteignier, Chiboz d’en Bas, Chiboz d’en Haut, Eulo, Jeur Brûlée, Le Carre, L’Etray, Mayen Loton, Mazembroz, Planuit, Randonnaz, Saxe, Tassonières and Vers l’Église.

name: Furna
geography: Furna lies in the central Prättigau valley on the eastern slope of the Furner Berg mountain. The extensive territory mainly comprises the left side of the Furner Bach valley, a tributary of the Landquart river. The valley is bordered to the south by the Hochwang mountain range, with the Hochwang (2533 m) as the highest point. The eastern border reaches the deeply cut Furner Bach gorge.
appearance: The settlements are concentrated in the groups Usserberg, Mittelberg and Hinterberg. There are also numerous individual farms.

name: Fürstenau
geography: Fürstenau besteht aus dem historischen Städtchen Fürstenau und dem Ortsteil Fürstenaubruck über dem Zusammenfluss von Hinterrhein und Albula.
appearance: Fürstenau ist im Inventar der schützenswerten Ortsbilder der Schweiz von nationaler Bedeutung eingetragen.

name: Gächlingen
geography: Gächlingen lies on the northern edge of the Swiss Klettgau, at the foot of the Hallauer Berg. North of Gächlingen, the Hallauer Berg connects via the Siblingerhöhe with the Langen Randen, a southern offshoot of the Randen.

name: Gachnang
geography: Gachnang is a municipality and church village in the Swiss canton of Thurgau. It belongs to the Frauenfeld district and is part of the Frauenfeld agglomeration. The municipality consists of Gachnang, Islikon, Kefikon, Niederwil (with Strass and Bethelhausen), and Oberwil (with Rosenhuben).

name: Gais
geography: Gais is located 15 km south of St. Gallen. It lies on the Appenzell Railways line connecting St. Gallen with Appenzell and Altstätten.  Neighboring municipalities include Trogen and Bühler in Ausserrhoden, Schlatt-Haslen, Appenzell, and Schwende-Rüte in Innerrhoden, and Eichberg and Altstätten in St. Gallen. The municipality covers 2119 hectares and lies at 933 m above sea level. The Gäbris mountain reaches 1246.8 m, and the lowest point is at 827 m.

name: Gaiserwald
geography: Gaiserwald is a municipality in the north of the Swiss canton of St. Gallen. It consists of the villages of Abtwil, Engelburg and St. Josefen.
appearance: The municipality consists of scattered farms and hamlets.

name: Galgenen
geography: Galgenen lies between 1272 m and 430 m above sea level on the lower Wägital. The Wägitaler Aa has formed a small river delta here at the valley exit towards Lake Zurich.

name: Gals
geography: Gals is located in the Seeland administrative district of the Canton of Bern. The municipality includes parts of the Zihlebene plain with the Zihl Canal and the Jolimont, at whose northwestern foot the main settlement is located.
