The Zihl Canal forms the western and northern municipal boundary, and also the cantonal border between Bern and Neuchâtel. The municipality borders Lake Biel on the eastern side.  The altitude ranges from 427 to 597 meters above sea level.

name: Gambarogno
geography: Gambarogno is located on the left bank of Lake Maggiore, from the Magadino plain to the Italian border. The altitude ranges from the lake (193 m above sea level) to the summit of Monte Tamaro (1960 m above sea level).
appearance: Gambarogno is an example of sprawling settlement, common on Swiss lakes. Unlike the Locarno agglomeration on the opposite shore, Gambarogno is a rural area with a low population density. Nevertheless, uncontrolled sprawl has led to the merging of villages over three kilometers apart, such as from Gerra to Dirinella. The lakeside from Magadino to San Nazzaro is also overbuilt with scattered houses. The only village hardly affected by sprawl is the mountain village of Indemini.

name: Gampel-Bratsch
geography: Gampel-Bratsch is located in the upper German-speaking part of the Rhone Valley, at the southern exit of the Lötschental. It is the easternmost municipality in the Leuk district and borders the Lonza river.

name: Gampelen
geography: Gampelen (französisch Champion) ist eine politische Gemeinde im Verwaltungskreis Seeland des Kantons Bern in der Schweiz.
appearance: Das langgezogene Dorf hat seit 2008 einen neuen Bahnhof an der Strecke Bern–Neuenburg der BLS. Ebenfalls auf dem Gemeindegebiet von Gampelen liegt die Haltestelle Zihlbrücke.

name: Gams
geography: Gams lies in the Rhine Valley at the foot of the Alpstein, at 478 meters above sea level.  It sits on the western edge of the Rhine Valley plain. The municipality includes the village of Gams, the Gamserberg and Gasenzen. The municipal area extends from Brennersfeld (440m) to the summit of Mutschen (2122m). It covers 22.26 square kilometers, including fields and meadows in the Rhine Valley plain, forests and meadows on the slopes above the village, and an alpine zone.

name: Gansingen
geography: Gansingen is located in the Mettauerbach valley, part of the Mettauertal region, near the German border. The area sits in a transition zone between the Table Jura and Folded Jura.  Hills border the narrow valleys.  The municipality is part of the Jurapark Aargau, a regional nature park. The highest point is on Grosshalde (698 m above sea level) and the lowest at 363 m above sea level on Mettauerbach.

name: Gebenstorf
geography: Gebenstorf is located at the "Wasserschloss der Schweiz", where three of Switzerland's five largest rivers – Aare, Limmat and Reuss – meet. The old village center lies on a terrace between the east bank of the Reuss and the western slope of the Gebenstorfer Horn. Aare and Limmat form a peninsula where the Vogelsang locality lies. The area is 5.65 km², 2.27 km² is wooded and 1.57 km² is built-up. Highest point is 561 m ü. M., the lowest 328 m ü. M.
pointsOfInterest: The Roman road from Vindonissa to Aquae Helveticae
The tombstone of a soldier of the Legio XI Claudia (built into the reformed church)

name: Gelterkinden
geography: Gelterkinden is located in the Oberbaselbiet in the Ergolz valley. The village center is located at about 400 m above sea level. The lowest point in the municipality is on the western edge of the village in the stream bed of the Ergolz (386 m above sea level) and the highest point at 680 m above sea level on the eastern slope of the Chienberg. The municipality area rises in the northeast on the southern ridge of the Farnsberg up to 568 m above sea level.

name: Geltwil
geography: Geltwil is located in the upper Bünztal on the border with the canton of Lucerne. The municipality consists of the settlements of Geltwil and Isenbergschwil, situated on the east-facing slope of the Lindenberg. The Rüeribach, a source stream of the Bünz, separates the easternmost part of the municipality. Geltwil sits at 681 m above sea level.
appearance: The municipality is rural. Isenbergschwil, at 575 m above sea level, lies on a terrace west of the Rüeribach. Geltwil is a little larger, located about one kilometer further west on the Sörikerbach, another source stream of the Bünz.

name: Gempen
geography: Gempen is located in the northern tip of the Canton of Solothurn, which protrudes into the Canton of Basel-Landschaft. It's situated on the Gempen plateau at 676 m above sea level. The Schartenfluh rises about 80 meters higher, featuring the Gempenturm, a 28-meter-high observation tower at 760 m above sea level.
appearance: NULL

name: Genève
geography: Genf liegt am südwestlichen Zipfel der Romandie in der Genferseeregion am Ausfluss der Rhone aus dem Genfersee.

name: Genolier
geography: Genolier is located at 547 m above sea level, 6 km north of Nyon. The village stretches on the lower southern slope of the Jura, west of the Ruisseau d'Oujon stream, in a scenic location about 170 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva. The municipality covers an area of 4.8 km² on the lower southern slope of the Jura.

name: Genthod
geography: Genthod is a political municipality in the Canton of Geneva in Switzerland. The municipality includes the village of Genthod and the hamlets of Malagny and Creux-de-Genthod and is located on the right bank of Lake Geneva between Bellevue and Versoix.

name: Gerlafingen
geography: Gerlafingen is located on the eastern bank of the Emme river, which was corrected in 1889. The neighboring municipalities are Biberist, Derendingen, Kriegstetten, Obergerlafingen, Zielebach and Bätterkinden.
appearance: The municipality is heavily built-up, practically over the entire area, making Gerlafingen the most densely populated municipality in the Wasseramt district.

name: Geroldswil
geography: Geroldswil is located in the Limmattal valley at an altitude of 395 m above sea level, bordering the Limmat river to the north, and extending up the southern slope of the Altberg mountain. At the foot of Altberg lies the Wiesentäli valley. The highest elevation in the municipality is the Hasleren, at 583 m above sea level.

name: Gersau
geography: Gersau is located in the Canton of Schwyz and forms its own district. It's a self-contained landscape in a basin embedded in the sunny and sheltered southern slope of the Rigi. It is protected from cool winds by the Rigi-Hochfluh and Gersauerstock to the north and Lake Lucerne to the south. This creates a mild climate, allowing even sweet chestnuts to grow. Gersau is also called the Riviera of Lake Lucerne.

name: Gerzensee
geography: Gerzensee is located at 646 m above sea level, 14 km southeast of Bern. The village lies in a scenic location on the southern slope of the Belpberg, above the hollow of the Gerzensee. The municipality area comprises a section of the Aare valley. The eastern border runs along the Aare. The municipal area extends westward onto the Belpberg ridge. The Gerzensee lake lies in a hollow. The municipality reaches northwest to the Belpberg plateau.
appearance: In addition to extensive new residential areas, Gerzensee includes the Thalgut settlement on the slope west of the Aare crossing, the Sädel hamlet on the southern slope of the Belpberg, Vorderchlapf and Hinterchlapf on the eastern slope of the mountain, as well as various farm groups and individual farms.

name: Geuensee
geography: Geuensee is located north of Sursee on the eastern edge of the Surental valley. Krumbach (690 m above sea level) and Hunzikon (729 m above sea level) are hamlets located within the municipality. The Dorfbach stream originates near Krumbach and flows through the Chrumpechertobel and the village, emptying into the Suhre river west of Moos. 71.4% of the municipality's 643 ha area is used for agriculture.

name: Gibloux
geography: The municipality is located on the northeast slope of Gibloux, about 12 kilometers south-southwest of the district and cantonal capital of Fribourg. It consists of many small and larger villages, all of which were once independent municipalities.

name: Giebenach
geography: Giebenach is located at 315 m above sea level in the Violental valley. It is connected to Lupsingen and Augst by the AAGL line 72, and to Olsberg by the Postauto line 99. Its neighboring municipalities are Arisdorf, Füllinsdorf, Augst (all in the canton of Basel-Landschaft) and the Aargau municipalities of Kaiseraugst and Olsberg.
appearance: The village mainly consists of two farms and some small commercial enterprises.

name: Giez
geography: Giez is located at 529 m above sea level, 4 km north-northwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches on a slightly south-facing slope of a plateau at the foot of the southern Jura, between the valley of the Arnon and the western shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality includes a section at the foot of the southern Jura. In the south, the area extends into the lowlands of the Le Grandsonnet stream, to the west to the Bois des Tassonnières forest area.

name: Giffers
geography: Giffers is located in the upper Sense district, about 6.5 km southeast of Freiburg. It lies at 762 m above sea level, with its lowest point at 679 m (near the Ärgera river) and its highest at 1032 m. Two-thirds of the 5.22 km² area is used for agriculture, 13.6% is built-up, and 20% is forest. The Ärgera river forms the southern boundary, creating a nationally significant floodplain landscape.
appearance: The main settlement, closely connected to Tentlingen, is located in the west around the parish church. In the southeast lies the settlement of Eichholz, mainly consisting of farmhouses.

name: Gilly
geography: Gilly is located at 484 m above sea level, 10 km north-northeast of Nyon. The wine-growing village is situated slightly elevated on the lower southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, in a scenic location about 100 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva.  The municipality extends from the shore of Lake Geneva to the plateau at the foot of the Waadtländer Côte. The highest point is at 895 m above sea level in the Le Saugey forest.
appearance: Gilly is a wine-growing village located on the lower southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, offering scenic views approximately 100 meters above Lake Geneva.

name: Gimel
geography: Gimel is situated at 730 m above sea level, 16 km west of Morges. The village extends slightly elevated above the valley of the Saubrette, at the foot of the southern Jura and on the pre-Jura plateau. The municipality includes a section of the southern slope of the Jura and the Vaud Jura. The southern part of the municipality is occupied by the valley of the Saubrette, a tributary of the Aubonne.

name: Gingins
geography: Gingins is located at 542 meters above sea level, 5 km northwest of Nyon. The village is situated on the southern foot of the Jura Mountains, at the foot of La Dôle, about 170 meters above the level of Lake Geneva. The municipality's area extends from the Asse River up the wooded Jura slope to La Barillette (1528 m above sea level) and the Pointe de Poêle Chaud (1628 m above sea level).
appearance: Gingins includes several large single-family house neighborhoods and some individual farms.

name: Giornico
geography: Giornico lies in the valley floor of the Leventina on both sides of the Ticino River. A inhabited river island divides the village. The municipality includes the small village of Altirolo northwest of Giornico. Coming from the north, Giornico is the first place with a southern character.

name: Gipf-Oberfrick
geography: Gipf-Oberfrick lies in the Tafeljura on the Bruggbach. The Bruggbach runs from southwest to northeast in an almost 500-meter-wide valley and flows into the Sissle near Frick. The once separate villages of Gipf and Oberfrick have grown together and form an almost three-kilometer-long settlement band with the neighboring municipality of Frick. The highest point is on the Tiersteinberg.

name: Gisikon
geography: Gisikon is located in the Lucerne part of the Reuss Valley at the foot of the Rooterberg. With an area of 107.66 ha, it is the smallest municipality in the canton of Lucerne. 42.2% of the area is used for agriculture, 31.2% is settlement area and another 22.0% is forest and woodland. The highest point of the municipality is on the Rooterberg at 646 m above sea level, the lowest on the Reuss at 406 m above sea level.

name: Giswil
geography: Giswil is located in the south of the valley area dominated by the Sarnersee in the canton of Obwalden at an altitude of 484 m above sea level. The lowest point is the Sarnersee at 469 m above sea level, the highest point is at 2348 m above sea level on the summit of the Brienzer Rothorns.

name: Givisiez
geography: Givisiez lies at 630 m above sea level, 2 km west-northwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village extends slightly elevated above the southern slope of the valley basin of the Ruisseau du Tiguelet, on the western outskirts of Fribourg. The area extends from the Bois de la Faye southwards over the valley basin of the Ruisseau du Tiguelet up to the Bois de Moncor, at 696 m above sea level.
appearance: Givisiez includes an extensive industrial and commercial zone in the valley below the old village center, as well as various residential settlements.

name: Givrins
geography: Givrins is located at 546 m above sea level, 6 km north-northwest of Nyon. The village extends on the lower southern slope of the Jura, east of the Colline valley, in a scenic location about 170 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality covers a section of the southern slope of the Jura.
appearance: The description of the town's appearance is not available in the provided text.

name: Gland
geography: Gland is situated at 432 meters above sea level, 5 kilometers northeast of Nyon. It lies on a plain gently sloping towards Lake Geneva at the foot of the Jura mountains, in the westernmost part of the Vaudois Côte. The municipality extends from the lake shore over the flat coastal strip northwards to the foot of the Jura.

name: Glarus Süd
geography: Glarus Süd encompasses the rear Linth valley, also known as Grosstal, and the entire Sernftal, known as Kleintal.  It spans from 504 m above sea level in Mitlödi in the north to the summit of Tödi at 3614 m above sea level in the south. Glarus Süd has tri-cantonal corners with Graubünden and St. Gallen, Graubünden and Uri, and Schwyz and Uri.

name: Glattfelden
geography: Glattfelden is located in the Zürcher Unterland on the last section of the Glatt river, which flows into the Rhine at Rheinsfelden. In addition to the village of Glattfelden, the municipality includes the settlements of Schachen, Aarüti, Rheinsfelden and Zweidlen. Neighboring municipalities are Weiach, Hohentengen, Eglisau, Bülach, Hochfelden and Stadel.  It sits on the border with Germany.

name: Gletterens
geography: Gletterens is located at 487 m above sea level, 8 km north of Payerne. The village extends on the broad ridge between the eastern shore of Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye plain, in the northwestern Fribourg Mittelland. The municipality includes a section on the eastern shore of Lake Neuchâtel with a flat shoreline. These zones belong to the Grande Cariçaie nature reserve. The highest point is at 498 m above sea level.

name: Goldach
geography: Goldach is located on the southern shore of Lake Constance. It borders Rorschach to the northeast, Rorschacherberg to the southeast, Untereggen to the south, Mörschwil to the southwest, Tübach to the west, and the Thurgau exclave of Horn TG to the northwest. The Goldach river flows through the municipality, forming the border with Mörschwil and Horn TG. The Goldachtobel and Rantelwald are local recreation areas.

name: Gollion
geography: Gollion is located at 506 m above sea level, 8 km north of Morges. It lies on a gently south-facing slope on the plateau of the southwestern Gros de Vaud, west of the Venoge valley, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality covers a section of the Gros de Vaud, the granary of the canton. The main part is the plateau, reaching its highest point at the wooded Brichy hill (561 m).
appearance: Gollion consists of two parts: Gollion proper (west) and Mussel (east) of the main road. The hamlet of Crausaz is located on the western slope of the Venoge valley, along with some isolated farms.

name: Gommiswald
geography: Gommiswald is located about 4 km east of Uznach on the Ricken. Since the merger in 2013, the political municipality consists of the villages of Ernetschwil, Gebertingen, Gommiswald, Ricken, Rieden and Uetliburg.

name: Goms
geography: Goms is a municipality in the Goms district of the Swiss canton of Wallis.  The area extends over 129.53 square kilometers.

name: Gondiswil
geography: Gondiswil is located in the Oberaargau region in the Swiss Mittelland. The neighboring municipalities are Huttwil, Auswil, Madiswil, Reisiswil, Melchnau, Grossdietwil, Fischbach, Zell and Ufhusen.

name: Gonten
geography: Gonten is a district in the canton of Appenzell Innerrhoden in eastern Switzerland. The best-known elevation is the Kronberg (1662 m above sea level).
appearance: The Catholic parish church of St. Verena was built in 1863 in the neo-Gothic style. The Roothuus was built in the 18th century as a four-storey town house.

name: Gontenschwil
geography: Gontenschwil is located in the upper Wynental valley and borders the canton of Lucerne. The village lies in a side valley of the Wyna river, separated from the main valley by a distinct lateral moraine.  The moraines formed during the Würm ice age during the retreat of the Reuss glacier. The settlement area is located west of the lateral moraine in the Sagenbach valley. The highest point is 750 m above sea level, the lowest 496 m above sea level on the Wyna.
appearance: The settlement area, over two kilometers long, is located in the Sagenbach valley and consists of the districts of Unterdorf, Kirchdorf and Oberdorf. At Oberdorf, the moraine merges into the southern foothills of the 872 meter high Stierenberg, where the Geisshof is located. On the west side of the Sagenbach valley, the terrain rises steeply and then turns into an average 700 meter high, elongated plateau. The hamlet of Hasel is located on this.

name: Gordola
geography: Gordola is located in the canton of Ticino, at the entrance to the Verzasca Valley, at the southern foot of chestnut and vineyard-covered slopes, on the Bellinzona-Locarno road, and 5.5 km northeast of Locarno. It is situated at an altitude of 222 m above sea level. The municipality borders the Lago di Vogorno and Lago Maggiore.

name: Göschenen
geography: The village of Göschenen is located in the upper Reusstal valley. The municipality includes the hamlets of Abfrutt (1168 m), Wiggen (1318 m) and Gwüest (1582 m) in the Göschenen Valley. At the Wiggen alp settlement, the Alper Reuss and Voralpreuss rivers unite. The river then bears the name Göschenerreuss and flows into the Reuss below the village.

name: Gossau (SG)
geography: Gossau lies between the city of St. Gallen and Wil in the Fürstenland. The entire area of the city has an area of 2751 hectares. St. Gallen and Gaiserwald in the east, Waldkirch and Andwil in the north, Niederbüren, Oberbüren and Flawil in the west and Herisau in the south share borders with Gossau. In the south, the hills of Appenzellerland flank the elongated hollow where Gossau lies.

name: Gossau (ZH)
geography: Gossau is a municipality in the canton of Zurich, located in the Zürcher Oberland, in the upper Glatt valley between Wetzikon and Forch, and belongs to the district of Hinwil. It is located in a landscape characterized by over 150 drumlins, a remnant of the Ice Age. The villages developed on the wooded hills and in the moor-covered lowlands. Altitude: 455 m ü. M.

name: Gottlieben
geography: Gottlieben is located at 400 m above sea level, northwest of Kreuzlingen on the left bank of the Seerhein, which incorporates the Dorfbach. The municipality is the smallest in the canton of Thurgau in terms of population and area.
appearance: The settlement has an urban character.

name: Goumoëns
geography: Goumoëns lies in the heart of the Gros-de-Vaud northeast of the small district town of Echallens on the north side of the Talent stream.

name: Graben
geography: Graben is located at 455 m above sea level, 4 km north of Herzogenbuchsee and 5 km west of Langenthal. The scattered settlement extends on the gravel terrace east of the Önz, shortly before it flows into the Aare, in the Oberaargau.
appearance: Graben is a scattered settlement with no real village center.

name: Grabs
geography: Grabs is located in the Rhine Valley between Buchs in the south and Gams in the north. To the west, it borders the Toggenburg municipality of Wildhaus-Alt St. Johann, to the south the municipality of Sevelen and to the southwest the municipality of Walenstadt. The municipality includes the extensive scattered settlements on the Grabserberg and Studnerberg, as well as the town of Werdenberg.  Embedded between the mountains is the Voralpsee lake at 1123 m above sea level.

name: Grächen
geography: Grächen is located at 1619 m above sea level on a terrace above the neighboring village of St. Niklaus, in the Mattertal valley. To the south, Grächen borders Gasenried, part of the municipality of St. Niklaus. Grächen includes the Kipfen/Chipfe settlement between the Stalden-Täsch main road and the Mattervispa river. Grächen is located in the driest area of Switzerland and the Alps.

name: Grancia
geography: Grancia lies in the valley of the Scairolo, 5 km south of Lugano and the same distance north of Morcote. The west portal of the A2 motorway tunnel to Melide lies immediately south of the settlement area. The neighboring municipalities are Collina d’Oro and Lugano.
appearance: null

name: Grancy
geography: Grancy is located at 581 m above sea level, 9 km north of Morges. The village is situated on the high plateau in the extreme southwest of the Gros de Vaud, in the Waadtland Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the slightly undulating high plateau of the Waadtland Mittelland. The municipality area is bordered to the north by the river Veyron.

name: Grandcour
geography: Grandcour is located at 484 m above sea level, 6 km north of Payerne. It lies on the southern side of the ridge between Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye plain. The municipality extends from the Broye plain northwards over the Petite Glâne to the Molasse ridge. The highest point is Bellevue at 502 m above sea level.

name: Grandevent
geography: Grandevent is located at 665 m above sea level, 7 km north-northwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village is situated on the southern slope of the Jura, in a panoramic location above the valley of the Arnon stream. The municipality extends from the foot of the Jura (580 m above sea level) northwards, up the steep forested slope of La Côte, and over the height of Brelingard (1273 m above sea level) and Crêt Breny (1219 m above sea level).
appearance: The provided text primarily focuses on the geography and location of Grandevent, mentioning it as a farming village with a panoramic view. There is no description of the town's architecture or urban/rural character.

name: Grandfontaine
geography: Grandfontaine is located at 529 m above sea level, eleven kilometers west of Porrentruy. The farming village extends in a valley basin of the western Ajoie on the border with France. The area encompasses the wide valley basin of the dry valley of Grandfontaine. To the south, the municipality extends to the wooded heights of La Clef and Le Perchet, and in a narrow strip across the dry valley of Réclère to the northern slope of Roche d’Or.

name: Grandson
geography: Grandson is located at 447 m above sea level, 3 km north of Yverdon-les-Bains. The historic town extends slightly elevated on a moraine hill above the western shore of Lake Neuchâtel, near the mouth of the Grandsonnet stream, at the southern foot of the Jura and in the northern part of the Vaud Central Plateau. The area includes a section on the western shore of Lake Neuchâtel.

name: Grandval
geography: Grandval is located at 588 m above sea level, 4 km east of Moutier. The village stretches on both sides of the La Raus stream in the Cornet, the eastern part of the Jura longitudinal valley of Moutier, which is also called Grand Val. The area extends to the Jura chain of Mont Raimeux (1302 m) in the north and the Oberdörferberg (1233 m) in the south.

name: Grandvillard
geography: Grandvillard is located at 762 m above sea level, 8 km south-southeast of Bulle. The village is situated on the alluvial fan of the Tâna on the eastern edge of the Saane valley in the Haute-Gruyère, in the Freiburg Alps east of the Moléson. The area extends eastward over the flat valley floor and includes the catchment area of the La Taouna stream. The boundary runs south over Les Millets, Pra de Cray, and Vanil Carré, and northeast over Le Van.

name: Granges (Veveyse)
geography: Granges (Veveyse) is situated at 753 m above sea level, 7 km north of Vevey. The village is located on a vantage point on the northern edge of the Mont Pèlerin ridge, west of the Biorda valley, in the southwestern part of the Freiburg Mittelland. The municipality's area includes a section of the Molasse hills in the upper Broye catchment area, bordered by the Corbéron and Biorda streams. The Mont Pèlerin ridge rises between the streams, reaching 965 m above sea level.

name: Granges-Paccot
geography: Granges-Paccot lies at 620 m above sea level, 2.5 km northwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village extends on a high plateau west of the Saane trench and north of the Lavapesson valley, on the northern outskirts of Fribourg, in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Central Plateau. The area includes a section of the Molasse heights between the valleys of the Sonnaz and the Saane. The Saane is dammed up to form the Schiffenensee.

name: Grangettes
geography: Grangettes is located at 783 m above sea level, 4 km east-southeast of Romont. The village extends on the western slope of the Gibloux, on the Mausson stream, above the valley of the Neirigue, in the higher Freiburg Mittelland.

name: Gränichen
geography: Gränichen is located in the Wynental valley in the canton of Aargau. The Wyna river flows through the municipality in a northerly and then northwesterly direction. The valley floor is about 500 meters wide and lies between 435 m above sea level in the south and 405 m above sea level in the north. Several streams drain the hilly landscape to the Wyna. The municipality is surrounded by hills, such as the Manzenberg, Wällenen, Moosberg, Heidberg and Pfendel.

name: Gravesano
geography: Gravesano is located in the middle section of the Valle del Vedeggio (Vedeggiotal) on its western side. The Vedeggio river, which used to mark the eastern border of the municipality, no longer runs on its territory. The western border runs along the slope of Monte Ferraro, while the southern and northern borders are largely formed by two smaller streams.
appearance: The former hamlet of Grumo has now grown together with Gravesano and forms its own district. It gave its name to a medieval castle district, which probably included Gravesano, Manno and Bedano.

name: Greifensee
geography: Greifensee is located in the Zürcher Oberland. Its buildings extend to the shore of the lake of the same name, Greifensee. The municipality is bordered by Niederuster to the south, Nänikon (Uster) to the southeast, Volketswil to the northeast, Schwerzenbach to the northwest, and Fällanden and Maur to the southwest on the opposite shore of the Greifensee.
appearance: The provided text focuses on the history of the area and doesn't contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: Grellingen
geography: Grellingen is located in the lower Laufental and has belonged to the Canton of Basel-Landschaft since 1994. It lies south of Basel, on the Basel–Delémont railway line. It is 15 kilometers to the city of Basel. The district capital Laufen is 9 kilometers to the west.

name: Grenchen
geography: Grenchen is located at the southern foot of the Jura mountains, between the cities of Solothurn and Biel/Bienne. The northern part of Grenchen includes a portion of the Jura mountain range. The highest point in the municipality is about 1405 meters above sea level. The municipal area extends from the Jura heights over the southern flank of the first Jura chain and the Aare plain to the Aare river. The city center is located about 450 meters above sea level.

name: Greng
geography: Greng lies at 439 m above sea level, 2.5 km southwest of Murten on the southern shore of Lake Murten near the mouth of the village stream, at the edge of the adjacent hills. The municipality area includes a section on the southern shore of Lake Murten with about 1.5 km of shoreline. The highest point in the municipality is 464 m above sea level.
appearance: Greng consists of the districts of Unter-Greng and Ober-Greng, and the western part of the hamlet of Blessoney.

name: Grengiols
geography: Grengiols consists of the main settlement and the hamlets Zenhäusern, Bädel, Bächerhäusern, Viertel and Hockmatte as well as Deisch and Nussbaum. Deisch and Nussbaum are located on the right bank of the Rhone.
appearance: The village is located in a channel on the southern slope of the valley and has a distinctive townscape. Characteristic is the old village square with its gate-like narrowed access, which leads to a square surrounded by closed house fronts; from there, the street-like part of the village rises steeply up a narrow channel, at the end of which the church, parsonage and schoolhouse set a special settlement accent.

name: Grens
geography: Grens is located at 496 m above sea level, 4 km west-northwest of Nyon. The village extends on the slightly southeast-sloping plain at the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of La Dôle. The municipality covers a section of the plain at the foot of the Jura, extending north to the Asse River. The highest elevation reaches 510 m above sea level.

name: Greppen
geography: Greppen is located on Lake Lucerne, on the eastern shore of the Küssnacht arm at the foot of the Rigi. It stretches from Lake Lucerne to the western slope of the Rigi up to below Rigi-Staffelhöhe (1400 m above sea level). Only 330 ha of the municipal area is land, the rest is lake area. Of the land area, 46.7% is used for agriculture, 39.5% is forest and woodland and 13.5% is settlement area.
appearance: The municipality stretches along the road from Küssnacht SZ towards Brunnen, gradually rising along the foot of the Rigi. Many new side roads are gradually fragmenting the agricultural land and slopes near the village.

name: Gretzenbach
geography: Gretzenbach is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Solothurn and belongs to the Olten district.
appearance: The present-day Gretzenbach includes the old Gretzenbach (located near the Catholic church, front part of the village) and the Weid district in the rear part of the linear village, which also houses the current school facilities of the village. The original Gretzenbach used to not have a proper school house of its own, while Weid already had one.

name: Grimisuat
geography: Grimisuat is located in the district of Sitten in the Swiss canton of Valais.

name: Grindel
geography: Grindel lies at 577 m above sea level, 4.5 km south of the city of Laufen. The farming village stretches on a saddle between two streams flowing north to the Birs, in the folded Jura at the northern foot of the Fringelikette, in the Schwarzbubenland.

name: Grindelwald
geography: Grindelwald is a municipality in the Interlaken-Oberhasli administrative district of the Canton of Bern in Switzerland.

name: Grône
geography: Grône is located in the upper part of the Lower Valais south of Sierre on the southern side of the Rhone Valley. In the southwest, the municipality extends to the banks of the Rhone. In the southwest of the municipality lies the Pouta-Fontana moorland, which is a nature reserve.
appearance: The municipality consists of the village of Grône and the hamlets of Daillet, Erdesson, Itravers, La Coutoulaz, Le Coujon, Loye and Pramagnon, as well as numerous individual farms.

name: Grono
geography: Grono is located on the right side of the Moesa River. Approximately 60% of the municipality area consists of forest and woodland, and 30% is unproductive land. About 5% of the usable area is settlement and 5% is agriculture, mainly consisting of viticulture. Grono borders several municipalities, including Roveredo, Buseno, and Cama. In the east, it borders the municipalities of Gordona and Dosso del Liro in Italy towards Lake Como.

name: Grossaffoltern
geography: Grossaffoltern is located near Lyss in the Bernese Seeland. The municipality includes the villages and hamlets of Suberg, Ammerzwil, Vorimholz, Chaltebrünne, Weingarten, Kosthofen and Ottiswil as well as several individual farms and farm groups.

name: Grossdietwil
geography: Grossdietwil lies on the right bank of the Rotbach. In addition to the village, the municipality includes two exclaves: Eppenwil and Erpolingen. The second exclave is called Kället. The landscape is hilly and partially wooded. The lowest point is Ängelgehr (550 m above sea level), while Rugenstall is the highest (752 m above sea level). The Fischbach flows through the village, merging into the Rotbach.

name: Grosshöchstetten
geography: Grosshöchstetten is a municipality in the Bern-Mittelland administrative district of the Canton of Bern. The municipality has an altitude of 745 meters above sea level and a height range of 659–915 meters above sea level.

name: Grosswangen
geography: Grosswangen is located about 25 km northwest of Lucerne, in the Wahlkreis Sursee. The region around Grosswangen, Buttisholz and Ruswil is called Rottal. The highest point is Oberhöhe with 747 m above sea level, the lowest near Buchwald nature reserve at 523 m above sea level.

name: Grub (AR)
geography: Grub is located in the Vorderland region of Appenzell Ausserrhoden. The village lies in a depression on the Mattenbach stream, which separates Grub (Canton St. Gallen) to the north and Grub (AR) to the south. The highest point of the municipality is on the eastern secondary peak of the Kaien mountain at 1115 m above sea level. A section in the valley of the Gstaldenbach also belongs to the municipality.

name: Grüningen
geography: The municipality is located on the northeastern flank of the Pfannenstiel, in the valley floor of the Zürcher Oberland, which is traversed by gently rolling hills, between Pfannenstiel and Bachtel. The highest point of the municipality, which averages around 500 m above sea level, is the Schlüssberg (554 m above sea level), the lowest point is at 453 m above sea level where the Aabach leaves the municipality towards Gossau ZH.

name: Grüsch
geography: Grüsch is located in the Vorderprättigau on the fan of the Taschinasbach stream. Fanas lies northeast on the mountain slope, 300 meters above the valley floor. Valzeina is situated in a southern side valley above the Schranggabach stream. The highest point since the 2011 fusion is the Giraspitz at 2393 m.a.s.l.
appearance: The village of Grüsch is a clustered village (Haufendorf).

name: Gruyères
geography: Greyerz lies at 810 m above sea level, 4.5 km south-southeast of Bulle. The town extends on an isolated hill at the northern edge of the Alps, at the northeast foot of the Moléson and at the point where the Saane leaves the Freiburg Alps. The municipality includes a section of the Saane valley and the Freiburg Alps. The Moléson reaches an altitude of 2002 m above sea level.

name: Gryon
geography: Gryon is located at 1114 m above sea level, 9 km southeast of Aigle. The village stretches on a south-facing slope high above the Avançon valley, west of the Les Diablerets massif, in a scenic location about 700 m above the Rhône plain. The municipality covers a section of the Vaud Alps. The area is mostly bordered by the Avançon stream in the south and the Gryonne stream in the north.
appearance: Gryon includes the hamlets of Rabou (1130 m above sea level) above the Avançon valley and La Barboleusaz (1211 m above sea level) on the ridge between Gryonne and Avançon, extensive holiday home settlements in the Les Frasses area, the Alpine settlement of Taveyanne (1647 m above sea level), and a few isolated farms.

name: Gsteig
geography: Gsteig bei Gstaad liegt im Berner Oberland auf dem Weg zum Col du Pillon. Die Gemeinde besteht aus den Orten Gsteig und Feutersoey. Die Berge im Süden der Gemeinde bilden die Grenze zum Wallis. Auf dem Gipfel des Oldenhorns befindet sich ein Dreikantonseck zu den Kantonen Waadt und Wallis. Im Ortsteil Feutersoey befindet sich der Arnensee, ein Stausee.

name: Gsteigwiler
geography: Gsteigwiler is located in the Bernese Oberland at the foot of the Schynige Platte in a valley. The neighboring communities starting from the north in clockwise direction are Matten bei Interlaken, Bönigen, Gündlischwand and Wilderswil. The Lütschine flows in the valley.

name: Guggisberg
geography: Guggisberg is located in the pre-Alpine region, between Schwarzwasser and Sense. The main village is at 1115 m on the southwest slope of the Guggershorn (1283 m), making Guggisberg one of the highest municipalities in the Swiss pre-Alpine region. The highest point of the municipality is the 2151 m high Schibe, the lowest point is at 708 m at the confluence of Niederriedgraben and Sense. The municipality covers 55 km2.

name: Gündlischwand
geography: Gündlischwand lies in the Bernese Oberland in the Alps on both sides of the Black Lütschine. In the upper part of the municipality is the Sägistal with a small lake and the Sägissa mountain (2465 m above sea level). The municipality extends to just below the summit of the Männlichen above the Obere Spätenenalp. The confluence of the Weissen and Schwarzen Lütschine rivers also lies within the municipality's borders.
appearance: The village of Zweilütschinen is much better known than the village of Gündlischwand due to the Berner Oberland-Bahn (BOB) railway station of the same name.

name: Günsberg
geography: Günsberg lies on 624 m above sea level, 6 km northeast of Solothurn, on the southern slope of the first Jura chain, in the Unterleberberg region, around 200 m above the plain of the Solothurn Mittelland. The municipality is part of the Solothurn Jura and has relatively large differences in altitude. The highest point is the Chamben with 1251 m above sea level.
appearance: New residential areas were built mainly below the old town center, so that the settlement area of Günsberg has almost grown together with that of Niederwil.

name: Gunzgen
geography: Gunzgen is located at 429 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of Olten. The village stretches in the Dünnern plain near the southern foot of the Jura in the so-called Mittelgäu of the Solothurn Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Aaretal plain. The northern boundary runs along the canalized Dünnern. The area extends southwards over the wide gravel plain to the wooded heights of Eichliban and Stierenban.

name: Gurbrü
geography: Gurbrü lies in the Swiss Mittelland on the edge of the Grossen Mooses. The municipality consists of the village Gurbrü and the hamlet Stämpflerei. The neighboring municipalities are Wileroltigen, Ferenbalm, Ried bei Kerzers and Kerzers.

name: Gurmels
geography: Gurmels lies at 542 m above sea level, 6 km southeast of Murten. It stretches along the southern edge of the Biberen valley, in a hollow on both sides of the Cordast stream, at the western foot of the Grossholz, in the northern Fribourg Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the Molasse hills between Lake Murten and the Saane valley.

name: Gurtnellen
geography: Gurtnellen is located in the upper part of the Urner Reusstal valley. The large municipality also includes several side valleys. Gorneren is a side valley of the Reusstal and is drained by the Gornerbach. The Fellital is on the right side of the Reuss and is traversed by the Fellibach.
appearance: Gurtnellen-Dorf (935 m above sea level) lies on the mountainside, with the hamlets of Obergurtnellen, Richligen and Ruepelingen above it. 1.5 km south of the village center, Gurtnellen-Wiler (741 m above sea level) lies on the Reuss with the train station on the Gotthardbahn and the village school. Between these village parts is the hamlet Stalden (875 m above sea level).

name: Gurzelen
geography: Gurzelen lies at 591 m above sea level, 8 km west-northwest of Thun. The farming village stretches in the valley basin of the Müsche, shortly before it enters the wide Gürbetal plain, in the hilly landscape of the Thuner Westamt. The municipality encompasses a section of the Aare depression between Bern and Thun. Most of the area is occupied by the Drumlin landscape.

name: Guttannen
geography: Guttannen lies in the Berner Oberland near the Grimselpass. It is in the Haslital valley in the Berner Oberland.  The neighboring communities are Innertkirchen, Obergoms, Goms, Fieschertal and Grindelwald. The Schreckhorn, Lauteraarhorn, Finsteraarhorn and Ritzlihorn are located on the western border of the municipality.

name: Guttet-Feschel
geography: Guttet-Feschel is located in the German-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Valais. It is a mountain village on the northern slope of the Rhone Valley near Leuk. The hamlets of Grächmatten and Wiler also belong to the municipality.

name: Güttingen
geography: Güttingen is located near Lake Constance, about 1 kilometer from the shore, on the road between Kreuzlingen and Romanshorn. It borders the municipalities of Langrickenbach, Altnau, Kesswil, and Sommeri. The Güttinger Wald belongs to the municipality.
appearance: The core of Güttingen is a clustered village (Haufendorf). The Pfarrhäuser und paritätische Kirche are notable buildings.

name: Gy
geography: Gy befindet sich links des Genfersees und rechts der Seymaz an der Grenze zu Frankreich (Département Haute-Savoie).

name: Habkern
geography: Habkern lies in the Bernese Oberland on the border to the Emmental, which is formed by the Hohgant. The place consists of the Bäuerten Bohlseiten, Bort, Schwendi and Mittelbäuert, the actual village center. In the underground of the municipality is the Siebenhengste-Hohgant cave. Above Habkern-Bolsite lies the Augstmatthorn.

name: Habsburg
geography: Habsburg is located east of Wülpelsberg, where the castle is located. The Wülpelsberg slopes steeply to the Aare valley in the north and west. The east and south sides form the edge of a gently sloping plateau that transitions seamlessly into the Birrfeld. The area is 223 hectares, 137 of which are forested. The highest point is the 505 meter high Wülpelsberg, and the lowest is at 370 meters at the foot of the Wülpelsberg.
appearance: Habsburg is a Haufendorf, a clustered village, surrounded by forest to the west, north and east. The village likely arose in the early 15th century when the forest south and east of the castle was cleared. In 1529 it counted only four houses.

name: Häfelfingen
geography: Häfelfingen is located on the northwest slope of the Wisenberg, which belongs to the Jura mountains. The summit of Wisenberg is the highest point of the municipality at 1002 m above sea level. The Eimattbach flows through the village, a tributary of the Homburgerbach, which in turn flows into the Ergolz.
appearance: No information about the town's appearance is available in the provided text.

name: Hagenbuch
geography: Hagenbuch is a municipality in the Winterthur district of the canton of Zurich in Switzerland. The municipality also includes the outer districts of Kappel, Egghof, Oberschneit, Hagenstal, Mittel- and Unterschneit and Schneitberg. 61.7% of the municipal area is agricultural land, 28.3% is forest, 5.8% is settlement area and 3.9% is used for transport, 0.4% are bodies of water.

name: Hägendorf
geography: Hägendorf is located at 434 m above sea level, 5 km west-southwest of Olten. The village extends in the plain at the southern foot of the Jura, at the exit of the Cholersbach from the Teufelsschlucht into the Dünnern valley. The municipality area includes a section of the Solothurn Jura and has a great variety of landscapes. The southern boundary runs along the canalized course of the Dünnern.

name: Häggenschwil
geography: Häggenschwil lies on the Sitter River between St. Gallen and Amriswil. The landscape is characterized by gently undulating terrain with parallel moraine hills from the last ice age. The municipality has an exclave in the municipality of Egnach in the canton of Thurgau.

name: Hägglingen
geography: Hägglingen is located in the western part of the Bremgarten district on the edge of the Bünztal. It is also known as the "Seven-Hills-Village" as it lies on the Rötler plateau, bordered by numerous hills of the Wagenrain chain. The Maiengrün, the highest of these hills at 589 m above sea level, is located in the northwest.

name: Hagneck
geography: Hagneck lies in the Bernese Seeland on the south shore of Lake Biel at the mouth of the Hagneck Canal. The neighboring municipalities from the north, starting clockwise, are Täuffelen, Walperswil, Siselen and Lüscherz.

name: Hallau
geography: Hallau is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Schaffhausen. The wine-growing community is located in Klettgau north of the Rhine on the border between Germany and Switzerland. The hamlet of Wunderklingen on the other side of the Hallauerberg also belongs to the municipality.
appearance: The infobox contains a picture of the 'Hauptstrasse in Hallau'.

name: Hallwil
geography: Hallwil is located in the Seetal valley, about seven kilometers south of Lenzburg. The village stretches along the western edge of the Seetal, but not directly on Lake Hallwil.  It is situated on a moraine about two kilometers from the northern end of the lake. West of the village center, the terrain rises steeply to the plateau of Dürrenäsch. The Aabach river flows in the east of the municipality.

name: Härkingen
geography: Härkingen is located at the southern foot of the Jura mountains, at the A1 Zürich–Bern motorway junction, where the A2 from Basel joins. It lies in the Gäu district of the canton of Solothurn.
appearance: The text does not offer a clear description of the town's appearance other than mentioning the Gasthaus zum Lamm, which is mentioned as possibly the oldest building and dating back to 1560.

name: Hasle (LU)
geography: Hasle is located in the Entlebuch region of the canton of Lucerne. The municipality includes the village of Hasle, the hamlets of Habschwanden and Heiligkreuz, and numerous other settlements. The northern border follows the Entlen river to its confluence with the Kleine Emme.  Much of the area is located on the right bank of the Kleine Emme. Altitudes range from 662 to 2040 meters above sea level.
appearance: The village of Hasle is situated in the valley along the Luzern-Bern road. It has grown together with the hamlets of Oeschtor, Gibel, Feld, Büel, and Farbstutz. The Biberebach stream flows through the village. The area around Heiligkreuz and along the streams has larger wooded areas.

name: Hasle bei Burgdorf
geography: Hasle bei Burgdorf is located at 571 m above sea level, 5 km south-southeast of Burgdorf in the Emmental valley. It lies on the floodplain and adjacent terrace on the left side of the Emme river, in the Molasse hills of the higher Swiss Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the Emmental, with the northeastern border running along the canalized Emme. Four side valleys, Biembachtal, Bigental, Talgraben, and Goldbachtal, meet here.

name: Hasliberg
geography: Hasliberg is located behind the Brünigpass and extends over the sunny terrace of the Haslital to Planplatten. The municipality borders Meiringen to the west and south, Innertkirchen to the east, and the canton of Obwalden to the north. The highest point is Glogghüs with 2534 m above sea level, and the lowest point is in Reutiberg at about 700 m above sea level.
appearance: The populated area extends over four villages over nine kilometers: Hohfluh, Wasserwendi, Goldern and Reuti.

name: Hauenstein-Ifenthal
geography: Hauenstein-Ifenthal is located in the Gösgen district of the canton of Solothurn. Hauenstein sits at about 675 m above sea level, below the highest point of the Unteren Hauenstein pass. Ifenthal is situated two kilometers west at about 700 m above sea level, above the valley of the Grabenbach on the southern slope of the Ifleterberg. The municipality stretches at an average altitude of 670 m in the Solothurner Kettenjura.
appearance: The municipality consists of two larger settlement parts and individual farms. Between the two settlements, the Ifenthaler Kirchlein with the Patrozinium Sankt Katharina is visible on the Jura slope edge above the Trimbach valley.
pointsOfInterest: Ifenthaler Kirchlein mit dem Patrozinium Sankt Katharina

name: Hauptwil-Gottshaus
geography: Hauptwil-Gottshaus is a municipality in the Weinfelden district of the canton of Thurgau in Switzerland. It consists of the villages of Hauptwil, Wilen (Gottshaus) and St. Pelagiberg and a group of hamlets in between. The municipality borders the municipalities of Bischofszell and Zihlschlacht-Sitterdorf in the canton of Thurgau, as well as the St. Galler municipalities of Waldkirch, Muolen and Häggenschwil.

name: Hausen (AG)
geography: Hausen is located approximately three kilometers south of Brugg in a flat, roughly 500-meter-wide side valley between the Aare and the Birrfeld. The valley is bordered to the west by the 457-meter high Wülpelsberg and to the east by the 500-meter high Eiteberg. The Guggerhübel (434 m above sea level) at the southern municipal border runs across the valley.
appearance: Hausen lies on the southern edge of the Brugg-Windisch agglomeration. There is no appearance description available in the article content.

name: Hausen am Albis
geography: Hausen am Albis is located south of the Canton of Zürich in the Affoltern district, on the south side of the Albis. The municipality in the upper Jonental consists of the villages of Hausen and Ebertswil as well as the hamlets of Türlen, Vollenweid, Tüfenbach, Hinter-, Mittel- and Oberalbis, Husertal, Hirzwangen and Schweikhof. The municipality's catchment area extends from Sihlbrugg to Türlersee. The highest point is 916 m above sea level, the lowest is 532 m above sea level.
appearance: Heisch is a district that has now grown together with Hausen. It is located about one kilometer west of the village center and is divided into Ober- and Unterheisch. Ebertswil is located in the south of the municipality, about two kilometers from the village center. The location of the village on a slightly elevated plateau allows a wide view of the canton of Zug with the Zugersee and into the Swiss Alps.

name: Haute-Ajoie
geography: Haute-Ajoie is located southwest of Porrentruy, at the border with France. Neighboring municipalities are Grandfontaine, Fahy, Bure, Courtedoux and Fontenais in the canton of Jura as well as Montancy, Glère, Vaufrey, Montjoie-le-Château, Villars-lès-Blamont and Dannemarie in neighboring France. It is the second largest municipality in the district of Porrentruy.

name: Hautemorges
geography: Hautemorges is a municipality in the district of Morges in the canton of Vaud in Switzerland.

name: Hauterive (FR)
geography: Hauterive lies at around 680 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The municipality extends on the Molasse plateau between the valleys of the Glâne in the west and the Saane in the east, in the Freiburg Mittelland. The area covers a section of the slightly undulating Molasse plateau between the Glâne and Saane rivers, which have cut deeply into the plateau.

name: Haute-Sorne
geography: The municipality of Haute-Sorne is located in the canton of Jura, Switzerland. The river Sorne flows through the region.
appearance: The municipal administration of Haute-Sorne is located in Bassecourt.

name: Hauteville
geography: Hauteville is located at 718 m above sea level, 7 km northeast of Bulle. The village extends on a terrace above the eastern shore of the Lake Gruyère, on the village stream Ruisseau des Branches, at the western foot of the Berra. The municipality includes a section of the pre-Alpine area in the Gruyère region and a share of the Lake Gruyère to the west.

name: Haut-Intyamon
geography: Haut-Intyamon is located in the Haute-Gruyère, in the Intyamon valley of the Saane (Sarine), in the Freiburg Alps east of the Moléson chain. The area includes a section of the Haute-Gruyère in the Freiburg Alps. The Saane valley forms the central part.  North of Lessoc, the Saane forms a flat valley. East of the Saane lies the catchment area of the Torrent. The western part is more structured by the Marive and Hongrin valleys.

name: Häutligen
geography: Häutligen lies at 762 m above sea level, 3 km south-southwest of Konolfingen and 12 km north of the city of Thun. The farming village stretches in a scenic location on the gently sloping western slope of the Lochenberg towards the Aare valley, around 230 m above the Aare valley, in the Alpine foothills. The municipality includes the wooded hills of Lochenberg, Egg and Hubewald.
appearance: The article primarily describes the municipality's location and geography rather than its visual appearance.

name: Hedingen
geography: Hedingen lies in the southwest of the Canton of Zürich. It is located in the district of Affoltern. The municipality includes the hamlets Fromoos and Ismatt. Hedingen is located 13 kilometers away from Zurich and 17 kilometers away from Zug.

name: Hefenhofen
geography: Hefenhofen is located north of Amriswil and includes the 11 hamlets of Hefenhofen, Brüschwil, Hamisfeld, Auenhofen, Chappehuse, Chatzerüti, Sonnenberg, Chressibuech, Hatswil, Tohueb and Moos. Hefenhofen borders the municipalities of Sommeri, Kesswil, Dozwil, Uttwil, Romanshorn, Salmsach and Amriswil.
appearance: Numerous single and multi-family homes and commercial buildings characterize the rural residential community.

name: Heiden
geography: Heiden lies in the Appenzell Vorderland, nestled between Kaien, Bischofsberg and Freudenberg, around 400 meters above Lake Constance at 810 meters above sea level. The Gstaldenbach stream rises on the Kaien, flows through the village and forms a deep ravine below it. The lowest point in the municipality is at 470 meters near the Engi on the Gstaldenbach, and the highest point is above the Risi at 1030 meters.
appearance: A village center gradually formed around the church built on a hilltop, and the community developed into a regional center.

name: Heiligenschwendi
geography: Heiligenschwendi is located above the right bank of the Thunersee on the western slope of the heavily wooded Blume hill. The main settlements are Schwendi-Dörfli, Heiligenschwendi and Halten. Of the total municipal area, a little less than half is used for agriculture, with a further 43.22% covered by forest and woodland.

name: Heimberg
geography: Heimberg is the lowest municipality in the Aare valley that belongs to the Bernese Oberland. The municipality includes the hamlets of Bümberg and Thungschneit, which are located northwest of the village of Heimberg. The municipality is one of the northern suburbs of the city of Thun. Neighboring municipalities of Heimberg are Fahrni, Steffisburg, Thun, Uetendorf, Uttigen, Kiesen, Brenzikofen and Oppligen.

name: Heimenhausen
geography: Heimenhausen is located 2.5 km north of Herzogenbuchsee and 7 km west of Langenthal. The former linear village extends on the gravel terrace west of the lower Önz valley and south of the Aare lowlands, in the Oberaargau. The area is divided by the parallel streams of the Önz and the Seebach. The Bergwald covers a ground moraine wall of the Ice Age Rhone Glacier and reaches the highest elevation of Heimenhausen at 487 m above sea level.

name: Heimiswil
geography: Heimiswil is located at 615 m above sea level, 3 km east of Burgdorf. The farming village extends in the Heimiswilgraben, an eastern side valley of the Emmental, in the Molasse hills of the higher Swiss Mittelland. The central part of the municipality is the Heimiswilgraben, drained by the Fischbach.
appearance: The landscape often shows very steep slopes, which makes agricultural cultivation of this area difficult. Forests and pastures therefore predominate in the higher altitudes.

name: Heitenried
geography: Heitenried is located at 762 m above sea level, 11 km east-northeast of Freiburg. The village extends in a panoramic location on the southwest slope of the Magdalenaholz, above the valley of the Lettiswilbach, in the hilly landscape of the eastern Freiburg Mittelland. The municipality is situated in the Molasse hills between the Saane and Sense river valleys.

name: Hellikon
geography: Hellikon is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the west of the Fricktal region. The village lies in the upper Möhlin valley, which is traversed by the Möhlinbach. The municipality consists of two parts: Unterdorf and Oberdorf. The valley floor is limited by hills of the Tafeljura.  The Wabrig plateau lies to the east. The municipality is part of the Jurapark Aargau.

name: Hellsau
geography: Hellsau is situated at 478 m above sea level, 6 km southwest of Herzogenbuchsee and 10 km north of Burgdorf. The farming village is located on a slight elevation at the northern foot of the Grossholz in the valley of the Chrümelbach, east of the Emme alluvial plain, in the Swiss Mittelland.

name: Hemishofen
geography: Hemishofen is a municipality in the canton of Schaffhausen in Switzerland. The border between Germany and Switzerland runs in the east.

name: Hemmiken
geography: Hemmiken is located north of the Wischberg on the Hemmikerbach in a side valley of the Ergolz valley. It borders Buus to the north, Hellikon (AG) to the northeast, Wegenstetten (AG) to the east, Rothenfluh to the southeast, and Ormalingen to the southwest and west.
appearance: From the flourishing stonemasonry in the 18th and 19th centuries, decorated door supports can be seen on older houses.

name: Hendschiken
geography: Hendschiken is located in the lower Bünztal valley, two kilometers east of Lenzburg. The village lies west of the Bünz river. The Lütisbuech (538 m above sea level) and the Rain (519 m above sea level) rise on the western municipal border, extensions of the Rietenberg. The highest point is 535 meters and the lowest point is 398 meters on the Bünz.
appearance: The village has three distinct parts: the Horner industrial area in the west, the agricultural hamlet of Büel on the eastern slope of the Lütisbuech, and the modern single-family housing estate of Steinacker on the east bank of the Bünz.

name: Henggart
geography: Henggart is located between Winterthur and Schaffhausen, in the Zürcher Weinland. The municipality belongs to the agglomeration area of the city of Winterthur.

name: Henniez
geography: Henniez is located at 484 m above sea level, 10 km south-southwest of Payerne. It extends along the eastern edge of the Broye valley, at the entrance to the Trémeule erosion valley, in the eastern Vaudois Midlands. The municipality encompasses a section of the Broye valley, extending eastward onto the Molasse hills, with the Trémeule carving an erosion valley.
appearance: NULL

name: Herbetswil
geography: Herbetswil lies at 524 m above sea level, 8 km west-southwest of Balsthal. The village extends on the sunny side of the northern edge of the Balsthaler valley, on both sides of the Rickenbächli stream, at the foot of the Brunnersberg chain in the Solothurn Jura. The area includes a section in the western part of the Balsthaler or Dünnern valley, a longitudinal valley in the Solothurn Jura.

name: Herdern
geography: Herdern lies on the Seerücken between Frauenfeld and the Untersee. The municipality consists of the two villages Lanzenneunforn and Herdern as well as the hamlets Wilen, Ammenhausen, Kugelshofen and Liebenfels.
appearance: The castle and the more recently built single-family houses characterize the rural residential community today.

name: Hérémence
geography: The municipality is located in the Val d’Hérémence valley. The neighboring municipalities are Vex, Saint-Martin, Evolène, Val de Bagnes and Nendaz.

name: Hergiswil (NW)
geography: Hergiswil lies at the foot of Pilatus mountain on Lake Lucerne (Vierwaldstättersee). The municipality's area is 1699.6 hectares. Only 29.3% is used for agriculture, while 44.4% is covered by forest. 9.7% is settlement area, and 16.6% is unproductive area. The entire eastern slope of the Pilatus massif belongs to the municipality.

name: Hergiswil bei Willisau
geography: Hergiswil bei Willisau is located in the Wahlkreis Willisau of the Canton of Lucerne. It consists of hills and mountains north of the Napf. The municipality has a scattered settlement pattern with many individual farms, hamlets, and groups of houses typical of the mountain landscape. The main settlement is the village of Hergiswil (647 m above sea level). The Änziwigger river flows through the main valley.

name: Herisau
geography: Herisau is located southwest of St. Gallen on the Glatt River, on the Jakobsweg from Rorschach to Einsiedeln. Neighboring municipalities are St. Gallen, Stein, Hundwil, Waldstatt, Schwellbrunn, Degersheim, Flawil and Gossau. The center of Herisau lies at 771 m above sea level. The highest point is on the Polishöchi at 995 m above sea level. The lowest point is at 588 m above sea level.

name: Hermance
geography: Hermance is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. It is located directly on Lake Geneva and borders France to the north.

name: Hermenches
geography: Hermenches is located at 679 m above sea level, 24 km southwest of Payerne. The village lies on a promontory east of the Bressonne valley, on the northeast slope of the Jorat plateau, in the Swiss Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Jorat plateau, bounded by the Mérine and Bressonne valleys. The highest point is 834 m above sea level in the Bois de Ban forest.
appearance: Hermenches is a farming village situated on a promontory east of the Bressonne valley.

name: Hermrigen
geography: Hermrigen is located in the Seeland administrative district of the Swiss Canton of Bern. Its neighboring municipalities, starting from the north and proceeding clockwise, are Bellmund, Merzligen, Kappelen BE, Bühl BE, Epsach, Mörigen, and Sutz-Lattrigen.

name: Herrliberg
geography: Herrliberg is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Zürich. It is located on the lower right bank of Lake Zurich, in the Meilen district. The hamlet of Wetzwil, high above the lake, belongs to the municipality.

name: Hersberg
geography: Hersberg lies on the eastern slope of the Domberg between Arisdorf and Liestal. Other neighboring municipalities are Lausen, Nusshof, Olsberg and Sissach. Olsberg includes the exclave Spärge, a 1.4 hectare forest in a depression between the Eileten and Halmet hills.

name: Herznach-Ueken
geography: Herznach-Ueken ist eine politische Gemeinde des Bezirks Laufenburg des Kantons Aargau in der Schweiz.

name: Herzogenbuchsee
geography: Herzogenbuchsee is a political municipality in the Oberaargau administrative district of the Canton of Bern in Switzerland. The town was built on a moraine of the Rhone Glacier from the last ice age.

name: Hettlingen
geography: Hettlingen is located north of Winterthur in the hilly, glacially formed area at the eastern foot of the Irchel mountain range. The municipality borders Henggart to the northwest, Dägerlen to the northeast, Seuzach to the southeast, Winterthur to the south, and Neftenbach to the west.
appearance: The provided text does not contain any information on the appearance of the town.

name: Hildisrieden
geography: Hildisrieden is located near Sempach, above the memorial site of the Battle of Sempach. It sits on the southern slope of the Erlosen hills, providing views of the pre-Alps and Pilatus mountain from many locations. The municipality includes Hildisrieden-Dorf, the hamlets of Breiti, Mülacher, Gimmermee, Ohmelinge and Traselinge. The Ron river flows through the village. The highest point is at 726 m ü. M. and the lowest at 588 m ü. M..

name: Hilterfingen
geography: Hilterfingen is located on the right bank of Lake Thun and has grown together with the neighboring municipalities of Thun and Oberhofen. The municipality's area is almost half covered by forest and woodland, while 40.5% is settlement area and only 10.4% is used for agriculture.
appearance: The villages on the right bank of Lake Thun, including Hilterfingen and Hünibach, are often described as the Gold Coast or Riviera of Lake Thun due to their attractive location.

name: Himmelried
geography: Himmelried is located at 662 m above sea level, 15 km south of Basel. The village is situated in a scenic location on a terrace on the southern slope of the Homberg, above the valley of the Chastelbach, on the eastern edge of the Laufen basin, in the folded Jura of the Schwarzbubenland.
appearance: Null

name: Hindelbank
geography: Hindelbank lies at 519 m above sea level, 6 km west of Burgdorf and 12 km northeast of Bern. The elongated street village stretches in a slightly undulating landscape on the southern edge of the Emme floodplain, at the foot of the Molasse hills. The municipality area comprises a section of the Bernese Mittelland, shaped by the Rhone Glacier during the Ice Age. The northern boundary runs along the Urtenen.
appearance: Hindelbank includes extensive new residential areas, the hamlet of Wiler (530 m above sea level) in the valley basin between Schnarz and Haselberg with the Schloss Hindelbank women's prison, and a few isolated farms, as well as the village of Mötschwil since January 1, 2021.

name: Hinwil
geography: Hinwil is located in the Zürcher Oberland. It is situated on the western slope of the Bachtel (1115 m above sea level) and is oriented towards the Pfäffikersee with the Wildbach. The municipality includes six outer districts: Girenbad, Hadlikon, Ringwil, Unterbach, Unterholz, and Wernetshausen, as well as the hamlets of Bossikon and Erlosen.

name: Hirschthal
geography: Hirschthal is located in the middle Suhrental in Aargau, about eight kilometers south of Aarau. The village lies east of the Suhre River at the exit of a side valley called "Tal". The narrow side valley is bordered by the Egg and Gschneit hills. The Hochwacht forms the transition to the Wynental.  The municipality area is 353 hectares. The highest point is 653 meters on the Hochwacht, the lowest at 437 meters on the Suhre.
appearance: NULL

name: Hittnau
geography: Hittnau lies in the Zürcher Oberland above the Pfäffikersee, on a saddle between the Kempt and Töss valleys. The Luppmen flows through the village. The highest point is the Stoffel at 928 m above sea level, and the lowest point is at the Luppmen below the Balchenstal mill at 604 m above sea level. 47.1% of the area is used for agriculture, and 37.4% is forested.

name: Hitzkirch
geography: Hitzkirch is located in the Luzerner Seetal between Hallwilersee and Baldeggersee, about 20 km north of Lucerne. Since the municipal merger in 2009, it is the third largest municipality in the Seetal in terms of population and the largest in terms of area. The lowest point of the municipality is in Mosen (450 m above sea level), the highest on the Lindenberg (878 m above sea level).
pointsOfInterest: Höhen des Lindenbergs in Hämikon, Müswangen und Sulz

name: Hochdorf
geography: Hochdorf lies in the Luzerner Seetal. The municipality consists of the districts Hochdorf-Dorf, Baldegg, Ligschwil, Urswil and numerous groups of houses and individual farms. The village itself lies on the road Luzern-Lenzburg about one kilometer southeast of the Baldeggersee.
appearance: NULL

name: Hochfelden
geography: Hochfelden is located in the Glatt Valley in the Zurich Unterland, just west of Bülach on the Glatt River. The nature reserve in the north of the municipality marks the lowest point of Hochfelden (391 m above sea level). The highest point in the municipality is in the northwest in the heavily wooded Strassberg at 495 m above sea level.

name: Höchstetten
geography: Höchstetten lies at 480 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of Herzogenbuchsee and 10 km north of Burgdorf. The farming village extends slightly elevated on the northwest foot of the Grossholz in the valley of the Chrümelbach, east of the Emme floodplain, in the Swiss Mittelland.

name: Hochwald
geography: Hochwald is located at 620 m above sea level, 12 km south-southeast of the city of Basel. The village stretches in a hollow on the high plateau of Gempenplateaus in the Tafeljura, in the Schwarzbubenland. The area is occupied by the high plateau of the Dorneckberg.

name: Hofstetten bei Brienz
geography: Hofstetten liegt im Berner Oberland in den Alpen. Die Nachbargemeinden von Norden beginnend im Uhrzeigersinn sind Giswil, Lungern, Brienzwiler, Brienz BE und Schwanden bei Brienz. Die südliche Gemeindegrenze bildet die Aare. Ebenfalls im Süden, aber etwas höher gelegen ist der kleine Wyssensee.

name: Hofstetten-Flüh
geography: The municipality of Hofstetten-Flüh consists of the two districts Hofstetten at 462 m above sea level and Flüh at 379 m above sea level in a Solothurn exclave in the rear Leimental. In the district of Flüh begins the pass road up to the Challpass and on to Röschenz, which is already located in the canton of Basel-Land.

name: Hohenrain
geography: Hohenrain is located east, northeast, and north of Hochdorf. The municipality includes Hohenrain, the former municipality of Lieli, and the districts of Ottenhusen, Kleinwangen, Ferren, Günikon and Oberebersol. The village itself lies on a southwest-facing slope of the Lindenberg.
appearance: null

name: Hohentannen
geography: Hohentannen is located on a high plateau northwest of Bischofszell.
appearance: Despite the construction of individual family homes, Hohentannen has retained its character as a farming village to the present day.

name: Holderbank (AG)
geography: Holderbank is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau. It is situated on the Aare River, halfway between Lenzburg and Brugg. The village lies in a narrow strip of land between the Aare and the steep western slope of the Chestenberg, an offshoot of the Jura mountains. The area includes a valley marked by gravel pits and quarries.

name: Holderbank (SO)
geography: Holderbank is located in a valley between the first and second Jura mountain ranges (Roggen and Bereten) and is traversed by the Augstbach stream. The village center sits at 652 meters above sea level. The highest point is on the Beretenkopf (1104 meters above sea level). 48% of the area is forest and woodlands, 46% is agricultural, and 5% is settlement area.

name: Hölstein
geography: Hölstein is a municipality in the canton of Basel-Landschaft, located between Liestal and Waldenburg. It is part of the outer zone of the Basel catchment area. The building area covers 93 ha, the agricultural area 262 ha, and 244 ha are wooded.
appearance: null

name: Holziken
geography: Holziken is located in the canton of Aargau, between the Uerkental and Suhrental valleys. The village lies at the northern foot of the Stübisberg, a foothill of the Uerknerberg. The southern half is hilly and wooded, while the northern half is a flat, agricultural plain drained by the Uerke and Suhre rivers. The altitude ranges from 435 to 550 meters.

name: Homberg
geography: Homberg is located northeast of Thun, on the slopes on the left side of the lower Zulgtal valley. A village center has formed in the hamlet of Dreiligass (941 m above sea level). The next largest parts of the village are Enzenbühl (997 m above sea level), Huckhaus (951 m above sea level) and Fuhren (864 m above sea level). The area is heavily wooded along the streams. Of the total municipal area of 652 ha, 66.4% is used for agriculture, 30.1% is covered by forest and only 3.2% is settlement area.

name: Hombrechtikon
geography: Hombrechtikon is a municipality in the district of Meilen in the canton of Zurich, bordering the right bank of Lake Zurich. The neighboring municipalities are Grüningen, Bubikon, Rapperswil-Jona, Stäfa and Oetwil am See. In the north lies the transition from Lake Zurich to the Glatttal in the Zurich Oberland. Feldbach ZH is located on Lake Zurich.
appearance: Feldbach is located on the lake. The village sits above the lake on the Pfannenstiel. On a plateau in a hollow of the Pfannenstiel, the protected moor landscape with the Ütziker Ried and the Lützelsee is located on the municipality's territory above the village.

name: Homburg
geography: Homburg lies on the Seerücken near the Untersee and is the third largest municipality in Thurgau in terms of area. The municipality consists of the localities of Homburg, Gündelhart, Hörhausen, Salen and Reutenen.

name: Horgen
geography: Horgen is located in the southwest of the canton of Zurich and is the second largest municipality in the district. The landscape is characterized by the Zimmerberg, a lateral moraine, which the Linth glacier formed during its advance after the last ice age, and the Albis mountain range. The municipality extends from the left bank of the lake over the Sihltal to the Albisgrat and south to the Sihlsprung.

name: Höri
geography: Höri is a municipality in the Bülach district of the canton of Zürich in Switzerland. The municipality in the Unterland consists of the three villages Oberhöri, Niederhöri and Endhöri.
appearance: Coming from Oberglatt and Niederglatt, following the course of the Glatt, one first reaches Oberhöri, which, in addition to the old town center on the Glatt, has expanded along the slopes of the Höriberg. Here you will find mainly single-family houses.

name: Horn
geography: Horn is a municipality and village in the Arbon district of the Swiss canton of Thurgau. Horn is the easternmost place in the canton and is surrounded by the canton of St. Gallen as an exclave. The village is bordered by Goldach to the east, Tübach to the south, and Steinach to the west. Lake Constance forms the northern border. The municipality has three ports.

name: Horrenbach-Buchen
geography: Horrenbach-Buchen is divided by Teuffenthal. Buchen, the western part, consists of the hamlet of Buchen and some isolated farmsteads. Horrenbach, the eastern part, has no settlement center but consists of several groups of houses and isolated farmsteads. The Chäsereigraben stream is the only water body in Buchen, while Horrenbach has several streams. The boundaries extend from the Sichle in a northeasterly direction along the Sigriswiler Grat to the Fallbach.  The municipality has a large proportion of mountain area.

name: Horriwil
geography: Horriwil is located at 455 m above sea level, 7 km east-southeast of Solothurn. The village lies in a small depression on the eastern edge of the Emme river's alluvial plain, in the southern Solothurn Mittelland. The area includes a section of the moraine landscape shaped by the Rhone Glacier.

name: Horw
geography: Horw is a southern suburb of the city of Lucerne and lies on Lake Lucerne at the foot of Mount Pilatus. Horw includes the Bireggwald (a high forest) in the northeast and the Horw peninsula in the east of the municipality, as well as the (floodplain) area west of the two and areas on the Pilatus slope.
appearance: The village of Horw, with the districts of Waldegg, Althof and Rank, has grown and become urbanized in the second half of the 20th century and is crossed by several streams. Southeast of the village, on the northwest corner of the peninsula, lies the district of Winkel on Horw Bay.

name: Hospental
geography: Hospental is located in the south of Uri in the Urseren Valley between Andermatt and Realp at the confluence of the Furkareuss and Gotthardreuss rivers. The municipality consists exclusively of the street village of the same name and the former Walser settlement of Zumdorf.

name: Hundwil
geography: Hundwil is located in the hinterland of the canton of Appenzell Ausserrhoden, on the road between Herisau and Appenzell. It lies at the northern foot of the Hundwiler Höhi at 788 m above sea level. The Säntis (2502 m above sea level) is also located on the Hundwil municipal territory.

name: Hünenberg
geography: Hünenberg lies in the pre-alpine landscape between Lake Zug and the Reuss river. It borders the municipalities of Dietwil, Oberrüti, Sins, Mühlau and Merenschwand in the canton of Aargau to the west, Obfelden and Maschwanden in the canton of Zurich to the north, Cham to the east, and Risch in the canton of Zug to the south. The highest point is in the Chnodenwald at 495 m above sea level, and the lowest is at Reussspitz at 388 m above sea level.

name: Hüntwangen
geography: Hüntwangen is located in the Rafzerfeld, the area of the canton of Zurich on the right bank of the Rhine. Neighboring municipalities are Hohentengen, Glattfelden (Neuhus exclave), Eglisau, Wil and Wasterkingen. It is located between Zurich and Schaffhausen. The border between Germany and Switzerland runs to the west.

name: Iffwil
geography: Iffwil is located at 560 m above sea level, 13 km north of Bern. The village is situated in a flat basin in the eastern part of the Rapperswil Plateau, in the Swiss Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the central Bernese Mittelland. It lies between the Mannenbuch and Brättenmoos hills to the southwest and the Tannwald forest to the northeast.
appearance: The text does not explicitly describe the appearance of the town.

name: Inden
geography: Inden liegt im Dalatal auf einem Hochplateau unterhalb des Kurorts Leukerbad.
appearance: null

name: Ingenbohl
geography: Ingenbohl lies at 435 m above sea level on the shores of Lake Lucerne (Vierwaldstättersee), surrounded by Urmiberg, Fronalpstock and the Mythen mountains. It is located directly on the 47th parallel.  The Muota and Leewasser streams flow through Ingenbohl, emptying into Lake Lucerne in Brunnen.

name: Innertkirchen
geography: Innertkirchen lies in the Haslital valley in the Bernese Oberland, six kilometers southeast of Meiringen. The Aare river flows through the municipality. Innertkirchen is the starting point to the Trift Glacier and Rosenlaui Glacier. The Gental valley with the Engstlensee lake also belongs to Innertkirchen.

name: Ins
geography: Ins is located in the Grosses Moos, a fertile area with almost black soils in the Bernese Seeland.

name: Interlaken
geography: Interlaken is located in the Bernese Oberland at the Aare river between Lake Brienz and Lake Thun. The Lütschine from the south and the Lombach from the north have filled the valley between the two lakes. The river section between the lakes is almost six kilometers long.  The municipality's territory includes part of the plain south of the Aare and a strip on the northern slope up to Wannichnubel.

name: Inwil
geography: The municipality extends from the foothills of the Lindenberg, the Inwilerberg (551 m above sea level), to the northern bank of the Reuss and lies between Lucerne and Zug.
appearance: The village of Inwil and the hamlet of Oberhofen (420 m above sea level) have now grown together. The district of Unter Pfaffwil (411 m above sea level) is located 2.7 km northeast of the village. South of the village is the hamlet of Ausserschachen (415 m above sea level), and in a southeasterly direction at a distance of 1.5 km lies the former monastery of St. Kathrine.

name: Ipsach
geography: Ipsach is a village located on the right bank of Lake Biel.
