appearance: Ipsach developed into a suburb of the city of Biel during the 1950s and 60s due to active construction.

name: Iseltwald
geography: Iseltwald is a municipality situated on a delta on the southern shore of Lake Brienz in the Bernese Oberland. For a long time, it was only accessible by water. Since the construction of the A8 motorway, it has its own highway exit. The highest point is the 2687-meter-high Faulhorn.

name: Isérables
geography: Isérables covers an area of 1532 hectares between the Rhône plain (460 m above sea level) and the Pointe des Champs Ferret, the highest point of the municipality at 2742 m above sea level. The village itself is situated on a steep slope at around 1100 m above sea level. The municipality also includes the hamlet of Les Crêteaux, the Maiensäss Les Prarions, the Alp Balavaux and the Rosey Valley with the Alp of the same name.
appearance: Due to its topographical location on a steep slope, the inhabitants lived in isolation for a long time and were de facto independent. Only a footpath provided the connection to the valley. The inhabitants therefore created extensive arable terraces in the steep terrain for growing cereals and potatoes and erected small storage buildings, so-called raccards. This still shapes the village's appearance today.

name: Islisberg
geography: Islisberg is located on a hill that is a continuation of the Holzbirrliberg. The village lies at the top of this hill. The terrain slopes steeply to the south, west, and northwest. To the northeast, there is a two-kilometer-long plateau extending into the canton of Zurich. The municipality is surrounded by Zurich on three sides.

name: Itingen
geography: The municipality of Itingen is located on the south bank of the Ergolz, halfway between Liestal and Sissach.
appearance: The T-shaped farming village shows residential and commercial buildings from the 16th to 19th centuries, which are lined up eaves to eaves. The medieval village center was included in the inventory of worthy townscapes of Switzerland in 1986.

name: Ittigen
geography: Ittigen is located northeast of Bern, in the lower Worble valley. Neighboring municipalities are Münchenbuchsee, Moosseedorf, Bolligen, Ostermundigen, and Zollikofen. The Worble river flows through the municipality, merging into the Aare river in Worblaufen. The A1 highway crosses the municipality in the north and west.

name: Jaberg
geography: Jaberg is located at 540 m above sea level, 8 km northwest of the city of Thun. The village stretches in the floodplain west of the Aare and on the slope of the southern foothills of the Belpberg, opposite Kiesen.  The municipality encompasses a section of the Aare valley between Bern and Thun. The eastern border runs along the canalized Aare. The municipality extends westward over a narrow floodplain and the slope of Jaberg to the adjacent ridge.
appearance: Jaberg consists of the settlement core Vorder Jaberg (540 m above sea level at the Aare crossing), which has been expanded by a residential area, and the hamlet Hinter Jaberg (560 m above sea level) on the eastern slope of the Gestelen, as well as some individual farms.

name: Jaun
geography: Jaun is located 17 km east of Bulle in the upper Jaun valley, west of the Jaun Pass, at an altitude of 1015 m. It is the highest village in the canton of Fribourg. The area encompasses a section of the Fribourg Alps on both sides of the Jaun valley. The Jaunbach flows through the area. The terrain includes the valleys of Sattelbach and Klein Montbach, and the eastern flank of Ruisseau du Gros Mont. The southern boundary runs over the peaks of Wandfluh and Gastlosen.

name: Jegenstorf
geography: Jegenstorf lies at 527 m above sea level, 12 km north-northeast of Bern. The village is situated in a wide depression on the eastern edge of the Rapperswil Plateau, on both sides of the Dorfbach stream, shortly before its confluence with the Urtenen, in the Swiss Mittelland. The area encompasses a gently undulating section of the central Bernese Mittelland.
appearance: Jegenstorf includes extensive new residential areas, the villages of Ballmoos, Münchringen and Scheunen, and some isolated farmsteads.

name: Jenaz
geography: Jenaz is located in the valley floor on the Landquart-Davos railway line. Alt-Jenaz, the former center, lies 30 meters above on an ice-age alluvial terrace. The hamlet of Rüti on the right side of the Landquart and the district of Pragg-Jenaz on the Furnerbach also belong to the municipality. Half of the area is agricultural, and over 10 km² are covered by forest and woodland.  The area includes 263 ha of unproductive area and 77 ha of settlement area.
appearance: Alt-Jenaz has a village appearance of national importance.

name: Jonen
geography: Jonen is located in the Reuss Valley on the border with the Canton of Zurich. The village center lies on the edge of the fertile plain of the Reuss River. Auen forests and smaller swamps exist along the riverbank. The Jonental extends from east to west. The eastern part of the Jonenbach runs through a narrow, up to 30-meter-deep Tobel between the Birriwald and the Goomwald. The highest point is at 559 m ü. M. and the lowest at 380 m ü. M. on the Reuss.

name: Jonschwil
geography: Jonschwil is located in the canton of St. Gallen and belongs to the Wil constituency. It consists of the villages of Jonschwil and Schwarzenbach, the hamlet of Bettenau and part of Oberrindal. Jonschwil lies on the Thur river near Wil SG and Oberuzwil. The highest point is the Wildberg, at around 800 m above sea level.

name: Jorat-Menthue
geography: Jorat-Menthue lies in the southeast of the Gros-de-Vaud on the Molasse hills of the Jorat, about 7 km southeast of Moudon. The municipality consists of several villages and individual farms. Neighbouring municipalities are Montanaire, Moudon, Hermenches, Corcelles-le-Jorat, Froideville, Poliez-Pittet and Montilliez.
pointsOfInterest: Sendeturm des Westschweizer Landessenders Radio Sottens

name: Jouxtens-Mézery
geography: Jouxtens-Mézery is located at 525 m above sea level, 4.5 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality extends on the southwest slope of the Jorat, in the Vaud Central Plateau, in a panoramic location above Renens and about 150 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality covers a section on the southwest slope of the Jorat plateau. The northwestern boundary is formed by the wooded valley of a side stream of the Mèbre.
appearance: Jouxtens-Mézery consists of the two villages Jouxtens (525 m above sea level) and Mézery (555 m above sea level) on the slope above Renens. The settlement area of Jouxtens-Mézery has now almost completely merged with those of Renens, Prilly and Romanel-sur-Lausanne.

name: Juriens
geography: Juriens is located at 797 m above sea level, 7 km southwest of Orbe. The village extends on a promontory on the Jura slope, above the Nozon valley. The municipality covers an area including the Jura slopes south of the Nozon valley, extending westwards over the steep slopes (La Côte and Drochard) up to Chalet Dernier at 1290 m above sea level, the highest point of Juriens.

name: Jussy
geography: Jussy is a political municipality in the Canton of Geneva in Switzerland. The municipality also includes the hamlet of La Monniaz, located directly on the border with France (border stones 132 and 135 form the highest points of the Canton of Geneva at 517.7 m).

name: Kaiseraugst
geography: Kaiseraugst is located in the west of the Fricktal region and in the extreme northwest of the canton, directly on the banks of the Rhine. The municipality is one of the fastest growing residential and industrial locations in the Basel metropolitan region. The municipality lies on the southern edge of the Upper Rhine Plain. The Violenbach stream cuts through the gravel plain and flows into the Ergolz, which in turn flows into the Rhine.  In the southeast there are wooded foothills of the Tafeljura.
appearance: The old center is located directly on the bank of the Rhine, another historical part of the village is at the Ergolz bridge. The largest part of the population lives in the Liebrüti settlement, which was built in the 1970s between the railway line and the Violenbach. To the east of this are extensive industrial plants.

name: Kaisten
geography: Kaisten is located on the High Rhine on the border with Germany, in the northeast of the Fricktal region. The village of Kaisten lies at the confluence of three streams, just two kilometers south of the Rhine. The village center is located in a gorge between the Chinzhalde and the Heuberg, two hills of the Table Jura. South of the gorge extends a valley to the village of Ittenthal. The Schinberg borders the valley on the east.
appearance: No explicit description of the town's visual appearance is available in the provided article content.

name: Kallern
geography: Kallern is located on the eastern slope of the Niesenberg, an offshoot of the Lindenberg chain, at the edge of the middle Bünz valley. The terrain rises from the Bünz valley to undulating terrain and then rises again in the south. The municipality is a scattered settlement consisting of seven hamlets.

name: Kallnach
geography: Kallnach is located at the foot of a moraine of the Rhone Glacier on the edge of the Grossen Mooses and lies on the road from Lyss via Aarberg to Kerzers. The village has a railway station on the Broyelinie (Lyss–Aarberg–Kerzers line).
appearance: Kallnach is considered the longest street village in Switzerland.

name: Kaltbrunn
geography: Kaltbrunn is located east of Uznach, north of Benken, west of Schänis and south of Gommiswald. The village and the hamlets of Fischhausen, Wilen and Steinenbrücke are located on debris cones on the edge of the Linth plain. Gublen, Chirnen and Altwies are located on the sparsely populated slopes.

name: Kandersteg
geography: Kandersteg is located at the end of the Kandertal valley at 1174 m above sea level. The municipality has approximately 1,300 inhabitants and covers an area of 134.58 km². Kandersteg is the fifth largest municipality in the canton of Bern in terms of area. However, due to its alpine location, only about 30% of the area is usable. Highest point: Balmhorn, 3,698 m, lowest point: Bühl, 1,150 m.

name: Kappel (SO)
geography: Kappel SO is located in the district of Olten in the canton of Solothurn. The village is part of the Untergäu, nestled between the Jura foothills and the Born at 425 m above sea level. Of the 509 hectares of municipal area, 249 ha are forest, 176 ha agricultural land and 82 ha settlement area.

name: Kappelen
geography: Kappelen is a municipality in the Seeland administrative district in the canton of Bern in Switzerland. The neighboring municipalities are Aarberg, Bargen, Bühl, Hermrigen, Jens, Lyss, Merzligen, Walperswil and Worben.

name: Kaufdorf
geography: Kaufdorf is a municipality in the Bern-Mittelland administrative district of the canton of Bern, located in the Gürbetal valley, exactly in the middle between Bern and Thun in Switzerland.

name: Kehrsatz
geography: Kehrsatz is situated at 570 m above sea level, 4.5 km southeast of Bern. It lies on a flat area on the lower eastern slope of the Gurten mountain and the northern edge of the Längenberg, above the Belpmoos plain which is part of the Aare valley. The area encompasses a section of the Aare valley between Bern and Thun. The northern border runs along the Aare river, where the Gürbe river flows into it.

name: Kemmental
geography: Kemmental is located between the Ottenberg and the Seerücken. With an area of 25 km², Kemmental is one of the largest municipalities in the canton of Thurgau. The Chemebach flows through the municipality from east to west. The landscape is characterized by agriculture (67%) and forest areas (24%). Only 9% is populated.

name: Kernenried
geography: Kernenried lies at 506 m above sea level, 6 km west of Burgdorf and 15 km north-northeast of the cantonal capital Bern. The farming village stretches on the southern edge of the Emme alluvial plain, in the Urtenen lowlands, east of the hills of the Rapperswiler Plateau, in the Swiss Mittelland.
appearance: Kernenried consists of the districts of Oberdorf (506 m above sea level) and Unterdorf (also called Chappeli; 502 m above sea level) and a few individual farms.

name: Kerns
geography: Kerns is located near Sarnen at 565 m above sea level. The highest mountain is the Rotsandnollen (2700 m). With an area of 9,254 ha, Kerns is the largest of the seven municipalities in the canton of Obwalden. The Melchsee, Tannensee, and Blausee lakes are located within the municipality, as well as the very small Gerzensee and Blindseeli lakes. The western boundary of the municipality is formed by the course of the Grosse Melchaa.

name: Kerzers
geography: Kerzers is a municipality in the Seebezirk (Lake District) of the Canton of Fribourg, located on the eastern edge of the Grosses Moos (Great Marsh), the largest vegetable growing area in Switzerland.

name: Kesswil
geography: Kesswil is located in the canton of Thurgau, between Romanshorn and Kreuzlingen, on Lake Constance. It is part of the Arbon district.
appearance: With the single-family houses and residential buildings built after 1980, Kesswil has developed into a rural residential community. The image shows the 'Gemeindehaus und zentraler Kreisel' (community center and central roundabout).

name: Kienberg
geography: Kienberg lies at 549 m above sea level, 11 km north-northeast of Olten. The farming village extends on the north side of the Solothurn Jura Mountains in the valley of the Bruggbach, at the northern foot of the Salhöhe. The area encompasses a section of the eastern Jura. The Bruggbach drains the area. In the south, the border runs along the Jura main ridge, the watershed between the Aare and Sissle catchment areas.

name: Kiesen
geography: Kiesen is located at 547 m above sea level, 8 km north-northwest of the city of Thun. The village stretches on both sides of the Chise on the floodplain on the eastern edge of the wide Aare valley. The area includes a section of the Aare depression between Bern and Thun. The western and southwestern boundary runs along the Aare.

name: Kilchberg (BL)
geography: Kilchberg is located in the so-called Eital at an altitude of 571 m above sea level on a hill that rises on the western bank of the Eibach, a tributary of the Ergolz. Kilchberg forms an administrative association with the two neighboring municipalities of Rünenberg and Zeglingen.

name: Kilchberg (ZH)
geography: Kilchberg is located on the western shore of Lake Zurich. 26.4% of the municipality's area is agricultural, 2% is forest, 58% is settlement area and 13% is for transport. The village center with the church is located slightly above Lake Zurich at about 500 meters above sea level.

name: Killwangen
geography: Killwangen is located in the Limmattal valley between Baden and Zürich. It lies between the left bank of the Limmat river and the wooded northeast slope of the Heitersberg. The old village center is at the foot of the Heitersberg, while the new quarters are in the narrow plain between the village center and the train station. The highest point is 702 meters, and the lowest is 385 meters on the Limmat.
appearance: Brief description of how the town looks (architecture, urban/rural character, notable buildings, atmosphere) - max 100 words

name: Kirchberg (BE)
geography: Kirchberg lies on the right side of the Emme river, where it is crossed by important traffic routes. Kirchberg also includes the hamlet of Bütikofen. The Ösch flows through the eastern part of the municipal area. Of the approximately 905 hectares of municipal area, 135 ha are settlement area, 458 ha are agricultural land and approximately 301 ha are forest.

name: Kirchberg (SG)
geography: Kirchberg is located in the northwest of the Toggenburg region and borders the canton of Thurgau to the west and the Thur river to the east. The municipality consists of the village of Kirchberg situated on a high plateau, the village of Gähwil to the south, the linear village of Bazenheid on a terrace above the Thur, and the villages of Müselbach and Dietschwil, as well as several hamlets.
pointsOfInterest: Pfarr- und Wallfahrtskirche St. Peter und Paul

name: Kirchdorf (BE)
geography:
Kirchdorf is located at 611 m above sea level, 10 km northwest of the city of Thun. The village stretches in an elevated position on the southern foothills of the Belpberg between the valley plains of the Gürbe in the west and the Aare in the east, south of Lake Gerzensee.

The area of the 6.11 km² municipal area covers a section of the Aare basin between Bern and Thun. The main part of the area is taken up by the undulating plateau of the southern Belpberg.

name: Kirchleerau
geography: Kirchleerau is located on the eastern edge of the Suhrental valley. It is a scattered settlement without a distinct center, loosely connected.  It lies in a side valley, separated from the Suhrental by an average of 20-meter-high lateral moraine formed during the Würm Ice Age. The two-kilometer-long valley is bordered by steep hills: Rossrücken, Nack, and Burg. The Rötler plateau extends along the eastern border.
appearance: The village is a scattered settlement, with no real town center. It consists of loosely connected parts. The settlement is growing together with Moosleerau.

name: Kirchlindach
geography: Kirchlindach is located north of the Aare river and the city of Bern. Neighboring municipalities include Schüpfen, Münchenbuchsee, Zollikofen, Bremgarten bei Bern, Bern, Wohlen bei Bern, and Meikirch. It consists of the villages and hamlets of Heimenhaus, Herrenschwanden, Jetzikofen, Kirchlindach, Oberlindach, and Niederlindach. A panorama from the Bernese to the Freiburg Alps opens from the forest edge above the village.

name: Kleinandelfingen
geography: The municipality of Kleinandelfingen is located in the Zurich Weinland on the Thur river, between Winterthur and Schaffhausen. It consists of the three villages Kleinandelfingen, Alten and Oerlingen. 49.7% of the municipal area is used for agriculture, 33.1% is forested, 8.4% is settlement area, 5.2% is traffic area, 2.5% is water and 1.2% is unproductive area (as of 2018).
appearance: Kleinandelfingen is a distinct wine-growing community.

name: Kleinbösingen
geography: Kleinbösingen lies at 510 m above sea level, 3 km west-southwest of Laupen. The village is located slightly elevated on the western edge of the Saane valley. The municipality covers an area of 3.0 km² and includes a section of the Molasse hills between Lake Murten and the Saane valley. The southeastern border runs along the Saane river. The highest point is reached at Müllerholz with 600 m above sea level.

name: Kleinlützel
geography: Kleinlützel is a municipality in the Thierstein district of the canton of Solothurn. It is an exclave separated from the rest of the Solothurn canton by the Laufental in Basel-Landschaft, located on the banks of the Lützel river on the border with France. A tripoint with the cantons of Basel-Landschaft and Jura is located at the Surtel.

name: Klingnau
geography: Klingnau is located in the lower Aare valley in the Swiss canton of Aargau, about four kilometers south of the German border. The town area lies on the east side of the Klingnauer Stausee in the Aare valley plain and on the Acheberg. The southwest slope of the hill is steep, transitioning into a plateau to the northeast. The Blitzberg protrudes as a distinctive spur into the valley.
appearance: The historical town center of Klingnau is located on a terrain terrace on the right bank of the Aare, with houses on the north and south sides of the town church. Younger districts are grouped around the old town in the river plain and on the Acheberg. The settlement is connected to the neighboring municipality of Döttingen.

name: Klosters
geography: Klosters is located in the Prättigau/Davos region. The municipality's territory largely covers the upper Landquart drainage basin, with the border following the watershed against Montafon, Unterengadin, Landwassertal (Davos), and Schanfigg. The landscape is characterized by a wide valley basin where the Landquart, Stützbach, and Schlappinbach rivers converge. The Schlappintal valley extends westward, bounded by the Silvretta range to the north, including the Rotbüelspitz (2852 m), and borders Austria.
appearance: The center of the resort and winter sports area consists of the districts of Platz and Dorf, which have grown together due to construction activity in the 20th century. Selfranga adjoins to the south, while the hamlets Aeuja and Monbiel are located east of Klosters Platz. Below Klosters Dorf, the valley narrows. Serneus is located to the left of the Landquart, and Mezzaselva lies on the other side of the river.

name: Kloten
geography: Kloten is located approximately 10 km northeast of the center of Zurich in the Glatt Valley plain.  The municipality extends from the wooded Kuppe im Hard and Balsberg in the south over the heights of the hamlets Gerlisberg and Bänikon to beyond the narrow Eigental. The Zurich Airport, lies in the plain on the Glatt in the west of the municipal area and in the adjoining Rümlanger Ried.

name: Knonau
geography: Knonau is located in the southwest of the canton of Zurich. With 6.48 km², it is the fourth smallest municipality in the Affoltern district in terms of area. The largest proportion of the municipality is agricultural land, which accounts for 64.8 percent. A further 17.3 percent is forest, 10.0 percent is settlement area, 7.4 percent is traffic area, 1.1 percent is water and 1.7 percent is unproductive area. The municipality is drained by the Haselbach towards the Lorze.
appearance: The village of Knonau lies at 431 m above sea level and is 23 kilometers as the crow flies from Zurich and 7 kilometers as the crow flies from Zug. The municipality also includes the hamlets of Vorderuttenberg, Hinteruttenberg and Baaregg.

name: Knutwil
geography: Knutwil is located at the junction of the Hürn and Suhrental valleys, 5 km northwest of Sursee. The hamlet of Eriswil lies to the northwest, and Bad Knutwil, a former spa and mineral water source, is north of the main settlement. The district of St. Erhard is located about 2 km south of Knutwil village.

name: Koblenz
geography: Koblenz is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau. It lies at the confluence of the Aare and High Rhine rivers, directly on the border with Germany. The Rhine flows west and then southwest. The Aare's water volume is greater than the Rhine's. The area includes the Giriz nature reserve, an alluvial protection zone and amphibian spawning area.
appearance: The village center stretches along a narrow strip of shoreline between the Rhine and the steep northwestern flank of the Frittel hill. Newer residential areas are located on the adjoining plateau.

name: Kölliken
geography: Kölliken is located in the lower Uerkental and borders the canton of Solothurn. The village sits on the western edge of the Hard plain. The Uerke river flows along the eastern edge of the settlement, while the Köllikerbach stream runs through the village center. To the west, the wooded hills of Köllikertann and Pfaffentann rise gently. In the south, the Ghürst separates the valleys of the Uerke and the Köllikerbach.

name: Köniz
geography: Köniz lies southwest of the city of Bern. The municipality has an area of 51.73 km². The municipality is considered the largest agglomeration municipality in Switzerland. Despite the high number of inhabitants, the municipality still has a partly village character, as the inhabitants are distributed over many individual villages.
appearance: Despite the high number of inhabitants, the municipality still has a partly village character, as the inhabitants are distributed over many individual villages.

name: Konolfingen
geography: Konolfingen lies approximately in the middle between Bern, Thun, Langnau, and Burgdorf. Geographically located in the Kiesental, Konolfingen, which is situated at about 660 meters above sea level, is often referred to as the gateway to the Emmental. The municipality includes the hamlets and localities of Ballenbühl, Gysenstein, Herolfingen, Hötschigen, Hürnberg, Stalden, and Ursellen.

name: Koppigen
geography: Koppigen lies in the northeast of the canton Bern, on the border to the canton Solothurn. The village lies at the foothills of the hilly landscape east of the Emme river and is traversed by the Oesch stream.

name: Krattigen
geography: The municipality lies on a hill above Lake Thun, at 750 m above sea level on a gypsum moraine. In the southeast, the municipality rises to the top of the Greberegg up to a height of 1595 meters. Neighboring municipalities are Leissigen, Aeschi bei Spiez and Spiez, and Sigriswil and Beatenberg on the other side of Lake Thun.

name: Krauchthal
geography: Krauchthal is located in the pre-Alpine region in the valley of the Krauchtalbach stream, opening the Emmental from the northern side. It is situated almost exactly between Bern and Burgdorf. Krauchthal and Hub lie in a narrow valley stretching east-west, while Dieterswald is on a gently sloping plateau. Hettiswil lies to the north with an open view over the Bernese Mittelland.
appearance: The article does not provide a detailed description of the town's appearance, but it does mention the Kreuzfluh, a nearly one-hundred-meter high vertical rock pinnacle with a viewing pavilion, located on the eastern edge of the village.

name: Kreuzlingen
geography: Kreuzlingen lies in the north of the Thurgau canton on the shore of Lake Constance, southeast of the German city of Konstanz. It has traces of small-town structure on formerly vine-covered slopes, surrounded by forests on the hilltops in the south, rural areas, and Lake Constance to the east. The border with Germany runs through densely built-up areas to the north. The harbor area is 397 m above sea level.

name: Kriechenwil
geography: Kriechenwil lies in the Swiss Mittelland on the Saane. The municipality consists of the villages of Kriechenwil, Riesenau and Schönenbüel. The neighboring municipalities from the north clockwise are Ferenbalm, the Friborg enclave Wallenbuch (municipality of Gurmels), Laupen, Bösingen, Kleinbösingen and Gurmels.

name: Kriegstetten
geography: Kriegstetten liegt auf 453 m ü. M., 6 km südöstlich von Solothurn in der Ebene östlich der Emme im südlichen Solothurner Mittelland. Das Gemeindegebiet umfasst einen Abschnitt der grundwasserreichen Schotterebene. Der Gemeindeboden ist völlig eben und erstreckt sich im Osten bis an die Ösch, im Nordwesten in das Eichholz. Die höchste Erhebung befindet sich mit 456 m ü. M. in der Ebene am südlichen Rand des Gebietes.
appearance: Zu Kriegstetten gehören ausgedehnte neue Wohnquartiere. Das Siedlungsgebiet von Kriegstetten ist heute lückenlos mit denjenigen von Oekingen und Halten zusammengewachsen.

name: Kriens
geography: Kriens is located at the foot of Mount Pilatus. The town consists of the center with various districts, the Obernau district to the west, the Hergiswald hamlet, and numerous individual farms on the mountain slope to Pilatus. A new district has been developing around the Mattenhof train station since around 2018.
appearance: The eastern part of Kriens lies in a valley floor. From Kupferhammer, the terrain rises gently westward to Obernau.  Since 2018, near the Mattenhof train station, projects such as Schweighof, Mattenhof 1 and 2 and Nidfeld are being marketed under the collective term "Luzern Süd."

name: Küblis
geography: The municipality is located in the middle Prättigau near the mouth of the Schanielabach into the Landquart. Besides the street village Küblis in the valley, it includes the hamlets Pläviggin, Prada and Tälfsch. The largest part of the municipal area lies in the sector between Landquart and Schanielabach.  The border runs for about 4 kilometers along the creek, then through the Horntobel to the Jägglisch Horn (2290 m above sea level), an offshoot of the Madrisagruppe, to lead up.

name: Künten
geography: Künten is located on the eastern side of the Reuss valley on a saddle between the western slope of the Heitersberg and the Talhau, a wooded moraine hill. The village of Sulz is located on an old watercourse in the Reuss plain. At the western boundary, the Reuss has created a gorge about 25 meters deep. The highest point is 530 meters, the lowest 354 meters.

name: Küsnacht (ZH)
geography: Küsnacht is a municipality in the Swiss Canton of Zürich, located on the eastern shore of Lake Zurich, known as the Gold Coast. It is situated in the Meilen district. Küsnacht includes the village center and the lakeside parts of Goldbach (north) and Heslibach (south).  The higher altitude Quartier Itschnach borders the municipality of Zumikon. The hamlets Küsnachter Berg, Schmalzgrueb, Limberg, Wiserholz, Hohrüti, Wangen, and Chaltenstein are situated on the upper reaches of the Küsnacht stream.

name: Küssnacht (SZ)
geography: Küssnacht is a municipality in the canton of Schwyz, located in Central Switzerland. It lies predominantly on the Küssnachtersee, the northern arm of Lake Lucerne, as well as on the southwest shore of Lake Zug. The Rigi, a popular mountain, is located on the southeastern border. Rigi Kulm is the highest point at 1797 m above sea level, while the Zugersee is the lowest at 413 m above sea level.

name: Küttigen
geography: Küttigen is located north of Aarau in a side valley of the Aare. The northern boundary extends along the main ridge of the Faltenjura, between the Wasserflue and the Küttiger Homberg. The Aabach, which rises below the Benkerjoch pass, drains the municipality. Another pass into the Fricktal is the Staffelegg.
appearance: The municipality consists of four districts. The main settlement, Küttigen, lies in the middle Aabach valley. The Rombach settlement, which merges seamlessly into the buildings of Aarau, connects to the southwest. Horen and Kirchberg are located a little offset in the Horenbach valley. All districts have loosely grown together.

name: L’Abbaye
geography: L’Abbaye is located at 1014 m above sea level, 29 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains and 28 km northwest of Lausanne. The village is situated in the Vallée de Joux on the alluvial fan of the Lionne on the eastern shore of Lac de Joux, in the Vaud Jura.
appearance: The provided HTML does not contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: L’Abergement
geography: L’Abergement is located at 655 m above sea level, 12 km west-southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on the Jura foothills plateau between the Orbe plain and the first Jura chain. The municipality area stretches from the Jura foothills plateau westwards over the steep slope to the ridge of the Suchet, where the highest point of L’Abergement is reached at 1460 m above sea level.

name: L’Isle
geography: L’Isle is situated at 660 m above sea level, 14 km northwest of Morges. The village extends near the sources of the Venoge and the Chergeaule stream, at the southern foot of the Jura and on the Jura foothills plateau. The municipality stretches from the valley of the Veyron to the sources of the Venoge near L’Isle. The highest point is La Biole at 1428 m above sea level.

name: La Baroche
geography: La Baroche is located in the Porrentruy district of the Canton of Jura in Switzerland. Neighboring municipalities are Pleigne, Bourrignon, Boécourt, Clos du Doubs, Cornol, Alle and Vendlincourt in the canton of Jura and Levoncourt, Oberlarg and Lucelle in neighboring France.

name: La Brévine
geography: La Brévine is located at 1043 m above sea level, 24 kilometers west of Neuchâtel. The farming village extends across the level area of the Vallée de la Brévine in the Neuchâtel Jura, on both sides of the Le Bied stream, near the border with France. The municipality includes the central and western part of the Vallée de la Brévine syncline with the Lac des Taillères.

name: La Brillaz
geography: La Brillaz is located about 12 km west-southwest of Fribourg. The municipality extends on the Molasse plateau between the Broye plain in the northwest and the Glâne valley in the south, in the Fribourg Midlands. The central part is taken up by the La Brillaz ridge, which at 772 m above sea level is the highest point of the municipality.

name: La Chaux (Cossonay)
geography: La Chaux (Cossonay) is situated at 557 m above sea level, 12 km north of Morges, in the valley of the Veyron, in the western Gros de Vaud. The municipality covers a section of the undulating Waadtland plateau, traversed by the valley of the Veyron. It extends to the edge of the Bois du Sépey forest and the Jurafussplateau.

name: La Chaux-de-Fonds
geography: La Chaux-de-Fonds is located at around 1000 m above sea level in the Neuenburg Jura, near the border with French Franche-Comté. It lies in a broad high valley in the Neuenburg Jura, between the heights of Mont Sagne and Pouillerel. The main settlement area is the high valley of La Chaux-de-Fonds, a syncline in the folded Jura, which is oriented in a southwest-northeast direction. The area includes the Combe du Valanvron, a valley cut deep into the highlands.
appearance: La Chaux-de-Fonds has retained a rural character, earning it the name "Ville à la campagne" (city in the countryside). La Chaux-de-Fonds was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2009 along with Le Locle because of the perfect symbiosis between urbanism and industry and its numerous Art Nouveau buildings.

name: La Chaux-du-Milieu
geography: La Chaux-du-Milieu lies at 1081 m above sea level, 6 km southwest of Le Locle. The farming village stretches in the northeast of the high valley Vallée de la Brévine in the Neuchâtel Jura, at the northern foot of the anticline of Grand Som Martel. The area includes the eastern section of the Vallée de la Brévine, with moor areas and the Grand Som Martel reaching 1300 m above sea level.

name: La Côte-aux-Fées
geography: La Côte-aux-Fées lies at 1041 m, 38 km west-southwest of Neuchâtel. The farming village extends on a south-facing slope above the Combe des Mulets valley, on the heights of the southwestern Neuchâtel Jura. The municipality includes the Combe des Mulets valley and extends north to Mont des Verrières (up to 1180 m). To the east, it extends over the Vallon de Noirvaux to the Chasseron anticline, reaching 1430 m at Roches Blanches.

name: La Ferrière
geography: La Ferrière lies at 1005 m above sea level, seven kilometers east-northeast of La Chaux-de-Fonds. The village stretches on a north-facing slope in the extreme southwest of the Jura plateau of the Franches-Montagnes, east of the Combe de Valanvron valley. The area includes part of the slightly undulating plateau of the Jura, on which moorish, mostly surface-drainage depressions alternate with limestone peaks. To the south, the area extends to the Jura chain of the Montagne du Droit.

name: La Grande-Béroche
geography: La Grande Béroche is a municipality in the canton of Neuchâtel in Switzerland. It extends over an area of 4221 hectares.

name: La Neuveville
geography: La Neuveville liegt auf 434 m ü. M., 14 km südwestlich von Biel/Bienne, etwa auf halbem Weg zwischen Biel und Neuenburg, am Nordwestufer des Bielersees. Die Siedlung bedeckt den schmalen Landstreifen am See unterhalb des Berghangs am Jurasüdfuss. Zu La Neuveville gehören der Weiler Schafis sowie mehrere Einzelhöfe. Darüber liegt die Hochfläche der Montagne de Diesse.

name: La Praz
geography: La Praz is located at 873 m above sea level, 10 km southwest of Orbe. The village extends on the southern slope of the Jura, high above the plains of the Vaudois Midlands. The municipality's area covers a section of the Vaud Jura slope, extending from the edge of the Prins Bois westward over the clearing of La Praz to the Jura chain.

name: La Punt Chamues-ch
geography: La Punt Chamues-ch is located in the Upper Engadine region. It consists of two settlements: La Punt by the Inn river, and Chamues-ch in the plain at the exit of the Chamuera valley. La Punt sits at the foot of the Albula Pass, where the Engadine valley road and the Inn meet. The Ova Chamuera flows into the Inn near La Punt Chamues-ch.
appearance: From the 17th century onwards, the Albertini family built manor houses in La Punt. Numerous apartments and holiday homes have been built north of Chamues-ch and in La Punt / Arvins. The two parts of the village have practically grown together.

name: La Rippe
geography: La Rippe is located at 528 m above sea level, 7 km west of Nyon. The village stretches at the foot of the Jura, at the foot of La Dôle, on a slope above the valley of the Boiron de Nyon. The municipality extends from the foot of the Jura to the steep slope of the Jura up to the anticline of La Dôle. The summit of La Dôle forms the highest point of La Rippe at 1677 m.

name: La Roche
geography: La Roche is located at 746 m above sea level, 11 km northeast of Bulle. The village is situated in the valley of the Serbache stream, at the western foot of the Berra, in the Freiburg Alpine foothills. The municipality covers a section of the pre-Alpine landscape at the foot of the Berra. The western part is occupied by the Serbache valley.

name: La Sagne
geography: La Sagne is located at 1039 m above sea level, 6 km south-southwest of La Chaux-de-Fonds. The village stretches in the northeast of the Vallée des Ponts in the Neuenburg Jura, west of the heights of Tête de Ran and Mont Racine. The municipality encompasses the northeastern section of the Vallée des Ponts, drained by the Grand Bied.
appearance: La Sagne consists of the districts Les Coeudres, Le Crêt, Miéville, La Sagne-Église and La Corbatière, all located on the western side of the high valley along the road from Les Ponts-de-Martel to La Chaux-de-Fonds. The central location is Le Crêt. On the eastern side of the Vallée des Ponts below the Côtes de Marmoud is the hamlet of Marmoud. Numerous individual farms are scattered on the Jura heights.

name: La Sarraz
geography: La Sarraz is located at 490 m above sea level, 17 km north of Morges. The historic town rises on a promontory west of Mormont, on the northern valley edge of the Venoge, on the continental divide between the Rhone and Rhine catchments, in the Vaud Central Plateau.

name: La Sonnaz
geography: La Sonnaz is located about 4.5 km northwest of Fribourg. The municipality stretches with various villages on the slopes and in the wide valley of the lower Sonnaz, in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Mittelland. The main part of the area is taken up by the wide valley, which is traversed by the Sonnaz from southwest to northeast.

name: La Tour-de-Peilz
geography: La Tour-de-Peilz is situated at 385 m above sea level, 1.5 km southeast of Vevey, on the northeastern shore of Lake Geneva, also known as the Riviera vaudoise, and on the adjacent slopes at the foot of Les Pléiades. The municipality includes a section on the northeastern shore of Lake Geneva and extends from the lake shore over a relatively flat strip to the gently sloping hills below Blonay.

name: La Verrerie
geography: La Verrerie is located about 11 km west-southwest of Bulle. The municipality extends on the undulating plateau in the source area of the Mionna, in the extreme southwest of the Freiburg Mittelland, near the edge of the Alps. The municipal area covers a section of the Molasse plateau north of the upper reaches of the Broye, in the Alpine foothills. The highest point is reached at Le Crêt (932 m above sea level).

name: Laax
geography: The municipality of Laax is located in the Surselva region. Its territory extends from the Laaxer Tobel up to the watershed of the Graubünden and Glarus mountains and the Vorab Glacier. Within the municipality are the Lag digl Oberst and the Laaxersee lakes. Above Laax lies the Uaul Taviarna, known for its capercaillie population. East of the village is a deep ravine carved by the Ual da Mulin stream through the debris of the Flims rockslide.

name: Lachen
geography: Lachen is located on the upper part of Lake Zurich, called the Obersee. The highest point is at 420 m above sea level, the lowest at 406 m above sea level (lake level). The municipality covers an area of 5.2 km², of which 54.7% is Lake Zurich.
appearance: Lachen is known for the view of one of the most beautiful sunsets on the whole lake due to its south-eastern location on the shore of Lake Zurich.

name: Laconnex
geography: Laconnex is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. It is located south of the Rhone.

name: Lajoux (JU)
geography: Lajoux is located at 960 m above sea level, 11 km east-northeast of Saignelégier. The village extends in a hollow on the Jura plateau of the eastern Freiberge. The municipality area includes a section of the slightly undulating plateau of the Jura, where moorish, mostly surface drainage-less depressions alternate with limestone peaks.

name: Lalden
geography: Lalden lies in the Upper Valais between the north bank of the Rotten (Rhône) and the Lötschberg south ramp. The municipality borders Eggerberg to the north, Naters to the northeast, Brig-Glis to the east, Visp to the south and Baltschieder to the west.
appearance: The old village center (with Owlighaus from 1520) has new buildings in front of it on the plain.

name: Lamone
geography: Lamone is located at the foot of San Zeno hill (561 m above sea level) and on the left bank of the Vedeggio river. It also includes the hamlet of Ostarietta.
appearance: NULL

name: Lampenberg
geography: Lampenberg is located at 522 m above sea level on a plateau between the Frenken valleys. It borders Niederdorf to the south, Hölstein to the east, and Bubendorf to the west. There is only a border point with Ramlinsburg at the northernmost point of the municipality.
appearance: The text describes Lampenberg as a "Bauerndorf" (farming village) but provides no additional details about the appearance.

name: Lancy
geography: Lancy is located south of the Rhone and consists of the two districts Grand-Lancy and Petit-Lancy separated by the Aire valley, as well as several hamlets (Pesay, Saint-Georges, La Tour, La Vendée, Le Pont Rouge), which now form a contiguous settlement area.

name: Landiswil
geography: Landiswil is located at 764 m above sea level, 17 km east of Bern. The farming village extends along a right-hand side stream of the Goldbach, in the Molasse heights of the Blasenflue between the Aare valley in the west and the Emmental in the east. The Goldbach valley has a fairly wide, flat valley floor. The hills around Landiswil have a characteristic relief with numerous short valleys and protruding hills.

name: Landquart
geography: Landquart is located on the southern bank of the Landquart river.
appearance: Landquart developed around the Landquart train station in the 20th century.

name: Langenbruck
geography: Langenbruck is located on the border with the Canton of Solothurn, in the upper section of the Augstbach valley, which drains the area south of the watershed to the Dünnern. It is separated from the Waldenburg valley by the pass at the Oberen Hauenstein. With an average altitude of 704 m above sea level, Langenbruck is the highest municipality in the Canton of Basel-Landschaft.

name: Langendorf
geography: Langendorf lies on 496 m above sea level and two kilometers northwest of Solothurn on the valley of Wildbach, slightly elevated north of the Aare valley at the southern foot of the Jura. The area of the 1.9 km² municipality covers a small section of the lower southern slope of the Jura, which is made up of moraine material from the Rhone Glacier.
appearance: Langendorf has developed from a street village on the way from Solothurn to Oberdorf and on the Weissenstein to a large suburb of Solothurn, which grew together with the settlement area of this city and with Bellach in the 20th century.

name: Langenthal
geography: Langenthal is situated in the Swiss Mittelland between Olten and Bern on the banks of the Langete stream, which flows through the town from south to north.

name: Langnau am Albis
geography: Langnau am Albis is located in the Horgen district of the canton of Zurich, Switzerland, situated on the Sihl river, approximately 10 kilometers from the city of Zurich. The Albis Pass is also part of the municipality's territory.  Much of the area is composed of forests and meadows. The Albis ridge forms the natural boundary in the west, and the Sihl river in the east. The terrain is mostly steep.

name: Langnau im Emmental
geography: Langnau im Emmental lies in the lower Ilfis valley, approximately halfway between Bern and Lucerne. It is the commercial, industrial, and service center for the upper Emmental region. The municipality covers about 24 square kilometers of agricultural land with a 170 km road network. Two-thirds of the inhabitants live in the villages of Langnau and Bärau, and one-third in scattered settlements within the Ilfis side valleys.

name: Langrickenbach
geography: Langrickenbach lies on the eastern foothills of the Seerücken, not far from Lake Constance, at the intersection of the Sulgen–Altnau and Amriswil–Konstanz roads. The municipality consists of the villages Dünnershaus, Herrenhof, Langrickenbach, Zuben and Schönenbaumgarten.

name: Lantsch/Lenz
geography: Lantsch/Lenz is a municipality and parish village in the Lenzerheide valley. The municipality sits at an altitude of 1328 m above sea level.

name: Laténa
geography: Laténa is a municipality in the canton of Neuchâtel, Switzerland.

name: Lauenen
geography: Lauenen is located in the Bernese Oberland in the Lauenental, which is traversed by the Louwibach from south to north. The mountains in the south of the municipality, such as the Wildhorn (3248 m above sea level), form the border with Valais. The lowest point of the municipality is at 1153 m above sea level. The Wildhorn is the highest peak.
appearance: NULL

name: Lauerz
geography: Lauerz lies in the foothills of the Alps at the northeastern foot of the Rigi, directly on Lake Lauerz (450 m above sea level). The island of Schwanau in Lake Lauerz belongs to the municipality of Lauerz. There are many individual farms in the municipality, and the village has numerous holiday homes on the lake shore and on slopes.
appearance: Not enough information to satisfy requirements.

name: Läufelfingen
geography: Läufelfingen is located at the top of the Homburgertal valley, nestled in the hills of the Baselbieter Jura, at the foot of the Unteren Hauensteinpass on the border with the canton of Solothurn. It is 10 km from Olten, 17 km from Liestal and 35 km from Basel. It lies on the Sissach–Olten railway line. The SBB station is located at 556 m above sea level.  The highest point of the municipality is located at the Schmutzbergfluh (980 m).

name: Laufen
geography: Laufen lies in the Laufental valley on the Birs river and the Jura railway line from Basel to Delsberg. Its highest elevation is Mätteberg at 672 m above sea level and the lowest point is the Birs riverbank near Neumatt at 348 m above sea level. The municipality covers 1140 hectares, of which 26% is agricultural land, 53% forest, 20% settlements and 1% unproductive land.

name: Laufenburg
geography: Laufenburg is a town in the Swiss canton of Aargau, located on the High Rhine at the border with Germany, in the northeast of the Fricktal region. The town lies at a bend in the Rhine, nestling against the Schlossberg. The Sulztal valley, is located east of the old town. The municipality area is part of the Jurapark Aargau. The highest point is the summit of the Schinberg.
appearance: The old town is located at a bend in the Rhine and nestles against the Schlossberg. The new housing estates of Laufenburg are located on the plain behind the Schlosshügel. The narrow Sulztal valley is surrounded by mountains.

name: Laufen-Uhwiesen
geography: Laufen-Uhwiesen is located in the Andelfingen district, in the wine region (Weinland) of the Canton of Zurich. The municipality borders Germany to the west, as well as the cantons of Schaffhausen and Thurgau.
appearance: The village of Uhwiesen, at 450 meters on the southern slope of the Cholfirst in the Zürcher Weinland.  The village is characterized by half-timbered houses, and contains the oldest preserved chapel in the Canton of Zurich. It is a wine and fruit farming village with many vines growing on the steep southern slope of the Cholfirst.

name: Laupen
geography: Laupen lies in the lower Sense valley at the confluence of the Sense and Saane rivers. The area is 4.14 km², of which 1.05 km² is forest. Neighboring municipalities are Kriechenwil, Ferenbalm, Mühleberg and Neuenegg in the canton of Bern and Bösingen on the Fribourg side.

name: Laupersdorf
geography: Laupersdorf is located at 493 m above sea level, 3 km west of Balsthal. The village stretches in a sheltered location in the hollow of the Dorbach on the sunny side of the northern edge of the Balsthalertal valley, at the foot of the Brunnersberg chain in the Solothurn Jura. The area includes a section in the middle part of the Balsthaler- or Dünnerntal. The highest elevation is reached at the Höllchöpfli with 1215 m above sea level.

name: Lauperswil
geography: Lauperswil is located in the Emmental and covers 2119 ha, of which 687 ha are forest.

name: Lausanne
geography: Lausanne is located in the Waadtländer Mittelland on the northern shore of Lake Geneva. The 41.4 km² municipal area includes the steep mountainside rising from the lake with the densely built city settlement of Lausanne. It is bordered by the Chamberonne in the west and the Vuachère in the east. The city center is at an altitude of 495 m above sea level.

name: Lausen
geography: Lausen is located in the middle Ergolz valley southeast of Liestal, with which it has now grown together.

name: Lauterbrunnen
geography: Lauterbrunnen is located in the Lauterbrunnen valley and consists of the villages of Lauterbrunnen, Wengen, Mürren, Gimmelwald, Stechelberg and Isenfluh. The municipality's lowest point is at 728 m above sea level, and the highest is at 4158 m above sea level.

name: Lauwil
geography: Lauwil is located in the Jura Mountains of Basel-Landschaft, immediately north of the Passwang massif. The village lies at 634 m above sea level and belongs to the Waldenburg district. Its neighboring municipalities are Reigoldswil, Bretzwil, Nunningen, Mümliswil-Ramiswil and Beinwil.

name: Lavertezzo
geography: Lavertezzo is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino, located in the Magadino plain. It is part of the Navegna circle and the Locarno district. Since the merger of the main town Lavertezzo Valle with other municipalities to form the municipality of Verzasca on October 18, 2020, the municipality area is identical to the Riazzino area (Lavertezzo Piano).

name: Lavey-Morcles
geography: Lavey-Morcles is located 12 km south-southeast of Aigle. Lavey-Village sits at 444 m above sea level, in a basin filled with alluvial material from the Le Courset mountain stream, east of the Rhone River, opposite Saint-Maurice. It lies between the Dents du Midi mountain range to the west and Dent de Morcles to the east. The municipality includes a section of the Vaud Alps, with the Rhône forming the western boundary.

name: Lavigny
geography: Lavigny is located at 522 m above sea level, 7 km west of Morges. The village is situated on a south-facing slope above the Aubonne valley, opposite Aubonne, offering panoramic views approximately 140 m above the level of Lake Geneva. The municipality's territory extends on the slope of Lavigny, bordered by the Aubonne valley to the west and the Boiron de Morges valley to the east.

name: Lavizzara
geography: Lavizzara is located in the northeastern part of the Vallemaggia district. The main valley is Val Lavizzara, with Val Sambuco to the north near Fusio. Important side valleys include Valle di Peccia to the west and Val di Prato to the east. Lago del Narèt is in the northwest. The Maggia river originates from there and flows through Val Sambuco into Lago del Sambuco. Much of the municipality is high alpine terrain. The valley is enclosed by mountains.

name: Lax
geography: Lax is located in the Aletsch region at the entrance to Goms. The village itself lies at 1048 m above sea level. The lowest point of Lax and the Goms district lies in the valley floor on the Rhone at 980 m above sea level. The municipality stretches from the valley to the high mountains of the glacier area, and lies exclusively on the right side of the Rhone. Because of its altitude, Lax has a mild climate and is considered a climatic health resort.

name: Le Bémont (JU)
geography: Le Bémont is located at 982 m above sea level, 1.5 km northeast of Saignelégier. The former street village extends on a southeast-facing slope on the Jura plateau of the Freiberge. The area encompasses a section of the gently undulating plateau of the Plateau Jura.  The northern boundary is near the steep slope to the Doubs valley. The area extends south over extensive pasture areas and the height of Le Haut Bémont (1070 m above sea level) to the Étang des Royes nature reserve.
appearance: The text doesn't describe the town's appearance.

name: Le Cerneux-Péquignot
geography: Le Cerneux-Péquignot is located at 1088 m above sea level, 8 km southwest of Le Locle. The farming village stretches northeast of the Vallée de la Brévine in the Neuchâtel Jura, near the border with France. The municipality includes a section of the Jura landscape south of the Doubs valley, similar to the Franches-Montagnes, with moorland and sinkholes between limestone hills. The highest point is Maix Musy at 1285 m above sea level.

name: Le Châtelard
geography: Le Châtelard lies at 903 m above sea level, 5 km east-southeast of Romont. The village extends in an exposed location on a promontory on the western slope of the Gibloux, north of the valley of the Ruisseau du Mausson, in the higher Freiburg Central Plateau. The area lies on the western slope of the Gibloux. The southern boundary is formed by the Ruisseau du Mausson.
appearance: The text describes Le Châtelard as a farming village (Bauerndorf) in a scenic location on a promontory. There is mention of a forest called "La Joux de Villargiroud", and the area is described as being in the Freiburg Mittelland.

name: Le Chenit
geography: Le Chenit is located at 1013 m above sea level, 37 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains and 32 km west-northwest of Lausanne. The municipality stretches in the Vallée de Joux on the Orbe River, southwest of Lac de Joux, in the Vaud Jura. The area includes a section in the Vaud Jura and the entire southwestern part of the Vallée de Joux. The central part is the 1 km wide valley of the Orbe.

name: Le Flon
geography: Le Flon lies about 16 km north of Vevey. The municipality extends on the ridge between the valleys of the Flon in the east and its right side stream Maflon in the west, in the extreme southwest of the Fribourg Mittelland.  The area is traversed by the valley of the Flon. To the north of the valley is a ridge that forms the main settlement area of the municipality and culminates in the forest heights of La Râpe and La Tossaire.

name: Le Landeron
geography: Le Landeron is located at the southern foot of the Jura Mountains, on the shores of the Zihl Canal and Lake Biel. The old town was built in the formerly marshy Seeland between arms of the Zihl on a sandy island.
appearance: No explicit description of the town's appearance is available in the provided article content.

name: Le Lieu
geography: Le Lieu is located at 1043 m above sea level, 31 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains and 30 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality extends in the Vallée de Joux.  The area includes the northwestern half of the Lac de Joux and the Lac Brenet. From the steep bank of the Lac de Joux, the municipal area extends to the Petit Risoux. The highest point is the Gros Crêt at 1419 m above sea level.

name: Le Locle
geography: Le Locle is located at 920 m above sea level, 8 km southwest of La Chaux-de-Fonds, near the border with France. The industrial town extends in a narrow high valley drained by the Bied stream in the Neuchâtel Jura, between the heights of Grand Som Martel in the south and Pouillerel in the north.

name: Le Mont-sur-Lausanne
geography: Le Mont-sur-Lausanne lies at 702 m above sea level, four kilometers north of Lausanne. The municipality extends on the southwest slope of the Jorat in the source area of the Petit Flon in the Vaud Plateau, about 330 m above the level of Lake Geneva. The area encompasses a section of the plateau southwest of the Jorat. The highest elevation is 814 m above sea level at the edge of the Bois du Jorat.
appearance: Le Mont-sur-Lausanne consists of the two villages Grand Mont and Petit Mont in the source area of the Petit Flon. These places are now connected by new housing estates. Le Mont-sur-Lausanne also includes the newer settlements La Clochatte, Les Planches, the extensive industrial settlement En Budron, the hamlets La Naz, Longeraies, Etavez and Penau, and several isolated farms. The settlement area has now almost completely merged with that of Lausanne.

name: Le Mouret
geography: Le Mouret is located at 754 m above sea level, 7 km south of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The municipality extends in the valley of the Ruisseau du Pontet, in the pre-Alpine hills of the Fribourg Mittelland, at the northern foot of the Berra mountain range. Le Mouret belongs to the agglomeration of Fribourg, the urban area surrounding the city of Fribourg. The southern boundary runs along the mountain ridge between Petit Cousimbert and Chrüzflue.
appearance: Le Mouret is a scattered settlement municipality consisting of a number of villages and hamlets, which before the merger were partially split by the numerous municipal boundaries and assigned to different municipalities.

name: Le Noirmont
geography: Le Noirmont is situated at 971 meters above sea level, five kilometers southwest of Saignelégier. The village is located on the Jura plateau of the Freiberge, directly on the edge of the deeply cut valley of the Doubs. The area encompasses a section of the rolling plateau Jura with moorish sinkholes. The highest point is Point de Vue at 1170 meters. The Doubs river forms the northwestern border.

name: Le Pâquier (FR)
geography: Le Pâquier is located at 749 m above sea level, 3 km south of Bulle. The village stretches on both sides of the Ruisseau du Village stream, slightly elevated on the western edge of the Saane valley, in the Gruyère region at the northern foot of the Alps, northeast of the Moléson.

name: Le Vaud
geography: Le Vaud is located at 815 m above sea level, 11 km north of Nyon. The village stretches along the southern slope of the Jura, between the streams Ruisseau du Geny to the west and Serine to the east, in an exposed position about 450 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva. The municipality area encompasses a section of the southern Jura slope, bordered by the valleys of Ruisseau du Geny and Serine.  It reaches up to the Mont-Tendre chain, with the highest point at 1350 m above sea level.
appearance: Includes several single-family house quarters.

name: Leibstadt
geography: Leibstadt is situated in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the district of Zurzach. It lies on the High Rhine (Hochrhein) at the border with Germany. The municipality consists of two geological parts: the Rhine plain in the north and the foothills of the Jura mountains in the south. The Wandfluh in the southwest is very steep. The highest point is at 530 meters, and the lowest is at 302 meters at the Rhine.
appearance: The settlement area stretches over one and a half kilometers from north to south. In the north, near the bank of the High Rhine, lies the Bernau district. The village center is located on the edge of the plain, directly in front of the southern slopes of Brüehalde and Winterberg, two steep, protruding hills. Between these hills lies the southern third of the village.

name: Leimbach (AG)
geography: Leimbach is located in the upper Wynental and is the smallest municipality in the canton by area. The village is nestled in a small niche of a lateral moraine formed during the Würm Ice Age. Most of the area covers the western slope of the 787-meter-high Homberg, but does not reach the summit. The hamlet Seeberg is located above the village at an altitude of 650 meters. A small part in the southwest is completely flat and lies in the plain of the Wyna.

name: Leissigen
geography: Leissigen is located in the Bernese Oberland on Lake Thun. The neighboring municipalities, starting from the east in a clockwise direction, are Därligen, Saxeten, Aeschi bei Spiez and Krattigen. The southern border of the municipality is the Morgenberghorn (2249 m above sea level).

name: Lema
geography: Lema is a political municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino. It includes the lower Malcantone and belongs to the Breno circle or Lugano district. The name refers to the Monte Lema (1619 m above sea level).

name: Lengnau (AG)
geography: Lengnau is located in the Surbtal valley, about seven kilometers from the German border. The municipality lies in the transition zone between the Tafeljura in the north and the Swiss Mittelland in the south. The village consists of Oberlengnau and Unterlengnau. The Surb river flows in a northwesterly direction. The terrain rises to the Wannenbuck (591 m above sea level) in the north and to the Gländ (609 m above sea level) and Hüsliberg (605 m above sea level) in the south, which form the natural border to the Limmattal.
appearance: Based on the image, the town appears to be a village with a mix of residential and commercial buildings. It looks like a traditional Swiss village center.

name: Lengnau (BE)
geography: Lengnau is located at the southern foot of the Jura in the Bernese Seeland. The neighbouring municipalities are Grenchen, Büren an der Aare, Meinisberg, Pieterlen and Romont BE.

name: Lengwil
geography: Lengwil is located south of the town of Kreuzlingen on the Seerücken.

name: Lenk
geography: Lenk is the highest municipality in the Simmental valley. The municipal area includes several mountains, the highest being the Wildstrubel. The Simme river originates near the Wildstrubel at Siebenbrünnen, giving the Simmental its name.  The lowest point is at Brändli at about 1016 m above sea level, and the highest point is the Wildstrubel at 3244 m above sea level.

name: Lens
geography: The municipality of Lens lies between Sion and Siders and extends from the Rhone Valley (560 m above sea level) on the right side of the Rhône up to the summit of Bella Lui (2548 m above sea level). It includes the villages of Chelin, Flanthey, Lens and Crans-sur-Sierre (part of the Crans-Montana spa town).
appearance: The Catholic parish church of St-Pierre is a monumental building from 1843. Next to the church is the Priory building of the monks from the Great St. Bernard. West of the church is a manor, a stone house from the 16th century.
pointsOfInterest: Prioratsgebäude der Mönche vom Grossen St. Bernhard

name: Lenzburg
geography: Lenzburg is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the northern Seetal valley near the Aabach river, about three kilometers south of the Aare river. The city area is characterized by two Molasse hills, the Schlossberg (508 m above sea level) and the Goffersberg (507 m above sea level). The northeastern part of the municipality extends over a flattened terminal moraine.
appearance: The old town of Lenzburg lies between the Schlossberg with the castle and the Aabach.

name: Les Bois
geography: Les Bois is located at 1034 m above sea level, 11 km northeast of La Chaux-de-Fonds. The village stretches on a gently south-facing slope on the Jura plateau of the southwestern Freiberge. The municipality includes a section of the slightly undulating plateau, alternating between moorish, mostly above-ground drainage depressions and limestone peaks.

name: Les Breuleux
geography: Les Breuleux is located at 1038 m above sea level, 5 km south of Saignelégier. The village extends on a south-facing slope on the Jura high plateau of the Freiberge. The municipality covers a section of the slightly undulating plateau Jura, where moorish, mostly surface-drainage depressions alternate with limestone peaks. The area reaches on the north slope of the Jura chain Montagne du Droit.

name: Les Clées
geography: Les Clées lies at 610 m above sea level, 5 km west of Orbe and 15 km west-southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on a promontory to the left of the Orbe River, in a small valley in the area of the Gorges de l’Orbe on the edge of the Jura and at the southern foot of the Suchet.

name: Les Enfers
geography: Les Enfers is located at 955 m above sea level, five kilometers northeast of Saignelégier. The village extends on a level Jura plateau of the Freiberge, south of the Doubs valley. The municipality area includes a section of the slightly undulating plateau of the Plateau Jura.  The highest point of the municipality is the Sur le Begnon northeast of Montfaucon, at 1022 m above sea level.
appearance: The infobox contains the following description 'Dorfzentrum' which translates as 'village center'.

name: Les Genevez (JU)
geography: Les Genevez is located at 1035 m above sea level, 10 km east of Saignelégier. The village extends in a slight depression and on the adjacent slopes of the Jura plateau of the eastern Freiberge. The municipality's area includes a section of the Jura plateau, with moorish depressions and limestone peaks. The area extends to the Montbautier, which at 1177 m above sea level is the highest point of Les Genevez. East of the village begins the valley of Bellelay, which is traversed by the Sorne.

name: Les Montets
geography: Les Montets is located approximately 4 km south of Estavayer-le-Lac. The municipality extends along the southwestern edge of the Broye plain and into the adjacent Molasse hill country, in the northwestern Fribourg Mittelland. The area stretches from the plateau near Estavayer-le-Lac southward through the valley of the Ruisseau de l’Arignon and over the Montet hill into the Petite Glâne valley.  The Bois d'Aumont is the highest point at 726 m above sea level.
appearance: Les Montets consists of the villages Montet (Broye) north of the Petite Glâne, Frasses in the Arignon valley, Granges-de-Vesin in the Petite Glâne valley, and Aumont on the hill between the Petite Glâne valley and the Bois d'Aumont. Some individual farms also belong to the municipality.

name: Les Planchettes
geography: Les Planchettes is located at 1063 m above sea level, five kilometers west of La Chaux-de-Fonds. The farming village stretches on the northern slope of the Pouillerel in the Neuchâtel Jura, about 400 m above the deeply cut valley of the Doubs. The northern and western boundary forms the Doubs, which is dammed to Lac de Moron. The highest point is the Pouillerel at 1276 m above sea level.

name: Les Ponts-de-Martel
geography: Les Ponts-de-Martel is located at 1009 m above sea level, 16 km west of Neuchâtel. The village stretches along the western edge of the Vallée des Ponts high valley in the Neuchâtel Jura and on the adjacent slope of the Grand Som Martel anticline. The municipality includes the western part of the Vallée des Ponts. Large areas of raised bog have been preserved on the plain, which are listed as "Tourbière des Ponts-de-Martel".

name: Les Verrières
geography: Les Verrières is located at 930 m above sea level, 36 km west-southwest of Neuchâtel. The village stretches in the Vallon des Verrières, surrounded by the heights of the western Neuchâtel Jura, near the border with France. The area includes the central section of the Vallon des Verrières, drained by the Morte river to the Doubs.

name: Leuggern
geography: Leuggern lies at the mouth of the Aare into the Rhine, bordering Germany. The northern part is in the Aare river plain. The main town of Leuggern sits on a hill at 332m. North of Leuggern is Gippingen by the Klingnauer reservoir and Felsenau at the Aare's mouth. The western and southern parts feature the foothills of the Tafeljura mountains, with the highest point at 547m and the lowest at 312m.

name: Leuk
geography: Leuk is located in the Swiss Rhone Valley on the northern bank of the river, east of the confluence of the Dala into the Rotten.  The municipality consists of Leuk Stadt, Susten and Erschmatt and several hamlets. The hamlets Brunnen, Lichten, Rotafen, St. Barbara and Thel are located on the northern slope of the Rhone Valley. Two thirds of the inhabitants live in Susten.
appearance: Null

name: Leukerbad
geography: Leukerbad is located in the Dalatal, at an altitude of 1411 to 2700 m above sea level. The valley is bordered by the Leeshörnern to the Rinderhorn and Balmhorn mountains to the northwest, with a deep saddle at the Gemmipass. The other side of the valley is dominated by the Ferdenrothorn, the Majinghorn and its glacier, and the Torrenthorn.
appearance: As the text says, Leukerbad is known as Wintersport- und Thermalkurort (Winter sports and thermal spa town)

name: Leutwil
geography: Leutwil is located on a plateau between the Seetal valley and the Homberg hills. The plateau was formed by a lateral moraine during the retreat of the Reuss glacier in the Würm Ice Age. Two small streams drain the plateau and flow into Lake Hallwil. To the south and southwest, the terrain rises steeply to the Egg (781 m above sea level) and the Wandfluh (766 m above sea level).
appearance: The village is stretched out on a plateau.

name: Leuzigen
geography: Leuzigen lies at 456 m above sea level as the last village of the Canton of Bern and of the Seeland between the Aare and the beginning of Bucheggberg. It is surrounded on three sides by the Canton of Solothurn. The northern boundary of the municipality is the winding course of the Aare river. The village has only small differences in altitude of about 80 meters.
appearance: The actual village consists of old farmhouses mixed with newer houses along the main road and Bucheggbergstrasse towards Bibern SO. Furthermore, behind the ice-age moraine wall of the Längenberg is a settlement called Brunnadern.

name: Leysin
geography: Leysin is located at 1253 m above sea level, 4 km northeast of Aigle. The village is situated on a wide terrace on the southern slope of the Tour d'Aï, high above the valley of the Grande Eau, in a panoramic location east of the Rhone Valley.  The area includes a section of the Vaud Alps, including the limestone peaks of Tour d'Aï, Tour de Mayen, and Tour de Famelon. Several mountain lakes, including Lac d’Aï, Lac de Mayen and Lac Segray, are located on the southern slopes of these mountains.

name: Leytron
geography: Leytron is located on the north side of the Rhone Valley, halfway between Sion and Martigny. The village of Leytron lies at the foot of the rocky Ardève hill between the mountain streams La Losentse and Salentse. The municipality includes the main town of Leytron and the resort of Ovronnaz.
appearance: The description does not mention any specific architectural styles or urban characteristics.

name: Lichtensteig
geography: Lichtensteig is located on the Thur River, between Wil SG and Wattwil. The neighboring municipalities are Neckertal, Bütschwil-Ganterschwil and Wattwil.

name: Liddes
geography: Liddes is located on the main road 21 to the Great St. Bernard Pass. It borders Orsières to the north, Val de Bagnes to the east, and Bourg-Saint-Pierre to the south. The municipality includes the hamlets of Chandonne, Dranse, Rive-Haute, Fontaine-Dessous, Fontaine-Dessus, Les Moulins, Vichères, Fornex, Chez-Petit and Palasuit.

name: Liedertswil
geography: Liedertswil is a municipality in the Waldenburg district of the canton of Basel-Landschaft in Switzerland. It is the smallest municipality in the district with an area of 1.94 km². The village lies on the bank of the Weigistbach, which flows into the Vordere Frenke in Oberdorf.
appearance: null
pointsOfInterest: Reste einer frühen Burganlage aus dem Mittelalter im Bereich Mörlifluh

name: Liesberg
geography: The municipality of Liesberg is located in the upper part of the Laufen valley, the section of the Birs valley between Delsberg and Laufen. Besides the village of Liesberg itself, the municipality includes the hamlets of Riederwald, Oberrüti and Niderriederwald as well as the industrial settlement of Liesberg Station in the valley floor and several mountain farms. The municipal area comprises a large section of the mountains on both sides of the valley with steep, almost 500-meter-high mountains and rock massifs and small side valleys in between.

name: Liestal
geography: Liestal is located in a Jura valley on the Ergolz river, about 15 km southeast of Basel. The Ergolz flows through the city from southeast to north. Left tributaries of the Ergolz are the Frenke, Orisbach, and Rösernbach. In the northeast, a mountain range from Grammet over Leisenberg to Elbisberg closes off the valley. Several ridges reach the settlement area, with the Furlen in the south and the Laubiberg and Ostenberg in the west. The highest point is 614 m above sea level, and the lowest is 287 m above sea level.

name: Ligerz
geography: Ligerz is located in the Bernese Seeland on the northern shore of Lake Biel. The municipality also includes the hamlets of Schernelz, Bipschal and Kleintwann, which lies west of the Twannbach stream. The neighboring municipalities, starting from the north in a clockwise direction, are Plateau de Diesse, Twann-Tüscherz and La Neuveville.

name: Lignerolle
geography: Lignerolle is located at 760 m above sea level, 6 km west-northwest of Orbe and 14 km west-southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches on the southern slope of Suchet in a hollow, north of the Orbe valley. The municipality extends from the foot of the Jura to the anticline of Suchet. The highest point is Bel Coster at 1415 m.
appearance: Lignerolle is a farming village situated on the southern slope of the Suchet mountain range, nestled in a depression north of the Orbe valley.

name: Lignières
geography: Lignières is located at 802 m above sea level, 14 km northeast of Neuchâtel. The farming village is located on the southwestern edge of the Montagne de Diesse plateau, south of the Chasseral, in a panoramic location high above Lake Biel. The area comprises the westernmost section of the Plateau de Diesse. The Ruisseau de Vaux drains the village towards Lake Biel.  The highest point is on the Chuffort with 1478 m above sea level.

name: Lindau
geography: Lindau is located between Winterthur and Zürich, on the watershed between Kemptthal and Glatttal. It is considered the border to the Zürcher Oberland. A third of the municipal area is wooded.

name: Linden
geography: The municipality lies at 916 m above sea level between the Emmental and Aaretal regions in a trough valley. It is flanked to the north by the steep flanks of the Kurzenberg and to the south by the Falkenfluh-Schafegg-Stauffen range. The village center with the church lies exactly on the watershed of the Diessbach and the Jassbach. The lowest point is at 705 m, the highest at 1200 m on the Kurzenberg.

name: Linescio
geography: Linescio lies at 668 m above sea level on the rocks to the left of the Rovana, 26 km northwest of Locarno. The western municipal boundary runs from Madone di Càmedo (2446 m above sea level) in a slightly south-easterly direction. Almost two thirds of the municipality are covered by forest and woodland, and 31.7% are unproductive areas (mostly mountains).
appearance: The main settlements are lined up along the road from Cevio towards Cimalmotto and are from east to west Ponte Asciutto (708 m above sea level), Linescio di Fuori (700 m above sea level), Linescio(-Dorf) (664 m above sea level) and Linescio di Dentro (677 m above sea level).

name: Locarno
geography: Locarno lies on the northern shore of Lago Maggiore and the eastern edge of the Maggia Delta. The district of Monti della SS. Trinità nestles on the slope above the town. The municipality also includes a large area in the Magadino plain, the Gerre di Sotto.
appearance: The urban area of Locarno has grown together with the independent municipalities of Muralto, Minusio and Orselina.

name: Lohn (SH)
geography: Lohn is located on the high plateau of the Reiat, the "sun terrace" of the canton of Schaffhausen. The total area of the municipality is 486.6 ha, of which 167.9 ha are forest and 30.4 ha are building land. The village center (church) is at 640 m above sea level, the lowest point is in the Langloch-Feldbrunn at 480 m above sea level, and the highest is in the Dicki at 674 m above sea level.

name: Lohn-Ammannsegg
geography: Lohn-Ammannsegg lies at 500 m above sea level, 4 km south of Solothurn. Both villages are located on the sunny slope north of the lower Biberental, in the northeast of the Bucheggberg. The area includes a section of the Molasse heights of the Bucheggberg. The southern border runs along the Biberenbach. The municipal area extends northwards over the flat valley and the slope of Lohn-Ammannsegg up to the high plateau with the Rütifeld, the Lohner Oberwald and the Oberholz.
appearance: The settlements of both districts have now grown together seamlessly. In addition, there are some isolated farms belonging to the municipality.

name: Löhningen
geography: Löhningen lies in Klettgau at the foot of the Randen. It borders Beringen to the north, east and south, Neunkirch to the south and west, and Siblingen to the west. The municipal area of 682.7 hectares is divided into 420 ha of cultivated land, 256 ha of forest and 11 ha of vineyards, in addition to the settlement area.

name: Lommis
geography: Lommis is a municipality in the district of Münchwilen in the Swiss canton of Thurgau. It consists of the villages of Lommis and Weingarten-Kalthäusern and lies in the Lauchetal near Matzingen.

name: Lommiswil
geography: Lommiswil is located at 565 m above sea level, 5 km west-northwest of Solothurn. The village extends in a panoramic location on a wide, slightly south-facing terrace at the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of the Hasenmatt, about 130 m above the Aare plain.  The municipality includes a section of the southern slope of the Jura.
appearance: Due to strong residential construction activity in recent years, Lommiswil and Im Holz have now grown together seamlessly.

name: Lonay
geography: Lonay is located at 416 m above sea level, 2.5 km northeast of Morges. The village extends on a south-facing slope above the valley of Le Bief stream, offering scenic views approximately 50m above Lake Geneva. The municipality's territory includes a section of the Vaudois lowlands, ranging from the lower reaches of the Bief in a broad valley to an open hollow in the Bief's source area, flanked by the plateau of Echichens and the Crêt Blanc hill (475 m above sea level).

name: Longirod
geography: Longirod is situated at 899 m above sea level, 13 km north of Nyon. The village extends on a slightly south-facing slope on the southern Jura slope, in a panoramic location about 500 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva. The municipality includes a section of the southern Jura slope and the Vaud Jura. The highest point is the Crêt de la Neuve at 1495 m above sea level.
appearance: The text does not offer any appearance related details.

name: Lostallo
