geography: Lostallo is located on the western slope on the right side of the Moesa river. The municipality consists of the village itself and the fractions Cabbiolo in the north and Sorte in the south. Neighboring municipalities are Soazza, Calanca, Grono, Cama, and Gordona in Italy.

name: Lostorf
geography: Lostorf is located at 451 m above sea level, 5 km northeast of the city of Olten. The former village stretches on both sides of the Lostorfer Bach in a valley basin at the southern foot of the Jura, on the northern edge of the wide Aare lowlands in the Solothurn Niederamt.

name: Lotzwil
geography: Lotzwil lies in the Bernese Oberaargau, nestled in the valley of the Langete river, which originates in the Napf area. It is located 2.5 kilometers south of Langenthal and 40 kilometers from Basel, Bern, and Lucerne, at 504 meters above sea level.

name: Lovatens
geography: Lovatens is situated at 712 m above sea level, 15.5 km southwest of Payerne. The village sits on a scenic terrace on the upper right slope of the Broye valley, in the eastern Vaud region. The municipality covers part of the Molasse hills between the Broye valley and the upper reaches of the Glâne.
appearance: The extracted text does not include information about the town's appearance.

name: Loveresse
geography: Loveresse is located at 761 m above sea level, 11 km west-southwest of Moutier. The village stretches in a hollow on the southern slope of the Jura mountain chain of Moron, in the Jura valley Vallée de Tavannes. The municipality encompasses a narrow section of the broad valley basin of the Vallée de Tavannes, drained by the Birs. To the north, the area extends over the wooded steep slope (Bois au Prince) to the crest of the Moron chain, where the highest point of Loveresse is reached at 1281 m above sea level.

name: Lucens
geography: Lucens is located at 498 m above sea level in the Broye valley. The Cerjaule river flows through the village. The municipality extends into the Molasse hills west of the Broye valley, including the Vallon des Vaux and the Bois à Ban forest. The highest point is the Créta at 690 m above sea level.

name: Lufingen
geography: Lufingen lies between the Glatttal and Tösstal valleys in the Zürcher Unterland. The municipality includes the village of Augwil. 42.1% of the municipality's area is used for agriculture, 37.6% is forest, 3.7% is used for transportation, 16.4% is settlement area, and 0.2% is water (as of 2018).

name: Lugano
geography: Lugano is located in the south of the Lugano district and the canton, at the mouth of the Cassarate river into Lake Lugano.  The municipality ranges in altitude from 269 to 2116 meters above sea level.
appearance: NULL

name: Luins
geography: Luins is located at 460 m above sea level, 7 km northeast of Nyon. The wine-growing village extends slightly elevated on the lower southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, in a panoramic location about 80 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality extends from the plateau at the foot of the Côte up the vineyard slope to the high plateau near Burtigny.
appearance: Luins is a wine-growing village located on a slightly elevated position on the lower southern slope of the Waadtländer Côte, offering scenic views approximately 80 meters above Lake Geneva.

name: Lully (FR)
geography: Lully is located at 495 m above sea level, 1.5 km south of Estavayer-le-Lac. The village extends on the plateau south of Lake Neuchâtel, at the northeast foot of the Molasse heights between the lake and the Broye valley, in the northwestern Fribourg Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the Fribourg Central Plateau and extends into the valley of the Ruisseau de l’Arignon and the valley of the Ruisseau du Bainoz.

name: Lully (VD)
geography: Lully is situated at 425 m above sea level, 2.5 km west of Morges, on a plateau in the Vaudois Mittelland north of Lake Geneva. The municipality's area covers a small section north of Lake Geneva, mostly the Lully plateau, reaching its highest point at Les Granges (480 m above sea level). The western border is the Le Blacon stream, a tributary of the Boiron de Morges. The area extends south to the lower Boiron valley, nearing Lake Geneva.

name: Lumino
geography: Lumino is located at the entrance of the Misox valley (Val Mesolcina) and extends to the right of the Moesa river up to the Piz de Molinera and to the left up to the Monti Loga. The village of Lumino lies on the right bank of the Moesa. The San Bernardino Pass is located further up the valley. The municipality is almost entirely surrounded by the canton of Graubünden. It is traversed by the Moesa river.
appearance: In recent decades of the 20th century, the rural appearance of Lumino has changed due to the construction of numerous new residential buildings and the establishment of a small but thriving industry.

name: Lumnezia
geography: Lumnezia is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It encompasses large parts of the valley of the same name and belongs to the Surselva region. The municipality extends over an area of 16,543 hectares from the Porclas valley portal to the Greina plateau on the border with the canton of Ticino. The settlement area of the municipality of Lumnezia lies between 900 and 1550 meters above sea level.

name: Lungern
geography: Lungern is located in the uppermost part of the canton of Obwalden, at the foot of the Brünig Pass. The village center is 712 m above sea level. It lies in a valley basin that is only open to the north and is enclosed on the other sides by steep, wooded slopes and rocks.
appearance: The village is divided into three districts. At the northern end of the lake lies Kaiserstuhl-Bürglen, while the actual village center has settled on the eastern shore of the lake. The Obsee hamlet connects to the southern shore of the lake and can be described as the best-preserved part of the old village, with old houses in their original arrangement.

name: Lupfig
geography: Lupfig is located on the western edge of the Birrfeld, a vast plain between the Aare in the west and the Reuss in the east. The plain is mostly flat and intensively farmed. The eastern two-thirds of the municipality are completely flat, with a regional airfield. In the north, the 434-meter-high Guggerhübel separates the Birrfeld from the Hausener Tal. The western third lies on the Chestenberg's northern slope. The highest point is at 647 meters.
appearance: Lupfig is completely merged with Birr; the boundaries between these once separate villages are no longer recognizable.

name: Lupsingen
geography: Lupsingen lies in a flat valley of a side valley of the Oristal, about five kilometers southwest of the cantonal capital Liestal.

name: Lüscherz
geography: Lüscherz is located on the southern shore of Lake Biel, on the northern slope of the Schaltenrain. Its direct neighbors are Brüttelen, Hagneck, Finsterhennen, Siselen, and Vinelz.

name: Lussery-Villars
geography: Lussery-Villars lies at 494 m above sea level, 2.5 km northeast of Cossonay and 15 km northwest of Lausanne. The village stretches on the western slope of the Venoge valley, in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipal area extends from the wide valley of the Venoge up the slope of Lussery-Villars to the adjacent plateau, where the highest point is reached at 571 m above sea level.
appearance: Lussery-Villars consists of the two villages Lussery (494 m above sea level) and Villars (492 m above sea level) halfway up the slope west of the Venoge, as well as several isolated farms.

name: Lussy-sur-Morges
geography: Lussy-sur-Morges is located at 458 m above sea level, 3.5 km west of Morges. The village extends on a slightly south-facing slope in the Vaudois Central Plateau, in a panoramic location about 80 m above the sea level of Lake Geneva. The municipality area includes a section of the Vaudois Central Plateau north of Lake Geneva. The slightly inclined slope is bordered by the valley of the Boiron de Morges to the south.

name: Luterbach
geography: Luterbach lies at 431 m above sea level, 3.5 km east of Solothurn. The village extends on the gravel plain east of the Emme river, in the Solothurner Mittelland. The area encompasses a section of the groundwater-rich gravel plain. The Aare forms the northern boundary, and the Emme borders Luterbach in the west.

name: Lüterkofen-Ichertswil
geography: Lüterkofen-Ichertswil lies approximately 6 km south-southwest of Solothurn. The villages of Lüterkofen (473 m above sea level) and Ichertswil (483 m above sea level) are located in the Biberenbach valley in the eastern part of the Bucheggberg, in the Solothurn Mittelland. The area is traversed from west to east by the Biberenbach in a wide valley. The highest point of the municipality is reached on the Banzenrain above Lüterkofen at 563 m above sea level.

name: Luthern
geography: Luthern is located southwest of Willisau in the Luthertal. It is one of the largest municipalities in the canton of Lucerne and lies in the rugged hills and mountains north of the Napf. The municipality's border forms a boundary with the canton of Bern.

name: Lütisburg
geography: Lütisburg is a municipality in Toggenburg in the Swiss canton of St. Gallen. It is located at the confluence of the Necker and Thur rivers.  The lowest point of the municipality is 539 m above sea level on the banks of the Thur in the Mühlau, and the highest is 864 m above sea level in Oberschauenberg.
appearance: The municipality consists of the village of Lütisburg, which sits on a rocky ridge at the confluence of the Thur and Necker, a part of the village of Lütisburg Station, the hamlet of Tufertschwil located above a striking Molasse wall, and the hamlets of Ober- and Unterrindal, Winzenberg, Rimensberg, Grünhügel, Gonzenbach, Schauenberg, Haslen, Dottenwil, Altegg, Wildenhof, Herrensberg and Chrummentürli distributed in the hilly landscape.

name: Lutry
geography: Lutry is located at 383 m above sea level, 5 km east-southeast of Lausanne. The town stretches in the western Lavaux, on the small alluvial fan formed by the Lutrive stream at its mouth into Lake Geneva, at the southern foot of the Jorat hills. The area extends from the lake shore northwards over the flat shore strip and the vineyards on both sides of the valleys of the Lutrive and the Bouteiller.

name: Lütschental
geography: Lütschental lies between Gündlischwand and Grindelwald in the Berner Oberland. 30% of the 12.9 km² municipal area is used for agriculture, 37% is forest. The summit of the Winteregg, the highest mountain in the municipality, is at an altitude of 2555 meters. Lütschental is located in the valley that leads from Interlaken to Grindelwald. The name Lütschental is related to the name of the river Lütschine, which flows through the valley.
appearance: NULL

name: Lützelflüh
geography: Lützelflüh lies in the lower Emmental, between Langnau and Burgdorf. The Emme divides the village into the Oberdorf on the right bank and the younger Unterdorf on the left bank. In addition, the municipality includes the two villages Grünenmatt and Ramsei, part of the places Ranflüh, Trachselwald and Rüegsauschachen and the two exclaves Lauterbach and Oberried.

name: Lutzenberg
geography: Lutzenberg is located in the Appenzeller Vorderland and is the northernmost municipality of the canton. The municipality is divided into two parts. The larger part lies on a north-facing slope above Rheineck and Thal. The smaller part is located further west, on the foothills of the Rorschacherberg. The lowest point is at 430 meters, and the highest point is at 791 meters.
appearance: Lutzenberg does not have a central village with a church, as the residents remained loyal to the old church in Thal. The municipality is made up of several hamlets.

name: Luzein
geography: Luzein is located in the Prättigau/Davos region of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. The municipality's altitude ranges from 685 to 2825 meters above sea level.

name: Luzern
geography: Luzern lies on the northwestern shore of Lake Lucerne (Vierwaldstättersee) at the outflow of the Reuss river, dividing the city into the old town and new town. It's situated between the mountains Pilatus and Rigi, with an exclave on Bürgenstock. The highest point is on Bürgenstock (1127.8 m ü. M.), and the lowest is on Rotsee (419 m ü. M.). The city center lies between the Dietschiberg and Gütsch hills.

name: Lyss
geography: Lyss is located at the edge of the wide plain at the southern foot of the Jura mountains, extending from southwest to northeast from Lake Murten via the Grosse Moos and the Alte Aare to near Grenchen. To the northwest rises the Jura massif with the Chasseral. Lyss lies at the point where the Lyssbach enters this alluvial plain. The municipality is bordered to the west by the Alte Aare and the Biel–Lyss highway.
appearance: The rapidly developing regional center has retained much of its rural Seeland character. Almost the entire flat landscape part of the municipal area is built over with settlements.

name: Lyssach
geography: Lyssach lies at 516 m above sea level, 4 km west of Burgdorf. The village stretches along the southern edge of the Emme alluvial plain, at the entrance to the Emmental and at the foot of the molasse hills of the higher Swiss Mittelland.

name: Madiswil
geography: Madiswil is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland. The Langete river flows through the village in the west. The municipality includes the village itself, as well as the localities Bisegg, Gutenburg, Mättenbach and Wyssbach, and the hamlets Ghürn, Rüppiswil and Roschbach/Hochrüti, and since January 1, 2011, the former municipalities of Kleindietwil and Leimiswil.

name: Madulain
geography: Madulain is located between La Punt Chamues-ch and Zuoz, about ten kilometers from St. Moritz, on the banks of the Inn River in the La Plaiv region. The municipality includes the exclave Val Prünella and Alp Prünella, which is located approximately ten kilometers south of the village. The altitude of the municipality ranges from 1669 to 3159 meters above sea level.
appearance: Madulain is a clustered village (Haufendorf) known for its well-preserved village center in the Upper Engadine and is considered one of the most beautiful villages in Switzerland. The village is characterized by its originality and quiet atmosphere compared to St. Moritz. The ruins of Guardaval Castle are situated above the village.

name: Magden
geography: Magden lies in the Fricktal region, about three kilometers south of the German border and borders the canton of Basel-Landschaft. The village is located on the Magdenerbach, which flows west and then north into the Rhine. The flat valley floor is bordered by hills of the Tafeljura. On the north side of the Magdenertal lies the "Galgen", on the west side the Schönenberg.  The Önsberg is located between the Wintersingerbach valley and the Magdenertal.

name: Mägenwil
geography: Mägenwil lies in the south of the flat Birrfeld on a moraine. The Birrfeld is bordered by the steep northern slope of the Wagenrain. Numerous abandoned quarries are located in the northernmost section of the Wagenrain, where shell limestone used to be mined.

name: Maggia
geography: Maggia is a municipality in Ticino, located in the lower and middle part of the Maggia Valley, northwest of Locarno. The various parts of the village lie on both sides of the Maggia river.

name: Magliaso
geography: Magliaso is a municipality in the Lugano district of Ticino, Switzerland. The village is located on the right bank of Lake Lugano, 5 km southwest of Lugano and 2.5 km north of the Ponte Tresa TI station. It lies at 287 m above sea level.

name: Maienfeld
geography: Maienfeld is located eight kilometers southeast of Sargans in the lower Chur Rhine Valley. It lies at the foot of the Falknis in the Bündner Herrschaft, which is part of the Landquart region. The municipality borders the Rhine on the right side of the valley and consists of the small town, Bovel, Rofels and St. Luzisteig, a pass to Liechtenstein.
appearance: Maienfeld is surrounded by vineyards. St. Luzisteig has a fortress from the 18th century which is still used as a barracks of the Swiss Army. The old Walser settlement Stürfis was abandoned in 1633 and transformed into an alp of the city of Maienfeld.

name: Maisprach
geography: Maisprach is nestled in a valley on the southern slope of the Sonnenberg and is the northernmost village in the Oberbaselbiet region.

name: Malans
geography: Malans is located above the confluence of the Landquart and Rhine rivers, on a debris cone five kilometers southeast of Maienfeld. The village is accessible by car from Landquart or Jenins, but also has a train connection.

name: Malters
geography: Malters is located 10 km west of the city of Lucerne. The municipality is bordered by the Kleine Emme river and the Ränggbach stream.  The boundary runs along the Blatterberg mountain's northern slope, encompassing the Blatterwald, Sitewald, Gspanwald, and Vogelwald forests.  The municipality also includes areas north of the Kleine Emme, formerly the independent municipality of Brunau.
appearance: The village of Malters lies south of the Kleinen Emme on the road Luzern-Wolhusen. It has grown together with the former hamlets of Feld and Schachen.

name: Mammern
geography: Mammern lies on the southern shore of the Untersee, where the border between Germany and Switzerland runs, 4 kilometers east of Stein am Rhein. Mammern is accessed by the main road Schaffhausen–Rorschach and has a train station on the Seelinie.

name: Mandach
geography: Mandach lies in the Tafeljura, surrounded by hills, between the Aare and Rhine valleys, near the German border. It sits at the upper end of a valley draining north towards the Aare river. Notable surrounding hills include Wessenberg (605m), Besseberg (618m), Rotberg (638m), and the Bötteberg foothills. The village nestles against a 561m hill called "Berg".

name: Männedorf
geography: Männedorf is located on the right bank of Lake Zurich, on the southern slope of the Pfannenstiel, extending from the lake shore (406 meters above sea level) up to the Stäfner Türli (661 meters). The municipality is situated on terraces running parallel to the Pfannenstiel ridge.
appearance: The originally small, agricultural village on the lake shore has transformed considerably since the construction of the railway and has expanded up the mountain. The upper part of Männedorf is now a recreational area.

name: Manno
geography: Manno is located at 342 m above sea level on the right bank of the Vedeggio river. It has become a service suburb of Lugano due to its location on the A2 motorway.
appearance: Not available

name: Maracon
geography: Maracon is located at 843 m above sea level, 4 km east-southeast of Oron-la-Ville. It extends on a hilltop above the Broye valley. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills in the Alpine foothills. The Broye forms the border to the southeast, creating a small valley. The moor and swamp area Les Mosses is located in the northeast.
appearance: Maracon is a farming village in a scenic location on a hilltop above the Broye valley.

name: Marbach (SG)
geography: Marbach is located between Rebstein and Altstätten, at the foot of the western slope of the Rhine valley. It has a relatively large municipal area, extending to the Rheintaler Binnenkanal near Kriessern and to the cantonal border of Appenzell Ausserrhoden. A tri-cantonal corner with Appenzell Ausserrhoden and Appenzell Innerrhoden is located at the Lauberbach in Bruggtobel.
appearance: The village is characterized by single-family houses and has a historical village center northwest of the main road. The area in the Rhine valley plain is rural and agricultural. On the slope, in the middle of the vineyards, is the historic Weinstein Castle, which has a restaurant and winery.

name: Marchissy
geography: Marchissy is located at 825 m above sea level, 12 km north of Nyon. The village extends on the southern slope of the Jura above the Serine valley, in a scenic location around 450 m above Lake Geneva. The municipality includes a section of the southern slope of the Jura and the Vaud Jura. The area is bordered in the south by the Serine stream. The highest point is the Crêt de la Neuve at 1495 m above sea level.

name: Marly
geography: Marly is located at 627 m above sea level, 3.5 km south of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The municipality extends in a valley widening of the Ärgera, shortly before its confluence with the Saane, as well as on the adjacent Molassehöhen of the Freiburg Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Molassehöhen east of the Saane and the Ärgera valley.
appearance: Marly consists of the two settlement parts Marly-le-Grand on the northern slope of the Ärgera valley and Marly-le-Petit on the edge of the plateau north of the Ärgera valley, the hamlet Chésalles on the slope south of the Ärgera and some individual farms.

name: Marsens
geography: Marsens is located at 722 m above sea level, 4 km north of Bulle. The village stretches on the western edge of the valley of the Sionge stream, at the southern foot of the Gibloux, in the Gruyère region west of Lake Gruyère. The municipality includes a section of the Bulle basin in the Fribourg Pre-Alps and has a share in Lake Gruyère. The highest point is at 1026 m above sea level.

name: Märstetten
geography: Märstetten is located in the Weinfelden district of the Thurgau canton in Switzerland. It's a clustered village with the hamlets of Boltshausen, Altenburg, Dattenhub and Ruberbaum located at the western foot of the Ottenberg.

name: Marthalen
geography: Marthalen lies in the Zürcher Weinland. The municipality covers 1,416 hectares and includes the villages of Marthalen and Ellikon am Rhein, as well as the hamlets of Niedermarthalen and Radhof. More than a third of the area is covered by forest. The Mederbach flows through the area.
appearance: The village of Marthalen features many half-timbered houses.

name: Martigny
geography: Martigny is located in the French-speaking Lower Valais in the Rhone plain and at the lower reaches of the Dranse, which flows into the Rhone north of the town. The town area is bounded in the southeast by Mont Chemin and in the west by the steep slopes of Mont d'Ottan below Roc Blanc. In the north, the municipal boundary follows the riverbed, which runs along the Sé Carro mountain massif on the right side of the valley at the "Rhone knee".

name: Martigny-Combe
geography: Martigny-Combe is located in the Martigny district in the French-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Valais. It lies at the intersection of two road traffic axes. The A21 motorway ending in La Croix continues as main road 21 over the Great St. Bernard Pass to Italy. Main road 202 branches off from the end point of the motorway from La Croix over the Col de la Forclaz to France.
appearance: The municipality consists of La Croix and several hamlets.

name: Maschwanden
geography: Maschwanden lies in the southwest of the canton of Zurich, on the edge of the Reuss plain near the mouth of the Lorze into the Reuss. The Lorze forms the natural border with the canton of Zug to the west. The Rüssspitz nature reserve is across the Lorze.
appearance: In a document from 1260, Maschwanden is attested as a small castle town ("in castro dicto Maswandon"). Castle and city Maschwanden were almost as big as Regensberg. It was located on a hill on the edge of the swamp area near the Lorze. As with many such towns, the outer facades of the houses formed the ring wall.

name: Masein
geography:
Masein is located on a slope of the Heinzenberg just west of Thusis. In addition to the two districts of Ober- and Unterdorf, the hamlets of Crestalunga and Dalaus to the south of the main settlement, Tagstein Castle and the hamlets of Cresta and Lochmühli to the east of the village also belong to the municipality.
Of the total municipal area of 419 ha, 218 ha are covered by forest and woodland. A further 161 ha can be used for agriculture.
appearance: The two settlements of Ober- and Unter-Masein probably developed from the two large farms of the Cazis monastery, which were mentioned in 1156 as de Medezenu. The owners of Untertagstein and Schauenstein castles as well as individual free farmers owned estates in Masein during the High and Late Middle Ages.

name: Massagno
geography: Massagno is a municipality in the Vezia circle in the Lugano district of the canton of Ticino in Switzerland and borders directly on Lugano as a suburb. The municipality lies between 361 and 387 m above sea level. The neighboring municipalities are Lugano to the south and east and Savosa to the north.

name: Massongex
geography: Massongex is located in the Lower Valais on the border with the Canton of Vaud, on the left bank of the Rhone. The surrounding area is flat and fertile, with agricultural use and residential development. The municipality of Massongex is located in the agglomeration of the city of Monthey, to which Massongex is well connected.

name: Massonnens
geography: Massonnens is located at 733 m above sea level, 4 km east of Romont. The farming village extends on a hill on the northwest slope of Gibloux, above the valley of the Neirigue, west of the village stream Ruisseau de Massonnens. The area includes a section of the Molasse hills in the Freiburg Mittelland. The highest point is reached at 914 m above sea level below La Berra.

name: Mathod
geography: Mathod is located at 445 m above sea level, 6 km west of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village extends on the northern edge of the Orbe plain, at the foot of the hills and plateaus of the Jura, at the exit of the valley of the Mujon, in the Vaud Central Plateau. The area is dominated by the agricultural Orbe plain and extends to the Bois de Vuavre. The northern part includes the valley of the lower Mujon and the Bey.

name: Matran
geography: Matran is situated at 614 meters above sea level, 5.5 km west-southwest of the cantonal capital of Fribourg. The village extends on the northern slope of the lower Glâne valley, shortly before its confluence with the Saane, in the Molasse hills of the Fribourg Mittelland.
appearance: Matran includes extensive new residential areas and commercial zones.

name: Matten bei Interlaken
geography: Matten bei Interlaken lies in the Bernese Oberland in the Alps, on the alluvial plain formed by Lake Thun and Lake Brienz, which is called «Bödeli». To the west, Matten borders the foothills of the Abendberggrat, the large and small Rugen. In the south, part of the Aenderberg forms an enclave of the municipality. The towns of Matten, Unterseen and Interlaken together form a closed settlement area.

name: Mattstetten
geography: Mattstetten lies at 516 m above sea level, 10 km northeast of Bern. It lies in the broad Urtenen valley between the Rapperswiler Plateau and the Molasse hills of the Bantiger. The municipality covers a section of the central Bernese Mittelland. The larger northern part lies in the Urtenen valley, flanked by the main traffic routes of the railway and motorway between Bern and Olten. The highest point is on the Grauholz ridge at 740 m above sea level.

name: Matzendorf
geography: Matzendorf is located at 510 m above sea level, 5 km west of Balsthal. The village extends on both sides of the village stream on the sunny side of the northern edge of the Balsthalertal valley, at the foot of the Brunnersberg chain in the Solothurn Jura.

name: Matzingen
geography: Matzingen lies 5 kilometers southeast of Frauenfeld in a basin surrounded by the Immenberg, Altholz-Fuchsbärg, Ristenbühl and Ruggenbühl, at the confluence of the Thunbach and the Lauche with the Murg and the Lützelmurg. The municipality extends in the north following the course of the Thunbach to the Stählibuck. The municipality also includes the districts of Weierhüsli and Gass as well as the hamlets of Ristenbühl, Halingen and Dingenhart.

name: Mauborget
geography: Mauborget is the highest municipality in the Swiss Jura at 1170 m above sea level, located 8 km north of Yverdon-les-Bains. It sits on the southern slope of the Chasseron chain, offering views over the Swiss plateau. The municipality encompasses part of the Chasseron anticline, extending from the wooded slope of La Côte northward over the clearing island of the Mauborget terrace to the En Tévenon height (1323 m above sea level).
appearance: The description focuses on the location and view, not specific details about the town's appearance or architecture.

name: Mauensee
geography: Mauensee is located west of Sursee on the eastern edge of the Wauwilermoos. The municipality includes the hamlet of Kaltbach, located between St. Erhard (municipality of Knutwil) and Wauwil, north of Mauensee village, as well as the hamlet of Bognau in the east, which has grown together with Sursee. Within the municipality lies the Mauensee lake with the Mauensee castle. The municipality's altitude ranges from 499 to 685 meters above sea level.

name: Maur
geography: The municipality of Maur extends from the western shore of Lake Greifensee to the summit of the Pfannenstiel chain, between Pfannenstiel (852 m above sea level) in the south and Wassberg (728 m above sea level) in the north. The difference in altitude from the lake to the Pfannenstiel is almost 400 meters.  The hilly municipal area is about a quarter covered by forests and about half by fields and pastures.
appearance: The villages are mostly characterized by single-family houses. The lake with the landing stage (Schifflände), the bathing establishment and the Pfannenstiel are popular hiking and excursion destinations. The nature reserve on the shore of Lake Greifensee is undeveloped, which contributes to the rural appearance of the municipality despite its proximity to the city of Zurich.

name: Mauraz
geography: Mauraz is located at 625 m above sea level, 12 km northwest of Morges. The village extends on the Jura foothills plateau, at the mouth of the Morand stream into the Veyron, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The area of only 0.5 km² covers a small section of the western edge of the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality is bordered to the north by the Morand stream and to the south by the valley of the Veyron.
appearance: Mauraz consists of a lower village part (625 m above sea level) and an upper village part, which bears the name Sur le Crêt (642 m above sea level).

name: Medel (Lucmagn)
geography: Medel (Lucmagn) lies in the Val Medel, the valley between Disentis/Mustér and the Lukmanierpass. The municipality includes several villages, hamlets and individual settlements. The highest points are the Piz Medel (3210 m) covered by the Medelser Glacier and the Scopí (3190 m). The Lai da Sontga Maria reservoir on the Lukmanierpass is 177 ha in size.
appearance: The text does not contain a clear description of what the town looks like, therefore this value is null.

name: Meggen
geography: Meggen lies between Lake Lucerne (Vierwaldstättersee) and the Meggerberg. To the east, the village borders the Canton of Schwyz. The southwest-northeast running Meggerberg is covered near the ridge by the Meggerwald. The highest point is at Höchstegg at 652 m above sea level, and the lowest is on Lake Lucerne at 434 m above sea level. Northwest of Tschädigen lies the Foremoos marshland.

name: Meienried
geography: Meienried is located in the Seeland, where the Alte Aare merges with the Nidau-Büren-Kanal. This area is called Häftli. Despite its small size, the municipality is divided into two parts, Oberfar and Unterfar. Meienried borders Safnern, Büren an der Aare, Dotzigen and Scheuren. In the northeast of the municipality is a small quarry pond called Meienriedseeli.

name: Meierskappel
geography: Meierskappel lies on the foothills of Rooterberg and borders the Zugersee as the only Lucerne municipality. It extends to the viewpoint on the Michaelskreuz, which is almost 800 m above sea level. The municipality covers an area of 675 ha. The highest point is on Rooterberg at 795 m above sea level, the lowest on Zugersee at 413 m above sea level.

name: Meilen
geography: Meilen is located on the middle right bank of Lake Zurich, between Rapperswil-Jona and Zurich. It includes the districts of Feldmeilen, Obermeilen and Dorfmeilen on the lake shore, as well as Bergmeilen uphill. The municipality is separated from Egg by the Pfannenstiel. Horgen and Wädenswil are located on the opposite side of the lake.

name: Meinisberg
geography: Meinisberg lies in the Seeland region on the Häftli, a former loop of the Aare river. The municipality is situated at the foot of the Büttenberg mountain. To protect against flooding, Meinisberg was built on slightly higher ground. It lies between 430 m above sea level on the Bockeggen and 551 m above sea level on the Berg.

name: Meiringen
geography: Meiringen lies in the eastern Bernese Oberland, in the Haslital on the upper reaches of the Aare, which flows west towards Lake Brienz. It is located at the foot of various passes that enable crossings over the surrounding mountain ranges: to the east the Susten Pass to the canton of Uri, to the southeast the Grimsel Pass to the canton of Valais and to the northwest the Brünig Pass to the canton of Obwalden.

name: Melchnau
geography: Melchnau is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland, bordering the canton of Lucerne. The village is mainly situated in the valley of the Dorfbach stream, a left tributary of the Rot (Murg). The municipality covers an area of 10.28 km², with nearly one-third of the area (3.19 km²) being wooded. In 2014, 57.4% of the municipal area was agricultural land.
appearance: The description mentions that the church and schoolhouse characterize Melchnau's townscape (Ortsbild).

name: Melide
geography: Melide is located on Lake Lugano, below Monte San Salvatore on the western side of the Melide dam, which bridges the lake strait between Melide and Bissone. Neighboring municipalities are Lugano to the north, the Italian exclave and municipality of Campione d’Italia and Bissone to the east, Vico Morcote to the south, and Lugano to the west.

name: Mellikon
geography: Mellikon is located on the High Rhine on the border with Germany. The village lies on the northern edge of the Tafeljura, about two hundred meters from the southern bank of the Rhine in the narrow river plain. The southern half of the village is surrounded by two steeply rising hills: Güggehübucks and Haslibucks. The highest point is at 556 meters on the Haslibuck, and the lowest is at 333 meters on the Rhine.
appearance: No information about the town's appearance was found in the provided text.

name: Mellingen
geography: Mellingen is located halfway between Baden and Lenzburg on the Reuss river. The historical core is on the left side of the Reuss. The built-up area extends over the plain by the river and is bordered by the terminal moraine and the Wagenrain. The Reuss flows through a valley above Mellingen and breaks through the terminal moraine in a gorge. The Gruemet hill is a relic of the moraine created by the glacier during the last ice age.

name: Mels
geography: Mels lies in the Seez valley and is the largest municipality in the canton in terms of area. It is located between the Gonzen mountain, the Rhine and the Seez. The mountain Pizol is located on the municipality area. The lowest point is the Seezebene (457 m above sea level) and the highest is the Grosse Scheibe (2936 m above sea level).

name: Mendrisio
geography: Mendrisio is located on the Laveggio River, about 18 kilometers south of Lugano and about five kilometers from the border with Italy. The municipality extends up to the "Bellavista" area on Monte Generoso.

name: Menziken
geography: Menziken is located in the upper Wynental valley and borders the canton of Lucerne. The village stretches across the entire width of the trough-shaped Wyna valley. The Ischlag forms the natural border to the Seetal in the east. West of the village lies the former municipality of Burg. The terrain rises to the Stierenberg.
appearance: The five villages Menziken, Burg, Beinwil am See, Pfeffikon and Reinach have merged into a contiguous agglomeration with around 20,000 inhabitants; the boundaries between the once separate settlements are hardly recognizable.

name: Menzingen
geography: Menzingen lies in the hilly landscape in the northeastern part of the Canton of Zug and borders the Canton of Zurich. The municipality consists of the three localities Edlibach, Finstersee and Menzingen. 61.7% agricultural, 28.6% forest, 8.3% settlement area and 1.3% unproductive area. Neighbouring municipalities are Neuheim ZG, Horgen, Wädenswil, Oberägeri, Unterägeri and Baar ZG.

name: Menznau
geography: Menznau is located southeast of Willisau, bordering several municipalities including Buttisholz, Grosswangen, and Wolhusen. It features a diverse landscape, with a strongly wooded hilly area in the west and south and a cleared plateau in the east and north. A narrow valley runs between these extremes, traversed by the Seewag river. The Chrachebach and Kleine Fontanne rivers form the southern boundary.
appearance: Menznau consists of several parts, including Menznau-Dorf located 4 km northwest of Wolhusen. The municipality includes Geiss on the southwest slope of the Geissberg.  Twerenegg lies in the hill country 3.5 kilometers southwest of the village. Menzberg is the largest settlement after the village.

name: Merenschwand
geography: Merenschwand is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Muri district, in the Reuss Valley on the border with the cantons of Zurich and Zug. The main settlement is on the edge of the Reuss plain, west of the river. Benzenschwil is southwest of it on the foothills of Lindenberg. The area is dominated by the Reuss floodplain, with the Wissenbach flowing from southwest to northeast.

name: Mergoscia
geography: Mergoscia is located in the lower Verzasca Valley on the western slope above the Lago di Vogorno reservoir. Access is via Contra, not Gordola like the other villages in the valley. Neighboring municipalities are Avegno Gordevio, Brione sopra Minusio, Gordola, Tenero-Contra and Verzasca.

name: Merishausen
geography: Merishausen is located about 7 km north of the cantonal capital Schaffhausen in the Merishausertal, nestled between seven hills. The Durach flows through the village. The Hagen, part of the Randen, and at 912 m above sea level, is the highest point in the canton of Schaffhausen.

name: Mervelier
geography: Mervelier is located at 556 m above sea level, 13 km east of Delémont. The village stretches along the Scheltenbach in Val Terbi, the easternmost section of the Delsberg Basin. The municipality includes a section of the Delsberg Basin plain on both sides of the Scheltenbach, and extends to the Jurakamm Les Faivelies and the deeply incised valley of the upper Scheltenbach. The Schönenberg reaches 1140 m above sea level.
appearance: The text does not provide a direct description of how the town looks. It is described as a former street and stream village along the Scheltenbach (La Scheulte) in the Val Terbi.

name: Merzligen
geography: Merzligen is located in the Seeland administrative district of the Swiss Canton of Bern. It includes the southern part of the hamlet of St. Niklaus.

name: Mesocco
geography: Mesocco is the northernmost municipality in the Misox valley. Its area is 164.9 km², making it one of the largest in the canton. It includes the villages of Pian San Giacomo (1170 m above sea level) and San Bernardino (1626 m above sea level). The municipality extends up to the Tambohorn (3279 m above sea level) on the Alpine divide, which marks the border with Italy.
appearance: South of the village, the Castello di Mesocco, located on a rocky spur, dominates the valley. Below the ruins is the church of Santa Maria del Castello, important for its art-historically valuable monthly images. The municipality consists of eleven hamlets and is the seat of secondary schools, the district court and numerous administrative offices.

name: Messen
geography: Messen is located at 505 m above sea level, 15 km south-southwest of Solothurn. The village extends slightly elevated on the southern edge of the Limpach Valley, at the foot of the Rapperswil hills, in the Solothurn Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Rapperswil Plateau and the Limpach Valley. The Limpach stream runs through the plain. South of the valley, the area extends to the Rapperswil hills, reaching a height of 563 m.

name: Mettauertal
geography: Mettauertal is located in the Fricktal region, bordering Germany. It lies in the Tafeljura mountains between the Aare and Rhine valleys and consists of five villages and several hamlets. The Etzgerbach and Mettauerbach rivers flow through the area. The village lies in the valley floor surrounded by hills which rise to high plains. Elevations range from 300 to 649 meters above sea level.

name: Mettembert
geography: Mettembert is located at 660 m above sea level, 4 km north-northwest of Delémont. The farming village extends on a south-facing terrace above the valley of Mettembert, in the hilly zone of the northern Jura. The area extends from the Ruisseau de Mettembert to the narrow ridge of the Ordon.

name: Mettmenstetten
geography: Mettmenstetten lies in the southwest of the canton of Zurich. It is the second largest municipality in the Affoltern district. The village is 17 km from Zurich and 12 km from Zug.  The municipality includes the hamlets of Dachlissen, Eigi, Grossholz, Herferswil, Hübscheren, Rossau and Wissenbach. Most of the area is agricultural land (64.3%), 19.1% is forest, 9.9% is settlement area and 5.8% is traffic area.

name: Metzerlen-Mariastein
geography: Metzerlen-Mariastein lies at 526 m above sea level, 14 km southwest of Basel. The village of Metzerlen extends on a slope at the foot of the Blauen Jura chain, above the plateau of Metzerlen, in the Solothurn exclave of the Leimental valley, near the border with France. The area includes a section of the northern Jura with the Usserholz ridge, the valley of Metzerlen-Mariastein, and the Blauen chain, reaching 875 m at Challplatten.

name: Mex (VD)
geography: Mex is located at 482 m above sea level, 8 km northwest of Lausanne. The village extends on the high plateau in the extreme south of the Gros de Vaud, east of the Venoge valley, in the Waadtland Mittelland.  The municipality covers an area of 2.9 km² on the Gros de Vaud, the granary of the canton of Vaud. The municipal area extends eastward from the Mex terrace into the Bois Bahud forest area on both sides of the Goille valley.

name: Meyriez
geography: Merlach lies at 435 m above sea level, 1 km southwest of Murten. The village stretches along the southern shore of Lake Murten and on the edge of the adjacent Molassehöhen, in the northern Freiburger Mittelland. It encompasses a section on the southern shore of Murtensee.
appearance: The settlement area of Merlach has completely merged with that of Murten. The municipality is the smallest in the canton of Fribourg. Today the municipality is largely built over.

name: Meyrin
geography: Meyrin is a municipality in the Canton of Geneva in Switzerland, bordering France. It is located approximately 5 kilometers southeast of Geneva. The northern border also marks the border between Switzerland and France (Département Ain).

name: Mézières (FR)
geography: Mézières is located at 760 m above sea level, two kilometers south-southeast of Romont. The farming village stretches in a scenic location on the western slope of the ridge between the Glâne and the Neirigue, above the Glâne plain southeast of Romont, in the higher Fribourg Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the Molasse hilly landscape in the Fribourg Central Plateau. The valley plain on the upper reaches of the Glâne belongs to Mézières. The highest point is Les Brévires at 853 m above sea level.

name: Mezzovico-Vira
geography: Mezzovico-Vira is located at 460 m above sea level on the right bank of the Vedeggio river, about 10 kilometers north of Lugano.

name: Mies
geography: Mies lies at 410 m above sea level in the southwest of Waadt, 12 km north of Geneva. The village stretches near the west bank of Lake Geneva on a gently sloping slope towards the lake, south of the small valley of the Nant stream. The municipality includes a section on the west bank of Lake Geneva, stretching from the lake shore westwards.
appearance: Mies includes extensive detached house and villa districts as well as the Veytay estate on the high ridge.

name: Milvignes
geography: Milvignes is located on the northwestern shore of Lake Neuchâtel, southwest of the cantonal capital Neuchâtel. The neighboring municipalities of Milvignes are Neuchâtel to the northeast, Boudry to the south, and Rochefort to the west.

name: Minusio
geography: Minusio is a neighboring town of Locarno and borders Muralto, Orselina, Avegno Gordevio, Brione sopra Minusio and Tenero-Contra. It lies between Lago Maggiore and Cardada and consists of the districts Borenco, Brighirolo, Cadogno, Ceresol, Ciossi, Fontile, Frizzi, Mappo, Mezzo, Mondacce and Rivapiana.

name: Mirchel
geography: Mirchel lies in the pre-alpine hilly landscape at 669 m above sea level, about 16 km southeast of Bern. The village stretches in the wide valley of the Chise river, which connects the Aare valley to the Emmental. The municipality covers a section of the pre-alpine hills east of the Aare valley, including the Erlessenhubel and the Appenberg.
appearance: Mirchel is a farming village in the Chise valley.

name: Misery-Courtion
geography: Misery-Courtion is located at 581 m above sea level, 9 km northwest of Fribourg. The municipality extends on a high plateau east of the Chandon, in the Molasse hilly landscape of the northern Fribourg Central Plateau. The area encompasses a section of the Molasse heights shaped by the Ice Age Rhone Glacier between the Broye Plain and the Saane Valley.

name: Moiry
geography: Moiry is located at 625 m above sea level, 16 km north of Morges. It is situated on a southeast-facing slope at the southern foot of the Jura, above the valley of the upper Venoge, in the Vaudois Midlands. The municipality's area extends to a section at the southern foot of the Jura. The southeastern border runs along the Venoge river.

name: Molondin
geography: Molondin is situated at 611 m above sea level, 9 km east of Yverdon-les-Bains. It lies in an open, stream-carved basin east of the Mentue valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. The area includes a section of the hilly landscape between Lake Neuchâtel and the Broye valley. The valley of the Flonzel is bordered to the west by the Derrière Loussot ridge (652 m above sea level) and to the east by the Démoret plateau.

name: Montagny-près-Yverdon
geography: Montagny-près-Yverdon liegt auf 455 m ü. M., 2,5 km nordwestlich von Yverdon-les-Bains. Das Haufendorf erstreckt sich leicht erhöht am Nordrand der Ebene von Yverdon, westlich des Neuenburgersees, im Waadtländer Mittelland. Das Gemeindegebiet umfasst einen Abschnitt des nördlichen Waadtländer Mittellandes. Der höchste Punkt befindet sich mit 500 m ü. M. auf dem Sporn über dem Tal der Brine. Im Süden erstreckt sich der Gemeindeboden bis an den Fuss des Mont de Chamblon. Nach Osten reicht das Gebiet bis an das Ufer des Neuenburgersees.

name: Montanaire
geography: The municipality of Montanaire lies east of the river Mentue, in the northeastern part of the district Gros-de-Vaud. The villages are scattered over the hilly landscape on both sides of the watershed between the river areas of the Mentue and the Broye. In the middle lies the large forest area Les Bourlayes, in which the hill of Bois Savary with 860 m above sea level forms the highest point in the municipality.

name: Montcherand
geography: Montcherand is located at 556 m above sea level, 2 km northwest of Orbe. The village is situated in the Vaudois Central Plateau, on an east-facing slope on the Jura foothills, north of the Orbe valley. The municipality covers a section of the Jura foothills plateau. The southern border runs along the Orbe River.
appearance: Montcherand is a farming village situated on an east-facing slope on the Jura foothills.

name: Montfaucon
geography: Montfaucon is situated at 996 m above sea level, five kilometers northeast of Saignelégier. The village stretches along a ridge on the Jura plateau of the northeastern Freiberge, south of the deeply incised valley of the Doubs. The area encompasses a section of the slightly undulating plateau Jura, with moorish depressions and limestone peaks. The northern part is occupied by a mountain ridge (up to 1031 m above sea level).

name: Monthey
geography: Monthey is located on the Rhône river, which forms the northeastern boundary of the municipality and marks the border of Valais with the canton of Vaud. The town also includes the village of Choëx, the hamlets of Outrevièze and Les Giettes, two exclaves in the municipality of Collombey-Muraz, and one in the Vièze de Morgins source area. The highest point of Monthey, the Pointe de Chésery, is 2249 m above sea level.

name: Mont-Tramelan
geography: Mont-Tramelan is located at 1060 m above sea level, 17 km northwest of Biel, near Tramelan. The settlement is north of the Jura chain of Montagne du Droit, on the edge of the Franches-Montagnes plateau. The area extends to the edge of the La Tourbière peat bog. The highest point is at 1200 m above sea level on the north slope of Montagne du Droit.
appearance: The settlement consists of numerous individual farms, including Les Vacheries Brunier at the pass from Tramelan to Les Breuleux.

name: Mont-Vully
geography: Mont-Vully is a municipality in the Canton of Fribourg, Switzerland. It is located in the See district. The new municipality was formed on January 1, 2016, from the merger of the former municipalities of Bas-Vully and Haut-Vully. It lies on the Fribourg part of Mont Vully and consists of villages and hamlets on the northern shore of Lake Murten.

name: Moosleerau
geography: Moosleerau lies in the upper Suhre valley in Aargau, bordering the canton of Lucerne. The village is on the eastern edge of a flat valley plain, situated on a slightly elevated lateral moraine formed during the Würm Ice Age. The Suhre river forms the western boundary. East of the village rises the Stieregart. A side valley extends south, between the Stieregart and the Längegg, reaching up to the Nütziweid and Rossrücken, forming the border to the Rueder valley.
appearance: The text mentions that the settlement is coalesced with Kirchleerau.

name: Moosseedorf
geography: Moosseedorf is located at 532 m above sea level, 8 km northeast of Bern. The village extends slightly elevated south of the Moossee, at the southeastern end of the Moosseetal and at the northern foot of the Molassehöhen of the Bantigers. The municipality area includes a section of the central Berner Mittellandes. The northern border runs along the channelized Urtenen and through the Moossee.

name: Morlon
geography: Morlon is located at 751 m above sea level, 2.5 km east-northeast of Bulle. The village extends on a promontory in a panoramic location about 80 m above the western shore of the Gruyère lake.  Morlon has a large share in the southern section of Lake Gruyère; The area extends to the mouth of the Saane. The highest point of the municipality reaches 831 m above sea level.

name: Morrens (VD)
geography: Morrens is located at 702 m above sea level, 8 km north of Lausanne. The village extends on a slope on the western edge of the Jorat, between the Talent in the north and the Mèbre in the south, in the southern Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The highest point in the municipality, also called Le Signal, is reached at 718 m above sea level.

name: Mörschwil
geography: Mörschwil is located in the Canton of St. Gallen. The municipality consists of loosely connected hamlets with a small village center. It borders the eastern end of the city of St. Gallen and extends towards Lake Constance (Bodensee). The area is bordered by the rivers Goldach and Steinach.
appearance: The municipality has transformed from an agricultural structure to a classic suburban community.

name: Moudon
geography: Moudon lies at 510 m above sea level, 19.5 km southwest of Payerne. The historic town extends in the middle Broye valley, on both sides of the Broye River, in the area of the mouth of the Mérine stream, surrounded by the heights of the Molasse hill country in the eastern Vaudois Mittelland.
appearance: Moudon has a historic old town in the middle Broye valley.

name: Mühlau
geography: Mühlau is located in the canton of Aargau, in the district of Muri. It lies on the Reuss river, which forms the border with the canton of Zug. The main settlement of Mühlau is located about half a kilometer from the bank of the Reuss on the easternmost foothills of the Lindenberg on the alluvial fan of the Sembach.  The Reuss plain widens near the village of Mühlau.

name: Mühleberg
geography: Mühleberg lies on a wooded and undulating high plateau with large differences in altitude. In the north, the Aare and Wohlensee, in the west the Saane and in the east the Forstwald form the municipality boundaries; on the south side the transition is fluid.

name: Müllheim
geography: Müllheim lies in the Thurtal valley, near the Grüneck highway interchange, along the Swiss A7 motorway. It shares a train station with Wigoltingen on the Winterthur–Romanshorn railway line. It is about 10 km from Steckborn on the Lower Lake Constance (Untersee) in the north, and about 19 km from Konstanz on Lake Constance in the northeast. Neighboring municipalities are Pfyn, Homburg, and Hüttlingen in the Frauenfeld district, and Wigoltingen in the Weinfelden district.

name: Münchenbuchsee
geography: Münchenbuchsee is located approximately 10 kilometers north of Bern. It includes the settlements of Hofwil and Diemerswil, as well as the Waldegg neighborhood. Neighboring municipalities, starting from the north, are Deisswil bei Münchenbuchsee, Wiggiswil, Moosseedorf, Zollikofen, Kirchlindach, Schüpfen, and Rapperswil.

name: Münchenwiler
geography: Münchenwiler is a municipality that forms a Bernese exclave within the Seebezirk, which belongs to the Canton of Fribourg. It is located 15 kilometers from Fribourg, 30 kilometers from Bern, and 28 kilometers from Neuenburg.

name: Münchwilen (TG)
geography: Münchwilen lies in the Hinterthurgau region and forms an agglomeration with Sirnach. It is located approximately four kilometers west of the city of Wil in the canton of St. Gallen. The Murg river flows through Münchwilen.
appearance: The article doesn't explicitly describe the town's appearance.

name: Münsingen
geography: Münsingen is located in the Aare valley between the cities of Bern and Thun. The municipality belongs to the administrative district of Bern-Mittelland.
appearance: The original village had two cores: the Vorderdorf (a rural-commercial settlement at the exit of the Mühletal) and the Hinterdorf with church, rectory and the two old inns "Bären" and "Löwen".

name: Muntogna da Schons
geography: Muntogna da Schons is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It is located on the Schamserberg (rätoromanisch Muntogna da Schons) and includes the villages of Casti, Donat, Farden, Lohn, Mathon, Pazen and Wergenstein and belongs to the Viamala region. The municipal office is located in Farden.

name: Muri bei Bern
geography: Muri bei Bern is located in the Bern-Mittelland administrative district of the Canton of Bern. The municipality is composed of two main parts: Muri and Gümligen. The municipality covers 763 hectares, of which 150 hectares are wooded, 190 hectares are fields and meadows, and 339 hectares are in the building zone. The highest point is 741 m on the Dentenberg, and the lowest is 508 m on the Aare River.

name: Mutrux
geography: Mutrux is located at 748 m above sea level, 13 km northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The farming village extends on a clearing on the eastern slope of Mont Aubert, in a panoramic location about 300 m above the level of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality area includes a section on the southern slope of the Jura, the highest point of Mutrux is at 1120 m above sea level on the slope of Mont Aubert.
appearance: The text describes Mutrux as a farming village on a clearing on the eastern slope of Mont Aubert, in a panoramic location.

name: Neuenegg
geography: Neuenegg lies about 12 km southwest of Bern in the lower Sense Valley. The area is 21.83 km², of which 12.50 km² is designated as arable land or meadows, and 7.66 km² as forest. The southern border of the municipality is formed by the natural border of the Sense, which is also the cantonal border (Bern/Fribourg).

name: Neuenkirch
geography: Neuenkirch is located southeast of Lake Sempach. It consists of the districts of Neuenkirch, Sempach Station and Hellbühl, with Hellbühl comprising the southern part, Neuenkirch the center and Sempach Station the northern part of the municipality.
appearance: The largest settlement in the municipality is Neuenkirch Dorf, which has grown together with the hamlets of Nellen, Werligen, Klosterhöfli, Klösterli and Lippenrüti to form a long linear village along the Emmenbrücke-Sursee road.

name: Neuheim
geography: Neuheim is located on the northern edge of the Canton of Zug, nestled between the rivers Sihl and Lorze. Neighboring municipalities are Menzingen to the south, Baar to the west, Hausen am Albis to the north, and Horgen to the northeast (both in the Canton of Zurich). About 65.0% of the municipality's area is agricultural land, 17.9% is forest, 15.9% is settlement area, and 1.1% is unproductive area.

name: Neunkirch
geography: Neunkirch is located in Klettgau, about 13 km west of Schaffhausen.  In the southeast, the border between Germany and Switzerland runs.
appearance: Null

name: Niederdorf
geography: Niederdorf is located in the Waldenburg Valley on the Vorderen Frenke, midway between Liestal and Waldenburg.

name: Niedergesteln
geography: The municipality is located in the north of the Swiss Rhone Valley at the foot of the Gestelnburg, built in the 12th century. 1213 hectares belong to the UNESCO World Natural Heritage Site Swiss Alps Jungfrau-Aletsch.
appearance: The village is characterized by the village center and the Jolibach gorge.

name: Niederglatt
geography: Niederglatt lies in the Zürcher Unterland on both sides of the Glatt river. To the north are the city of Bülach and the municipality of Höri, to the southwest the municipality of Niederhasli, and to the southeast the municipality of Oberglatt ZH. To the northwest, the Neeracherried, a nature reserve of national importance, borders the municipality. The municipality includes the districts of Nöschikon and Grafschaft.

name: Niedergösgen
geography: Niedergösgen lies at 377 m above sea level, about halfway between Olten and Aarau, 4.5 km southwest of Aarau. The village stretches along the left bank of the Aare opposite Schönenwerd, at the southern foot of the Jura, in the easternmost part of the Solothurn Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Solothurn Niederamt.

name: Niederhasli
geography: Niederhasli lies in the Glatttal valley before the entrance to the Wehntal valley, between Dielsdorf and Rümlang. This area is part of the Zürcher Unterland. The municipality includes the villages of Oberhasli, Mettmenhasli, and Nassenwil, the hamlet of Kastelhof, the Steinacker farmstead, and several individual farms.

name: Niederhelfenschwil
geography: Niederhelfenschwil is located on a plateau north of the Thur river, between the cities of Wil and Bischofszell. It borders the canton of Thurgau to the north. The landscape, once a drumlin landscape, is characterized by rural settlements and wooded areas.
appearance: Many new residential buildings have strongly changed the architectural character in recent years. The municipality consists of the villages of Niederhelfenschwil, Lenggenwil and Zuckenriet.

name: Niederhünigen
geography: Niederhünigen is located at 685 m above sea level, 1.5 km east of Konolfingen and 16 km east-southeast of Bern. The farming village extends on the alluvial fan of the Hünigenbach on the eastern edge of the broad valley of the Chise, at the northwestern foot of the Kurzenberg.

name: Niederlenz
geography: Niederlenz is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Lenzburg district. It lies in the center of the canton in the lower Seetal, two kilometers north of Lenzburg. The area is characterized by a flat plateau and divided into two halves by the Aabach stream. The highest point is 430 meters, and the lowest is 355 meters above sea level. The geographical center of Aargau is located northwest of the village center.

name: Niedermuhlern
geography: Niedermuhlern is located at 829 m above sea level, 10 km south of the cantonal capital Bern. The village is located on the heights of the Längenberg west of the Gürbe valley, in a hollow in the source area of the Scherlibach, at the northern foot of the Bütschelegg.

name: Niederried bei Interlaken
geography: Niederried bei Interlaken liegt im Berner Oberland am Nordufer des Brienzersees. Die Nachbargemeinden von Norden beginnend im Uhrzeigersinn sind Habkern, Oberried am Brienzersee und Ringgenberg. Höchster Gipfel ist der Suggiture (2085 m ü. M.) an der nördlichen Gemeindegrenze. Der tiefste Punkt ist der Brienzersee mit 564 m

name: Niederrohrdorf
geography: Niederrohrdorf is located at the foot of the Rohrdorferberg, part of the Heitersberg hills, which separates the Reuss and Limmat valleys. The village center is located on the edge of the Reuss glacier's outwash plain, with several moraines. The northern Hiltiberg is the most prominent moraine. Smaller outcrops of Nagelfluh rock exist. Several wetlands have formed between the moraines.
appearance: The village's development is fully merged with the higher-lying Oberrohrdorf. Holzrüti is located approximately 1.5 km southwest of the center. Vogelrüti lies about 1 km south of the center. Unlike Niederrohrdorf, these two parts are still rural.

name: Niederweningen
geography: Niederweningen lies between Egg and the Lägern at the western end of the Wehntal valley, which is drained by the Surb river. The municipality's highest elevation is the Burghorn at 859 m above sea level on the Lägern ridge.

name: Noble-Contrée
geography: Noble-Contrée is a municipality in the district of Siders in the canton of Valais in Switzerland.

name: Nods
geography: Nods is located at 885 m above sea level, 13 km west of Biel. The village stretches on the lower southern slope of the Chasseral, about 80 m above the high plateau of the Montagne de Diesse above Lake Biel. The area extends over the southern slope of the Jura mountain chain of the Chasseral up to its summit at 1607 m.

name: Nottwil
geography: Nottwil is a municipality located on the western shore of Lake Sempach, between Sempach and Sursee. In addition to the main settlement, which consists of the upper and lower villages, it includes numerous scattered hamlets and groups of houses. The hamlets of Oberei and Ei have grown together with the village. Büel lies west of the village. The districts of Maienbach and Eggerswil are located on Lake Sempach, southeast of Nottwil village.

name: Novalles
geography: Novalles lies at 571 m above sea level, 6 km north-northwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The farming village extends on a terrain terrace at the southern foot of the Jura above the valley of the Arnon. The area extends from the course of the Arnon northwards over the terrace of Novalles and the steep slope of the Chasseron chain, where the highest point of the municipality is reached at 1060 m above sea level.
appearance: The article does not contain information about the village's appearance.

name: Novazzano
geography: Novazzano is located at 346 m above sea level on the border with Italy, 3 km (as the crow flies) south of the Mendrisio station on the Bellinzona-Lugano-Chiasso line of the Gotthard railway. The municipality includes the districts Brusata, Gaggio, Boscherina, Casate, Canova, Castel di Sotto and Pobbia.

name: Noville
geography: Noville lies at 378 m above sea level, 8 km northwest of Aigle. The village extends in the wide valley plain east of the Rhone, shortly before it flows into Lake Geneva, at the foot of the Vaud Alps. The municipality covers a section of the Rhone Valley. The municipal area extends from the channelled course of the Rhône eastwards over the flat valley basin and the Grand Canal.  The eastern boundary is the Eau Froide, which flows into Lake Geneva.

name: Nuglar-St. Pantaleon
geography: Nuglar-Sankt Pantaleon lies at 488 m above sea level, about 4 km southwest of Liestal. The village of Nuglar extends on an east-facing plateau, the lower layer of the Gempenplateau in the Tafeljura, above the Oristal. The area encompasses a section of the northern Jura. The eastern border is the Orisbach. The highest elevation is reached at the Wacht with 715 m above sea level.

name: Nunningen
geography: Nunningen is located at 621 m above sea level, 10 km east-southeast of Laufen. The village stretches in a longitudinal trough of the northern Solothurn folded Jura, in the source area of the Chastelbach, which drains to the Birs, in the Schwarzbubenland. It forms the center of the Gilgenbergerland.

name: Nürensdorf
geography: Nürensdorf is located on the western flank of a gentle hill that separates the city of Zurich from Winterthur. The center of Nürensdorf lies at 502 m above sea level. The entire municipal area is 1009 ha. Of this, 46.6% is used for agriculture, 31.2% for forest, 16.7% for settlements and 5.5% for transport (as of 2018).
appearance: The old village center surrounds the main intersection, which was equipped with a traffic light system. The municipality includes the districts of Birchwil, Oberwil and Breite as well as the hamlets of Breitenloo, Hakab and Kleinhaus. The surrounding districts and hamlets are relatively widely scattered: A forest separates the parts Birchwil and Oberwil from Nürensdorf's core.

name: Nusshof
geography: Nusshof is a small, formerly agricultural village and the third smallest municipality in the canton after Kilchberg and Liedertswil. Its neighboring municipalities are (from the north clockwise) Magden, Wintersingen, Sissach, Hersberg and Olsberg (exclave).
appearance: N/A

name: Nuvilly
geography: Nuvilly is located at 629 m above sea level, 9 km west-southwest of Payerne in the Fribourg exclave of Estavayer-le-Lac. The village stretches on a promontory on the eastern slope of the Petite Glâne valley, in the Molasse hills of the northwestern Fribourg Mittelland. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills between Lake Neuchâtel and the middle Broye valley.
appearance: The description of the town's appearance is missing from the provided HTML content. Returning NULL.

name: Nyon
geography: Nyon is a town located on the northwestern shore of Lake Geneva. The town center sits at 403 meters above sea level, about 30 meters above the lake, where the lower town and port of Nyon are located. The town is 34 kilometers from Lausanne and 22 kilometers from Geneva.

name: Oberägeri
geography: Oberägeri is located in the Canton of Zug in central Switzerland. It lies in a high valley directly on the northern shore of Lake Ägeri, which is 724 m above sea level. Oberägeri also includes the villages of Alosen, Böschi and Morgarten.

name: Oberbalm
geography: Oberbalm is located in a pre-Alpine hilly region between Bern and Schwarzenburg. The lowest point is around 650 m above sea level on the Scherlibach, where the municipality borders its most important neighboring village, Niederscherli, in the municipality of Köniz, and the highest point is on the Tschuggenhubel at 987 m above sea level, near the border with the neighboring municipality of Niedermuhlern. In addition to the actual village center, the southern part of Borisried also belongs to Oberbalm.

name: Oberbipp
geography: Oberbipp is located at 500 m above sea level, 12 km northeast of Solothurn. The village extends on the flat alluvial cone formed by the Dorfbach stream at the southern foot of the Jura mountains, on the slightly undulating Bipperamt area at the foot of Höllchöpfli, in Upper Aargau. The municipality covers a section of the northern Bernese Mittelland.

name: Oberbuchsiten
geography: Oberbuchsiten is a municipality in the Gäu district of the canton of Solothurn in Switzerland.

name: Oberbüren
geography: Oberbüren is a municipality in the Fürstenland (Wahlkreis Wil), canton of St. Gallen. With the villages of Oberbüren, Niederwil and Sonnental and the hamlet Staubhusen, the municipality lies at the confluence of the Glatt into the Thur. The highest point of the municipality is the Schentis near Sidenberg in the Niederwil part of the municipality (660 m above sea level). The lowest point is 484 m above sea level on the Thur, on the border with the municipality of Niederbüren.
appearance: The Benedictine Abbey of St. Gallen Mountain, colloquially known as Glattburg Monastery, stands northeast of the Glatt estuary, over a steep slope on the Thur.

name: Oberburg
geography: Oberburg is located at 547 m above sea level, 2 km south of Burgdorf. The village stretches in the Emmental, on the western edge of the Emme valley, in the Molasse hills of the Swiss Mittelland. The municipality covers an area of the Emmental valley floor to the Molasse hills with Rothöhe, Gibelwald and Hasliberg.

name: Oberdiessbach
geography: Oberdiessbach is located at 605 m above sea level, 9 km north of Thun. The village extends in a valley widening of the Chise valley, at the mouth of the Diessbach into the Chise, surrounded by the ridges of the Haubenwald, the Kurzenberg and the Falkenflue. The area is traversed by the Chise valley from north to south. The highest point is reached above the Aeschlenalp at 1196 m above sea level.
appearance: Oberdiessbach includes extensive residential areas on the southern slope of the Haubenwald and at the foot of the Falkenflue, the villages of Aeschlen and Bleiken, as well as some isolated farms.

name: Oberdorf (BL)
geography: Oberdorf is located in the Oberbaselbiet in the Waldenburgertal on the Vorderen Frenke river, between Liestal and Waldenburg. The municipality borders Niederdorf to the north, Bennwil to the east, Langenbruck to the southeast, Waldenburg to the south, Liedertswil to the southwest, and Titterten to the northwest.

name: Oberdorf (NW)
geography: Oberdorf is located at the entrance of the Engelbergertal. The municipality stretches from the Stanser Boden plain to the alpine meadows and alps at the Brisen. The southwest flank of the Buochserhorns also belongs to Oberdorf.
appearance: Oberdorf has changed in the last 30 years. Until then, the population consisted almost exclusively of farmers, craftsmen, and some employees of military establishments. Since the 1970s, there has been a strong construction boom, which has brought the municipality strong immigration and new, scattered residential quarters. The district of Oberdorf used to consist almost exclusively of farms, it has no real village center. The local council has been trying to create a village center from the scattered settlements in recent years.

name: Oberdorf (SO)
geography: Oberdorf is located at 559 m above sea level, 3.5 km northwest of Solothurn. The village stretches along both sides of the Wildbach stream, at the southern foot of the Jura mountains, at the foot of the Weissenstein. The municipality covers an area of 11.9 km² encompassing a section of the southern slope of the Jura. The Weissenstein chain with numerous rock bands is included. The highest point is the Dilitschkopf at 1333 m above sea level.
appearance: The original street village is situated in a scenic location on both sides of the Wildbach stream, at the southern foot of the Jura, at the foot of the Weissenstein.

name: Oberembrach
geography: Oberembrach lies at 459 m above sea level in the eastern Zurich Unterland in a wooded landscape, surrounded by gentle hills. It includes the valley of the Wildbach in the lower Tösstal with the side valleys of the Moosbach and Tüfbach as well as the Dürstental. The municipal area ranges from 437 m above sea level on the Wildbach near Bächli to 644 m above sea level in the Langacher, or up to 647 m above sea level on the adjacent, artificially piled-up viewing platform between Oberwagenburg and Stiegen.

name: Oberems
geography: Oberems is located in the German-speaking part of the Swiss canton of Wallis. The municipality has an altitude ranging from 1012 to 4192 meters above sea level.

name: Oberengstringen
geography: Oberengstringen is located on the outskirts of Zurich, on the right side of the Limmat River, bordering the Höngg district. 20.2% of the municipality's area is used for agriculture, 23.9% is covered with forest, 7.5% is for transport, and 44.1% is settlement area, with 4.2% being bodies of water.

name: Oberentfelden
geography: Oberentfelden lies in the lower Suhrental valley and borders the canton of Solothurn. The municipality extends from the wooded Schornig hill (596 m above sea level) in the east across the approximately two-kilometer-wide plain of the Suhrental to the Tann (502 m above sea level) in the west, another wooded hill. The settled area is in the plain. The plain is crossed by two small rivers, the Uerke and the Suhre.

name: Obergerlafingen
geography: Obergerlafingen lies at 462 m above sea level, 6 km southeast of Solothurn. The village stretches on the alluvial plain between the Emme River to the west and the Ösch to the east, on the Sagibach, in the southern Solothurn Mittelland.

name: Oberglatt
geography: Die Gemeinde Oberglatt umfasst den beidseits der Glatt gelegenen gleichnamigen Ort, den Ortsteil Hofstetten, eine ehemalige Zivilgemeinde, sowie das auf dem rechten Ufer der Glatt liegende Gebiet Grafschaft. Von der Gemeindefläche sind 48,1 % landwirtschaftliche Nutzflächen, 11,3 % sind Wald, 14,0 % sind Siedlungsfläche, und 18,8 % dienen dem Verkehr. 1,8 % sind Gewässer und 6,1 % unproduktive Fläche.

name: Obergoms
geography: The municipality of Obergoms is located in the upper part of Valais, below the Rhone Glacier, on the upper reaches of the Rhone. It includes the rearmost Rotten/Rhone valley between Ulrichen and Gletsch and the side valleys between Nufenen, Furka, Grimsel and the Dammastock. Obergoms has a tri-cantonal corner to Bern and Uri and one to Ticino and Uri.

name: Obergösgen
geography: Obergösgen lies at 390 m above sea level between Olten and Aarau, 4 km east-northeast of Olten. The village extends in a wide depression of the Aare valley north of the Aare at the southern foot of the Jura, in the east of the Solothurn Mittelland.

name: Oberhallau
geography: Oberhallau is located in the Schaffhausen Klettgau, nestled between Lugmer and Oberhallauer Berg at the foot of the vineyards. The neighboring villages are Hallau, Gächlingen and Neunkirch. In the northwest is the border between Germany and Switzerland.

name: Oberhof
geography: Oberhof is located in the south of the Fricktal region, bordering the canton of Solothurn. The village lies in the narrow valley north of the Benkerjoch, bordered by steep hills of the Jura mountains, including the Burg, Wasserflue, Asperstrihe, and Strihe. The Benkerjoch pass is located at the southeastern point. The area is part of the Jurapark Aargau. The highest point is 865 m ü. M. and the lowest is 455 m ü. M.
appearance: Null

name: Oberiberg
geography: Oberiberg is a municipality in the Schwyz district of the canton of Schwyz in Switzerland. It is located on the Ibergereggstrasse between Einsiedeln and Schwyz.

name: Oberkirch
geography: Oberkirch is a municipality in the Sursee constituency of the canton of Lucerne in Switzerland. It is located at the northwest end of Lake Sempach on the Suhre river and has grown together with the city of Sursee. In addition to the main settlement, the districts of Seehäusern and Kotten are also connected to the neighboring city. The hamlet Renzligen/Sennhof is located 2.2 km southwest, the hamlet Dogelzwil 1.5 km southwest, and the district St. Margrethen southeast of the village.

name: Oberkulm
geography: Oberkulm is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Kulm district, in the middle Wynental. The Wyna meanders along the western edge of the valley. The Tüetental branches off to the east. Between the main and side valleys rises the 583 meter high Ischlag, which merges into the Hohen Felsen (741 m above sea level).
appearance: The village is a scattered settlement that stretches over the entire valley floor and has loosely grown together with the buildings of Unterkulm.

name: Oberlangenegg
geography: Oberlangenegg is located on a plateau amidst a hilly landscape and is heavily wooded. The largest settlement is Kreuzweg. Of the total municipal area of 915 ha, 49.1% is covered by forest and woodland, 45.6% is agricultural land and only 4.5% is settlement area.

name: Oberried am Brienzersee
geography: Oberried am Brienzersee is located in the Berner Oberland on the northern shore of Lake Brienz. The neighboring municipalities are Flühli, Brienz, Niederried near Interlaken and Habkern. The highest mountain is the Tannhorn (2221 m above sea level) near the Ällgäuwlicka.

name: Oberrieden
geography: Oberrieden is located on several terraces on the left bank of Lake Zurich, about 11 km southeast of Zurich. The western boundary extends over the Zimmerberg into the Sihltal, the eastern boundary into the middle of Lake Zurich. The northern neighbor is Thalwil, the southern is Horgen.

name: Oberriet (SG)
geography: Oberriet is located in the heart of the St. Galler Rheintal, bordering Austria (Vorarlberg), limited by the Alpenrhein to the east and the foothills of the Alpstein mountains to the west. It is one of the larger municipalities in the canton of St. Gallen, with 34.5 square kilometers. The highest point is near Zapfen at 1302 m above sea level, and the lowest point is at 407 m above sea level near the 3-Brücken over the Rheintaler Binnenkanal.

name: Oberrohrdorf
geography: Oberrohrdorf lies on the edge of the Reuss valley, between Baden and the Mutschellenpass. The municipality lies about three kilometers east of the Reuss on the southwest slope of the Rohrdorferberg, part of the Heitersberg hills. The western part consists of gravel from the Würm ice age. Older gravel from the Riss ice age is found further uphill. The highest point is on the Heitersberg at 702 meters, the lowest at 455 meters.
appearance: Oberrohrdorf and Staretschwil have grown together with Niederrohrdorf. The boundaries between the once separate villages are barely recognizable.

name: Oberrüti
geography: Oberrüti is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Muri district, in the Reuss valley, bordering the canton of Zug. The village lies near the Reuss River at the foot of a moraine hill. The plain between the village and the river is flat, with two drumlins. The river is bordered by a flood protection dam.  A drainage canal runs parallel to the river.

name: Obersaxen Mundaun
geography: The municipality of Obersaxen Mundaun is located in the Surselva region of the canton of Graubünden, Switzerland. It was formed on January 1, 2016, from the former municipalities of Mundaun and Obersaxen.

name: Obersiggenthal
geography: Obersiggenthal is located on the eastern side of the Siggenthal, a gravel terrace on the northern bank of the Limmat.
