To the north, the Siggenberg forms a natural border with the Surbtal, while the Limmat separates the municipality from Baden. The municipality consists of the Ortsteilen Nussbaumen, Kirchdorf, Rieden, Tromsberg and Hertenstein.

name: Oberthal
geography: Oberthal lies in Emmental in the eastern part of Amt Konolfingen, at an average of 900 m above sea level. It's mainly an agricultural municipality with a scattered farm system. It is a popular destination for excursions and hiking for the Bern agglomeration.
appearance: It's an agricultural municipality with a scattered farm system (without a village center).

name: Oberuzwil
geography: Oberuzwil is located in Untertoggenburg in the canton of St. Gallen. The municipality covers 1408 hectares, of which 939 hectares are used for agriculture and 321 hectares are forest. The highest point is 854 meters above sea level, and the lowest is 509 meters above sea level.
appearance: The municipality includes the villages of Oberuzwil-Dorf (formerly Oberuzwil), Niederglatt and Bichwil. Each of the three villages consists of other small villages and hamlets.

name: Oberweningen
geography: Oberweningen is located in the Wehntal in the Zürcher Unterland. The municipality borders Schleinikon, Schöfflisdorf, Boppelsen, Bachs, Regensberg, Steinmaur and Siglistorf AG. 32.4% of the municipal area is used for agriculture, 56.0% is covered by forest, and 7.1% is settlement and 4.1% traffic area.

name: Oberwil (BL)
geography: Oberwil lies 5 km from Basel at 316 m above sea level in the Leimental on the eastern slope of the Bielhübels, with foothills on the western slope of the Bruderholzes. Its neighboring villages are Biel-Benken and Neuwiller in the west, Therwil in the south, Reinach in the southeast, Bottmingen and Binningen in the north, Allschwil in the northwest. The municipality covers 788 hectares, of which 45% is agricultural land, 20% forest, 34% settlement area and 1% unproductive area.

name: Oberwil bei Büren
geography: Oberwil bei Büren is a municipality surrounded by hills and forest, except towards Schnottwil. The neighboring municipalities are Rüti bei Büren, Buchegg, Biezwil, Schnottwil, and Büren an der Aare. The region's hilly terrain made it suitable for building mills in the late Middle Ages.

name: Oberwil im Simmental
geography: Oberwil im Simmental is located in the Berner Oberland in the Alps on the Simme river. The municipality consists of the Bäuerten Oberwil, Hintereggen, Pfaffenried, Bunschen and Waldried.

name: Oberwil-Lieli
geography: Oberwil-Lieli is located on the edge of the Mutschellen on the Holzbirrliberg, a gently undulating chain of hills east of the Reuss Valley. The municipality lies on a southwestern slope with distant views of the Alps. Oberwil is in the southwest of the municipality at 530 m above sea level. Three streams flow through deeply incised ravines, draining the plateau towards the Reuss. Lieli is located one kilometer northeast of Oberwil at 590 m above sea level.

name: Obfelden
geography: Obfelden is located in the Knonauer Amt on the Reuss River, which forms the cantonal border with Aargau. The municipality also borders the canton of Zug to the south. The municipality includes the hamlets of Unterlunnern, Oberlunnern, Wolsen, Toussen and Bickwil.

name: Ochlenberg
geography: Ochlenberg is located at 580 m above sea level, 8 km south-southwest of Langenthal. The municipality extends into the Buchsibergen, a Molasse hill country between the valleys of Önz in the west and Langete in the east, on a terrain terrace east of the Stauffenbach valley, in the Oberaargau.

name: Oensingen
geography: Oensingen is located in the Swiss Mittelland at the foot of the Jura mountains and at the exit of the Klus, through which the Dünnern flows from Balsthal to the southern foot of the Jura. The Jura slopes make up about 40% of the municipality's area and are heavily wooded. The highest point is the Wannenfluh west of the Klus at 1033 m above sea level.
appearance: Oensingen is considered an example of urban sprawl in the Swiss Mittelland. The town, whose original village center is located in the lower village, initially expanded to the railway station further west. The industrial enterprises were not located near the village center, but on the plain to the neighboring town of Niederbipp. Oensingen and Niederbipp have now almost grown together.

name: Oeschenbach
geography: Oeschenbach lies in Oberaargau in the Swiss Mittelland, on the watershed to the Emmental. The neighboring municipalities are Ursenbach, Walterswil, Wynigen and Ochlenberg.
appearance: Oeschenbach is a hamlet with about eight houses, besides other, even smaller hamlets that belong to the agriculturally shaped municipality.

name: Oeschgen
geography: Oeschgen lies on the Sissle river, on the eastern edge of a 500 meter wide valley. In the village center, the Starzlebach valley branches off to the northeast. This side valley is bordered by the foothills of the Kaistenberg (501 m above sea level). The municipality extends to the Leischberg (402 meters) on the western side of the Sissle.

name: Oetwil am See
geography: Oetwil am See is located completely on the side of the Pfannenstiel facing away from Lake Zurich, on the edge of the Zurich Oberland.

name: Olsberg
geography: Olsberg is located in the Swiss canton of Aargau, in the Fricktal region, about three kilometers south of the German border and borders the canton of Basel-Landschaft. The village lies in the valley of the Violenbach, in the transition zone between the Tafeljura and the Upper Rhine Plain.  The Violenbach, which flows through the village in a northwesterly direction, is also the cantonal border.

name: Olten
geography: Olten lies in a basin on both sides of the Aare River at the foot of the Jura Mountains. It is located between the southernmost chain of the Jura Mountains and the Born, Engelberg and Säli hills. The southern part of the municipality includes the Aareklus between Born and Säli, the Ruttigertal valley and Ruppoldingen south of Born. The northeastern end of the Gäuebene plain with the Dünnern river lies on the territory of Olten, between the Born and the Jura slope.
appearance: Altstadt mit Holzbrücke

name: Oltingen
geography: Oltingen is located at 576 m above sea level on the Ergolz river and at the foot of the Schafmatt.
appearance: Oltingen is a farming village.

name: Onex
geography: Onex is a municipality in the canton of Geneva, located south of the Rhone and north of the Aire, approximately 5 km southwest of the center of Geneva. It borders Plan-les-Ouates to the south, Confignon and Bernex to the west, Vernier to the north, and Lancy to the southeast.

name: Onnens (VD)
geography: Onnens is situated at 477 meters above sea level on the southern foot of the Jura mountains, 7 km northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village is located on a hill above the western shore of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality stretches from the lake shore up to the first Jura mountain chain, reaching an altitude of 1300 meters.

name: Onsernone
geography: Onsernone is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino, encompassing the Onsernone valley and the Vergeletto valley. Neighboring municipalities include Centovalli, Maggia, Terre di Pedemonte, and the Italian municipalities of Craveggia and Re.

name: Opfikon
geography: Opfikon is located in the Glatt valley between Zürich, Wallisellen, Rümlang and the airport municipality of Kloten. The landscape is rather flat. The lowest point is at 420.4 m above sea level on the border with Rümlang. The highest point of the municipality is in the Hardwald at 481 m above sea level.
appearance: Opfikon has a lot of construction activity. Since the turn of the millennium, the settlement areas of the city of Zurich and those of the municipality of Opfikon have been growing together in the Glattpark and Glattbrugg area.

name: Oppens
geography: Oppens is situated at 556 m above sea level, 23 km north of Lausanne. It is located on the western slope of the Sauteru valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaudois Central Plateau.

name: Oppligen
geography: Oppligen is located at 560 m above sea level, 8 km north of Thun. The village extends south of the Chise River, on the eastern edge of the Aare Valley, at the foot of the Oppligenbergli, west of the Falkenflue. The municipality encompasses a section of the Aare lowlands between Bern and Thun, mainly the alluvial plain of the Chise and Rotache rivers. The Oppligenbergli (621 m) rises in the center.

name: Orbe
geography: Orbe is located at 479 m above sea level, 10 km southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The town extends on a promontory surrounded on three sides by the Orbe River. It lies about 40 m above the intensively cultivated Orbe plain. The area is part of the Waadtländer Mittelland. The Orbe plain, once swampy, is now drained and traversed by the rivers Nozon, Talent and Orbe.

name: Orges
geography: Orges is located at 560 m above sea level, 5 km northwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village is situated on the gently sloping southern slope of the Miriau, at the foot of the Jura mountains, in a panoramic location about 130 m above the level of Lake Neuchâtel. The municipality covers an area of 4.0 km², encompassing a section of the northern Vaud plateau.

name: Origlio
geography: Origlio is a municipality in the Capriasca district of Lugano in the canton of Ticino, Switzerland. It consists of the districts of Origlio and Carnago. The Lago di Origlio on the municipality's territory is a nature reserve. The village lies at 450 m above sea level near the small Lake Origlio and 3 km east of the Taverne-Torricella station on the Bellinzona-Lugano-Chiasso line.
appearance: In the Middle Ages, there was a fortified tower here. This was later converted and now serves as a residential building in the village center.

name: Ormont-Dessus
geography: Ormont-Dessus is located about 15 km east of Aigle in the upper part of the Grande Eau valley, in the Les Ormonts valley in the Vaud Alps, at the northwest foot of the Les Diablerets massif. The area is part of the Vaud Alps, including the valley basin of the Grande Eau and the mountain range with Pic Chaussy, Châtillon, Le Tarent, La Para, and Cape au Moine. South of the valley is the Tête de Meilleret and the Les Diablerets massif.

name: Orny
geography: Orny is located at 467 m above sea level, 1 km northeast of La Sarraz and 18 km north of Morges. The village stretches on both sides of the Nozon river in a small valley on the southern edge of the Orbe plain, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the Vaudois Mittelland, the valley of the Nozon, the Sur Crause hill, the Sur le Mont hill, the Orbe plain, and the Mormont.

name: Oron
geography: Oron is located in the Lavaux-Oron district in the canton of Vaud in Switzerland.

name: Orpund
geography: Orpund is located in the Berner Seeland, part of the Drei-Seen-Land and the Biel agglomeration, east of Biel. It's nestled between the Aare (Nidau-Büren-Kanal) to the south and the Büttenberg to the north.

name: Orselina
geography: Orselina is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Ticino. It is located above Locarno on a mountainside overlooking Lago Maggiore.

name: Orsières
geography: Orsières, the sixth-largest municipality in Wallis, spans 165 km² and encompasses the central section of Val d’Entremont and the side valleys Val Ferret and Vallée de Champex. The market town of Orsières lies on the Dranse d’Entremont, an upper reach of the Dranse, which flows into the Rhone near Martigny. The Mont Dolent, where the tripoint between France, Italy, and Switzerland is located, lies in the southwest of the municipality.

name: Orvin
geography: Orvin is located at 669 m above sea level, 3 km northwest of Biel. The village is located in the valley of the Orvine, a right tributary of the Schüss (Suze), in the southern Jura. The village belongs to the protected landscape of the Parc régional Chasseral.

name: Orzens
geography: Orzens is located at 622 m above sea level, 7 km south-southeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches on the upper western slope of the Mentue valley, in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. It encompasses a section of the hills between the Orbe plain and the Broye.

name: Ossingen
geography: Ossingen is located in the Weinland (wine country) region of the canton of Zürich. The municipality lies four kilometers east-northeast of Kleinandelfingen, towards Unterstammheim.

name: Ostermundigen
geography: Ostermundigen is a municipality in the agglomeration of Bern and lies east of Bern at the foot of the Ostermundigenberg.

name: Otelfingen
geography: Otelfingen is a political municipality in the Dielsdorf district in the Unterland of the canton of Zurich in Switzerland.

name: Othmarsingen
geography: Othmarsingen is located in the lower Bünztal valley. The village sits in a hollow on both sides of the straightened Bünz river and is surrounded by forest on three sides.  The "Berg", an offshoot of the Wagenrain, forms the natural border to the Reusstal. The area is 472 hectares, 193 of which are wooded.
appearance: There are two main settlement areas: the village center on the west bank and the area around the train station. The hamlet of Steinhof is located on the southeastern border of the municipality.

name: Oulens-sous-Echallens
geography: Oulens-sous-Echallens is located at 588 m above sea level, 4 km west of Echallens and 14 km north-northwest of Lausanne. It is situated on the high plateau of the Gros de Vaud, between the valleys of the Venoge to the west and the Talent to the east. The municipality's area encompasses a section of the rolling plateau of the Gros de Vaud, forming the watershed between the Talent and the Venoge.

name: Pailly
geography: Pailly is located at 642 m above sea level, 20 km north of Lausanne. The village is situated on the western slope of a broad ridge in the northern Gros de Vaud, above the valley of the Sauteru, in the Vaudois Midlands.  The area includes a section of the northern Gros de Vaud. The slope is gently sloping towards the valley of the Sauteru and is subdivided below the village by several small erosion valleys.

name: Paradiso
geography: Paradiso lies on Lake Lugano at the foot of Monte San Salvatore. The municipality, which only borders Lugano on Swiss territory, merges seamlessly into it and is therefore often mistakenly regarded as a district of Lugano. Paradiso has an international border with the Italian exclave and municipality of Campione d’Italia.

name: Paudex
geography: Paudex is located at 382 m above sea level, 3.5 km southeast of Lausanne. It lies on the slope bordering the northern shore of Lake Geneva, east of the Paudèze stream, in the westernmost part of the Lavaux. The municipality covers a small section on the northern shore of Lake Geneva.

name: Payerne
geography: Payerne is situated at 456 m above sea level, 17 km west of Fribourg. The town lies on both sides of the canalized Broye River, where it emerges from the Molasse hills of the Vaud and Fribourg Mittelland into the wide Broye Plain. The municipality includes a section of the Broye Plain and parts of the hills to the south. The northern part is occupied by the 4 km wide Broye Plain.

name: Penthalaz
geography: Penthalaz is situated at 491 m above sea level, 1.5 km east of Cossonay and 13 km northwest of Lausanne. The village extends on a slightly south-facing slope above the Venoge valley, in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Midlands. The municipality includes a section of the Gros de Vaud high plateau and the Venoge valley with the Bois de Vaux marshland.

name: Penthaz
geography: Penthaz is located at 482 m above sea level, 3 km southeast of Cossonay and 12 km northwest of Lausanne. The village is situated on a west-facing slope above the Venoge valley, in the Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality's area extends from the Venoge valley meadows eastward over the slope of Penthaz to the high plateau of the Gros de Vaud, reaching the highest point of the municipality at 526 m above sea level.
appearance: Penthaz includes several new housing developments.

name: Penthéréaz
geography: Penthéréaz is located at 624 m above sea level, 5 km north-northwest of Echallens and 18 km north of Lausanne. The village is located on the broad plateau of the northern Gros de Vaud, east of the Orbe plain, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality includes a section of the northern Gros de Vaud.  The main part of the area is occupied by the plateau of Penthéréaz, which reaches its highest elevation at 636 m above sea level on the summit of the Pierramont.

name: Perly-Certoux
geography: Perly-Certoux is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland.

name: Perrefitte
geography: Perrefitte lies at 600 m above sea level, 2 km west of Moutier. The former farming village extends to the west of the Jura valley of Moutier, on the left northern side of the Chalière stream. The area includes the westernmost part of the Grand Val, drained by the Chalière. The southern boundary runs on the Jura ridge of the Moron. To the north, the area extends to the Montagne de Moutier, where the highest point of Perrefitte is reached.

name: Perroy
geography: Perroy is located at 418 m above sea level, 14 km northeast of Nyon. The wine-growing village extends on the plateau at the foot of the Waadtländer Côte, in a panoramic location about 40 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality includes a section on the north shore of Lake Geneva, from the lake shore northwards over the flat shore strip to the plateau at the foot of the Côte. The highest point of Perroy is near the Signal de Bougy at 665 m above sea level.
appearance: The HTML does not contain a description of the town's appearance.

name: Personico
geography: Personico is located on the valley floor on the shady side of the Leventina. The municipality also includes the side valleys Val d’Ambra, Val Marcri and Val Nèdro. It borders Bodio to the north, Pollegio to the northeast, Biasca to the east, Iragna to the south, Lavertezzo Valle and Frasco to the southwest and Giornico to the northwest.

name: Pfäfers
geography: Pfäfers is located at approximately 800m above sea level at the entrance of the Taminatal valley. The municipality extends southwards over the Taminatal to the Kunkelspass, and from Vättis westwards to the high valley of Calfeisen. It is characterized by great differences in elevation from the Taminaschlucht gorge at 693m to the Ringelspitz at 3247m, with forests, meadows, Alps, and the Gigerwald and Mapragg reservoirs.

name: Pfäffikon
geography: Pfäffikon lies in the Zürcher Oberland on the northern and eastern shores of Pfäffikersee. The neighbouring municipalities of Pfäffikon are Wetzikon, Bäretswil, Hittnau, Russikon, Fehraltorf, Bauma, Wildberg, Seegräben and Uster.

name: Pfaffnau
geography: Pfaffnau is located between the valley of the (Gondiswiler-) Rotbach and the Wiggertal in the northwest corner of the canton of Lucerne. The municipality consists of the districts Pfaffnau-Dorf and St. Urban, which lies at the intersection of the cantonal borders of Aargau, Bern and Lucerne. The two villages are separated by the two large forest areas Chüewald and Sagerwald. The village lies in a hilly area. Pfaffnau-Dorf is traversed by the Pfaffneren.

name: Pfeffingen
geography: Pfeffingen is located at the southernmost end of the Birseck on the northern slope of the Blauen at 392 m above sea level. The neighboring municipalities are Aesch, Ettingen, Blauen, Nenzlingen, Grellingen and Duggingen. The area of the municipality is 489 hectares, of which 52% is forest, 33% agricultural land, 14% settlements and 1% unproductive land.

name: Pfungen
geography: Pfungen is located south of the Töss river, with the village of Pfungen on a spur of the Multberg, Hofsiedlungen in the Rumstal and the 19th century industrial settlements in the Bruni and in the Tössniederung Neu-Pfungen (Vorbruggen).

name: Pfyn
geography: Pfyn is located on the Thur river between Frauenfeld and Steckborn in the Thurgau canton.

name: Pierrafortscha
geography: Pierrafortscha lies at 750 m above sea level, 3 km southeast of the cantonal capital of Freiburg. The scattered settlement extends in a panoramic location on the hill east of the Saane trench, in the Molasse hills of the Freiburg Mittelland. The area includes a section of the Molasse heights between the Saane and the pre-Alpine hills.

name: Pieterlen
geography: Pieterlen liegt am Jurasüdfuss im Berner Seeland.

name: Plaffeien
geography: Plaffeien is located in the Sense district of the canton of Freiburg, in the Senseoberland region. It is the second largest municipality in the canton and borders the canton of Bern. The village of Plaffeien lies west of the Sense river on a small plateau surrounded by wooded hills. The municipality extends from Oberschrot and Zumholz to the village center, Schwarzsee, and the first two-thousand-meter mountains of the Freiburg Alps.  The altitude ranges from 746 m above sea level at the Sense river to 2239 m above sea level on the Schafberg.
appearance: The village center is divided into two parts by the Dütschbach stream.  A photograph shows traditional buildings clustered together in a valley.

name: Plan-les-Ouates
geography: Plan-les-Ouates is a municipality located south of the Aire river and the Ruisseau des Marais.

name: Plasselb
geography: Plasselb is situated at 856 m above sea level, 11 km southeast of Freiburg. The village is located on a terrace east of the Ärgera, at the exit of the Freiburg Alps, at the northern foot of the Schwyberg. The municipality encompasses a section of the Freiburg Alps, including the Plasselb basin, the Ärgera valley, and parts of the Schwyberg mountain range, reaching an altitude of 1645 m above sea level at the Grossen Schwyberg.

name: Plateau de Diesse
geography: Plateau de Diesse is located in the Berner Jura administrative district of the Swiss Canton of Bern. It is one of the three municipalities on the Tessenberg.

name: Pohlern
geography: Pohlern lies at the northern foot of the Stockhorn chain in the lower Stockental. The southern part is heavily forested and becomes increasingly mountainous towards the Stockhorn. Bodenwald and Engiwald are the largest forests. The most important waters of the municipality originate on the northern slope of the Stockhorn chain.
appearance: The hamlet of Obermatt on the road between Oberstocken and Blumenstein forms a kind of village center. Otherwise there are only groups of houses and individual farms. Of the total municipal area, a large part is forest or unproductive area, while a significant part is used for agriculture.

name: Poliez-Pittet
geography: Poliez-Pittet is located at 743 m above sea level, 4 km east-southeast of Echallens and 12 km north-northeast of Lausanne. The village extends on a terrace on the northern slope of the Jorat hills, in the eastern Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality extends from the valley of the Coruz stream to the southeast over the slope of Poliez-Pittet and the Bois Conti hill (834 m above sea level).

name: Pollegio
geography: Pollegio is located on the valley floor of the Bassa Leventina. The village lies on the valley floor of the Bassa Leventina. The municipality includes the district of Pasquerio, which has grown together with Biasca. Neighbouring municipalities are Serravalle, Giornico, Personico and Biasca.
appearance: null

name: Pompaples
geography:
Pompaples is located at 490 m above sea level, 1 km north of La Sarraz and 18 km north of Morges. The former street village extends on both sides of the Nozon, at the foot of the Jura, in the Vaudois Mittelland.

The area of the 4.5 km² municipal area covers a section of the Vaudois Mittelland. The southwestern part lies in the area of the Jura foothills plateau, into which the Nozon has dug a valley; here are the easily accessible climbing rocks of Saint-Loup.

name: Pomy
geography: Pomy is located at 558 m above sea level, 3 km southeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. It is situated on a plateau south of the Montéla ridge in the Molasse hills of the northern Vaud Central Plateau. The municipality encompasses a section of the hill country between the Orbe plain and the Broye. The area extends to the Montéla ridge, reaching 642 m above sea level at Haut de Baume.

name: Ponte Capriasca
geography: Ponte Capriasca is located at 447 m above sea level, a few kilometers north of Lugano. The neighboring municipalities are Bellinzona to the north (exclave in the Val di Serdena) and Monteceneri, Capriasca to the east, Origlio to the south and Torricella-Taverne to the west.

name: Pont-en-Ogoz
geography: Pont-en-Ogoz is located about 8 km north of Bulle, on the eastern slope of the Gibloux, in the northernmost part of the Gruyère region above the western shore of Lake Gruyère. The municipality covers a small section of the Bulle basin in the Fribourg Pre-Alps. The eastern border is formed by Lake Gruyère. The island of Île d’Ogoz also belongs to the municipality.

name: Porrentruy
geography: Pruntrut lies at 443 m ü. M. in a wide depression on both sides of the Allaine, in the Ajoie, at the northern foot of the Jura Mountains. The municipality covers the broad valley of the Allaine. To the south, the area extends to the heights of Le Banné and La Perche. The Allaine cuts through the table Jura plateaus. The highest point is on the Bure ridge at 580 m ü. M.
appearance: The stately old town of Pruntrut is in a slightly elevated position.

name: Port
geography: Port is a municipality in the Biel/Bienne administrative district of the Canton of Bern in Switzerland. The village was built around a late Roman port (lat. portum) and lies on the Zihl, which was merged with the Nidau-Büren Canal during the first Jura water correction. The municipality belongs to the agglomeration of the bilingual city of Biel/Bienne.

name: Port-Valais
geography: Port-Valais is located on the southeast end of Lake Geneva at the mouth of the Rhone, which was canalized in the 19th century. The Stockalperkanal runs between the river and the foot of the Grammont mountain. The municipality is divided into the two localities Le Bouveret and Les Evouettes.

name: Porza
geography: Porza is located 4 km north of Lugano. It lies at 486 m above sea level. The village is situated 10 minutes below Monte San Rocco (549 m above sea level) with views of Lugano and its surroundings.  Neighboring municipalities are Cureglia, Comano TI and Canobbio to the north, Lugano to the east, Savosa to the south, and Vezia to the west.
appearance: Porza is a beautifully located parish village. Traditional industries are agriculture and viticulture, animal husbandry and formerly also silkworm breeding.

name: Poschiavo
geography: Poschiavo is located approximately 15 kilometers south of the Bernina Pass, connecting the Engadine with Valtellina. The municipality includes the upper Puschlav valley and its side valleys, extending from the watershed in the north, formed by the Bernina group and the Forcola di Livigno, to the southern end of Lago di Poschiavo at 962 m. The highest point is the central peak of Piz Palü at 3901 m.

name: Pratteln
geography: Pratteln is located at 298 m above sea level, bordered to the north by the Rhine (border between Germany and Switzerland) and to the south by the Gempen plateau and the Adlerberg. The municipality also includes the Schweizerhalle industrial area and part of the large Basel-Muttenz marshalling yard. Neighboring municipalities of Pratteln are Augst, Füllinsdorf, Frenkendorf, Muttenz, Gempen in Solothurn and Grenzach-Wyhlen in Germany on the northern Rhine side.

name: Pregny-Chambésy
geography: Pregny-Chambésy is a municipality in the Canton of Geneva, Switzerland.

name: Premier
geography: Premier is located at 869 m above sea level, 7 km west-southwest of Orbe. The village extends on the southern slope of the Jura, north of the valley of the Nozon, in a panoramic position high above the plain of the Vaudois Midlands. The municipality extends from the edge of the Bois de Forel westward over the meadows of Premier and the Bois de Ban to the Jura chain.
appearance: The provided text does not describe the town's appearance. Therefore, the value is null.

name: Presinge
geography: Presinge is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. The municipality includes the hamlets of Cara and La Louvière.

name: Préverenges
geography: Préverenges is located at 405 m above sea level, 2.5 km east-northeast of Morges. The village extends on a foreland southwest of the Monteiron hill, in the Vaudois Mittelland, in a scenic location about 30 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. The municipality encompasses a small section on the northern shore of Lake Geneva, extending from the shoreline northwards over the gently rising slope up to the Monteiron hill.
appearance: Préverenges includes extensive single-family house neighborhoods along Lake Geneva. The settlement area of Préverenges has almost seamlessly merged with those of Morges and Saint-Sulpice.

name: Prévondavaux
geography: Prévondavaux is located at 688 m above sea level, 7 km north of Moudon in the Friborg exclave of Surpierre. The small farming village stretches on the western slope of the Lembe valley, in the Molasse hills of the western Friborg central plateau.
appearance: null

name: Prévonloup
geography: Prévonloup lies at 746 m above sea level, 14 km south of Payerne. The village extends on a slightly north-facing plateau east of the Broye valley, in the eastern Vaudois Mittelland. The area covers a section of the Molasse hills between the Broye valley and the upper reaches of the Glâne. The highest points are at 805 m above sea level.
appearance: The village is a street village located on a plateau.

name: Prez
geography: Prez is a municipality in the Saane district of the canton of Fribourg in Switzerland.

name: Prilly
geography: Prilly is located at 481 meters above sea level, 3 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality lies on the northern slope of Lake Geneva, in the Vaud Plateau, about 100 m above the lake level. The municipality extends from the lowest terrace (around 430 m above sea level) to the high plateau near Cery, west of the Blécherette airfield (around 600 m above sea level).

name: Provence
geography: Provence is situated at an altitude of 778 meters above sea level, 14 km northeast of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village sits on the southeastern slope of the Soliat range, overlooking the valley of the La Vaux stream, in a scenic location approximately 350 meters above Lake Neuchâtel.  The municipality extends westward and northward onto the Soliat range, reaching the highest point at Soliat (1463 m above sea level).
appearance: The article does not describe the town's appearance.

name: Puidoux
geography: Puidoux is located at 663 m above sea level, 12 km east of Lausanne. It lies in the valley of the Forestay stream, in a wide hollow between Mont de Gourze and Mont Pèlerin, northeast of Lake Geneva, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of Lavaux on the northeast shore of Lake Geneva and the adjacent heights to the north.

name: Pully
geography: Pully is located at 426 m above sea level, 2.5 km southeast of Lausanne. It extends in a panoramic position on a terrace above the northern shore of Lake Geneva and on the lower southern slopes of the Jorat hills, in the Vaud Central Plateau.  The municipality includes a section on the northern shore of Lake Geneva, stretching from the lake shore northwards over the narrow strip of land and the Pully terrace, as well as the adjoining slopes.

name: Puplinge
geography: Puplinge is a municipality in the canton of Geneva in Switzerland. The municipality includes the street village of Puplinge and the hamlet of Cornière.

name: Pura
geography: Pura is a municipality in the Magliasina valley, located at 387 meters above sea level. It is situated 9 km southwest of Lugano's train station. Neighboring municipalities include Lema to the north, Neggio and Magliaso to the east, Caslano to the south, and Tresa to the southwest.

name: Quarten
geography: Quarten is a municipality and village in the canton of St. Gallen in Switzerland. The sprawling mountain community south and north of Lake Walen consists of the villages of Quarten, Oberterzen, Unterterzen, Mols, Murg and Quinten. The lowest point is Lake Walen at 419.3 m above sea level, the highest is the Magerrain at 2523.7 m above sea level. Quarten lies in the foothills of the Alps, and the municipality extends both north and south of Lake Walen.

name: Quinto
geography: Quinto is a municipality in the Leventina district of the canton of Ticino. The village of Quinto lies slightly above the valley floor on the left slope of the Valle Leventina at 1011 meters. Quinto also includes most of the Val Cadlimo, which represents the upper reaches of the Medelser Rhine. Thus, Quinto is one of the few municipalities in Ticino that has a share in the Rhine catchment area.
appearance: The villages of Altanca, Ronco (Quinto), Deggio, San Martino, Catto and Lurengo are located on sunny terraces on the left side of the valley. Most of the population of the municipality of Quinto today lives in the villages of Ambrì and Piotta on the valley floor on the right side of the valley. During the summer months, life returns to the small districts of Quinto on the mountain, because the old houses are mainly used as holiday apartments.

name: Radelfingen
geography: Radelfingen is located in the Swiss Mittelland, 20 km from Bern and 7 km from Aarberg on the main road 235 Aarberg–Bern. The municipality includes the localities of Landerswil, Detligen, Jucher, Obermatt, Ostermanigen, Oltigen, Oberruntigen and Matzwil. It is served by the Postauto line 100 Bern–Aarberg.

name: Rain
geography: Rain is located on a plateau on the southern slope of the Erlosen between the southern Seetal valley and near the southern end of Lake Sempach.
appearance: The village of Rain is gradually growing together with the Sandblatte district (592 m above sea level) to the west due to strong construction activity. The municipality also includes the hamlet of Gundolinge (600 m above sea level; 1.1 km northwest of the village). There are a large number of groups of houses and isolated farms in the municipality, some of which are several kilometers away from the village.

name: Ramsen
geography: Ramsen is located in the Bibertal directly on the German border and has an area of 1345 ha. It consists of the village and the hamlets of Bibermühle, Hofenacker, Moskau, Wiesholz and Wilen. The Biber stream flows through the village and flows into the High Rhine below Stein am Rhein.

name: Rances
geography: Rances is located at 564 m above sea level, 4 km north of Orbe and 8 km west-southwest of Yverdon-les-Bains. The village stretches on the edge of the Jura plateau between the Orbe plain and the Jura, north of the valley of the Mujon. The municipality extends in a narrow strip from the Bois de Vuavre westwards over the valley of the Mujon, the plateau and the Jura slope up to the Suchet anticline.
appearance: NULL

name: Rapperswil (BE)
geography: Rapperswil is located in the Swiss Mittelland, on the edge of the Bernese Seeland, in the middle between the cities of Biel, Solothurn and Bern. The municipality extends on a slightly north-sloping plateau between the depressions of Limpachtal and Lyssbach. The main part of the municipal area lies on the Rapperswiler Plateau, a Molasse hill country, transformed by the glacial Rhone glacier.

name: Rapperswil-Jona
geography: Rapperswil-Jona is located in the southwest of the canton of St. Gallen on the right bank of Lake Zurich. From Rapperswil, the Seedamm von Rapperswil leads to Hurden in the canton of Schwyz. The Hurden peninsula near Pfäffikon SZ juts far into Lake Zurich. Together with the Seedamm, it divides Lake Zurich into the smaller, eastern Obersee and the larger Untersee (the actual Lake Zurich).
appearance: The boundary between Rapperswil and Jona was almost unrecognizable even for locals, as the border area was built over. They also formed a social unit; the term Rapperswil-Jona was included in the names of various clubs several years before the merger.

name: Raron
geography: In Raron liegen die südlichen Tunnelportale des Lötschberg-Basistunnels. Den Bietschbach überquert die auf Raroner Gemeindegebiet liegende Bietschtalbrücke.
appearance: Raron befindet sich ein markanter Burghügel mit einem Wohnturm, der zuerst Sitz der Herren von Raron und später der Vitztume des Bischofs von Sitten war, sowie einer gotischen Kirche, die kurz nach 1500 von Ulrich Ruffiner aus dem vormaligen Palas der Burg entwickelt wurde.

name: Realp
geography: Realp is located at the western end of the high valley of Urseren at the foot of the Furka Pass on the left bank of the Furkareuss. In addition to the village, the municipality includes some alpine settlements and isolated farms, including Tiefenbach (2106 m above sea level). Realp was for a long time the municipality in Switzerland most at risk from avalanches.

name: Rebévelier
geography: Rebévelier lies at 960 m above sea level, 14 kilometers west of Moutier. The farming village extends on a slightly north-facing slope of the Jura mountains west of the Pichoux Gorge, high above the valley basin of Undervelier. The municipality covers a height of a Jura chain in the extreme northeast of the region of Franches-Montagnes.
appearance: Rebévelier is a farming village.

name: Rebstein
geography: Rebstein is located in the Alpenrheintal region, part of the St. Galler Rheintal. The municipality extends from the Rheintaler Binnenkanal in the east to the border of the Appenzeller Vorderland in the west. The village center lies on the slopes of the Appenzell Alps. The highest point is northeast in the Lom at about 680 m above sea level. The lowest area is at 407 m above sea level between the Rietaach and the Binnenkanal.

name: Recherswil
geography: Recherswil is located at 458 m above sea level, 7 km southeast of Solothurn, in the plain between the Emme and the Ösch rivers, in the southern Solothurn Mittelland. The municipality extends from the groundwater-rich gravel plain in the middle Wasseramt eastwards over the canalized stream of the Ösch to the adjacent ground moraine landscape. The highest elevation is at 475 m above sea level in the Jäggenenwald.
appearance: Recherswil includes extensive new residential areas.

name: Rechthalten
geography: Rechthalten liegt auf 882 m ü. M. zwischen Freiburg und Schwarzsee. Es gehört sowohl zur Agglomeration Freiburg als auch zum Senseoberland und ist somit an der Grenze von Mittelland und Voralpen. Die Fläche beträgt 730 ha, wovon 130 ha Wald sind.

name: Reconvilier
geography: Reconvilier lies at 731 m above sea level, 13 km west-southwest of Moutier and 11 km north of Biel/Bienne. The village extends in the valley of the Birs, in the broad basin of the Jura longitudinal valley Vallée de Tavannes. The municipality covers a section of the western part of the Vallée de Tavannes, which is 3 km wide at Reconvilier. The area extends to the Jura chain of Montoz, reaching 1312 m above sea level.

name: Regensberg
geography: Regensberg is a municipality in the Canton of Zürich, Switzerland. The medieval town is located on a rocky spur of the Lägern high above Dielsdorf. Regensberg also includes Hirsmühle, a residential area adjacent to Dielsdorf with an old mill.
appearance: The provided text describes Regensberg as a medieval town. It is located on a rocky spur and the presence of an old mill in the Hirsmühle area suggests a blend of historical and residential character.

name: Regensdorf
geography: The municipality stretches across the Zürcher Furttal, a valley that forms a direct connection between the economic regions of Zürich North and Zürich West. It is located a few kilometers west of Zürich's city center and airport.
appearance: Regensdorf has transformed from a farming village into a town within the Zürich agglomeration. The old town center is located near the Reformed Church.

name: Rehetobel
geography: Rehetobel is located 953 meters above sea level. The village center lies 12 kilometers east of St. Gallen and 5 kilometers southwest of Heiden. The municipality borders Wald to the south, Trogen and Speicher to the southwest, with the Goldach and Moosbach forming natural boundaries. Grub lies to the north. The lowest point is Achmüli on the Goldach at 610 meters above sea level, and the highest is Kaienspitz at 1120 meters above sea level.

name: Reichenbach im Kandertal
geography: The municipality of Reichenbach im Kandertal extends from the summit of the Niesen in the northwest to the summit of the Blüemlisalp, which is 3664 meters above sea level. The lowest point is at 690 meters above sea level.  Around 120 alpine farms provide summer grazing for cattle and sheep. The natural and cultural landscape of the Kiental valley is popular with hikers.

name: Reichenburg
geography: Reichenburg lies on the edge of the pre-Alps and borders the cantons of St. Gallen and Glarus to the east and north. The municipality lies on the southern Linth Plain at 411 m above sea level, on the southern mountain slopes to the Mittelberg, the Ussberg, the Tafleten, the Lachen- and Austock and the Lauihöhe, which forms the highest point of the municipality at 1455 m above sea level.

name: Reiden
geography: Reiden is located in the lower Wiggertal, east of the Wigger river, on the cantonal border with Aargau. The village has grown significantly and includes the former hamlets of Unterdorf, Bifang, Unterwasser, Sonnhalden, Hinterberg, and Oberdorf. South of the village is the partially forested Höchflue (559 m above sea level). East of the village is the Lusberg (632 m above sea level). The connection between these two heights is the Ehag (682 m above sea level).

name: Reigoldswil
geography: Reigoldswil is located in the Waldenburg district of Basel-Landschaft. It is the rearmost village in the valley of the Hintere Frenke. The municipality extends over valley and mountain landscapes at an altitude of 470 to 1161 meters. The mountain station of the Wasserfallenbahn is located on the territory of the neighboring municipality of Waldenburg.

name: Reinach (AG)
geography: Reinach is a municipality in the Swiss canton of Aargau, belonging to the Kulm district. It lies in the upper Wynental valley and borders the canton of Lucerne. The village stretches across the entire width of the trough-shaped valley of the Wyna. The valley is bounded to the east by the Ischlag (651 m above sea level) and to the northeast by the Homberg (788 m above sea level).
appearance: The village has two historical centers, the Oberdorf and the Unterdorf, which are just under half a kilometer apart. The five villages Reinach, Beinwil am See, Burg, Menziken and Pfeffikon have merged into a contiguous agglomeration.

name: Reinach (BL)
geography: Reinach is located at the southern foot of Bruderholz in the Birs valley, with a short border connection to the city of Basel. The eastern border is formed by the Birs river and the Reinacher Heide, a bird paradise with many botanical rarities. It is situated at 303 m above sea level.
appearance: The provided content does not contain a clear description of Reinach's visual appearance or atmosphere.

name: Reisiswil
geography: Reisiswil is located in the Oberaargau region, west of Melchnau on the eastern slope of a mostly wooded hill range that extends from Langenthal to Huttwil, culminating in the 780 m high Hohwacht. Neighboring municipalities are Melchnau, Madiswil and Gondiswil.
appearance: Reisiswil is still strongly influenced by agriculture. There are also smaller craft and service businesses.

name: Reitnau
geography: Reitnau is located in the upper Suhrental valley of Aargau, bordering the canton of Lucerne. It consists of four parts: Unterdorf on the flat valley floor, Attelwil to the north, and Oberdorf and Hubel on a side moraine. The Suhre river forms the eastern boundary. West of the moraine are hills like Hornig, Tannholz, Bluemisweg, Stockrüti, Birch and Lügisried, dropping sharply into the Uerkental valley.
appearance: The municipality consists of four parts with loosely connected buildings. The main village is located on a relatively flat valley with the other sections on a higher elevation side moraine.

name: Remaufens
geography: Remaufens lies at 787 m above sea level, 8 km north-northeast of Vevey. The village stretches along a gently westward sloping hillside above the Tatrel and Broye lowlands, in the extreme southwest of the Freiburg Middleland. The area is traversed from east to west by the small valley of the Tatrel, a left tributary of the Broye.

name: Remetschwil
geography: Remetschwil lies on the south-west slope of Rohrdorferberg, part of the Heitersberg hills separating the Reuss and Limmat valleys. The west is made of glacial gravel from the Würm ice age. Higher up, older gravel from the Riss ice age is found, with alluvial loam in between. Busslingen is located one kilometer west of Remetschwil.

name: Remigen
geography: Remigen is located in the transition zone between the folded Jura and the table Jura, in the northwest corner of the Rüfenacher Ebene. The Geissberg rises to the north. The municipality extends only over the steep southern slope, while the extensive plateau belongs to Villigen. Towards the west are two valleys separated by the Bützberg. The municipality, drained by the Schmittenbach, is bordered in the west by the Burghalden.

name: Renan (BE)
geography: Renan is located at 907 m above sea level, 8 km east-northeast of La Chaux-de-Fonds. The village is situated in the western upper part of the Vallon de Saint-Imier valley, on the left side of the Schüss (Suze) river, at the lower southern slope of the Montagne du Droit. The municipality area includes the uppermost section of the Vallon de Saint-Imier, drained by the Schüss.

name: Renens (VD)
geography: Renens is located at 415 m above sea level, 4 km northwest of Lausanne. The municipality extends in a hollow east of the Mèbre valley and on the adjacent slopes north of Lake Geneva, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality covers an area of 3.0 km² and extends from the terrace near Malley northwards up the gently sloping slope of Renens to below Jouxtens-Mézery.

name: Rennaz
geography: Rennaz is situated at 377 m above sea level, 8 km northwest of Aigle. The village is located in the broad valley plain east of the Rhone, near the shore of Lake Geneva, at the western foot of the Mont d'Arvel in the Vaud Alps. The municipality extends exclusively in the flat part of the Rhône plain.

name: Reute (AR)
geography: Reute is located between Heiden and Rebstein, above the Rhine Valley. The municipality has the shape of a sickle and divides the Oberegg district municipality into two halves. Reute is divided into three districts: Mohren, Reute and Schachen. The village center is at 703 m above sea level, with the highest point at 1028 m above sea level and the lowest at 539 m above sea level.

name: Reutigen
geography: Reutigen lies in the Berner Oberland on the Kander river.  The Feusibach and the Fluhbach join to form the Glütschbach on the municipality territory. Its neighboring municipalities are Stocken-Höfen, Spiez, Wimmis, Erlenbach im Simmental and Niederstocken.

name: Rhäzüns
geography: Rhäzüns lies at the lower reaches of the Hinterrhein before its confluence with the Vorderrhein.
appearance: Several fires destroyed the original village appearance around the turn of the 20th century.

name: Rheinau
geography: Rheinau is a municipality in the Andelfingen district, in the Weinland region of the Swiss canton of Zurich. The village is located in the western loop of a double loop formed by the Rhine River, opposite the Rhine Island with the former Rheinau Monastery. The Rhine has been dammed for the Rheinau power plant. The municipality borders Germany on three sides.
appearance: NULL

name: Rheinfelden
geography: Rheinfelden lies 17 kilometers east of Basel, in the northwestern corner of the canton of Aargau on the border with Germany. The city stretches along the left bank of the High Rhine for about nine kilometers. The Inseli, an island of shell limestone, is important for the city's origins. The Rhine is navigable from Rheinfelden to the North Sea.
appearance: The old town of Rheinfelden is located on a rock terrace. A pronounced slope runs through almost its entire width, and its easternmost part is leveled out by artificial filling. South of the old town and west of the Magdenerbach rises another terrace, the Kapuzinerberg.

name: Rheinwald
geography: Rheinwald is a municipality in the Viamala region of the Swiss canton of Graubünden. It encompasses most of the valley of the same name, with the villages of Hinterrhein, Nufenen, Medels im Rheinwald and Splügen.

name: Riaz
geography: Riaz is located at 727 m above sea level, 2.5 km north of Bulle. The village stretches on both sides of the Sionge stream, at the southern foot of the Gibloux, in the Gruyère region west of Lake Gruyère. The area includes a section of the Bulle basin in the Fribourg Pre-Alps. The eastern part is taken up by the wide lowlands of the Sionge. To the west, the municipality extends to the Sur les Monts ridge, part of the Gibloux hills.
appearance: Riaz includes extensive single-family home areas and the settlements of L'Etrey and Joulin on the slope of Sur les Monts, as well as numerous individual farms.

name: Richterswil
geography: Richterswil lies between the southwestern bank of Lake Zurich and the Höhronen hills, bordering the Canton of Schwyz. The municipality extends from 408 m above sea level (Lake Zurich) to 725 m above sea level (Hüttnersee). It is about 25 kilometers (straight line) from Zurich.

name: Rickenbach (BL)
geography: Rickenbach is a municipality in the Sissach district of the canton of Basel-Landschaft in Switzerland.

name: Rickenbach (LU)
geography: Rickenbach is located approximately 20 km northwest of Lucerne and 6.2 km northeast of Sursee, bordering the canton of Aargau. The Butteberg (796 m above sea level) rises to the west, the Stierenberg (872 m above sea level) to the north, and the Bogeten (766 m above sea level) to the southeast. The settlement lies in a high-altitude valley basin.

name: Rickenbach (SO)
geography: Rickenbach is a municipality in the Olten district of the canton of Solothurn in Switzerland. It belongs to the so-called Solothurn Gäu. A road stretched south of the Jura, along the sides of which there were numerous Roman villas.

name: Rickenbach (TG)
geography: Rickenbach lies in the Hinterthurgau and is a suburb of the city of Wil SG.
appearance: The place offers many shopping opportunities, because among other things, the shop opening hours in the canton of Thurgau are more liberal compared to the neighboring canton of St. Gallen. On the other hand, Rickenbach benefits from its proximity to the city of Wil with its diverse opportunities and good transport links.

name: Rickenbach (ZH)
geography: Rickenbach is a municipality in the Winterthur district of the canton of Zürich in Switzerland. The municipality is composed of the villages of Rickenbach, Sulz, Grüt and some hamlets. Rickenbach is located approximately 10 km from the city of Winterthur.

name: Riddes
geography: Riddes is located on the left side of the Rhone river and on the steep mountain slope south of the Rhone valley. The municipality includes the main town of Riddes, part of the Ecône hamlet in the Rhone plain, the La Tzoumaz resort, and the Auddes-sur-Riddes hamlet on the mountain. Riddes sits on the alluvial fan of the La Fare river, which flows into the Rhone northeast of the village.
appearance: The Riddes village lies on the vast alluvial fan of the La Fare river.  In the valley plain, Riddes features orchards covering several square kilometers and vineyards at the foot of the south-facing slope.

name: Ried bei Kerzers
geography: Ried bei Kerzers is located at 511 m above sea level, 6 km east-northeast of Murten and 2.5 km south-southwest of Kerzers. The village stretches on the edge of a high plateau south of the Grosses Moos, in the northern Fribourg Mittelland. The municipality includes a section of the Grosses Moos and the adjacent Molasse hills. The southern part with the village is occupied by a high plateau, bordered to the east by the valley of the Biberen and to the west by the Galmizbach.
appearance: null

name: Ried-Brig
geography: The municipality includes several hamlets in the Brigerberg, which form the village of Ried-Brig, a total of 43 Maiensässe and Alps. The historically known Gantertal with the famous Ganterbrücke also belongs to the municipality.
appearance: The village of Ried-Brig has transformed from a farming village to a residential community in the last 40 years.

name: Riederalp
geography: Riederalp is located southeast of the Aletsch Forest, in the Jungfrau-Aletsch mountain region, which has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 2002, and is thus part of the Aletsch area.

name: Riedholz
geography: Riedholz is located at 471 m above sea level, four kilometers northeast of Solothurn. The village stretches on a terrace of a moraine deposited by the ice-age Rhone glacier, north of the Aare River, in the Unterleberberg region. The area includes a section at the southern foot of the Jura. The southern boundary runs along the Aare.

name: Riehen
geography: Riehen is located at the lower end of the Wiesental on the Swiss side and belongs to the agglomeration of the city of Basel. In the north, the Eiserne Hand forms part of the border with the German neighboring municipalities of Lörrach and Inzlingen.

name: Riemenstalden
geography: Riemenstalden is located high above Lake Lucerne at 1030 m above sea level. The village center is accessible via an access road from Sisikon (Canton Uri). The Riemenstaldertal is repeatedly hit by natural forces, including avalanches, mudslides and torrential torrents in the catchment area of the Riemenstaldnerbaches.

name: Rifferswil
geography: Rifferswil is located in the rolling drumlin landscape of the upper Jonen valley in the Knonauer Amt. 63.7% of the municipal area is agricultural land, 22.3% forest, 6.7% settlement area, 5.0% traffic area, 0.3% water, and 2.0% unproductive area (as of 2018).

name: Riggisberg
geography: Riggisberg is located at 762 m above sea level, 15 km south of Bern. The village extends in a wide valley of the Mülibach on the Längenberg west of the Gürbetal, at the northeast foot of the Gibelegg. The area includes a section of the Alpine foothills west of the Aare depression between Bern and Thun. The eastern part is occupied by the wide valley of Riggisberg, drained by the Mülibach to the Gürbe.

name: Ringgenberg (BE)
geography: The municipality is located on the northern shore of Lake Brienz, on the southern slope of the Harder. It consists of the two villages Ringgenberg and Goldswil near Interlaken. The Burgseeli lake lies between the two districts. Ringgenberg borders the municipalities of Niederried, Interlaken and Habkern.

name: Riniken
geography: Riniken lies in a trough-like valley between the Bruggerberg (516 m above sea level) in the east and the Ebni (514 m above sea level) in the west. Iberg narrows to the north to a 250 meter wide and more than 100 meter high rocky bar that drops steeply on three sides. Ebni and Iberg separate the village from the elongated Ital. The Rüfenacher plain extends to the northeast.

name: Risch
geography: The 22.9 square kilometer municipality of Risch is located on an offshoot of the Rooterberg, which extends to the Lorze in Cham and separates Lake Zug in the east from the Reuss in the west. Regionally, Risch is located in the extreme southwest of the canton of Zug in the Ennetsee region. The highest point of the municipality is 680 m above sea level on the Kappelerberg in the south, the lowest at 402 m above sea level. M. on the Reuss in the northwest.

name: Riva San Vitale
geography: Riva San Vitale is located on the eastern slope of Monte San Giorgio at the southern end of an arm of Lake Lugano, where the Laveggio flows into it.

name: Rivaz
geography: Rivaz is located at 445 m above sea level, 12 km east-southeast of Lausanne. The wine-growing village extends on a small terrain projection in the middle of the vineyards on the steep slope of the Lavaux, below Chexbres, in a scenic location about 70 m above the lake level of Lake Geneva. Rivaz is the smallest municipality in the canton of Vaud. The municipality area stretches from the lake shore northwards up the steep vineyard slope.
appearance: Rivaz is a wine-growing village located on a small terrain projection in the middle of the vineyards on the steep slope of the Lavaux, below Chexbres.

name: Riviera
geography: The municipality of Riviera is located between Bellinzona and Biasca in the canton of Ticino, Switzerland. It lies in the Riviera Valley, which is traversed by the Ticino River. The area extends over 8607 hectares. The municipality also includes the Val di Lodrino to the west, which is drained by the Lodrino.

name: Roche (VD)
geography: Roche lies at 390 m above sea level, 6 km north-northwest of Aigle. The village extends along the eastern edge of the Rhone Valley, at the exit of the Eau Froide mountain stream from the Vaud Alps, at the western foot of the heights of the Tour d’Aï. The municipality area includes a section of the Rhone Valley and the adjacent slopes. To the east, the area extends over the steep, wooded slopes up to Tête de Sauquenil and La Sarse.

name: Rochefort
geography: Rochefort is located at 759 m above sea level, 9 km west of the cantonal capital Neuchâtel. The municipality extends in a hollow in the catchment area of the Merdasson stream on the southern slope of the Jura, at the entrance to the Val de Travers, in a scenic location high above Lake Neuchâtel.

name: Roches (BE)
geography: Roches is located at 491 m above sea level, 3 km northeast of Moutier. The village extends in a valley widening of the Birs below the Gorges de Moutier, in the breakthrough valley through the anticline of the Mont-Raimeux chain of the Jura.

name: Rodersdorf
geography: Rodersdorf is located in the northwest of Switzerland, directly on the border with France. 88 percent of the municipal border is also the Swiss national border. The village is located in the Solothurn Leimental, an exclave of the canton of Solothurn, which is enclosed by the canton of Basel-Landschaft on the Swiss side. Rodersdorf is situated at the foot of the Jura mountains.

name: Roggenburg
geography: Roggenburg lies at 566 m above sea level, 8 km north of Delsberg. The farming village stretches on a north-facing slope above the Lützel valley, in the hilly landscape of the northern Jura. The municipality's area encompasses a section in the northern Jura Mountains. The northern border follows the Lützel, which also forms the border between Switzerland and France.

name: Roggliswil
geography: The municipality is located in the northwest of the canton of Lucerne and is horseshoe-shaped, enclosed by the municipality of Pfaffnau in the west, north and east. The whole place is in a hilly area. Roggliswil-Dorf, the Niederwil district northeast and the Weiler Netzelen southwest have now grown together. The Steinbach flows in a northwesterly direction and forms part of the southern border of the municipality.
appearance: NULL

name: Roggwil (BE)
geography: Roggwil is located in the Swiss Mittelland between Langenthal and Olten, approximately four kilometers south of the Aare River. It lies on the border with the cantons of Aargau and Lucerne, between the Rot and Langete rivers, which merge in the neighboring municipality of Wynau to form the Murg.

name: Roggwil (TG)
geography: Roggwil is a municipality and a village in the district of Arbon in the Swiss canton of Thurgau. Roggwil lies on the road Arbon - St. Gallen and consists of the clustered villages of Ober- and Unter-Roggwil, which have grown together in the 20th century, the village of Freidorf and numerous hamlets.

name: Rohrbach
geography: Rohrbach lies in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland on the Langete river. The neighboring municipalities are Auswil, Huttwil, Rohrbachgraben, and Madiswil.

name: Rohrbachgraben
geography: Rohrbachgraben is located in the Oberaargau region of the Swiss Mittelland, nestled in a small valley. The Rohrbachgrabenbach stream flows through this valley, eventually merging with the Langete.  About 73% of the municipality is used for agriculture, while 1.7 km² is forested.
appearance: The inhabitants are spread across several hamlets: Glasbach, Liemberg, Ganzenberg, Flückigen, Kaltenegg, Matten, Wald, and Wil, with Wil being the largest and the main village center.

name: Rolle
geography: Rolle is located at 376 m above sea level, 11 km northeast of Nyon. The town extends on the flat shore of Lake Geneva, at the foot of the Vaudois Côte. The municipality covers a section on the northwest shore of Lake Geneva, extending from the lake shore inland over the flat shoreline strip to the main road. The highest elevation of Rolle is reached at 442 m above sea level.

name: Romainmôtier-Envy
geography: Romainmôtier-Envy is located 6 km southwest of Orbe. Romainmôtier (674 m above sea level) extends in the narrow valley of the Nozon stream. Envy is situated at 691 m above sea level in a southern side valley of the Nozon. The municipality covers a section of the Jura foothills plateau.

name: Romanel-sur-Lausanne
geography: Romanel-sur-Lausanne is located at 592 m above sea level, 5 km north-northwest of Lausanne. The municipality extends on a plateau southwest of the Jorat, east of the valley system of the Mèbre, in the Vaudois Central Plateau. The municipality area comprises a section of the Vaudois Central Plateau north of Lake Geneva. The highest point is located at 640 m above sea level north of the hamlet of La Naz.
appearance: The description of the town's appearance is missing from the provided article content.

name: Romanel-sur-Morges
geography: Romanel-sur-Morges is located at 452 m above sea level, 5 km north of Morges. The village extends on a plateau above the Arena stream, west of the Venoge valley, in the southwestern Gros de Vaud, in the Vaudois Mittelland. The municipality extends from the western edge of the Venoge valley to the west over the Romanel plateau to the slope of the Trente-Chiens hill, at 500 m above sea level, the highest point of the municipality.

name: Romanshorn
geography: Romanshorn is a town in the Swiss canton of Thurgau, located on the southern shore of Lake Constance. It borders the municipalities of Uttwil, Hefenhofen and Salmsach. It has a large forest in its hinterland.

name: Römerswil
geography: Römerswil is located southwest of the Baldeggersee, 3 km west of Hochdorf on the eastern slope of the Erlosen. The village of Herlisberg lies 3.3 km north-northwest. The municipality includes numerous hamlets, groups of houses, and individual farmsteads. The northernmost settlements are Waldhus and the hamlet of Laufenberg. The municipality extends down to the southern shore of Lake Baldeggersee with the Nunwil district.

name: Romont (BE)
geography: Romont lies at 750 m above sea level, 9 km northeast of Biel. The former farming village extends on the eastern slope of the Jura chain of the Bözingenbergs, in a panoramic location high above the Swiss Central Plateau. The area of the 7.1 km² municipal area includes the eastern slope and, with a narrow tip, the ridge height of the Bözingenbergs (965 m above sea level).

name: Romont (FR)
geography: Romont is situated at 781 m above sea level, 22 km southwest of Fribourg, in the southwestern Fribourg Plateau. The historic town is located on the crest of a prominent hill in the middle of a wide valley. To the east is the plain at the upper reaches of the Glâne, and to the west and north is the valley of its side stream, the Glaney.
appearance: The historical town with its encircling wall was built on a hill in the upper Glâne valley.

name: Romoos
geography: Romoos is located in the pre-alpine region in the eastern part of the Napfbergland and is very hilly, partly even mountainous, and often heavily forested. The municipality's boundary almost exclusively follows natural borders. The Grosse Fontanne forms the eastern and southern border. The entire municipality lies in the foothills of the Alps.
appearance: Romoos-Dorf lies on a hill between the Grosse Fontanne in the east and the Altmülibach in the west and north. In addition to Romoos-Dorf, there are numerous individual farms and groups of houses in the municipality. The only larger settlement is Bramboden.

name: Ronco sopra Ascona
geography: Ronco sopra Ascona lies between Ascona and Brissago, and between Lake Maggiore (193 m above sea level) and Corona di Pinz (1294 m above sea level), extending slightly into the Centovalli. The highest point is 1374 m above sea level near Alpe di Naccio.
appearance: The village center sits on a rocky terrace about 160 meters above the lake. The municipality includes Livurcio, Croasca, Corafora, Capella Gruppaldo, Fontana Martina, and Porto Ronco, some of which have merged with the historical village core.

name: Rongellen
geography: Rongellen lies at the edge of the Viamala, halfway between Thusis and Zillis. Rongellen consists of widely scattered groups of houses in a forest clearing on the old Viamala path. Neighboring communities of Rongellen are Muntogna da Schons, Thusis, Sils im Domleschg and Zillis-Reischen.
appearance: Rongellen consists of widely scattered groups of houses in a forest clearing on the old Viamala path.

name: Root
geography: Root lies in the Rontal between Lucerne and Zug. A regionally known part of the municipality is Michaelskreuz. 51.1% of the total area of the municipality is used for agriculture, 27.9% is forest and woodland and 16.6% is settlement area. The highest point of the municipality is on the Rooterberg, above the Michaelskreuz chapel at 831 m above sea level, the lowest on the Reuss at 407 m above sea level.

name: Ropraz
geography: Ropraz is situated at 748 m above sea level, 27 km southwest of Payerne. The village is located on a plateau on the eastern slope of the Jorat, west of the Bressonne valley, in the Vaudois Midlands. The municipality covers a section of the Molasse hills between the Jorat and the upper reaches of the Broye. The Bressonne borders the municipality on the east, creating a deep, wooded valley.

name: Rorbas
geography: Rorbas is the lowest municipality in the Tösstal and lies directly in front of the mouth of the Töss into the Rhine (Tössegg), nestled between the Dättenberg and the Irchel.

name: Rorschach
geography: Rorschach is located in eastern Switzerland on the southern shore of Lake Constance, approximately opposite the mouth of the Argen river and south of the German town of Friedrichshafen.

name: Rorschacherberg
geography: Rorschacherberg is located on a slope above Rorschach and extends to Lake Constance east of Rorschach. Both municipalities have largely grown together with their settlement zones. It lies at an altitude of 570 m above sea level, with an altitude range of 395–900 m above sea level.
appearance: The HTML does not include a description of the town's appearance.

name: Röschenz
geography: Röschenz lies in a side valley of the Laufental. The Lützel flows southwest. The neighboring communities are Burg im Leimental, Metzerlen-Mariastein, Kleinlützel, Dittingen, Laufen and Liesberg. The highest elevation is the Forstberg at 810 m above sea level, the lowest point is in the Lützeltal at 370 m above sea level.

name: Rossa
geography: Rossa is located in the upper Calanca valley at an altitude of 1089 m above sea level, on both sides of the Calancasca river, and 30 km north of Bellinzona. A mule track leads from Rossa over the Pass di Giümela (2117 m above sea level) to Fontana in Val Pontirone.
